text: ....new to me, anyway. Today, I saw a Volkswagen Pointer City with plates from Nuevo Leon, Mexico. Both are quite an unusual sight in Chicago. The car looked OK, kinda cheap and generic but not tiny; certainly not the car I'd want to do a 2000+ mile road trip in, though!

author: boomchek
text:
The Mazda dealer at our Automall just received a shipment of the new Mazda5. I don't know if the US is getting it too but it's a subcompact minivan/tall wagon with three rows of seats and sliding doors. Sort of like a Nissan Axxess or Multi from back in the day.

Anyways had a close look at it and it looks pretty sharp. I think Mazda has another hit on their hands (coming from a Honda sales guy, I shouldn't be saying this :blush: ), and it's also available in 5 speed manual.

The seats in both second and third row are fairly tiny though but the overall look is nice.

author: merc1
text:
The Hummer dealer here has about 20 of them in stock, and I've seen at least one on the road that didn't have a dealer plate, so I guess someone is buying them.

M

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Looks very promising, hopefully we get it here in the states soon. Would like to check one out. Manual tranny on 4-cyl models only? Apologies for my ignorance as I don't know a whole lot about this model.

Thanks

author: ateixeira
text:
Will be sold in the US, prices are good and it's the only vehicle with sliding doors and a manual tranny that I can think of.

2.3l from the Mazda3, in fact it's based on that car too. It's a 6 seaters, 2+2+2, the US model will not have the middle 7th seat in the 2nd row.

-juice

author: anythngbutgm
text: Will there be a V6 from the MZ6? Sliding doors on an SUV? Sounds pretty cool.

author: anythngbutgm
text: Just looked it up online. It's like the MPV. I was thinking of the crossover that was going around the Auto show curcuit.

author: ateixeira
text:
That'll be here next year. The production model should debut in Detroit next January.

I think they'll use the name CX-7.

-juice

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Not a fan of the whole numbering scheme. Quite irritating. :mad: Thanks for the info, I appreciate it. The CX-7 looks quite promising IMO.

I kinda wonder how much attention a minivan with a manual tranny will get? There are probably a few takers out there, I guess... :confuse:

author: jaserb
text:
That's another hybrid you wouldn't notice except for the badge. It was parked at a scenic viewpoint, the only reason I noticed the badge.

-Jason

author: ateixeira
text:
CX-7 is a dumb name. Guess MX-Crossport sounded too much like MX-5, since they dropped the Miata part.

-juice

author: merc1
text:
I saw one of those top of the line 300C SRT-8 Chryslers on the back of a carrier this morning, in black. Awesome car.

M

author: ateixeira
text:
In a day, these are really taking off.

-juice

author: kyfdx
text:
Porsche Cayenne Turbo

Acura TSX.. I still like these a lot... They need a new wheel design, though.. The stock wheels are too plain...

author: stickguy
text: new 3 series, a Charger (sivler), and a Maser coupe (107K MSRP).

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a new 3 yesterday, my 2nd sighting on public roads. They look better in person, and are by far the best of Bangle's designs.

-juice

author: boomchek
text: I agree, they do look much better in person from all angles. Not something that can be said about other Bangled Beemers.

author: derrado1
text:
Well I'm from Australia, and I live in Brisbane.
Normally the suburbs aren't that great for car-spotting but I saw a new 3-series (the back is ugly... I actually prefer the 7-series, ive gotten used to it), a new Jaguar S-Type and a bright green (not British racing) MG ZT (based on the Rover 75)

Let's not forget downtown, where I saw a new Nissan 350Z (why do people always buy it in silver?) behind an Alfa Romeo GT (back looks too boxy)

Otherwise, nothing special, as usual.

author: seminole_kev
text: that bright green is called "Jaguar racing green" (as opposed to the darker British racing green).........or well at least it is in the States.

author: derrado1
text:
these reports from the UK about tons of those horrible little CityRovers (aka cheap and cheerless Tata Indica) sitting on a dock somewhere aren't a good sign. What's happened to MG Rover exactly? The Longbridge plant was shut down... but the company isn't dead is it?

MG Rover finally came to Australia, like, this year. The last time they were here, around the same time 'Sterling' was in the states, they had the 800 (Sterling/Vitesse) and the 416i (rebadged Honda Integra 4-dr... don't ask me why) and they left for some reason, probably finanical troubles. Now they come back with a decent line-up of cars and so of course the mothership has to have engine troubles. They'll probably leave Aus again.

Such a shame, I saw a beautiful MG ZS in dark-light grey at the most recent motor show. A little bit cramped inside, but it more than made up for it. I hear it drives pretty good too, at least better than the Rover 45 its based on.

author: fintail
text:
Today I stopped by the local Lexus dealer, as it is right down the street from me. They had some hybrids, expensive little things. The perfect new piece of jewelry for the wealthy housewife,

Struck me as odd that they had so many IS laying around, maybe a dozen of them. Off lease maybe. A lot of new GS too, although those seem to be selling very well as I see maybe 5 a day on the road here.

author: navigator89
text: Saw two pearl grey Audis - an A4 convertible and a new A6. The A6 seems to be really rare, this is only the third or fourth that I've seen.

author: anythngbutgm
text: Saw 2 Bentley Continental GT's, newer MB SL's in every color imaginable, a 300 SRT-8, and my FIRST Caddy XLR! So they do exist? Well this one was hauling down rt 24 with a cloud of white smoke choking out the back putting a nice cloud upon the highway. Nice. :sick:

author: kyfdx
text:
A Ferrari... With temporary tags.. so, I'm assuming brand new.. I think it was a Ferrari 360.. Convertible of some sort.. with a soft top..

It was parked near a rental property that I drive by often, as it is on a dead-end street that I go down to access my son's school and also the swim club.. In the past.. and I assume it is the same person.. I have seen a 911 GT3, an Escalade in a bright metallic blue with matching painted alloys, and a BMW 745Li with 20" optional BMW wheels..

Usually only see one of these vehicles once every two weeks or so, so they obviously don't live there.. girlfriend or something, I presume..

It is just incredible the variety and the major expense of every one I see there.. And, no dealer tags, so evidently not someone out for joyrides...

I mean.. a Ferrari, for pete's sake...

It just isn't fair...



EDIT: I just looked up the Ferrari website.. Definitely a 360 Spider.. Maybe a 2000 model.. My eleven-year-old pegged the model number for me, on first sight.. I don't know where he gets it from..

author: kyfdx
text:
I stopped by the BMW dealer today.. So, I can peruse in peace while they are closed...

And, rolling through the lot...

CLS55 AMG Mercedes....

Silver..... wild looking for a sedan..

author: davem2001
text: Not sure if this is a new factory option or a custom.... I saw a Honda Element with all of it's gray plastic "cladding" painted body color. It was a major improvement! Looked much smoother!

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw another 3 series, white doesn't look as good as the darker colors I've seen.

-juice

author: andys120
text:
I saw my first M45 on the highway, nice looking car in the Smoke Grey/Graphite Metallic that's everywhere now.

I could live without the "Tokyo by Night" tailights though.

author: kyfdx
text:
...or maybe the same one.. about 8 miles from where I spotted the last one..

AMG Mercedes CLS 55

author: guss
text:
I know these have been out for about a year but this was the first one I have seen. Very nice looking but not $70k nice.

It was at the local ice cream parlor, and while I am sitting outside to make sure the kids don't drip ice cream all over the mini-van , he let his kids hop in the back drippy cones and all. I guess it pays to get the leather interior.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw 2 at a time today, about 3 cars apart, pretty wild.

-juice

author: navigator89
text:
A black Mercedes SL55 AMG on the highway, and then a white Mercedes CL55 AMG parked by the road.

Also two Mercedes G Class SUVs. I know they've been out for two or three years, but I hardly see any. I can understand why, why would anyone pay 70K for something that looks like a box on wheels?

And finally, a grey Chevrolet Uplander and a silver C6 Corvette.

author: stickguy
text: a black on black on black convertible drove by my office. Had to look twice, since I first thought it was a Solara, but the back was a little too flat.

author: lemmer
text:
CLS's are all over the place in my neighborhood (relatively speaking anyway).

I know they are getting mixed reviews, but I love the way they look.

author: stickguy
text: I see a couple near me. I personally think they look rediculous. Style must sell, or why would people pay 10K more for an E class that looks like a bar of soap left in the spray too long?

author: ghulet
text:
....I've seen a few CLS around here, they're certainly, um, distinctive, but as a fan of the old-school utilitarian, conservative, boxy Benzes (think 300E), they're not my cup of tea. Too much flash.

I also just saw my first new Infiniti M, they look nice, but a bit like a 120% sized Subaru Legacy. Not quite stylish enough for $50k to me, YMMV.

author: princeabubu
text: I have seen 2 CLS's running around my city. One is black, which I think looks stunning, and the other is silver, which looks good too. I saw a new 325i yesterday, with sports package. It had a German lisence plate on the front. I was like wtf?? I wonder what the explanation for that was? The only thing I can think of is European Delivery?

author: navigator89
text:
Yeah, I saw a silver CLS today, they really seem to be getting popular. Here in the Midde East we get the CLS350, which features the 3.5L V6, 268hp engine found in the new M Class and SLK. As far as I know, North America only gets the CLS55 AMG and CLS500. I guess because of the lower price for the CLS350 explains why I'm seeing a lot of CLS's.

But today I some pretty neat cars, starting with a blue Mini Cooper Convertible, a red C6 Corvette convertible, a white Mustang, a silver Porsche 911 Carrera and two Lexus GS300s.

Also saw a pearl white Lexus SC430 on some nice rims, and a white Hummer limo that was incredibly long.

But the best part today was seeing my second Aston Martin DB9, parked in an underground garage. The first I saw was on the road. The car looks absolutely stunning, just like all the Ferraris and Lamborghninis. The car was a metallic grey/brown, the same color as the one in the Edmunds First Drive. Aston Martin sure nailed the styling on this one, pictures dont do it justice.

author: merc1
text:
The Aston-Martin DB9 gets my vote as the best looking production car in the world today. It took that distinction away from another Aston-Martin, the Vanquish.

M

author: fintail
text:
Yeah we only have the CLS500 and CLS55...and will get the S350 with the upcoming redesign, so it will probably come here then. That 3.5L is getting good reviews.

I'm seeing the facelifted 7er around a bit lately...and it's still very hard on the eyes. The one I saw yesterday seemed to be sitting low (but was driven by an old man and not some useless spoiled trust-funder who pimped it out as often happens to S-class here) so it either had a suspension hiccup or was in some kind of sport mode. It reminded me of a 48 Hudson or a Citroen DS with none of the charm or innovation.

author: stickguy
text: not sure how long they have been out, but this is the first tme I can actually recall noticing one!

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw 2 of these while on a walk this AM, they're not new but both were Hemis.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...outside a Dodge dealer in Hatboro, PA - a new orange-red metallic Dodge Charger. This car is beautiful! I couldn't keep my eyes off it!

author: stickguy
text: coupe. Didn't realize that were on the loose yet.

author: stickguy
text: maybe you and Andre can get something off in a package deal.

author: navigator89
text:
Is this forum dead? No new models spotted in 5 days? Guess you've all been busy with the July 4th weekend.

Anyway, just saw my first 2006 Sonata. It wasn't on the road, but at the mall, and in silver. The interior is really nice, puts a lot of cars to shame. Hyundai has really hit a homerun.

Also, my 3rd STS, in black, and a beige Bentley Arnage. Finally a white 2006 Lexus GS300.

author: ateixeira
text:
C&D just tested one, and it hit 0-60 in 7.0s. They are gonna sell, big time.

I saw 3 Ridgelines while up in Baltimore near a Marina, one pulling a boat.

Also saw a Lexus GS in the parking lot.

-juice

author: davem2001
text:
Yeah, I agree - I saw my first 2006 Sonata recently and, IMO, anyway, it blows away the Accord and Camry at least in the looks department.

P.S. do you get US built Sonatas in Kuwait?

author: ateixeira
text:
I don't like how they styled it. Profile looks like the Camry and the taillights are from the Accord. Why copy them? The outgoing model was more unique.

Underneath is a much better car, I can't wait to see the Kia Optima version, which might also be sportier.

-juice

author: vt330izhp
text: i saw that same car in hyannis mass and i dont think it exists... i guess sl65 or some other 65amg badging and the guy is to dumb to put 65 instead of 60

author: fintail
text:
Saw what I am pretty sure was an Aston DB9

Rebadging a MB like that is indeed dumb

author: navigator89
text:
Well, at least the Honda Accord is being refreshed for 2007, and the taillights are different so the Sonata wont look so much like an Accord.

But actually, the upcoming Azera's taillights are more similar to the current Accord. The Sonata's head/tailights have some sharp edges at least.

author: ateixeira
text:
Oddly I prefer its styling, maybe it's the rest of the package.

Been inside one? They are shockingly nice. Not just "for a Hyundai", nice period.

-juice

author: toomanyfumes
text: Has a new Bentley Continental GT. It's white, and while an attractive car, It doesn't stand out like a near 200,000 dollar car should.

author: davem2001
text: Is it the replacement for the XG350? I didn't think they were on sale yet?

author: danf1
text: They are supposed to be out within the next 2 months. I think Juice saw it at the Philly show.

author: davem2001
text: I must say, I was very impressed with the new Sonata...It would be on my list if I were looking for a $20K "family sedan". Still not totally "sold" on Hyundai quality compared to a Toyota or Honda, but the Sonata looks great compared to an Accord

author: danf1
text: The new Sonata has been a strange car for us. Our previous Sonata owners hate it. I think hate might even be too nice a word to use. But the good news is that everybody else seems to like it. It is a very nice car, and you should be seeing them all over soon.

author: davem2001
text:
The new Sonata has been a strange car for us. Our previous Sonata owners hate it

That IS strange....Why do you think they hate it?

I think it looks great - If I were in the market for an Accord/Camry right now, I'd certainly put it on my shopping list. But then again, I'm more of a Honda/Acura "loyalist", not a Hyundai fan. I don't like the looks of the old (pre '06) Sonata much at all. The '06 Hyundai is the first Hyundai to hit my radar screen.

author: danf1
text:
They think that the styling is too plain. No matter how good a car it is or should be, they are stuck on the look of the old one. Most seem to like the headlights of the last Sonata. People think it looks like a Jag or Mercedes. Personally, I thought the last style was a bit obnoxious, but beauty is in the eye of the beerholder.

What they've done with the new model is tried to appeal to the masses. Those who never would have considered a Hyundai before. As far as I can tell, it seems to be working.

author: davem2001
text: The new one has a lot of Audi A4 "influence"... but that doesn't really bother me... I'd rather have a car that looks good than looks unique.....

author: navigator89
text:
Actually, Hyundai claimed they used the Audi A6 as inspiration for their exterior design. It looks that way, especially the curved roof.

I don't know if we get US built Sonatas in Kuwait, but I doubt it anyway. It's more likely to come from Korea. Likewise, Camrys are built in Georgetown, Kentucky I believe, but my Camry is built in Australia.

author: ateixeira
text:
I got to see it debut live at the NY show, actually. :-)

Hyundai has come a long way, give them 3-5 years and the public (mostly) will embrace the brand and give them full consideration.

-juice

author: chidoro
text:
it's not new but it's the first I've seen in a very long time, a Hyundai Excel was riding in north Jersey the other day and the car looked to be in decent shape considering. the 155 12 tires looked amusing in this day and age but it was running.

And now back to our regularly scheduled program

author: danf1
text: It looks smaller than I expected, but it looks pretty good. Surprised to see that it is only a 4 seater. This was a black GTP.

author: chidoro
text: Saw a 400h and what I think was a Tribeca this weekend on the NJ Turnpike. The Lexus driver still had his/her temp plates on and was driving at least 90.

author: odie6l
text:
I actually saw a Ford GT40 (i will not call it a Ford GT) today in the Hershey Area on my way into work. The car was Dark Blue with White Stripes and had everybody stopping and watching it (of course we were all at a red light LOL), but boy-howdy was she a sweet looking car.

Odie

author: ateixeira
text:
Suddenly I'm seeing a bunch of these. Saw my first about a week or two ago but now I've seen about 5 on the road. They're picking up.

-juice

author: andys120
text:
I've had a good look at the same new Elise twice this week, once on the highway sans top and once parked w the top up.

I give Lotus a big thumbs up! The Elise looks like what it is a modern lightweight pure sports car for street and track. Some think the styling a bit insect like but I think it's nearly perfect. My only criticism would be of the overly bust rump of the car where four round tailights compete for a small space with a oversized chrome letters spelling out L-O-T-U-S.

The Titanium paint and the shutlines are as good as they get on a non-Mettalic body. It's interesting to see what a great job this non-British owner (Proton of Malaysia) is doing with the unique legacy of Lotus.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a new sedan in Rehoboth Beach, DE, it really stands out in a nice way. Walked by a dozen Bimmers and Benzes but had to stop and admire the unique Maser.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...the girl next door seems to have traded her huge pig of a Tahoe for a new gray Ford Five Hundred. I guess those $65 fill-ups got to be too much.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a black 3 series and then a new Jetta a little later. Then caught a Ridgeline coming the other way, all on my commute home yesterday.

-juice

author: jaserb
text:
I was on vacation and by pure chance drove by the Subaru plant in Lafayette, IN. Had no idea I was anywhere near the place. I stopped and asked if they gave tours but they needed more advance notice and I was just passing through. Lots and lots and lots of Tribecas on the back lot...

-Jason

author: merc1
text:
While waiting to make a turn into a particular tricky intersection I saw a SL55, CLK500 and a old-school E320 Cabriolet all with their tops down and one behind the other other. It would have been perfect for a MB commercial.

M

author: chidoro
text: Finally saw my first Ridgeline on the road last evening, a white one. Caught sight of another Tribeca, black, this morning on my way to work with the temp plates on.

author: ateixeira
text:
National ads just started this week, so we should start seeing more of these around.

-juice

author: navigator89
text:
Today I saw three Hummer H1s parked in front of a large house. H1s arent new, but they're pretty rare, and I can see why. The Hummers were in brown, red and white.

Also saw a red Ferrari 360 Modena, blue 2006 Lexus GS300, red Ford Mustang and white 2006 BMW 3 series all at the mall.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw one today ... in my driveway! Managed to finagle a loaner and it's niiiiice. :-)

Later, gotta go drive...some where!

-juice

author: fintail
text: I've seen several H3s lately. I think they will compete best with....the H2. The same debatable looks and more realistic size for less cash.

author: i_luv_toyota
text:
I saw a red H3 today and a yellow H3 a few weeks back. From what I could see, it actually doesn't look too bad.

I also saw a car carrier full of Chevy HHRs, all the same dark grey color, this past Friday. I didn't know they were on sale yet. I like it, put I prefer the other retromobile's (PT Cruiser) curvy style compared to the blocky HHR style.

author: chidoro
text: I ran a race at Teterboro Airport this past Saturday. A Mercedes rep was on-hand for promotional purposes. With him he brought a new M-class, a CLS500, and a Maybach 57. It was my first time seeing the Maybach upclose and it is quite the monster.

author: lemmer
text:
Around here, H2s are total soccer mommymobiles. I don't know who will buy the H3s. Who wants a smaller, sweeter version of the biggest, baddest?

By the way, at my daughters' preschool one of the moms drives a yellow H2. My five year old daughter got downright indignant with me when I tried to tell her it wasn't a school bus. Her reasoning was that it is yellow, huge, and has marker lights on the roof, and that makes it a school bus.

It is kind of ironic that the lady likely thinks she is oozing prestige, and my daughter thinks she is a bus driver and that her kids must be a little on the goofy side because they ride to school on the "short bus."

author: ateixeira
text:
Interesting timing, your post. Hummer sales were up 210.5% in June. :-)

-juice

author: lemko
text: ....new silver Cobalt sedan. Yesterday, I saw a sleek black Dodge Charger.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw this Z8 at a Marina in Ocean City, parked nex to my loaner. Talk about a rare photo!

-juice

author: stickguy
text:
took a trip to NY this weekend. Saw quite a few chargers on the NY Thruway, so they must be getting out there. Saw some other stuff too, just cant remember what it was.

I have been noticing a lot of Cobalt's around (2 doors). I think I notice them because the taillights stand out, in a good way. Hard to go wrong copying Ferrari styling (unless it is the Enzo).

author: fintail
text:
A yellow H2 is kind of a school bus. Both are just as inappropriate as a hauler for 1 or 2 people to their mall and child hauling duties. Brain addled trophy wives and clueless aging yuppies, unite!

"Who wants a smaller, sweeter version of the biggest, baddest? "

I think some soccer moms and similar types will. Lower price, less consumption, easier to park (and the drivers of these things often need help in that area) similar pseudo-intimidating looks.

I've seen a few more Cobal coupes over the past days. Seems the sedans beat them to market by many weeks. Still no SS on the road though...only seen one on a dealers lot, with a big second sticker I am sure,

author: davem2001
text: I think it will sell pretty well - a lot of people that want an H2 but can't afford one CAN afford an H3. Big difference between the payment on a $32K vehicle vs. a $50K vehicle.

author: chidoro
text: I also saw a 750i this past Saturday as well. Just the regular wheelbase :P

author: andys120
text:
were all the B9 Tribecas, since Subies are thick as thieves here in New England and the new 'becas have been reported quite a bit on this board.

Well today I got a glimpse of one in the rearview and it wasn't at all unpleasant to look at, fish mouth and all. No doubt they'll be all over the place in a short while.

author: stickguy
text: saw another new one on the road today near the house (to go along with the white one that lives 3 doors down from me). THis one was silver, a nice color for it.

author: ateixeira
text:
Not that they are brand new, but it really stood out, and it looked fairly new.

Also saw an Avalon and a Mustang. Those are abundant now.

Check out the pic I took below and you may understand the grille a little better. It evokes the aero heritage of FHI.

-juice

author: davem2001
text: It doesn't look any better with that model airplane glued to the hood! LOL!

author: ateixeira
text:
I had to try to convert you. LOL

-juice

author: davem2001
text: but right now, I'm not a big fan of the new "corporate face" of Subie

author: lemmer
text: I just saw a Buick Lacrosse for the first time - they must not be selling very well here. They look like a mildly updated LeSabre. Actually updated is too strong of a word, because to me it doesn't look any newer or more modern than the LeSabre.

author: ateixeira
text:
I also see very few of them. Only a handful since they've been out, and that was a while ago.

-juice

author: kyfdx
text:
The new one.. starting to see more of these.. IMO, much more pleasing to the eye than the Accord and Camry.. Exactly opposite of before...

Still... wouldn't buy one with your money.

author: bumpy
text: I've seen a LaCrosse or three...probably more, but until last week I didn't know how to tell it apart from the flotilla of oval-grilled LeSabres and Park Avenues favored by the local chapter of the Cataract Squad (the LaCrosse has bug-eye foglights inboard of the regular headlights).

author: ateixeira
text:
I dunno, I think in profile it looks like a Camry and from the rear it looks like an Accord. The resemblance almost seems intentional.

I like the front view the best, that hood is well shaped.

-juice

author: kyfdx
text:
I don't see the resemblence from the rear... The Accord butt is... well butt-ugly..

I think the Sonata is a big improvement over that... and a big improvement over the old model... Before, they reminded me of the Kias and old Daewoos.... Copying the Camcords, but somehow coming off looking cheap..

Now, it looks like it could actually be a Honda or Toyota.. which, overall, is a good thing....

Still.. not on my short list... maybe some other list that starts with sh....

regards,
kyfdx

author: ateixeira
text:
Both have tail lights that look like they are upside down. That's what I noticed.

It looks OK overall, just kinda conservative.

The 2004 Sonata was the most reliable car on the CR survey. They've come a long way.

-juice

author: kyfdx
text:
While I hold CR's survey results in high regard... An '04 is a car that is less than two-years-old and is still in warranty..

I tell everyone my wife's BMW has been very reliable, and only left her stranded one time... but, the maintenance is free, and the dealer gives me a loaner.. When I really stop and think about it, it has about five times the average problems of the Accords she used to drive...

I think Hyundai will need about ten years of Honda-like reports to sway me towards it... The price advantage isn't as large as it used to be...

I try to keep an open mind...... If the '04 Sonatas still have good surveys in '09, I might change my tune..

regards,
kyfdx

author: ateixeira
text:
That's all Hyundai needs, IMO. In five years' time they would have shed their old image.

-juice

author: davem2001
text: I'm very impressed with the looks of the '06 Sonata but I'm still not 100% convinced of their long term quality/reliability/resale value, etc... I don't want to be the first on my block to buy one.....Maybe when it's time to get a new car later this decade...I have an open mind about it.... I'm not really a "loyalist" or "fanatic" about any particular brand.

author: lemmer
text:
It kind of reminds me of when a new Galant came out around 1999. I think it was C&D who had a Galant V6 beating a 4cyl Camry, 4cyl Accord, and everything else in a comparison test. A lot of people thought the Galant was better looking, too.

And consumers said "OK" and continued to buy Camry and Accords.

The new Sonata looks pleasant to me, almost if they took a mold of an Accord and revised the areas that were getting complaints. I would buy one with kyfdx's money, but not with my own. I would have to drive it myself, as my wife would not drive even a free Hyundai.

author: kyfdx
text:
Well... if you have to buy one with my money, then you are out of luck, as I don't have any....

However, if you want to use my credit, you could, unfortunately, buy a 911 Turbo...

I'm always on the edge... One little attack of CCBA syndrome, and I'm only six months away from bankruptcy...

author: davem2001
text:
The new Sonata looks pleasant to me, almost if they took a mold of an Accord and revised the areas that were getting complaints.

I'd agree with that - what I don't like about the Accord is the nose, with the upside down headlights (the turn signals above the headlights)... The Sonata fixes that with it's Audi A4 nose.

author: jaserb
text:
The first one I've seen outside the dealer's lot. Pretty sharp looking little peoplemover - if we didn't already have an MPV we'd give it serious consideration. It's hard to move down once you're used to the extra space, though.

-Jason

author: jcat707
text: Today while driving on the freeway, I saw a silver Lincoln Zephyr. I didn't like the taillights on the back and it looked kind of small but look okay to me.

author: fintail
text:
Today I spotted a Range Rover Sport. I don't see where the "sport" is, it looks like a 4/5ths scale Range Rover. But I don't see the "sport" in most any SUV.

But here's the good one...a mile or so later, I pull into the gas station I always use, and pulling out of it is a FERRARI ENZO. I'd never seen one in person. It really looks like a F1 car compared to all the SUVs and minivans on the road. It's a car that cost as much as a house even here.

author: kyfdx
text:
Enzo.. an amazing spotting..

I thought the Range Rover Sport was just a supercharged Range Rover... I don't think it is a smaller vehicle, is it? (not that I follow Range Rovers).

Yesterday... on the way home.. E55 AMG.. I'm starting to think Cincinnati is the AMG capital of the world...

regards,
kyfdx

author: fintail
text:
I know that Enzo was my best new car sighting. I was stunned. It looked like something from another planet.

The Range Rover Sport has to be different...the rear greenhouse is more angled. It looks smaller. Probably not pricewise anyway.

I saw a CLS55 AMG last weekend. I'd rather have an E.

author: jcat707
text: The Range Rover Sport is a smaller and slightly cheaper version of the regular Range Rover. Also, this morning I saw an orange G6 coupe for the first time. It looks good to me. It reminds me of the Honda Accord coupe.

author: ghulet
text:
....in the past week, I've seen the following:

Audi A3 five-door, silver, pretty loaded (fancy upgraded alloys, mirror-mounted turning indicators), very nice looking, not much smaller than an A4 Avant

Bentley Continental GT, in a strange kind of bright cobalt blue (I think this is the third Continental I've seen, though)

Maserati Quattroporte, charcoal gray with saddle tan interior, sitting in a valet lot in the Loop on a weekday

Maserati coupe (can't remember the name), also gray with tan interior, really didn't look too special, parked on Dearborn (I don't know if I could park a $100k car on the street if I had one; it's probably a good thing I don't, eh?)

author: derrado1
text:
The Range Rover Sport is based on the Discovery platform... but with Range Rover looks. I only found out the other day, I kept wondering why a sportier version would cost LESS.

I'm not sure it's the greatest idea though. Ignoring the rakish glass at the back, it looks exactly like a normal Range Rover. It's like the red-headed stepchild.

author: nace818
text: A couple of days ago I spotted a new Mercedes CL500 I think it was. It's the swoopy one, the best way I can describe it It was so FINE! Dark blue with a tan leather interior,plus it was the AMG version. If I had a car this fine, I would be afraid to drive it because it might get dinged. I stopped at my local dealer to price one,way out of my league at $104,000.

author: fintail
text:
Must have been a CLS55...but I don't know about the price. They should be well under 100K, unless it had some odd performance upgrades.

I saw a yellow Elise today. They ae becoming a regular sight in this area

author: lemko
text: ...black 2006 Dodge Charger...pulled over by the Philadelphia Police Highway Patrol! I guess he couldn't resist trying out that Hemi!

author: ateixeira
text:
Already collecting tickets, eh?

Saw a couple of Mustangs, a Freestyle, some Avalons. The usual suspects.

-juice

author: lemmer
text:
I saw one of those yesterday. I don't really have an opinion on their looks. When I saw Chargers back in the day, I just thought of them as big cars with big V8s. I don't think I really even noticed that they were two-doors until the Duke boys started driving them. I see the new Charger and see a big car with a big engine, so what is all the fussing about doors about?

I saw two new Lincoln pick-em-ups. I don't get that at all.

author: ateixeira
text:
Also saw a new STS. Actually I thought I'd spotted my first Fusion out on the road, but it was the STS.

-juice

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Spent a week in London (standing on the steps of the Hotel Russell an hour before the bus blew up in front of it :surprise: ) and 2 weeks driving around Ireland.

Not much in Ireland but in London I saw probably a dozen Bentley GT's a few hot looking TVR's, Aston Martin's (my faves) aplenty. Peugot, Ford, MB own the market there, literally. They are everywhere, especially the Benzes... Toyota is pretty popular with the Avensis, Audi has a strong prescence and BMW does pretty well. But on the outskirts of London (we took a tour bus out of town) every other vehicle was a Vauxhal Vectra or Ford Mondeo. BTW, there is a Mondeo ST220 which is smokin hot, really nice car. I even caught a gorgeous '67 Mustang Fastback in Blue driving by B. Palace. There were a few Citroen's, Honda Accords (TSX) and CRV's and Mini's are very popular. All in all, London a was pretty cool place to see cars that we don't get here in the states

Side note, we rented a Toyota Avensis 4D4 (2.0 diesel) with a stick and I was quite impressed. Plenty of pep moving such a big car around and it returned 53 mpg!!! I am totally sold on the idea of diesels, this one was excellent. Had a little bit of Diesel patter on idle, but moving along it was unobtrusive and very smooth in operation. And the Avensis itself was a pretty nice vehicle IMO. A bit too much vehicle for the tiny Ireland roads, but a comfortable cruiser (when you could).

author: davem2001
text: Isn't that the car that the Scion tC is based on?

author: anythngbutgm
text: It was a pretty big car, about the size of a Camry. Had a bit of style as well (for a yota) Drove really nicely and I probably could have parked my S2000 in the boot of the thing!!!

author: davem2001
text: It's smaller than the USA Camry, (just like the Euro Accord is smaller than the USA Accord)...I'm pretty sure reading somewhere that the Avensis "platform" is the basis for the Scion tC

author: andys120
text:
what the plural of Prius is (Priuses? Pruisi? :confuse: ) because all of a sudden they are everywhere, I see at least three or four on my 20 mile drive to/from work and I even saw a first gen car today.

Funny thing is, I live in an exurban area where there isn't much advantage in gas mileage for hybrids over an efficient gas-powered car (they're relatively best in stop-and-go city traffic).

author: PF_Flyer
text:
Prius is like moose and deer, the plural is that same as the singular... at least according to an article I found.
http://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=10000080&sid=asahuwSpo4XA&refer=asia

"...The carmaker sold 8,200 Prius last year. "

author: teds1
text:
A couple of good odd one's recently:
Weirdest was an Alpina 7 series (previous body style) right hand drive in the middle of manattan

SLR Mclaren, just the back end turning a corner

Quattroporte in my neighborhood owned by a artsy looking guy in his late twenties (just not the demographic I imagined for them)

Range Rover Sport, which looked nice I guess but performance SUVs are stupid... there really shouldn't be any debate on this

nice 80's M6 one of my all time faves

a couple of Maybachs ( I work on Park avenue)

A ton of bentley GTs and cls mercs, only one AMG cls 55 though

and this morning the A6 wagon which was stunning. what a good looking car just wait till you see it. Best looking vehicle out of all the above... seriously

author: fintail
text: NYC must be a great high end spotting town

author: ateixeira
text:
* new Mustang
* 2 BMW 3 series
* Jetta
* black Tribeca

-juice

author: ghulet
text: ....Mercedes SLK 280? I'm almost sure, I was walking by it and it was parked, but I didn't think any 280s were sold here; I was under the impression that we'd either have the SLK 230 or SLK 320 (or both).

author: guss
text:
going in the opposite direction. At first I thought it was an MPV, until I see it from behind and it has the tuner tail lights. Nobody puts metallic tail lights on an MPV.

Alot nicer than I thought it would be.

author: jcat707
text: Today I saw a new Jeep Commander (about the third one that I've seen), an Escape Hybrid, and the new Acura RL.

author: ateixeira
text:
On the way to work today.

Also saw a Lexus GS on the way home yesterday, much improved styling over the old car.

Commander? I've only seen those at the auto shows.

5 looks sharp, doesn't it? You can get a manual tranny in a people mover, finally.

-juice

author: merc1
text:
No more SLK320 and 230, as a matter of fact there are no more 4-cylinder MBs sold in the U.S. anymore from the 2006 model year onward. The SLK now comes in 280 and 350 guise. The 280 is a 228hp 3.0L V6 and the 350 is a 268hp 3.5L V6.

M

author: fintail
text:
I've heard that 350 is a fairly sweet unit, too.

Good riddance to those rough 4cyl cars.

author: lemko
text: ...silver Buick Terrazza - the first one I've seen outside the dealership.

author: merc1
text:
Good riddance to those rough 4cyl cars.

Amen to that!

M

author: fintail
text: That reminds me...when the current C class came out, I went and looked at the first one the dealer had. This guy was somehow anxious to get me into it (it was purple! puke) although I was still in school and couldn't really buy any new car, and he went and started it for me. It was that 4cyl unit, and it sounded very bad. I actually asked him if it had an exhaust manifold leak.

author: merc1
text:
Yeah I remember that color, it was called Amethyst. I didn't hate it, but I wouldn't a Benz in that color either. I too was shocked to hear the I4 for the first time in the C as well as the original SLK230. Sounded like a John Deere.

M

author: jcat707
text: I agree about the original 2.3 liter four cylinder but the newer 1.8 liter used in the 2003 and up C-Class vehicles sounds and feels alot better.

author: fintail
text:
That's good to know. I honestly felt that old unit was embarrassing. It should remain in strippo non-NA markets in cars with cloth interiors and no amenities.

MB makes some excellent 6s and over the past 15 years some world class V8s...but that 4 was just not a premium product.

author: ateixeira
text:
I was about the say the same thing.

Also, I've driven this engine back-to-back with the 240 (2.6l V6) and much preferred the supercharged 4. It was not related to the old 2.3l S/C unit, and a whole lot smoother. I'm sad to see it go, actually.

The SLK350 is a hoot, plenty fun and fast. In fact I'm sure the SLK280 is more than adequate, but I haven't sampled that engine yet.

-juice

author: teds1
text: Last night I saw an Orange Murcielago on a trailer go by on amsterdam avenue... just stunning. We have a lot of nice cars in NYC but no Lambos that I've ever seen... It had New Hampshire plates "7seven7," which seemed odd to me. One would think California or Florida with a car like that

author: andys120
text: It's only about the third I've seen in 6 months (including a Canadian variant) , they're rally not selling well.

author: rcc8179
text: I saw a silver Chevy HHR on the way to work this morning. The front-end looked like a miniature version of the squared-off GM minivan front end, and it had a huge Silverado-sized bow tie in the middle of the back liftgate (just in case you didn't realize it's not a PT Cruiser). I didn't care for it, but then I am not a GM fan.

author: ateixeira
text:
Funny you mention it because I saw one yesterday as well. But they do seem rare.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...LaCrosses are quite common. Must be a regional thing. Our Buick dealer couldn't keep 'em in stock. My girlfriend's car had to come from New Jersey.

author: boomchek
text: On the freeway back from work I saw a gold Bentley GT driving the opposite way. I think the GT in black looks classier. Then I saw a yellow Ferrari F360 Spyder, stunning car especially in yellow. Can't mistake it for anything else.

author: ghulet
text: ....I also saw an HHR, though I completely forgot about it til you mentioned it, I was walking to the train from having minor surgery (which didn't turn out to be so minor, otherwise I would have arranged a ride!). Anywho, the HHR was silver with gray interior (yawn), looked like a somewhat boxier PT with a more chopped looking roof and tiny upright windshield, which I hope aren't becoming the new trend, I don't like what it does to outward vision, headroom or my general feeling of claustrophobia. Give me a big, airy greenhouse any day, like the one on my old Accord.

author: toomanyfumes
text: Has a white Bentley GT. The more I look at it, the more I like it. White just does'nt do it justice, though. Black, or red, as I saw in a magazine recently,would look much better. Not a new car, but today I saw a mid 90's Nissan 2-door compact. (200NX?) Anyway, it had a factory body colored rear spoiler, to which the owner had bolted a pep boys aluminum job. I'm surprised it did'nt have the plastic spinny hubcaps.

author: ghulet
text: .....I've only seen the Bentley GT in a charcoal gray and a strange cobalt blue, both looked OK, though I question the choice of blue as far as resale goes. I almost invariably hate white cars, the exception being '80s Cadillac Fleetwoods, for some reason. They're not too popular in Illinois what with the rust issues and general lack of heat most months. You're a lot more likely to see grays, black, blues and greens.

author: fintail
text:
I've seen the GT in many colors here. The gray is most common, also a maroon/burgundy that I recall. I've seen one white one...not my first choice.

I really want to see the Flying Spur or whatever the sedan variant is to be called.

author: kyfdx
text:
The Lotus dealership in Columbus was advertising their new Elise's.. That is about two hours from here.. they sell Lotus, BMW, Ferrari.. but, I don't ever remember them advertising in our paper..

They listed six of them.. with color, major options, and MSRP.. All between $44K-$49K..

This makes me think they are having trouble selling them...

regards,
kyfdx

author: kyfdx
text: AMG capital of the world.. I saw another CLS55 AMG.. In silver this time.. with temporary tags..

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a couple of Ridgelines this weekend, and a Tribeca or two as well. Both are beginning to become common.

-juice

author: teds1
text:
I had a hell of a spotting weekend, mostly b/c I went out in greenwich village Friday night and then drove out towards the hamptons the next day.
I saw a Challenge stradale 360 in front of a restaurant covered in racing sponsorship details including the logo of the restaurant, I guess it's the owner's or something. There was a burgundy Arnage red label parked in front of our restaurant... very nice color. Later that night a blue Azure rolled slowly by driven by a really fat guy who was clearly hoping someone would look at him. (Those cars are for attention craving losers, I prefer coupes). The next day on the highway I saw a black 360 spyder, a red diablo, and a black Rolls Corniche (rebadged Bentley azure). Coming back into the city we saw a lovely Austin Healey 3000 which was truthfully the nicest looking car of all

Oh and the Benz dealership near my office has a black Mclaren SLR with a big yelow SOLD sticker on the windshield... Must be nice to walk in on your lunch break and impulse buy one of those

author: anythngbutgm
text: Neighbor just bought a Mustang GT conv. over the weekend. Red w/white top. Pretty sharp looking vehicle. Also saw a few people taking B9's out for test drives. Avalons have become so common I wouldn't even call them a find any more...

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw one of these behind me in my commute today. Looks good on the road, better than in pics. You gotta see it in 3D, I like how the lights are incorporated in the car's lines instead of vice-versa.

-juice

author: merc1
text:
These have been out for a while, but I hadn't seen one yet. The Mini Cooper Convertible. Cute as a speckled puppy it is.

M

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a blue Charger yesterday, then a couple of Mustangs. Wonder if they made a 2 door if it would sell as well as the 'stang?

-juice

author: teds1
text:
Lotus Elise, rare in NYC because they would be really painful to drive here.
Maybach 57, full of people (like 6)

CL65.... so nice it hurt

author: lemko
text: ...blue Chevrolet Cobalt sedan on my way to mail some letters.

author: danf1
text: I was expecting to hate it, but it didnt look too bad. Much larger than I expected. Now if they would just do something about the engine and suspension settings.

author: jcat707
text: Yesterday I spotted a 2006 BMW 325 sedan. I like the new style. It looks much better than the 5 and 7 series redesigns.

author: ateixeira
text:
Rear drum brakes and a torsion beam suspension.

But the price is right. Besides the PT it might also have to compete with the Scion xB.

-juice

author: fintail
text: I saw a silver Gallardo today...I'd take it.

author: jcat707
text: Today I saw a white Hummer H3 and a silver 2006 Impala. The H3 is too small for my taste but I think it's great for the people who want a Hummer but can't afford to spend 50K for a vehicle. I haven't made a decision if I like the new Impala exterior but I can definitely say the the interior looks much better that the previous model, at least from the pics that I've seen here on Edmunds.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw one in a Chevy dealer's lot, still none on the roads yet that I've spotted.

Mustangs were all over the place at the beach, I lost count.

-juice

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a white one, first one I've seen on the road. I like 'em but my wife simply hated it. She doesn't like the styling of the Matrix either so I think it's just the wedgy shape with the pointed headlights that she dislikes.

She said the HHR looked like a clown car.

Didn't like either one at all.

-juice

author: fintail
text: Yesterday I saw a yellow Smart car, and at the MB dealer they had outside for display a C55, E55 wagon, CL65, and S65...lots of hp combined!

author: kyfdx
text:
...since all the license plate forums are Read Only.

N2WSHIN

I had to stare at this one for about 30 seconds at a stop light, before I got it..

author: chidoro
text: Saw a blue Quattroporte on Saturday morning. Looked magnificent.

author: andys120
text:
got only a quick glance, it looked just like an H3, only smaller. I also took a look at a parked Equinox which looked okay except for the overly wide chrome band in the nose.
It's too big for the car, they should've scaled it down from the sive they use on K-10a and Suburbans.

I saw quite a few Audi A8s during a recent trip to the NYC area. Everywhere you go you see new Mustangs, coupes outnumber 'verts but not by as much as you'd think. but V6s outnumber GTs 2-1.

author: andre1969
text:
I saw a white H3. Yesterday I saw a whole tractor-trailer full of VW Phaetons. Good looking car, and IMO marred only by the taillights and the VW badging.

On Saturday night I also got a good closeup look of the 2006 Impala, on a sales lot in Harrisburg. Pulled my Intrepid up next to it just to get a comparison. Man, those things have gotten tall! It's not a bad looking car, and the pricing seemed reasonable. I don't know if it's going to save GM, but it won't hurt. If I were in the market for a new car, and if the Charger/300 weren't out, I'd consider one.

author: kyfdx
text:
Infiniti M35x..

Kind of non-descript for a $50K car... For looks, you could toss this, the Lexus GS and the Acura RL in a blender.... All the same generic look..

author: andre1969
text: I also saw a new GS350 (I think they're up to the 350 now, aren't they?) Only saw it from the back, but I thought it was pretty attractive. About the only thing I don't like are the circles that look like they're drawn on the taillights.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw two of each yesterday and this morning. They seem to be selling well, at least in my 'hood.

They're pretty conservative, but handsome at the same time. At least they don't offend like some parts of newer Bimmers (Bangle butts and Dame Edna lights).

The M45 even manages to have a bit of character.

-juice

author: toomanyfumes
text: Saw a couple of new Chargers yesterday. Better looking than I expected, and better in person than in pictures.

author: stickguy
text: starting to see them all over the place now. None with a light bar yet though!

author: fintail
text: I saw one of those new Bentley Continental-based sedans today, driving by the local Rolls/Bentley lot. It had British plates, but was LHD

author: lemko
text: ...the first Chevrolet HHR I've seen on the road. This one was black and looked pretty sharp!

author: lemko
text: ...a deep sapphire blue metallic Buick LaCrosse parked in front of my house.

author: ncmom
text:
I was taking a short cut on the road behind all the car dealers here. It was an Audi, tall car or short SUV wrapped almost completely in white, except for the windows. It's shaped reminded me of the Pacifica.

When it turned onto a side street, a whole lot of cars followed it. Either its some super cool car I am ignorant about, or I got caught in a car commercial.

Any ideas what it could have been?

author: merc1
text:
Most likely it was their new crossover/SuV thingy, the Q7. What one was doing here so soon is anyone's guess.

M

author: imidazol97
text: Saw a bronze HHR today. Couldn't figure out what it was on the interstate ramp next to me. Has a jaunty look-like the Scion box vehicle. It doesn't have the hunched look the PT does have.

author: PF_Flyer
text: Haven't seen an HHR in the wild yet. Bronze sounds like it would be a good color for it!

author: xmf314
text: Here in West Los Angeles I see a surprising number of new Bentley Continental GTs. I don't know what the production figures are, but they are becoming fairly common here.

author: kyfdx
text: .. a new Ford 500 with the full carriage-roof treatment... and, chrome wheels..

author: anythngbutgm
text: Spotted an awesome Electric blue Roush Mustang (new body style) with the white racing stripes. WOW. very slick...

author: kyfdx
text:
Cadilllac XLR... with the top up...

I'm pretty sure this is the first one I've ever seen, except at the Cadillac dealership (which is next to my Honda dealership... I've never set foot in there, I swear.. :surprise: )

author: jcat707
text:
Unfortunately I have seen a couple of 500s with carriage roofs. One had a burgandy roof and another had a black roof. About 2 months ago I saw a Chrysler 300 with a carriage roof. Carriage roofs mess up the car in my opinion but after all, it's their money and if they like it then they can get it.

Other than that I saw a red Ferrari going down the street. I couldn't tell which one but it looks like the same Ferrari that Edmunds just tested. I believe it's called the F430?

Lastly I went to the Ford Innovation drive and saw the 2006 Explorer, Ford Fusion, Ford GT, and the Roush Mustang shown above.

author: ghulet
text: ....the first I saw was a silver five-door, kinda blended in with A4s, but the last one I saw was a yellow three-door, quite a bit more distinctive (though I don't like yellow cars!).

author: toomanyfumes
text: next to me at a stop light. I took off quickly, hoping to make him step on it a bit so I could hear the engine. He few by me like a shot, and it sounded awesome.

author: anythngbutgm
text: When I was in London last month I was at B. Palace and had the opportunity to hear one of the new DB9's. WOW. This guy was hammering the hell out if it leaving a stoplight, I think it was my favorite part of the whole 3 week trip!!!

author: teds1
text:
Just got back from a week in Italy... needless to say there was a lot of cool stuff over there. Some highlights.

Blue 575 Ferrari filling up next to me at the gas station... probably very expensive to run given fuel prices there (35 Euro for half a tank in my tiny rental)

Silver Lambo Gallardo parked on a small quiet unassuming street in a small tuscan town

Purple Spykker c8 going to the Palio in Siena... unbelievable to see and hear driver looked about 27, maybe a race car driver

The Alpha GT is pretty sweet looking as are all the alphas... I'd love to get them here but they seem pretty pricey for what they are

Smart cars and roadsters of course

I rented a tiny thing called a Fiat Panda. actually anything with a manual is fun there because of the great roads and this 60 HP monster did not dissapoint.

Weird thing called a Lancia Thesis... like a Maybach crossed with a bug eyed sprite roadster from the 60s... probably a nice car but very strange looking...

Great trip, I highly reccomend it...

author: ghulet
text: ....(2006, that is) today, strangely enough, after I had read the entire 2006 discussion forum last night. The one I saw was black or dark blue (it was from the elevated train, so not the best sighting); nicer looking car, certainly, than the last one, but a whole lot less distinctive. The car basically has an old Impala-meets-Accord-meets-Stratus (rear end) look. And what's with the really long front overhang of recent GM cars (the Impala and LaCrosse, in particular)? It's not good.

author: andys120
text:
I happened to see a couple of 2006 Impalas this weekend, I thought both were huge improvements on the rather insipid looking current style, very clean and sleek looking.
No gimmicky tailights or silver nose band.

One was an SS sporting a big pair of tailights and big (19"?) wheels.

The best looking Chevy sedan since the 970 Malibu(?) :shades:

author: ateixeira
text:
Plenty on my way home today...

BMW 3er
Qvale Mangusta (!)
Saab 9-2 Linear (not new but still uncommon)
Lexus GS

-juice

author: boomchek
text:
LOL, those are true car enthusiasts up there (anythingbutgm, and teds1) if the favourite part of an overseas vacation is seeing a rare exotic car that you rarely spot here.

I am like that too. When my parents returned from their London trip last month and were showing me the photos of the trip, all I was doing is spotting the unique cars parked along the streets that we don't get to see here. :P

author: anythngbutgm
text: I'll admit it here on the boards, but don't tell my wife... :P

author: ateixeira
text:
In fact I remember people according to what I saw them driving. It's pathetic.

-juice

author: PF_Flyer
text:
But I saw a Mercedes CLS 500on the road today. The sweeping arches of the lines, in almost every direction is what caught my eye. Very "concept car-like" if you know what I mean. It certainly was more striking than the photos of the Mercedes CLS 500 come across on the photo page here.
It's always amazing when a car looks different while it's in motion

author: lemko
text:
Don't know whether this should be here or in the "Spotted an Obscure Car" topic, but last night I saw a medium gray VW Phaeton.

At lunch I saw a new black VW Corolla...er...Jetta.

author: ateixeira
text:
Still seem rare, but I have seen a couple in the past week or so that I forgot to mention.

-juice

author: xmf314
text:
At lunch I saw a new black VW Corolla...er...Jetta

I have also seen a few VW Corollas...er...Jettas... What were the Volkswagen people thinking?

author: ateixeira
text:
I think their prices just crept up too much lately. An A3 breaks $30 grand easily, even without Quattro or a V6 engine. It's a fancy Golf, for goodness sake. That's where the A4 Avant should be priced, not the A3.

Lots of Jettas sticker for $27-28k and that's not even fully loaded.

I don't know about you, but when I think Jetta I think $20k, not $28k.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...a Jetta seems high - except for maybe a really loaded one. Whatever happened to the "People's Car?" I remember seeing a concept Bus. Was this project shelved?

author: ateixeira
text:
Yeah, but they're doing some other type of van now.

VW prices are where Audi should be. Audi is way high right now.

-juice

author: lemmer
text:
HHR - looks like a Trailblazer wrecked into a PT Cruiser. Is there anyone left looking for this kind of novelty?

Tribeca - looks like a Murano wrecked into a...I don't know, it just looks somewhat like a Murano with a really ugly front end.

Jetta - I would love to defend it, but I can't. I have to think a GLX with bigger wheels will help in the looks department.

author: andre1969
text: Murano wrecked into a '58 Edsel, perhaps? Or one of those old "pregnant" late 40's Packards? :P

author: ateixeira
text:
Murano + Alfa nose?

-juice

author: kyfdx
text: Umm.. that makes it sound way better than it looks....

author: ateixeira
text:
I think they look good in person, distinctive.

Initial reactions were negative but people seemed to have warmed to the look. I had a press car for 4 days and got a lot of looks with the thumbs up.

-juice

author: fintail
text:
It reminds me of an early 60s Saab

Yesterday I saw a Lambo Murcielago driving down my street, and late last night maybe 11pm I saw some kind of newer Ferrari, it was black..I could hear it and I looked out the window. Couldn't tell what it was though.

author: kyfdx
text:
Reminds me of the girl with a "great personality"..

Just don't look at her face...

author: andre1969
text: to pay some homage to Alfa. Unfortunately, narrow, vertical themes on cars rarely worked out well, especially once the 40's set in and hoodlines became lower, while fenders filled out and rose upward. Think of the Tucker's 3rd headlight, the Edsel, the pregnant Packards, some of the beakier Pontiacs and the big Fords and Mercury Montegos with the "poke through" center grille sections. And truth be told, that vertical slit didn't look so hot on some of the Alfas, either.

author: andre1969
text: I guess that's what paper bags are for! :P You can also try turning out the lights. But transferred to automotive terms, I guess that means you can only drive it at night, and I don't think they make paper bags THAT big! :shades:

author: ateixeira
text:
I got positive reactions from the people I saw. My nanny liked it, my neighbor (who drives Audis and Volvos) loved it. Some surfers that walked by when I was at the beach gave it the thumbs up, too.

It's a very distinctive look so people that like conservative/boxy are the ones that complain the loudest. That group is a lot more vocal than the people that like it (like me).

-juice

author: kyfdx
text:
The local Cadillac/Subaru dealer sponsors the home show... they park a car in every driveway ($1MM dollar homes)..

My wife, who loves SUVs, came out of the garage of one home, and saw the Tribeca sitting in the driveway... "Ooooh.. what is that? Looks nice"..

Then came around to the front and did a double-take...

I feel the same way.. a very nice vehicle... looks good from about 2/3 of the normal viewing angles..

regards,
kyfdx

author: ateixeira
text:
Frankly, I think it's much ado about nothing. The grille is just 12"x16".

Compare that to a Dodge Ram, and you barely even notice it.

Subaru should offer a chrome delete, though, it would look better with a black mesh insert.

-juice

author: teds1
text: I just can't believe that given the negative press and pulic opinon on the shape and design they went ahead and extended it down the line. Now one of my favorite cars (WRX STI) is going to have the "Subaru Schnozz" as well. I guess I will have to hold onto the 04-05' as the last years post bug eye headlights and pre ugly nose. What is is it with the corporate grill nowadays in general. We love the one's that are classic and established... Kidney BMWs, vertical bar jeeps, crosshair dodges, mesh bentleys etc... but none of the redesigns I have seen recently were such hits. The three bar fords are not really worth mentioning, they are pretty bland. The Audi trapezoid is still kind of ugly but since the cars look so good otherwise I'm willing to overlook it. But the Subaru?... I am a devoted Subaru owner and fan but this is really trying my loyalty. I think the tribeca is a tremendous waste of time in general although the dash is really cool and they will probably sell a lot of them despite it's flawed appearance. Bad name Bad grill, suv too late in the game, too much money... There just doesn't seem to be a lot going for it

author: ateixeira
text:
It's selling at about the pace they projected, FWIW.

I don't agree that the press and public opinion was universally negative, as you imply. Plenty of people like it, too. It is polarizing, though, and like I said before, the people that dislike it are more vocal.

Check the Tribeca thread - most bought it because of the styling, not despite it.

-juice

author: kyfdx
text:
Yeah.. while I think that front view is ugly.... BMW got the same reaction from the new 7-series, but went right ahead with the same look on the Z4, 5-series, X3, and now 3-series, and soon... the X5..

People squawked, but you get used to everything...

And besides, I can't see what the car looks like while I'm driving it...

This won't be a make or break deal for Subaru... No one was buying them for the looks, anyway.. ;-)

author: navigator89
text:
while going to the dentist, I saw plenty of cool things.

First up was a bright Ferrari red Escalade, and then a yellow Corvette ZO6 parked in a house's driveway.

Then another has a green QX56, black Range Rover, black 745Li, silver CLS500, black Escalade, and a beige S500.

Then at my dentist's building there was an Aston Martin DB9 which apparently belongs to the building's owner. However the car was under a cover so I didn't get a good look. There was also a black Range Rover and black 745Li.

Then parked nearby the building was a pearl white SC430 with some very nice, and large chrome DUBS.

But the best part of today was yet to come. There's a car dealership that specializes in fancy cars across the street from the dentist. Usually they have FX45s, Escalades, H2s, but today they had a long, red American looking car, probably from the 60s or so. I could not recognize it. There was also what looked like a black Rolls Royce from the 50s.

But amidst it all, I spotted a white Nissan Skyline R34 GT-R!!!!! This car is so damn rare! I went to Singapore recently, and spotted a grey one there, but it was a sedan. This was the first time I've seen the R34 GT-R! It had some nice yellow brake calipers.

On the way home I spotted an orange Range Rover Sport, and it looks very nice.

The on the highway, traffic slowed. When it picked up again I noticed three almost unrecognizable wrecks on the side of the road. One was a white Maxima, and a white 5 series, and there was an unrecognizable white SUV, probably a Patrol. Those were crumpled so bad it was unreal. The concrete divider had a lot of paint scraped upon it, and broken glass was all over the highway. The people in those cars would NOT have survived, IMO.

author: fintail
text: SC430 on DUBS...ROFL...should be in the bling thread. Just the thing for a pimpin dentist or CPA

author: andys120
text:
-A black Isuzu Axiom which was surprisingly attractive for an SUV. Unfortunately it was wearing a garish set of chrome dubs. Those look really silly on something capable of off-road travel.

-A Saab 9-2x, one of the few I have seen, they don't seen to be selling well here in an area generally hospitable to both Saabs and Subarus. This one had Minnesota plates (another Saab/Subaru area.

I haven't seen many Tribecas either which strikes me as weird for the same reason. The one I did see looked surprisingly attractive, it could be a knockout in the right color.

author: ateixeira
text:
I believe those actually gave up the low-range gearing normally offered on the Isuzus. It was their most car-like SUV, if you can call it that.

Tribeca will do low volume (35k/year) due to the prices over $30k. But it should meet targets.

I'm sure Ford builds as many white Explorers in a month. LOL

-juice

author: forza
text: I saw a burgundy Avalon, a beige Lexus GS and best of all, a silver Porsche 911 Carrera S.

author: boomchek
text:
I actually always liked the Axiom styling but haven't seen too many here as they were never sold in Canada.

Anyways the VW dealer across from our Honda dealer just got a shipment of the 2006 Passats and I am not too keen on their looks. The front and rear overhangs seem too long, and it doesn't have the fluid lines of the previous gen Passats.

You have to see in in person. The Jetta is kinda growing on me though.

author: ateixeira
text:
Haven't seen one yet, but it does look a bit generic for a German sedan.

Saw an M45 at the pool the other day, very nice. The new 5 series next to it just isn't as appealing to me.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...beautiful red GTO in the Whole Foods parking lot in Jenkintown and a cool red SSR near King of Prussia.

author: jcat707
text: I saw this wagon like vehicle called a Nissan X-Trail. It had Canada plates so I'm assuming it is only sold in Canada because I've never seen one here. Also I saw this Buick pass me on the freeway. It had manufacturer plates. It looked like the LaCrosse from the side but the rear was flat and had lights like the Corolla and Jetta

author: ateixeira
text:
I know that in Canada they use a different name for that model because of it's slang term in French.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...is called the Allure in Canada.

author: boomchek
text:
Unless it wasn't even a Lacrosse/Allure you saw but maybe the new Lucerne (especially if it had manufacturer plates).

Do you guys not get the Nissan X-Trail in the States? Just curious.

author: kyfdx
text:
A new '06 BMW 330i in Sparkling Graphite...

I know they are selling a lot of these... but, I rarely see one...

author: ateixeira
text:
Nope, we never got it. I think Nissan made a mistake there. The XTerra appeals to a different crowd, they could have had a double whammy.

-juice

author: teds1
text:
I saw the big boy Aston two days ago on Park Ave. Stunning but I don't understand why one would purchase it with the better looking (although it's really close) and significantly cheaper DB9 out there. My "uninterested in cars," girlfriend can't tell the three astons apart in a picture I showed her. Seems odd, but I wish the biggest problem I had was choosing which one to buy.

BTW did anyone see the photos of the Ford Iosis Concept for Frankfurt?...

I really hope that is their new styling direction!

author: ateixeira
text:
Yeah, I saw that. Name reminds me of "halitosis", but then they always pick odd names (SynUS sounded like "sinus" last year).

-juice

author: anythngbutgm
text:
What you are about to see are some super secret, candid shots of what appears to be the next gen Buick Rendevous. These pics are illegal and should not be posted anywhere else.

Repeat: these are ILLEGAL spyshots of the 07' Rendevous:
.
.
.
.
.
.
..
.
.
.
.
.


Saw my first HHR in red today. A blatant ripoff of the PT if there ever was one

author: xmf314
text: LOL!

author: fintail
text: Finally saw a new Passat on the road yesterday...in a little podunk coastal town where there's no VW dealer for maybe 75 miles. Not bad looking.

author: ghulet
text: ....but I have seen two or three new 3-series. Anyone know when the new Civic will hit the road (in Chicago, or anywhere else)? I'm dying to see the sedan.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a red Elise on my way to work today. Very sharp in that color.

Also saw a Lexus GS, they seem to be selling well around here.

-juice

author: navigator89
text:
a silver Mustang driven by some high school kid, and then a white Chrysler 300C, and a black STS.Thats my 4th Mustang, and 5th 300C and 4th STS.

I know these are common cars, but I live in the Middle East and they''re still coming here. The Armada took over a year to arrive here.

Damn...that means I'll have quite a while to see the new Fusion, H3, and the lastest GM fullsize trucks/SUVs.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw one of these coming in to work today.

Also, I've finally been seeing a few more Jettas. Those were painfully slow to trickle out.

-juice

author: highender
text:
sedan....yesterday .... in some kind of dark burgundy ...

the rear looks nice...imho.

front is OK side is nice too...

over all nice....

author: kyfdx
text: New Jetta... with all of the nose done up in chrome? Are they all like that, or is this a dealer add-on? Kind of goofy...

author: ateixeira
text:
I think they're all like that, though special edition models may be different.

I don't get why VW and Audi are both putting on that mouth-agape look. IMO it looks fine with thin euro plates but just awful with US plates.

-juice

author: lemmer
text: The GLI has a blacked out nose, and its bigger wheels help the looks of the car as a whole.

author: andys120
text: I got the most fleeting glimpse of a new 3 series as it passed me going the opposite direction. I didn't realize what it was and only caught a quick look at the nose and then of the rear in my mirror. Shouldn't a Bimmer be more recognizeable to another Bimmer driver?

author: ateixeira
text:
I'm seeing plenty of 3s nowadays. I don't even mention them any more.

-juice

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Loaded Mitsu Eclipse, exactly like the ones in the commercials, to the T...

Very sharp, pays homage to the gen 2's which are IMO the best generation.

author: navigator89
text:
a black Chrysler 300C, and then a silver one.

Also the new Suzuki Grand Vitara, in silver. It really sharp, much better than the bland version it replaces.

And tragically, I also spotted again a black Cadillac Escalade that has been abandoned by the highway. It's been there for a week now. Some people really are nuts, just leaving a 55K SUV by the road like that.....

author: andys120
text: An abandoned Escalade sounds more like a sign of progress than a tragedy. :P

author: ghulet
text:
.....they probably couldn't afford to put gas in it any more, and left it by the side of the road in hopes it would be stolen or repossessed.

Saw my first Mazda5 today, looks like a pretty cool vehicle. Funny, it's about the size that 'mini' vans used to be (y'know, the ones that aren't so mini any more). Sort of looks like the spiritual successor to something like the Mitsubishi Expo, only much more stylish.

author: navigator89
text:
I saw the new Toyota Land Cruiser and Lexus LX470. They aren't new, they just got their tallights restyled, and they look much nicer. The LX470 looks much nicer, and the taillights are more distinctive. Still, these restylings don't hide the fact that these two date back to 1998.

And about the abandoned Escalade....well I am in the Middle East so I dont think it was dumped because he couldn't afford gas.......

author: anythngbutgm
text: Maybe he realized he paid too much for a Tahoe...

author: ateixeira
text:
I've been seeing a lot of Infiniti Ms, maybe 3 this weekend. Saw an M35x driving in this morning. They look good.

LX470 got a big boost in engine output, that should help it.

-juice

author: lemmer
text:
I saw a new Miata at lunch today. I really like it.

I saw an A3 driving in my neighborhood yesterday. I like it a lot, but I did think it was a Golf at first.

author: teds1
text: Saturday on the long island expressway I saw 4 Bentley CGTs, an sl 65 merc, two maybachs, and Baby blue phantom. It's almost embarassing when you see that much Cash rolling by in one day. I agree about the Mazda 5 by the way, I like it a lot, very Euro.

author: navigator89
text:
a black Hyundai Sonata and a silver Mercedes G500. Looking forward to seeing the next generation.

About the abandoned Escalade....guys your comments are funny...but jokes aside I find it sad that someone can just leave an expensive luxury SUV just lying there. I did forget to mention in #1419 that the Escalade has the front left tire ripped to shreds, but that's no excuse for leaving a vehicle like that. I almost felt like getting some new tires and driving away with it!

author: danf1
text: sitting across from me at a red light this morning. It actually looked pretty good from the front and side views. I questioned if it really was a Chevy, then I saw that god awful back end. At that point I knew for sure.

author: ateixeira
text:
Almost forgot, saw my first 06 Accord sedan in the flesh, parked right outside work. You can tell by the tail lights, the whole rear looks a lot different.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...Saturn Relay minivan.

author: ateixeira
text:
Odd, saw 2 Vipers in one day. Not new, but rare enough that I was surprised.

Saw the new face-lifted Saturn Vue, not really digging it.

Also saw my first Hummer H3 on public roads. Still seems huge outside. Of course next to a Miata almost anything is.

-juice

author: kyfdx
text:
S40 T5... in bright red..

cool looking car... way overpriced...

author: navigator89
text: a new Jeep Grand Cherokee, a new Volkswagen Golf, and then a Land Rover Range Rover Sport. All were in silver. The Range Rover looks better in orange, IMO.

author: scott1256
text:
I also saw a new Jetta. I have to agree with you.

It is one odd duck!

No continuity with previous Jettas

author: xmf314
text:
I also saw a new Jetta. I have to agree with you.
It is one odd duck!

I don't understand why VW styled the Jetta to look like a Toyota Corolla. Yes, it's one very odd Duck.

author: merc1
text:
While on vacation I actually got to see an SLR on the road. WOW! Not the prettiest car per say, it is one of those all aggression cars. I've seen the new R-Class too. It really hides its size well, because up close this thing is huge.

Saw a DB9 also while in Houston. My pick for the best looking production car in the world. Its everything the Bentley Continental GT isn't.

M

author: navigator89
text:
Today I saw 3 Chevrolet Uplanders. First a grey/brown one on the highway, then two silver ones driving side by side on the highway.

Also a black Volkswagen Phaeton parked by the street. I know they're not new, but they're so new I felt I had to mention them. I see so few of them that I wonder if they exist or not... I see mostly Lexus LS430s, BMW 7 Series and Mercedes S Class around here, not many Audis Jaguars and VWs.

author: lemko
text: ...silver Chevrolet SSR.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw my first Eclipse on the road, in silver. Looks much better than the last one, they gave its character back.

Also saw a pair of Bimmer 3s. Those seem to be very popular already.

-juice

author: andys120
text:
New S40 sedans are popping up quite a bit but I'm really stunned at the apparent popularity of the V50 wagon, they are everywhere but they're all red or silver. :confuse:

I saw a new HHR at a dealer, I thought it looked a bit silly but then I thought well at least they're stealing from themselves, the PTCruiser OTOH apes '37 Fords.

author: lemko
text: ...saw several 500s, a Montego, and a Monterrey this morning.

author: navigator89
text:
I saw the new GS sedan today, one in black and and one in white. They seem to be becoming increasingly popular. I see plenty of BMW 5 Series, Jaguar S Type, and Mercedes E Class, but hardly any Cadillac STS or Audi A6.

Also saw a nice looking black Volvo S60 R AWD.

author: ateixeira
text:
First time I saw the new one on the streets, looks much better than the old one, but still sort of anonymous. I hardly noticed it.

Saw the same Infiniti G35x again today, we must both have the same commute. Saw a Lexus GS last night.

-juice

author: ghulet
text: ......a medium metallic gray 5-door with '2.0T' badging on the rear.

author: navigator89
text:
A red Bentley Azure coupe, a white Audi A6, a nice looking blue Navigator, two beige Uplanders and a silver one.

With the Bentley Continental Coupe out, the Azure looks prehistoric compared to it.

author: fintail
text:
With the t-tops, the old Continental/Azure reminded me of a British interpretation of something like an 80s Monte Carlo. It was ancient within a couple years of introduction.

Yesterday I saw a dark green Bentley GT parked on the street a couple blocks from my house, and probably about a dozen new Jettas. Around here anyway, someone is buying them.

author: fintail
text:
Today in Seattle I saw a new E350 AMG. I guess there's a more detailed AMG package available on the E class now, it had a bodykit and AMG wheels, etc. It was pretty sharp

I do have a problem with it though, it also had an AMG badge on the trunk. I think that should be reserved soley for cars with actual AMG performance mods. Don't cheapen the name that adds more clout to your cars than anything else, MB...

author: lemko
text: ...HHR on the road in New Hope, PA on Saturday.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
A kid here at work picked up one. LT maybe, with 5-spd, cloth for 14k brand new. Not a bad deal.

Anyone who asks him how he likes it gets the not so exiting response "eh, It gets me around..." But he is getting 32 mpg which is impressive.

author: merc1
text:
Saw one of these this morning. Such an awesome looking car, kinda puts other "domestic" sedans to shame imo.

M

author: teds1
text: I know there are a lot of them around at this point but it is still nice to get a good close look at an exotic. I read somewhere that there are 250 in Newport Beach CA alone. this one was parked in my neighborhood and I looked up close. The back seat looks almost real but not actually functional, otherwise gorgeous as expeced. I also just found out that a distant cousin of mine's father actually drives one in Georgia and people mistake it for a 300c all the time.

author: ateixeira
text:
It was hysterical. 300C stretch limo. Double-stretch, too.

Also saw my first Explorer on the roads. The headlights and tails are a little different, looks a bit more modern.

I'm finally seeing a few Jettas, took a while but they picked up a bit.

-juice

author: anythngbutgm
text: On my trip to NY a couple of weeks ago I saw a couple of Infiniti FX45 limos. Goofy looking... The local Ford dealer has a row of updated Explorers on the lot. Of particular interest was a loaded Eddie Bauer with chrome grill, two tone paint and stylish wheels. Pretty sharp looking!

author: jcat707
text: I saw a 3 series wagon and an E350 wagon today, both with 30 seconds of each other. I think that is the first time I have seen either of those cars up close in person outside of a dealership.

author: ateixeira
text:
The wife drives one on that show.

-juice

author: xmf314
text: Yesterday I saw a 300C with a vinyl roof and chrome dubs. I almost barfed.
