author: andys120
text:
I must've seen a dozen new Jettas on an extended road trip this weekend. While everyone notices they closely resemble a Corolla from behind I was fooled into thinking they were Accords from the side profile. :confuse:

For some reason they were all black.

author: boomchek
text:
Not only did I see them I drove them.

Co worker referred a wealthy customer to his friend at Ford . Customer bought two loaded Expeditions both black (for her car rental company), paid in cash etc..

He asked me to help him drive one of them across town to her office (he drove one I drove the other). It was funny because you don't see two identical especially black brand new tinted out Expeditions like that following one another unless it's a VIP convoy or a star is in one of them. Anyways we turned a few heads

On the way back I got to drive the customer's 2006 Mercedes ML350. I love the interior of it but the exterior is unattractively overdone IMO. Exterior styling looks like it belongs ona Kia or Hyundai.

That was my excitement for the day. :P

author: teds1
text: I have seen a few of these myself and while I don't think many cars look particularly graceful stretched, the 300c has got to be one of the worst. The ones I see ( and actually pretty much every 300C I see) all have the Strut replacement grill with the tighter Bentleyesque mesh. I am usually not a fan of cosmetic aftermarket add ons but this actually does seem to improve the look of the car. I know the standard grill heralds back to the original 300 cars but it is one of the worst features IMO on the car. However, the rest of the strut package is quite garish especially the front side vents which do absolutely nothing.

author: ateixeira
text:
If I had a nickel for every time I heard someone say it looked like a Corolla...

VW's biggest mistake was they they styled it anonymously, not only that but it looks more Asian than German.

boomchek: did you have to stop for gas? :P

Saw an HHR yesterday. In person they seem so small. You expect them to be a lot bigger.

-juice

author: navigator89
text:
I spotted quite a few nice models.

A blue Cadillac XLR coupe. Absolutely stunning.

Three 2006 Sonatas, in silver and like two in gray.

A silver Mercedes ML55 AMG.

A black BRABUS M class.

Silver Chrysler 300C, and red Lexus GS300.

A lot of Chevrolet Uplanders.

A light blue Mini Cooper S.

Two white Cadillac STS.

And finally, a black Avalanche on some nice chrome rims.

author: ateixeira
text:
I've seen quite a few of these, 3 just yesterday. I guess they are so common now that I hardly notice them.

-juice

author: boomchek
text:
The 06 Pilots and Accords are trickling in to our dealership. I bet all you guys have seen them already as the US usually gets cars before us.

anyways love the look of the Accords rear end. should have been that way from the start (03 model).

author: jcat707
text: I saw a red Pontiac Solstice today. It's the first one that I've seen. I guess they are finally getting to customers although up here in Michigan, convertible season is pretty much over. I also saw a Saturn Relay minivan for the first time. It was a dealer courtesy shuttle.

author: boomchek
text:
In red color, nice looking car and not as big as i thought it would be. From the magazine pics it seemed huge (unless the driver was tiny). In person looked very nice.

Also seeing the new Mercedes B Class on many test drives. Lots of Smart cars here too.

author: lemko
text: ...co-worker bought a new silver Chevrolet Uplander.

author: navigator89
text:
They really are getting common around here, I've seen them in grey, silver and beige. Generally I see 2-3 Uplanders a day.

Anyway, today I spotted my first Jaguar X Type wagon, in white. It looks good.

And 3 Mercedes SLKs, two silvers and one black.

author: stickguy
text: I must have missed this one. What does this model replace in the line up? Is it the new small one?

author: ateixeira
text:
They should be more common - they've been out for a full year now. GM added a bigger engine option for '06 so maybe sales will pick up.

I saw my first brand-new DTS yesterday. They applied the Art & Science styling to it. It's a big bulky looking, but still an improvement over the last gen.

-juice

author: stickguy
text:
Where does this fit in relation to the Equinox?

I will admit that I don't normally care for SUVs, and have zero interest in Chevy (GM for that matter), but I do try to keep up!

author: ateixeira
text:
You mean the Uplander?

Uplander is their minivan, despite the fact they call it a Crossover Sport Van in marketing materials.

Equinox is their actual Crossover, a car-based SUV.

Is that what you meant?

I think small families with 1-2 kids would shop Equinox, while bigger families would want the seating of the Uplander van.

-juice

author: stickguy
text:
OK, brain lock. I forgot that they renamed the minivan when they gave it the beak implant.

I will now give myself 10 lashes with a wet noodle (as Anne Landers used to say when she goofed up).

author: chidoro
text: saw a dodge charger last Sunday and I actually thought it was pretty snazzy looking. And I despise the 300C too so I think dodge did a good job distinguishing itself. I'm starting to see a lot more RL's on the road these days as well.

author: jcat707
text: I saw an 06 Trailblazer with the new front and new real bumper. The new bumper makes the back look much better. Too bad it's only on the LT models.

author: lemko
text: ...my first 2006 Chevrolet Impala. This car was a deep shiny black and appeared to be exquisitely built. Body panel gaps were tight and even. The craftsmanship was impeccable. The interior truly is a vast improvement over the old car.

author: danf1
text: I couldn't tell if it was an Accord or Civic at first. It seems to be much larger than the old one.

author: navigator89
text: Spotted today two new Grand Vitaras, one in silver and the other in black. Very sharp looking, more so than the CRV, Tucson, Sportage, etc.

author: fintail
text: Saw a new Civic sedan today, in the most boring color - white

author: ateixeira
text:
H3 spotted in Ocean City, MD. Among the millions of VWs that were there for some event/meet.

Saw an STS on the way in this morning, nice.

-juice

author: a_l_hubcaps
text:
I saw a dark blue 2006 Kia Sedona on City Ave in Philly today. It had California AUTO MFR plates. I don't think the Sedona is on sale to the general public yet.

-Andrew L

author: ateixeira
text:
It isn't, so nice find. Dealers don't even know when they'll get them.

-juice

author: jaserb
text:
Eye catching for sure. Woulda been a lot better car if they'd decided to make it a reskinned Lancer Evo instead of a reskinned Galant.

-Jason

author: navigator89
text:
Spotted two Audi A8s yesterday, one in beige and one in maroon.

And today saw another one in silver.

Seeing Audis is really rare, because all I usually see are BMW 745Li, Lexus LS430, and Mercedes S500.

author: andys120
text: I noticed quite a few A8s when I was in the NYC area.

author: lemko
text: ...red 2006 Impala.

author: navigator89
text:
I saw a blue Acura NSX, probably like my 3rd in my whole life.

The Uplander is really getting common. I see around 4-5 daily.

author: teds1
text:
New DTS, not that different overall from the old one, just the light treatments. the headlights look a little too slivery and aggresive for the rest of the car, not Cadillac's finest styling.

Maybach 62

My first R-Class, Nice... It's a minivan though, I don't care what they call it.
That's fine... I have nothing against mini vans per se, but it's a mini van. I definitely wouldn't mind having one, seems like it would nice for roadtrips and such.

Oh yeah and a rare one... audi A8 W12, don't see to many of them anywhere... This was chauffeur driven as well, why bother with the big engine if you aren't going to drive it?

author: jaserb
text:
He test drove the W12 and decided it wasn't fun because there was no way to use the extra power and stay out of jail. His former ride was a Passat W8, so I guess he really likes that engine.

-Jason

author: andys120
text: (320?)SLK, the first I've seen, it looks smaller and nicer than in photos. This one was a nice dark metallic red.

author: merc1
text:
Actually the Phaeton uses a regular Audi V8, not the W8. The W8 is history.

M

author: anythngbutgm
text:
I don't understand them sometimes. They go out of their way to develop the W engines only to drop them a couple of years later? Seems like a pretty boneheaded move if you ask me. VW reliability in the toilet, and they go flush millions (no pun intended) on a new and unproven technology figuring that nobody would know about their quality issues? And then to throw it into a midsize family car (Passat) at 40 grand set to compete with $25-30k Accords and Camry's in the marketplace. How about putting that money into R&D to figure out what the heck happened to the reliability of your mainstream cars?

Sorry for the rant. I saw a Passat W8 wagon this morning that got me thinking...

author: navigator89
text:
a silver Grand Vitara, a new Audi A4 in silver and a maroon Sonata.

And then a nice looking black Escalade on dubs.

author: jaserb
text:
I just looked it up and you're right - it is the same V8 engine as the Audis. The VP was going on and on at dinner about how technically cool his engine is. Maybe in the interest of job security I'll let him keep thinking that.

-Jason

author: boomchek
text:
They are goofy with the way they plan and develop things too. Instead of the money they put in a developing the Phaeton and Toureg theyt should have built a conventional minivan to compete with the Sienna and Odyssey.

I sell so many Odysseys to ex-VW owners who grew out of their Jettas, Passats, and Golfs. The reason is the Odyssey is more fun to drive than a SIenna, and many VW folks like good handling cars.

I bet if VW would develop a conventional minivan they would do really well and keep their loyal customers instead of losing them to us (Honda) :P

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw one of those also.

Sonatas are common around here now, I see them all the time.

-juice

author: stickguy
text:
a couple of Impalas on the road, and an SS (silver) parked out infront of the chevy dealer.

A new Sonata parked in my work lot today while I was looking out the window. Looks nice. A friend of mine that is looking at Camrys (new or used) I convinced to go take a look. The Sonata will be equipped like an '06 Camry, but probably priced closer to the '02 he is also looking at!

Also a new mercedes SUV. I'm pretty sure it was an ML. Didn't look like the R model, but did look like a Kia, so I guess that makes it an ML..

My first A3 out on the open road that I can recall.

Quite a few new 3 series are popping up, with the temp tags on still. Saw 2 like that yesterday. Like the car, but not the butt.

author: andys120
text:
all seen for the first time today:

-Hummer H3: honey, they shrunk the SUV and it worked!

-Audi A6, big mouth

-Mitsu Eclipse, seen from a distance-looks nice from the side. It was a trendy metallic orange.

author: boomchek
text: I must be the last one here to see one. We finally got a shipment. It looks much better than the pictures, and the coupe is smaller than it looked in the photos. I thought it would be bloated but it's not.

author: stickguy
text: 1st ones in the area. It was at the dealer Got to drive one too. Haven't seen one on the raod though, but expect to see a lot soon.

author: navigator89
text:
a maroon Hyundai Sonata, a silver Range Rover Spor and a beige Grand Vitara.

And when passing a car dealer I saw a white Nissan Skyline R34 GTR as well as a black Mitsubishi Evo. Both are absolutely stunning cars.

Also a red Ferrari, which was darker than Maranello red but lighter than maroon.

And when driving by a house, I saw what was either a 2007 Mercedes S Class or a Maybach 57, because I only saw the rear, which is very similar. Since the S isn't really out yet I assume it was the 57, my first.

And finally, a silver Maserati Quattroporte. A stunning car to say the least.

author: teds1
text:
All I have to say is that my mother has a beetle (new style) and it's the most unreliable piece of crap car I have ever seen. It has 48K and problems you woudl expect from a 150k vehicle. The check oil light has been on for a year, no one can figure out why. The check engine light has gone off regularly for serious issues. We just replaced the AC system, the bracket which allows the seat to go forward broke so in an accident the whole seat would have flipped forward, the ground clearance is minimal and we have ripped off the plastic cladding on the bottom on regular roads a few times. The engine screams at 4500 rpm in 5th on the highway at 75 mph, the milage isn't good and the rear headroom is non existent.... Thank god it's a 5 speed or I might push it off a cliff.

My point being that I agree, VW has had some serious quality issues in their cars since about 97. Phaetons are cool though, I like them a lot, soooo stealth, beautiful interior. I like the idea of W engines but they are rather unproven in passenger vehicles, obviously they do fine on a race track.

author: ateixeira
text:
No, I'm the last, in fact I still have not seen a new one in person.

-juice

author: fintail
text: Saw another new Passat this morning

author: chidoro
text: There was a new Impala parked at my office's garage this morning. It's a lot bigger than I thought it would be considering past Impala's. I also saw a 2006 Accord on my way home from work last night. The rear really looks good in person now, I almost thought it was a coupe until I realized it was the 2006 refresh. There is also a new, albeit 2005 Accord Hybrid in the parking lot as well.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw an Impala going home yesterday, and I was following an STS coming in.

I like the STS, it keeps growing on me. Edgy, like the CTS, but it doesn't over-do it, either.

-juice

author: clarencehollow
text: I spotted a new Hummer H3 the other day. I drove behind one today. It reminds me of the Jeep Cherokee. I found out it's actually nothing more than a re-bodied Chevrolet Colorado with the same engine, the 5 cylinder. I just don't like it, and if I wanted to spend that kind of money I would get a real SUV - the Chevy Tahoe - 2007 to be exact.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw an H3 in my friend's Town House development.

Then I saw a Lincoln Mark LT, first I've seen in person.

Then I saw something really freaky, it had a Benz logo, but it was a van. At first I thought it was an A-class, but it was bigger. I got closer and read the label - Vaneo on one side, 1.9 on the other, it said. I'd never even heard of that. Had diplomatic plates, so surely it's a european car.

Also saw a Tucson and a Sonata.

-juice

author: navigator89
text:
several Hyundai Tucsons since they came out. I see more of them than the Sportage. Of all the 2005 models out, I see Uplanders and Tucsons the most.

Spotted two Sonata today on the highway, one in silver and the other in black. Also was behind the 2006 BMW 750Li. The back looks nice now that's its cleaned up. Then a dark green new Odyssey.

Finally a white previous generation Pathfinder on dubs.

author: boomchek
text:
I saw Scion tc in person. They don't sell them in Canada, even though I see a lot of imported bA and BB or whatever the name is but never a tC.

Not a bad looking car.

author: lemko
text: ...coworker has a new blue Chevrolet Equinox. Well, GM's small SUVs are selling!

author: lemko
text: ...I did briefly spot my first Solstice on the way home from work Saturday night. This one was black and parked outside a small Pontiac dealer in Richboro, PA.

author: 1racefan
text: at the Mitsubishi dealer today. Looked better from a distance than the Dakota (it's clone) does. I would like to see the interior of it. I hear that the interior is very "car like".

author: andys120
text: FYI it's xA, and xB for the boxy Echo/Yaris-based Scions. I'm surprised they aren't sold in Canada considering it's more small-car friendly than the USA.

author: jaserb
text:
I saw one too, also at the dealer, in a very nice navy color. I agree they look much better than the Dakotas. Given the way Mitsus are (or aren't) selling they could be making some pretty good deals on them, and I think they have a better warranty as well.

As a side note, the local Mitsu dealer used to be a Mitsu / Subaru dealer, and 2 or 3 years ago they sold the Subaru franchise to focus on Mitsubishi. I think that was probably about as good a move as a local Hyundai / Isuzu dealer who 5 years ago sold the Hyundai franchise. They're not around anymore...

-Jason

author: boomchek
text: Thanks, I was too lazy to look up the actual model name. :sick:

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a couple of these this weekend, these are pretty common now.

-juice

author: boomchek
text: Sitting at the Ford dealership next to us.

author: merc1
text:
I passed by the local Mitsu dealer and saw some of these too. This is one good looking truck. Real aggressive and hip.

They've also got a pretty good commerical going for it too. It faces Nissan's small pickup and they stare each other down and then start moving towards each other. The Nissan backs down (of course) and starts to lose it's fluid uh...coolant (you get the implication).

M

author: guss
text:
I don't know how long these have been out but it was the first that I have seen.

Definitely looks different than an Explorer, I had to get up close to read the badge because it looked like something totally new.

author: navigator89
text:
Today I saw a dark green Volkswagen Phaeton 6.0L W12. It's a beautiful car to look at, and the interior is amazing, better than anything from Mercedes, Lexus or BMW. It was also very large, yet very elegant. Seeing a Phaeton is really rare for me.

guss, the Lincoln Aviator has been out since 2003!!! I can't believe you haven't seen one yet, lol!

author: ateixeira
text:
First I saw a new CLS...and it was being followed by a Bentley Conty GT! Both black.

Nice...

Then I followed an RX400H into my parking garage, someone must have just bought it. But I parked on a different floor so I didn't see who it was.

Later I saw an Aston Martin Vantage. Sweeeet!

-juice

author: ateixeira
text:
Forgot to mention, I've seen a couple of these over the past day or two.

They look a bit bloated, I dunno. And those overhangs are sooo long.

-juice

author: guss
text:
the Lincoln Aviator has been out since 2003!!! I can't believe you haven't seen one yet, lol!

I guess I need to change neighborhoods. I see way too many Explorers.

I saw a Fusion on the road. It had a dealer tag so it must have been a test drive. Front end looks a little like a CTS.

author: odman
text: A Mercedes dealer in north Toronto has a few of the new B-Class models out. Looks pretty sharp. I don't think it's for sale in the States but it looks like it could be a volume seller for the brand in Canada

author: boomchek
text: Saw one today at the automall. Odd looking thing. Like a large scale Cherokee Classic.

author: andys120
text:
Like a large scale Cherokee Classic.

I just saw a new Commander with dealer plates on it. It should look as good as a Cherokee Classic, instead it looks like an old Grand Wagoneer with the woody siding removed.

Not just ugly but drab.

author: teds1
text: I hate the Commander, I can't belivee anyone approved it, and I happen to like the classic Jeep looks. I saw it at the NY auto show and it was laughable. The need for a third row for families is real, but they tend to be cramped and uncomfortable when automakers squeeze a third row in a medium sized suv (Volvo, land rover). The Commander is bizarre, I do not predict succes in the sales column

author: boomchek
text:
Yeah true. I mean there's boxy but ok looking (Element, Scion, G Wagen, old Suburban from mid 90's), boxy and nice (300C), and boxy and ugly (Commander). For some reason the whole thing just doesnt click.

I'd take and Expedition any day over that.

author: jcat707
text: This morning I saw an 06 Accord with the new rear-end. To me, the rear now looks just like an Acura TL. The new LED brake lights are cool though.

author: andys120
text: spotted a silver four door pulling out of a dealership. WOW!

author: merc1
text:
Saw one of these this morning with dealer plates so I guess they're here now.

Very sterile and plain looking with lots of bare unadorned sheetmetal.

M

author: danf1
text:
probably not the most exciting spotting, but they aren't out yet so I thought I'd be the first to tell. Our regional service rep is driving one.

Overall a nice design for a small car. It looks like it has no trunk space from the outside, but when you open it it is very large. Interior seemed to be a huge upgrade. ABS and Side curtain airbags standard. This one had 4 wheel disk brakes and aluminum wheels. Nice for bargain basement transportation.

author: fintail
text: I've seen several 06 Accord this week. The new rump is how the car should have looked from the start.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw my 2nd HHR in person, a wild orange color. Again, surprising how small it is in person.

Also saw an Infiniti M.

-juice

author: navigator89
text:
a BMW 760Li, my first one. It was in black.

Also a previous gen. BMW M5 in red.

Also two Lexus GS300s, one is black other in white. Two Sonatas as well, in the same color. They've started to become quite common.

Two Audi A6s as well, one in black other in silver. Four 300Cs, in blue, grey, silver, and black.

Finally, a yellow Hummer H2 SUT.

author: fintail
text:
I saw another Range Rover Sport today, in white. Strangest thing, it was on a car hauler along with a c. '68 Chevy short bed pickup in immaculate condition.

I saw 4 or 5 Elise yesterday, and an 06 Civic coupe.

The SUT...funny how you can play with the letters to create a more appropriate name

author: stickguy
text:
with manufacturer plates.

Are these for sale already?

author: guss
text:
Stopped by my local dealer on Sunday to see if the had a Solstice laying around. Of course not.

But they had 2 Torrents pretty loaded up that looked pretty nice. Did not look too much like the Equinox as I thought it would. They have a much more aggressive grille.

author: danf1
text: No. Hyundai hasn't even said when they will be.

author: navigator89
text:
my first Hummer H3 in black.

And then 3 Grand Vitaras, in black, silver and reddish-orange. They seem to be gaining in popularity and I can see why.

author: stickguy
text:
Well, I have seen the one at my sno's school since late summer. It's always there when I pick him up from band practice. SOmebody must work for Hyundai (it has mnufacturers plates on it).

Not bad looking, kinda resembles a slightly larger Sonata. Doesn't look like what you would expect from a Hyundai though if you didn't see the badge.

author: guss
text: You are from Jersey aren't you ? What would a Hyundai with manuf. plates be doing there. I though there new plant was down in Alabama.

author: danf1
text: Hyundai's regional offices for the Eastern region are in New Jersey as is one of their ports of entry, so it makes perfect sense.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw one of these today, I like the styling much better than the last gen.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...a white Buick Allure with Ontario plates.

author: navigator89
text:
Today I saw my first Ferrari F430, in that awesome shade of red. The driver drove really dangerously, and even with the windows rolled up the engine sounded very loud.

And later I saw a black Aston Martin DB7, the new models look way better.

author: guss
text: Is there any other color for a Ferrari?

author: kyfdx
text:
Every F355 I've ever seen (all three of them..lol) have been yellow... C&D also had a yellow one on the cover in the '90s when they first came out...

Weird, huh?

author: andys120
text:
Is there any other color for a Ferrari?

Sure there is, Red's practically a cliche on 'em, like silver on Porsches.
FLY Yellow is also a "signature color" for Ferraris and has been used on numerous racing Ferraris. FLY=Ferrari light yellow.

Black, Silver and Titanium look great on F-cars, in fact a Silver '63 250 Berlinetta Lusso
is the best looking car I've ever seen, I still remember it after 41 years!.

author: teds1
text:
So I have started seeing 750 Beemers around and despite the reputed referesher they received I can not tell them apart from 745s from any angle other than from the new wheels (which are rather boring).

Ther are a few R-Classes around now and I think it looks really slick. If you have need of a minivan but want something upscale this is your new option. Nice with a roof rack as well, seems like it's not to exravagantly priced with the V-6 instead of the 500.

I have not seen any of the new family haulers in NYC, No HHRs, no Sonatas, No refreshed accords, no Impalas. I think the fact is in Manhattan if you can afford a car at all ($400/month for a garage minimum) you can afford a really nice car.

The audi A8 W12 has become more popular amongst the Park Ave. power broker set. I think b/c it was rated tops by a chaufeur professional association recently

I am getting pretty bored with Bentley CGTs, when is the flying spur coming out?

author: lemko
text: ...the first 2006 Honda Civic I've seen on the street. This one was a white sedan.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw an Accord in my garage, someone here must've bought one.

Then I saw a new Impala. They are becoming common now. I've also seen 2 of the new-style Malibus, with the face-lifted front end. They look better.

-juice

author: andys120
text:
I couldn't agree less, we don't see that many 7ers around here but I sure can tell when I'm seeing a new one, they look great IMO, and I can tell a new one from quite a ways off.

Bored w Bentley's, geez. I've seen fleeting glimpses of two. They look great too. :shades:

author: navigator89
text:
Of course there are other colors for Ferraris, but most people buy red because it looks the best.

I have seen several silver 360 Modenas, and blue Maranellos. None of those look as good as the red version.

With respect to exotic cars, it seems that they seem best looking in a certain color. Example, Porsche in silver, Lamborghini in yellow/orange, Ferrari in red, Aston Martin in greyish/green.......

author: guss
text:
I know there are other colors. The days of the the Model T where you could get it in any color ,as long as it is black are way over.

I was just making the point that almost everyone I see is red and they do look great in red. Although if you gave me one in black , I would take it.

author: jaserb
text:
they call it "resale red". In other words, even someone who might like a different color will have to give red some consideration so they can sell it easier down the road.

-Jason

author: fintail
text: I saw another Bentley Flying Spur today. I've seen two of these now

author: lemko
text: ...another Chevrolet HHR - this one a weird bronzish color. I think it looks better than the PT Cruiser. I like the quad round taillights.

author: teds1
text:
Perhaps Bored was too strong, I just mean they are common enough and have been around long enough that they really shouldn't even qualify for this forum anymore. I also think they look great.

first new civic last night as well, can't wait for the si, may even look into getting one

author: fintail
text: I saw the new Lexus IS today...it's not bad looking, but maybe i am growing jaded, as I wasn't really knocked over or anything.

author: derrado1
text:
Spotted in downtown Brisbane:
Chrysler Crossfire, in some greyish colour.
Lamborghini Gallardo, pulling out of an Audi dealership
And another Lamborghini Gallardo, in black, nearby.

author: kyfdx
text:
I saw my first new '06 Honda Civic...

A coupe.. Very, very nice... Probably the only new car under $20K that I would consider, besides the Mazda3...

author: fintail
text: Today in the drizzle at boring Factoria Mall I spotted a doozie - DB9:

author: guss
text:
I saw my first one at a local car show. The Pontiac dealer brought it and several other cars. It was a loaner from GM as they sold this years allotment of one already.

Thats one car for under $20k I would consider. If I could find one.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
The fact that got got an XKR in pic 3 to go along with the DB makes the pics that much cooler! Rolling work of art IMO. I was lucky enough to hear one launch from a stoplight in front of Buckingham Palace in London this summer.

Only one way to describe the sounds of an Aston at WOT: Spine Tingling

author: lemko
text:
...whether or not this should be here or in the "spotted an obscure car" topic:

Spotted a new Infiniti Q45 last night.

author: anythngbutgm
text: I think they sold a total of about 10 of those this year so it probably is a spectacle to actually see one on the roads...

author: fintail
text:
I still have yet to see a Solstice or Sky. But the auto show here is coming in a few weeks.

That was an XKR, I thought it was odd they were parked together, but at the same time, didn't seem to be connected - the Jag had plates etc. A friend of mine couldn't believe the pics, a brand new unplated DB9, in black, out in the rain!

I see more Bentleys than I do new Q45s

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a Rolls driving south on the NJ Turnpike yesterday, yowsah!

-juice

author: anythngbutgm
text: Sad to see that car out in the rain, I agree.

author: teds1
text:
Nice DB9, I've seen about three but no volantes. Ever been to exoticspotter.com?
you should post those

author: fintail
text: Never been there, I'll have to check it out

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Had a redesigned Malibu behind me the other day. The revised front end is much more palatible than before...

Saw a couple of Tribecas as well...

author: ateixeira
text:
I spent about 4 days in CT, a Subaru strong-hold (they have 7% market share vs. just 0.5% in the snow belt), and oddly enough I did not see a single one.

Sales pace is OK, I guess it might just be selling in non-traditional markets. I see them in the DC area all the time.

-juice

author: navigator89
text:
Saw a black Rolls Phantom parked in front of a house, and I also saw that familiar Aston Martin DB9 at my dentist's office.

Also today a black, then white Toyota Avalons. And two yellow Mustangs.

Sonatas are getting popular, must have seen at least 3.

And Uplanders! I must have seen around 10 today!

author: jcat707
text:
Today I saw my first Audi A3. I'm suprised I haven't seen them before, they have been out for a while haven't they?

Also, I saw 2 new Civics. One was a silver 4 door and the other was a black 2 door. Both looked nice although I was only able to see them from the side and rear. The new Civic sedan looks much better than the previous one. It was something about the old one that I just didn't like.

author: andys120
text: Jcat, I have yet to see an A3, even went by an Audi dealer just to see.

author: lemko
text: ...a black Saleen Mustang parked across the street from my house.

author: navigator89
text:
Today while on the highway, I spotted the most amazing vehicle. I passed by a car carrier, and it had on it a silver Mercedes SLR. That car looks soooo amazing, such a sleek design. Not everyday that you spot a $450,000 car. This is the probably the most expensive production car that I have ever seen.

And also saw my first Dodge Magnum from a distance today, in red. Looks great.

author: kyfdx
text: I'm not fond of the angular styling... It wasn't helped by a terrible looking lip spoiler at the edge of the rear decklid.. Cobalt style... yuck..

author: ateixeira
text:
You read that right, it had diplomatic plates on it, definitely a Nissan Primera, station wagon too. Not new but interesting enough that I thought I'd share.

Saw a Cobalt coupe yesterday. They aren't as common as the sedans.

-juice

author: i_luv_toyota
text:
I live in Connecticut and I agree with you there. I have only seen one and that was a few months back. Haven't seen a single one since.

Maybe they sell better in Vermont where it seems every other car is a Subaru!

author: boomchek
text:
First I'm starting to see more of the new Benz R Class van/wagon/cruiser things. Nice looking actually.

The Benz B Class are starting to get common as well.

Walked over to the Lexus dealer and looked at the new IS350. Much much better looking than in the pictures. Makes the TSX looks plain in comparison.

Also spotted the new Toyota Yaris 4 door hatch. Not a bad looking econobox, will have to see it upclose soon.

author: teds1
text:
So just a few thoughts on the GS lexus as I passed one closely this morning. It is growing on me a lot. I think while it isn't over all the most gracefully executed shape certain details are fantastic, particularly the front end. It is difficult with swooping cars to get the ends right and the rear isn't as beautiful (The CLS has this issue with both of it's ends IMO). It is a great looking car though. I used to work promoting beemers and I have driven nearly every lexus model so I am very set in my opinions that Lexus makes nice but ridiculously boring cars. However I want to try this one out.

Also spotted another W12 audi

author: ateixeira
text:
I just was following a GS. I liked the first generation, and the current car. I really did not like the generation inbetween.

Guigiaro did the first one. The 2nd one was done at CALTY, not sure of the designer for the new one.

-juice

author: merc1
text:
I saw Ferrari 612 Scaglietti on I-88 tonight sitting in construction zone traffic. Realy long looking car on the road. First time I'd seen one in the wild.

M

author: lemko
text: ...a maroon Chevrolet HHR.

author: PF_Flyer
text: Saw my first Ford Five Hundred

author: stickguy
text:
Solstice, out on the road with a temp tag. Looked sharp, but the top seemed to be ill fitting (the angles looked wrong), more like a Viper than a Miata.

And I know it is supposed to be down, but it is pouring rain today, so I will cut the owner some slack.

author: teds1
text: I have seen these in a showroom near my office and I have to say I don't ecstaticly love it. This could be excused for a lesser vehicle but this is a Ferrari Grand tourer. Every angle and view should be stunning by rights like the 550/575s, the 456 it replaced and so on back in history. It's still really cool and does look better in darker colors but it just doesn't do it for me. Honestly if one had the quarter million or so for one of these wouldn't you rather have something dripping sex appeal like a vanquish or a Murcielago? I realize that these are in slightly different categories but since the back seats are all but vestigial anyway we can consider them competitors. I don't particularly care for the Giugaro show car based on it either. Bit of a disapointment really although the spy shots of the upcoming 600 that share the design DNA are much more encouraging Especially the possible engine cover glass showing off the cylinder heads like the Peugot concept from a year ago. Love that

author: ateixeira
text:
There are already 2 brand new Accords in the garage at work. An LX 4cyl and an LX-SE 4 cyl, both autos. New because they have the new taillight design.

I've seen two new Civic coupes and one new sedan.

That was quick. That's about the same number of Freestyles I've seen, and they've been out for more than a year.

-juice

author: thegraduate
text: I saw a new 2006 Accord coupe V-6 last Saturday. It looked better with the more angular/aggressive rear end (taillamps especially). It looks nice! It was silver, btw.

author: merc1
text:
I think its the long proportions that kill the design for me. That and the just the overall plainess of the design. Yes I'd rather have a Vanquish or Murcielago for sure, much more eye-catching designs. I'm a little worried about the upcoming 600 Imola because it will most likely look something like the 612 Scag, but the saving grace is that it won't be a long as the 612. I read somewhere that the response to the 612 was not the usual sold-out reaction new Ferraris normally get.

M

author: navigator89
text:
Today I saw a beige Audi A8 W12. It was simply stunning. The leather was like red, and the wood was dark colored and it gleamed. It's the first one that I've seen, and a very rare car indeed.

Also spotted a silver Porsche Boxster and a red Porsche Carrera 4S.

author: 210delray
text:
...I saw a Lincoln Zephyr this past weekend. The rear end is particularly ugly, with big rectangular taillights with the backup lights in their centers. I don't think the charcoal gray color of the one I saw helped either.

I thought it was a bad idea in the first place to use the Mazda6 platform as a basis for a Lincoln; now I know it is.

Does anyone remember the Lincoln Versailles?

author: stickguy
text: DOn't cha?

author: boomchek
text: Yeah I saw them too at the Ford dealer next to us. Not bad looking actually. Also saw the Fusion, a nice car IMO

author: carguy58
text:
3 new Civic Sedans. I don;t really like the way they look either. I saw a Civic Coupe parked in a lot at one of my local Honda dealers. Then again the Civic sedan;d have always been more plain looking vs the coupe model Civic's 96 model years and up. Maybe the exterior design it has too grow on me with the coupe model Civic..

Seen several Mitsubishi Eclipse..and they look better than the 00-05 Eclipse's especially the back of it.

Seen a few new VW Passats...I doesn;t look as sleek as the 02-05 models.

Saw a refreshed 06 PT Cruiser yesterday.

Seen one 06 Miata. It looks like the designers went for a more exotic sports car look on the front end vs a more reserved/classy front end on the 99-05 Miata's.

Seen a few 06 Honda Accord's: It looks better than the 03-05 but the front end still doesn't match the back end.

author: 210delray
text:
My point, precisely!

A latter-day Caddy Cimarron (or Catera, for that matter).

author: ateixeira
text:
Hey, I can call it a Miata if Mazda's marketing dept still does.

It was dark red with a red top. Looked good.

The headlights hint back at the Ibuki concept from a couple of years ago. The power bulge from the NA models is back, too. I like it.

I gotta go test drive one...

-juice

author: stickguy
text: saw one at the dealer, but didn't sit in it. Does look much nicer in/out than the prior generation. Hey, I might even fit in it now (and I owned a 2001)

author: kyfdx
text: Looks like the old Lumina...

author: grbeck
text:
I'm still looking for a new Zephyr, as the local Lincoln Mercury hasn't received one. Like you, I don't think basing a Lincoln - even a junior model - on a relatively small, front-wheel-drive platform is a good idea.

I've also seen the new Fusion, and it is very handsome. The car has a nice, aggressive stance to it. It's just what Ford needs.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw another one today. Coupe still looks much better to me than the sedan IMO.

-juice

author: fintail
text: I saw an "STS4" yesterday, which must be a higher line AWD car. Shiny black, not bad looking. But it was driven by a 200 year old, and it had redline tires and chrome wheels.

author: andys120
text: Are redline tires back?! Cool, I had 'em on my '66 TR-4A. :P

author: navigator89
text:
I've seen the following.

Silver Grand Cherokee
Light Blue 360 Modena
Beige Avalon
Turquoise Sonata
Black A4
Several Lexus GS300s and GS430s in black, silver, white, beige, blue, red.

I'm not too fond of the A4's tailligts design.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw one too, on Friday at lunch. I love the sound that V8 makes, even at idle. Sounds like a lion roaring. Sooo sweet.

-juice

author: jaserb
text:
There was one parked in front of the building where I work, with a red carpet leading into the building. Apparently, it was there for a retirement party for a big shot in one of the companies my company recently acquired.

Prepare to be sick: he's 28.

-Jason

author: fintail
text: I saw a new R-class yesterday. Sure looks like a Pacifica at twice the price + to me

author: fintail
text: CEO's son or nephew?

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a bunch of new cars...had to write them down there were so many.

First an EVO parked right out front, arrest-me-red. EVO 8, though, not the newer 9.

300C driving on PA Ave near the White House.

G6, also red, parked near 2000 Penn.

Pathfinder on PA ave.

Sonata on 19th street.

Baja wasn't new, but still rare.

H3 driving down PA ave. Saw another one of these yesterday, too. Wonder how long this trend will last?

Titan - not sure if it was new, but I noticed it because a little old lady was driving it.

New Grand Cherokee. Still haven't grown on me.

BMW Z4, hasn't grown on me, either.

Scion xA - I read that this is the lowest HP output car in America. It was on the campus of GWU, so probably a college student.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...sleek black 2006 Cadillac DTS! Good God, this car is beautiful! Funny how a slight facelift makes this car look so much better not to mention the much nicer interior. Darn! I just finished paying off my 2002 Seville STS in March! I don't want to renew my subvscription to the "book-of-the-month club!"

author: jaserb
text:
No, just a principal in a small technology company that was bought out for too much money. The dot-com thing still happens now and then, just generally on a bit smaller scale.

But seriously, who would even want to retire at 28? What are you going to do for the next 60-odd years?

-Jason

author: fintail
text:
I'm 28...I could retire now....start some goofy side business of my own (fintail restoration center...LOL) or something.

I'm seeing new 3ers quite often now. I saw a new Passat yesterday that must have been in dealer transit - it was covered in all the odd tape and plastic wrap, yet was on the road.

author: teds1
text:
My girlfriend's cousin retired at 28 (right time right place stanford B-school grad in 95) from the dot com thing and he is just barely going back to work at 33, he has his pick of careers though and no salary requirements. He drives an Audi a4 avant 3.0 by the way

saw a few Maybachs near my office apparently they are being offered to guests at the 4 seasons around the corner.

also not a "future vehicle" but a lipstick pink (odd color but it looks good) Porsche 356 coupe (early 1960's) has been driving by me in the morning. Looks like it just rolled off the lot, gorgeous, and nice that the owner uses it as his daily commuter

author: ateixeira
text:
These keep growing on me. Very handsome. I like Cadillac's styling direction.

-juice

author: kyfdx
text: The new Accord with the re-designed rear end... Not one, so far..

author: lemko
text: ...saw TWO Buick Terrazas yesterday - a gray one and a red one.

author: navigator89
text: Chrysler Crossfire, in white. Yes, I know it's been out for 2 years but I haven't seen any.

author: lemmer
text:
I was behind one in traffic today - they look funny from behind.

Someone in my office building drives a Crossfire every day, and they usually park nearby a daily driven Insight.

author: andys120
text: -New '06 Fusion sedan, very handsome in black, no wonder the ads feature that color. Way spiffier than the 500.

author: ateixeira
text:
First wagon I've seen. Looks good. In some ways, I prefer the wagons over the sedans because they do away with the Bangle Butt.

-juice

author: kyfdx
text:
Hey! Me, too.... On the way to work today.. A black Fusion SEL with temp tags.. Very nice.. 17" alloy wheels.. maybe a little too much chrome trim...

Really, this is the first car I've seen from the domestic makes that could compete with Accord and Camry.. very handsome..

regards,
kyfdx

author: lemmer
text: They had a Fusion at the auto show yesterday, but it was on a platform and you couldn't get up close to one. Obviously it is far to valuable to allow normal middle class people near them. Same with a Solstice. People had to console themselves by going next door to the Honda area and sitting in new Accords and S2000s.

author: kyfdx
text:
Auto shows... don't get me started...

The Cincinnati show has to be one of the worst.. In late February 2003, they didn't even have a TSX in the Acura display... and..it went on sale April 1st!!

We always get the cheesy prototype cars that made the rounds of the "big" shows the year before... Although, we did have a Solstice in February of this year.. (no sitting in it, of course... lol).

author: fintail
text:
Ha, at the Vancouver show in April they had a *Lucerne* all roped off and not able to be touched. Give me a break. I sat in a SL65 AMG!

Seattle show is this weekend, I wonder if I'll be able to touch anything.

author: boomchek
text:
Yeah I saw that SL65 as well. I worked at that Auto Show at the Honda booth.

I sat in the Audi A8 and the BMW 7 Series as well. I guesss some cars if they're pre production maybe they don't want people touching stuff and breaking it and so they rope them off.

author: ateixeira
text:
Jag XK roadster, the one with the red label, I forget which model. Not brand new but not common.

BMW 530i.

2 Avalons and an Outback. Both quite popular around here.

Infiniti M, seems to be the investment banker's car of choice.

Buick LaCrosse right out front.

-juice

author: andys120
text:
while visiting the local Caddy store on business I spotted several new '06 DTSs. It's a big improvement over the wall-eyed look of the previous gen like my Dad's '03 DeVille.

The interior looked surprisingly good, much better than what you get in a CTS.

author: fintail
text:
I went to the Seattle Auto Show today, and saw the new models they had there. I do think the Vancouver show is better...not so much selection in Seattle. No S-class or CL, among others. Did get to admire an A8L, those are super cool...but 81K!

Saab SportKombi thing....a friend of mine wanted a pic

Maserati in a pretty silver blue color

Bentley Flying Spur

I see so many new cars where I live, not much else made an impression on me.

Surprisingly, a few people were checking out the Mercury Milan. They were quite old though.

author: guss
text:
I saw a Passat at the local YMCA . It looks very Camryesque.

With the Jetta resembling the Corolla it seems like VW is trying to rip-off Toyota styling. Why, I have no idea.

VW used to have the best looking cars.

author: lemko
text: ...my first up close and personal experience with the Pontiac Solstice. This car is beautiful and exquisitely built. The G6 also seems to be well-built, but it's going to take years to erase people's bad memories of recent Pontiacs.

author: ateixeira
text:
Brand new, but it was disabled and being lifted on to a flat bed tow truck. Not a good sign.

-juice

author: anythngbutgm
text:
The G6 at the Boston Auto show was a complete disaster. Chintzy, cheap and ergonomically challenged, big time. FAR from well built, and that is NOT coming from a Biased opinion. The Fusion/Milan/Zephyr are 20 times the car that the G6 wishes it was.

I will agree that the Sky is quite impressive, as I thought it was. Base price 26 grand, with options, 30k... Nice interior for the Solstice as well, too bad the looks (as well as the air inlets) are going to be interupted once the liscence plate goes on...

author: stickguy
text: guess they had to switch to copying Toyotas since Ford now makes VWs, right??

author: lemko
text: ...a co-worker had a Honda Accord and he traded it for a VW Jetta. Why would a guy trade one of the most reliable cars for one of the least? If he liked the look of the Jetta, he could've purchased a Corolla and at least maintained the reliability.

author: stickguy
text:
why not? I like cars too much to tell someone to drive something they don't like just to be practical.

Besides, for all the bashing, a new VW isn't guaranteed to be a nightmare. I'm sure plenty of people buy them and have perfectly fine ownership experiences. Same with a Taurus, a Kia, etc.

Yeah, if I had to lay odds, I would bet the Jetta is more likely to have some issues. But, it has a 4 year warranty, so at least they will be dealt with.

Besides, car sales have always been driven more by emotion than commen sense (IMO of course). Otherwise, a whole lot few cars would be sold, and the ones that were would be much less exciting.

author: ateixeira
text:
Some people get bored with appliances, so they get something they think has a little more character. The interior materials in most VeeDubs are also very nice.

Plenty of people are willing to take the risk. I bet the reason they switched to a Jetta was that Passat prices have crept up too high. C&D's Passat was $38 grand!

-juice

author: fintail
text: The Jetta has more issues....but how many are felt by the average buyer? I've known a couple people with late model Jettas who love them. A guy I work with bought a new Jetta diesel last year, and he has had very few issues at all, we're talking like a rattle in the seat. High grade interior with average mileage in the mid 40s, approaching 50 on the highway.

author: guss
text:
would VW choose to go in this direction.

I love VW's for their exterior styleing and cool interiors.

I love Toyotas for their reliability.

I am just waiting to hear Toyota has hired VW's quality control guy. That will really send my head spinning.

I do agree that most people I know that have Passats love them.I guess it is just the internet stories about when they go bad they go really bad. Like the Jetta i used to see once in awhile that had a :lemon: sign in the window. You must really hate the brand to go that far.

author: ateixeira
text:
That's what I have observed, one extreme or the other. They have die-hard fans and then people that swear they would never own one again.

-juice

author: kyfdx
text: ..in black.. Nice.. wretched excess.. just the way I like it..

author: boomchek
text:
I am working a deal involving a silver SL55 AMG right now.

Nice fella wants to trade in his SL55 AMG for a Odyssey Touring. He can't justify dropping $100k CDN for the Benz R Class. I am hoping this deal will happen so I can take the SL out for a spin.

author: anythngbutgm
text: I wish I had a camera! Silver Noble M12 passed me going the other direction this morning. I believe I've seen this car before...

author: fintail
text:
Wow, that's gotta be the least fun trade I've ever seen

I hope it works out for ya though

author: navigator89
text:
Saw my second Hummmer H3, in black. It seems tiny compared to the H2, but it looks nicer.

And saw another beige Avalon.

And several 300Cs, in just about every color, silver, white, black, green.......

author: kyfdx
text:
I'm leaving my son's basketball practice.. and, right behind my black CR-V is a black Hummer H2.. Talk about contrast...

It is driven by a local resident, who is a former NFL player and now a national broadcaster...

So, he is taller, better looking, richer and drives a bigger car than I do... and, don't even get me started on his wife...

author: ghulet
text: ...I've seen TWO new BMW M5s! I didn't even know they were building them yet. The first I noticed because of the color (it's called Indianapolis Red, think metallic Dentyne) and the big wheels, then noticed the standard M-type slotted vent thing on the front fenders. I saw one the next day downtown, in silver. Nice, but $81k is a lot of money for a kinda funky looking sedan with a puny back seat, no matter how fast. I'd sooner take a 550i and save $20k; I checked BMW's website, you STILL have to pay for a satellite radio, folding rear seat and rear seat heaters for that $81k.

author: boomchek
text:
We've had some unusual trades come in before. One guy traded his 97 BMW M3 for an Element. Another guy traded a 3 month old WRX for an Element as well.

The one that takes the cake though is an acquaintance who came in and wanted to trade his Ferrari for a used Civic or Corolla. :confuse:

The used car was to be for his mom, and since he already drives a SL500 and a MDX, he had no need for his 1991 348 cause maintenance was pricey.

author: fintail
text:
So maybe the out of place cars on dealer used lots are just nutty trade ins, and not cheapos picked up at auction as I have always suspected.

I'd like to know what the Ferrari/MB/etc dealers get

author: anythngbutgm
text: I wish I could get a picture, but a used car dealer in a nearby town has a Red Testerossa on the lot. Wonder what they traded THAT in for? :confuse:

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a Jetta this AM. Still not many around these parts.

I see 5 Avalons a day probably.

-juice

author: navigator89
text:
a beige Land Rover LR3. It looks way different from the Discovery, mostly due to the longer wheelbase. It almost looks like a van.

Also saw a 2006 Lexus LX470. They did a good job touching up the taillamps. As usual, the LX470's interior is simply amazing.

author: derrado1
text:
I've always, always despised LX470's. They look almost exactly the same as the Landcruiser, which is on virtually every street corner in Australia, and yet they cost a lot more. You can't just slap in some leather and different headlights. I think the pre-2006 LX470 even had the same taillights as the Landcruiser!

If I weren't so fascinated with American cars, I'd probably be hating on the Navigator, Escalade, Yukon Denali et all right now

author: fintail
text:
"You can't just slap in some leather and different headlights"

Depends on how poserfied the locals are. In my mall cruising SUV loving community, the dorky cosmetic upgrades fool lots of aging yuppie fools and their brainless greedy trophy wives.

It's almost too easy to hate on those rigs.

author: kyfdx
text:
Audi A3.. in silver....

Really looks good on the move... Too bad my wife doesn't like wagons, or this would be her next car... I think..

author: ateixeira
text:
This will make you even more mad, then - my dad headed up a field office for a large bank in Suriname (later in Belize), and they'd order UN-spec Land Cruisers, I mean vinyl seats, diesel engines, manual trannys.

Any how, the funny thing was these vehicles cost around US$22k delivered (with insurance and even spare parts).

So it's funny to see a Lexus badge and a $70k price tag. They're paying more than triple for the same truck wearing a tux.

Saw a new Jetta today - it had just rear ended a car and caused a big backup on the Clara Barton Pkwy. :mad:

-juice

author: guss
text:
I am a wagon guy and the the A3 is on my short list(in about 3 years).

Last week coming out of a realtors office I saw a Maserati Quattroporte in black.

Today in the parking lot of another realtors office a Bentley Continental GT in silver.

I don't know if the were buying, selling or brokers but the Real Estate market must be still doing all right.

The unusual part was the Maserati was a four door and the Bentley was a 2 door. When I think of these brands I picture them the other way around.

author: ateixeira
text:
So I saw a bunch of stuff:

3 Priuses
Sonata
Monte Carlo (new front, old back, looks strange)
A8
Civic coupe (sharp)
2 300s
Galant
Canyon (not new but rare sight for me)
Pathfinder (same one as last time, parked in the same spot!)
Mini Cooper (one coupe, one convertible)
5 series
4Runner
Lexus GS
Cobalt sedan

Busy lunch!

-juice

author: jaserb
text:
Leave it to the Italians - the Quattroporte has to be about the best looking 4 door car ever designed. It just oozes sensuality. If I were in the market for a high end 4 door I'd toss the practical options (STS? 7 series? S-class? LS430?) out the window and go for the Maser. Of course I'm not in that market, and I probably never will be, but still.

-Jason

author: andys120
text: I got a brief glimpse of a new Merc Milan in front of a dealer. Like it's bro', the Fusion, it looks trim and well detailed and the black paint looks great.

author: ateixeira
text:
I like 'em too. I saw one in trendy Rehoboth Beach, DE, it was surrounded by Benzes and Bimmers, but the Maser is the one that stood out!

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...the first Ford Fusion I've seen outside a showroom. This one was black - about the ideal color for a Fusion. Looks good, Ford! Best of luck with it!

author: andre1969
text:
I saw my first Hummer H3 on the Baltimore-Washington Parkway. It was on the median strip, behind a Plymouth Voyager that had a smashed in tailgate. Oops! :blush: As I drove past, I could see that the H3's bumper was pushed inward and upward. The grille was completely missing, with only the headlights remaining, pointing somewhat inward, giving it a cross-eyed look. Looked like the hood and fender fronts were a bit buckled, too.

The H3 definitely looked like it got the worst of it.

author: anythngbutgm
text: I know it's not new, and definitely not worthy of mention but I thought I would post the most bizzarre sighting. Went out to local restaurant on Sunday night and saw 4 Mercury Mystiques in the parking lot at the same time! I think Mercury only sold like 4 of them so imagine the shock! Must have been a club gathering

author: ateixeira
text:
You read that right, another diplomatic car. VW ought to sell it here since they moved the Golf/Jetta up in price.

Also saw a Passat and a Jetta. VW is adding incentives to both.

-juice

author: fintail
text: I saw a new style Passat Saturday that had some decent body damage, but was still being driven. That's gotta suck.

author: ateixeira
text:
I was hit by a Saab while driving my Miata. He still had temporary tags! This was a year or two ago. He was bummed. I had to get some string from my car to help him elevate his bumper enough that he could even drive it!

-juice

author: fintail
text: I think a wrecked normal new car is more painful than a wrecked new highline or exotic, simply for the fact that the car is likely more of a significant item to the driver. A wrecked new Ferrari or Porsche etc is likely just a castoff from some spoiled irresponsible inheritance playboy/lottery winner/entertainer/etc. But a mangled new Saab or Passat or Honda etc is probably more important to its owner.

author: lemko
text: ...that shows wrecked highline and exotic cars called wreckedexotics.com

author: anythngbutgm
text: OMG, I must have saw 100 new Civics yeserday, literally... I took a 50 mile+ trip to the south shore which consisted of mostly highway. The wife drove while I was playing "Punchbuggy" with all the new '06 Civics I saw

author: fintail
text:
I've seen that site...kind of sick seeing Ferraris etc all mangled.

I've seen many new Civics too, mainly sedans. I've seen a couple up close, and I will say this, they raise the bar for small cars. Everything else looks kind of old now. Honda will likely be satisfied with its performance.

Personally, I think the sedans are a little odd - Saturn-like ugliness and some odd proportions (but no lameo 4 spoke wheels and cartoon interiors), which makes sense given the design background. But the coupes are better.

author: lemko
text: ...silver Ford 500 on the way to lunch. They're quite common around here. The '06 Civics are still quite scarce. I've seen one white sedan in all this time.

author: navigator89
text:
I attended the Motor Show in Kuwait on the 11th, and saw some very nice vehicles there, and had the good fortune of sitting in a lot of them.

I sat in...
Range Rover Vogue Supercharged
Hummer H2
Range Rover Sport
Audi A6
Audi A8
Audi A3
Audi A4
Dodge Charger
Chrysler 300
Chrysler Crossfire
Volkwagen Passat
Jeep Grand Cherokee
Subaru Forester
Toyota Avalon
BMW 750Li
Infiniti Q45
new Accord
Mustang convertible
Euro Focus (very nice)
Hyundai Azera
refreshed Grand Marquis, (looks classier)

and a lot more cars! The best one I sat in was definitely the Audi RS4. You can read my impressions in the thread there. Beautiful car, with nice, grippy shifter, carbon fiber trim, special wheel, body kit, and sport seats.

I also many other exotics, like the Porsche Cayman, Carrera GT, Lamborghini Gallardo and Murcielago, Jaguar XK, Jaguar XJ Portfolio, Rolls Royce Phantom. Man, that car was big! They also had a Charger RT with a 440, and a Corvette Sting Ray with a 427. Not too many concepts, excep the Lexus LFX, and something from Skoda.

I'll post pictures soon.

Anyway today I saw a Hummer H3 in red. Very tidy looking. I wanted to sit in at the show, but the models were full of people. :mad:

And a white SL55 AMG zooming down the highway.

Question for you guys, how are autoshows there? What kind of cars can you sit in, and how much is admission. I remember at Toronto admission was high, it was very crowded and you could only sit in everyday cars. Admission here was free!!!

author: ateixeira
text:
The biggest ones are Detroit, Chicago, New York, and LA. The catch, however, is that a lot of the nicer, newer cars are roped off. Concepts especially.

So in a strange way, the small-town shows are better. I used to go to the DC auto show and even though they would get the same cars Detroit got 9 months later, more of them are open for you to crawl inside.

It really depends, if you are car shopping, seriously, you have to get inside. So the big shows may actually not be the best.

If you are just browsing, and want to measure crowd reaction to the cars, there's nothing like the Detroit. I've been the last 2 years. It's huge.

-juice

author: boomchek
text:
The Pacific International Auto Show in Vancouver BC is held in April, and the admission is about $13.

Most of the cars you can sit in except the high end luxury marques. Sat in the Acura RL, the BMWs, Audis were open, but all Jags, Land Rovers, and most of the high end Benzes were locked up.

We get quite a few exotics and concepts here as well.

This year's show had the RR Phantom, a bunch of Porsches, a ton of GM concepts, the Ford GT, Lambos and a couple of Ferraris if I remember correctly. Last year we had a Maybach 57 on display as well.

author: ateixeira
text:
Passat - looks bloated and much bigger than the old one.

Impala - nice improvement, but still kinda dull.

330i - Bangle's best design so far.

-juice

author: guss
text:
so far i I have seen two of these.

I like it over the last generation .But , for some reason it reminds me of a woman with big hips(apologies if I offended any women).

I don't think this is the car will save Mitsubishi's kiester.

author: fintail
text:
Autoshows in NA can really vary. I just went to the Seattle show weekend before last...I sat in SL500/E55/A8/S4/XJ. I didn't see an S class at that show, which surprised me. Cheaper performance cars like WRX/EVO/etc were all open too, and had as much of a crowd as the higher end cars. I am pretty sure the XLR was open too. I'm not a SUV fan so I didn't look at those. I went to the Vancouver show in the spring, and sat in a SL65, C55, S500. I was surprised they had that SL open, and that was my highlight of the show. Maybe it's because MB are so common in Vancouver, but there were no crowds around them either. The dealers at the stand were also surprisingly nice. Of course the exotics like Lambos/Ferraris/Rolls etc were not open for such viewing, but I didn't expect them to be.

I am seeing new Infiniti M quite often now, and it's competitor the new GS is a daily sight here too. Quite a few new 3ers too, and I agree, the design works.

author: i_luv_toyota
text:
I have seen several of the new 2006 Civic sedans, many Chevy Uplander vans, many new Chevy Cobalts, and many, MANY new Toyota Tacoma 4WDs. This was in Kailua-Kona on the Big Island where I was for a week.

While on Oahu (Honolulu) for a day I saw a new Ferarri with a large "RENT ME" sign on it at a gas station in Waikiki. I'm not good with IDing Ferarris so I have no idea what model I saw as I was just driving by.

Then I come back to Connecticut and see a new Range Rover Sport in that orange color we all have seen in that commercial.

author: lemko
text: ...new black Mitsubishi Galant. It is just as strange-looking from the back as it is the front. The taillamps are shaped similar to the Dodge Charger, but are chrome and illuminated through three tiny horizontal slits - red for taillamps and brake lights, amber for turn signals, and white for backup.

author: teds1
text:
I saw a CL65 this morning... that's gotta be pretty rare, even for NYC.

I have seen a bunch of the RR Sports now and I have to say, the image one projects while driving a 390 hp sporty SUV is not that of a smart humble man. It would seem that seem that these are bought 100% for image although the drivers look like they are having fun. what a dumb truck

author: fintail
text:
You'll see a dirty RR Sport as soon as you see a dirty normal RR or H2 or Escalade or G-wagen. All image, and for many the image isn't the most positive. These things are made for off-roading, that being leaving the road and entering the driveway of a face brick McMansion in Pressboard Estates.

Sometimes I go for a walk on nice weekend days, and I prefer to walk through a ritzy residential area near where I live. There's one house I walk by that has a SL55, S55, and C55, all in black. I wonder if the guy owns the local MB dealer or is just set in his tastes.

author: fintail
text:
I'm in Bellevue WA, which has more than its fair share of high end cars. Well today I saw one on par with the Enzo I saw a couple months ago. I saw a.....

Mercedes SLR

And it's a freaky lookin machine. It was black, driving in normal city traffic. Such a long hood, and the car is so long and low. Really it's hard to describe how it compares to normal cars. But it stuck out!

author: navigator89
text:
I went again to the Kuwait Motor Show on Tuesday, which was the last day.

And I was fortunate enough to sit in 4 Porsche, the Carrera 4S, Boxster S, Cayman S, Cayenne Turbo! All beautufil cars, high quality materials, and you can feel the technology in them

Also sat in a BMW 6 Series. The interior is fabulous and the wood is rich.

And I sat in some other cool SUVs, like the Infiniti QX56, Lincoln Navigator, FX35, Yukon and Envoy Denali. Also tried out all the French cars from Peugeot, Renault and Citroen. They have some pretty neat designs, like the Renault Clio Sport, Espace, Peugeot 607, 407 Citroen C5 and Picasso.

author: teds1
text:
I wonder if he just wanted to see how the same engine performs with slightly different weights and wheelbases...

Seems kind of boring, I never understood those people who had a 745 and a RR (pre Jag engine). It's the same damn motor!

And why on earth would you want an SL AND a CL? It's the same car almost.

Isn't the point of being wealthy enough to afford multiple cars the otion of variety?

BTW SLRs are really cool in person, I've seen two in the wild and there is usually one in a showroom by my office. They sell them pretty quick actually

author: lemko
text: ...gray Ford Freestyle. Hey, somebody bought one.

author: kyfdx
text:
A new BMW M5...

I had to run a red light and knock over a boy scout leading Grandma across the street to catch up to him...

But, it was worth it... In silver.. four big fat exhaust pipes coming out the rear...

Shewwwww.... I need a shower..

author: 210delray
text:
That is, pardon me while I puke.

I saw the rear end of a Mercury Milan today. Taillights too big for the rear, sort of like the Olds Alero, only worse: the Milan's lenses are mostly clear, so it reminded me of looking into a zombie's eyes.

author: guss
text:
I was behind a New Passat. When the brake light comes on it's a circle and the turn signal is in the middle of it.

I was behind it at a red light nd had to look away because I felt I was being hypnotized.

"Buy the new Passat....Buy the new Passat...."

author: ateixeira
text:
New Civic sedan. Looks modern but still not as nice as the coupe.

-juice

author: fintail
text: I don't know if it was brand new, but I saw a yellow Murcielago today. As well, I spotted both a new A6 and A8. They are pretty cars.

author: jcat707
text: My roommate's girlfriend's mother just bought a Civic Sedan. I've only seen it from the fourth floor window but it looks pretty good. I noticed that the windshield wipers open from the middle to the sides like the GM vans instead of the usual left to right sweeps.

author: derrado1
text:
I don't see many luxury SUV's around my parts (the entire northside is pretty much middle-class suburbia) but on the same stretch of road, on different days, I saw a Porsche Cayenne (ooooohh, I'm uber-jealous ) and today I saw a new Range Rover (looked quite small from the back)

So I'm thinking the intersection of these two words gets some pretty interesting traffic... I'll keep my eyes peeled.

author: navigator89
text:
Today as I drove by I saw what I first thought to be a Maybach, but then I realized that it was a new S Class. It was in maroon color and certainly looked better than the numerous, generic looking S Classes and 745Li's that I see everyday. I couldn't tell exactly which model it was though.

Funny, I found the car in a run down section of town, you know, the "ghetto".

author: ateixeira
text:
I'm not crazy about those, but I think the idea is that they clear more windshield area, mostly the improvement is on the passenger side. They just look weird in their operation.

Saw a new STS at Target in Rockville, MD, yesterday.

-juice

author: fintail
text:
I've noticed the "clap hands" wipers on the Civic too. Who pioneered that? I don't mean wipers going in opposition to each other, but actually overlapping.

I've also wondered why NA always gets new S class and other German cars like a year after everyone else. It'll be at least that long til I see one. But if I don't have to see that huncbbacked dashboard, maybe it's not a bad thing.

author: fintail
text:
I saw a new Impala LT this morning, it wasn't a bad looking car, better than the dumpy 00-05 models. I couldn't tell if it was a rental or not, but it didn't have a license plate frame. However, I did notice the panel gap where the rear bumper meets the body was pretty shoddily done. Didn't look encouraging. I hope it was damaged.

I also saw a Trailblazer SS. It reeked of lameness. But I say that probably because I think the body is less than pretty, the interior second rate, and "SS" on a mall cruising SUV to be an insult to the old cars.

author: ateixeira
text:
Not brand new, but these are so rare I thought I'd share. Looks like a really tough climb into the back seat, and poor visibility too.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...new cars at the Willow Grove Mall today: a silver Kia Sportage, a black Lexus GS300, white Honda Civic sedan, and a red-orange metallic Infiniti G35

author: kyfdx
text:
I can remember our '62 and '67 Pontiacs both having the wipers pivot from the outside... Since that was my first experience, I thought that was "normal", and that the other ones were strange... notably on Fords in the '60s... Now, of course, seeing the wipers "meet" in the middle looks weird, since it is so rare...

But, the first time I saw the Mercedes sedan with the single wiper? Now, that is weird...

author: fintail
text:
The fintail had it starting in 59...I am sure someone had overlapping wipers before that. On many old cars I see, the wipers oppose each other, but never cross over.

MB's single wiper idea came with the W201 (190 series) in 1983. It's actually pretty effective. My C43 has it as well.

author: ghulet
text: I thought the two wipers on one big arm was kinda neat (I think the 116s and 126s had these), then the single wiper on the 190; I think the 190 was also the first to have the articulated single arm (which I think debuted in '85), where the wiper takes a dip in the middle, then kind of hops back up before it makes its downward sweep. Kinda strange to see in action, but it's effective (sweeps something like 85% of the glass area on the 300E).

author: teds1
text:
Last night I saw a white Jeep Commander ewwwwww!
wow I hate that thing.

Also saw a 400i Ferrari though... remember that one? The sedan from the 80s? A guy I used to know's dad had one and I rememebr thinking even as a small kid that it was kinda odd.

I've seen a few civics now and strangely they don't look as good as in pictures (it's usually the other way around) I am still waiting on the coupe.
A guy in my neighborhood bought a TSX Acura and made it Euro spec with Honda badges. He did a pretty acurate job of it and I kinda like the result, not that I usually support that sort of thing

author: fintail
text:
I think the Ferrari 400 is the least loved Ferrari, and deservedly so. It looks like a sporty version of a Fiat 130.

The Mercedes 2 wiper system on the 116 and 126 was really unique. I've never seen anything like it. It is effective though. For awhile there, MB was an oddball in wiper design. My C43 has the wiper that pivots up and down when it reaches the apex of its sweep. It's still kind of distracting when I see it.

author: ateixeira
text:
I saw one, too, bright white, it really stood out. That thing is a rolling box.

-juice

author: guss
text:
I loved the basic utilitarian looks of the Cherokee. The Commander really butchered the look.

I saw my first Impala on the street. My first thought was pretty cool car what Japanese make is it? Then I realized it was the new Impala, what a vast improvement over the previous model.

author: lemko
text: ...this should be in the "obscure" forum, but I did see a new black Infiniti Q45 today. Also, spotted another Cobalt today - this one was silver.

author: kyfdx
text: ...so that is where the Infiniti Q45 is located... in Philly...

author: teds1
text:
I can't belive the amount of Q56's I've been seeing in NYC. This thing has to have the smallest demographic of any vehicle out there beyond maybe the H1 hummer. It is Beyond Ugly, chroming all the most unatractive parts on the Armada (one one of the worst names ever), expensive and HUGE. Maybe people want to have an escalade but stand out a bit more, but this is NOT the way to go about it.

I don't get it... why are this and the Q45 so bizzare and limited in appeal when Infiniti seems to have really caught the market pulse with the G and M classes? I hope we are just at a weird point in their product cycle and these models haven't caught up yet. Just imagine what a Q45 with the style engineering and appeal of the M45 might do on the marketplace... the M already competes well above it's price range

author: lemmer
text:
Rich suburbanites like big SUVs. That doesn't really shock me. The majority of Americans like a lot of lbs for their dollar, whether it be autos or hamburgers. And yeah, the QX56 is no looker, but it isn't like an LX470, GX470, Cayenne, or whatever else are candidates for the automotive museum of beauty.

As for the Q, one of the reasons it doesn't sell well as it not really any more car than an M, but it costs more. Before the new M, other makers were providing a more car for the dollar.

author: ateixeira
text:
Parked next to a new Accord sedan today.

-juice

author: navigator89
text:
Saw two Hummer H3's today in beige and red. They seem to be catching on.

Also a blue STS and several 300Cs.

author: lemko
text: ...is a great name for that Nissan clone of a Nash station wagon on steroids. It's about as big as a Spanish galleon.

author: anythngbutgm
text: Funny to see Infiniti's marketing "A line has been drawn" I think the designer must have had the hiccups when he got to the C-pillar...

author: ateixeira
text:
I see Renault influence...and Renault owns Nissan.

-juice

author: lemko
text: Looking at the QX56, you'd think Nash was in charge. That abomination looks like a 1957 Rambler wagon on steroids.

author: bhill2
text: Nah, the '57 Rambler may have been kind of funky, but it was a heck of a lot better looking than the QX56.

author: navigator89
text:
I've been seeing many of those too. I've sat in them and while they are very roomy and comfortable, the SUV feels enormous from the driver seat and it doesnt really feel luxurious compared to an Armada. The Navigator I sat in later was much nicer.

Everyday on the highway there is this white QX56 driver who thinks he owns the roads, he passes people on the right shoulder, changes 3 lanes at a time without signals, and he uses the right and left shoulders during traffic jams. Talk about irresponsible driving by a huge SUV.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
The Navi is the one to beat in the segment IMO. The Nissan 5.6 is a gem though and I would rank higher than the 5.4 for smoothness and NVH.

Interior-wise, no contest. Lincoln nailed it.

author: derrado1
text:
Saw a new Prius today, had some kind of logo on the door so I think it was a government vehicle.

WRX STI, brand new, post-facelift, drove past me. Ugly. The thing looks too old, you see the rear of it and it looks like somebody modded up an old 80's sedan. The new front, I have no problems with, but the overall design needs a rest.

Oh, and, pretty rare for my parts (very few Chrysler dealers) but I saw THREE PT Cruiser's on the bus this morning. The other afternoon, I saw three Suzuki Liana's (Aerio to you) on one drive. It's unsettling. Rare cars tend to cycle here.

author: lemko
text: ...new dark gray Mercury Milan.

author: anythngbutgm
text: Weel it seems the Avalon has pretty much become the official car of Massachusetts... I counted 32 of them on a 1 hour trek from my house to the south shore of the state. It is out of control ho many I saw yesterday... Wow. I did see a Lacrosse so I guess competition is pretty tight

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a pair of 06s, just face-lifted. They also raised the suspension a tad.

-juice

author: fintail
text:
I saw one of those new Mazda small van things the other day. Looks very Euro

I also saw the new Yaris on a Canadian TV commercial, and an ad for the Acura CSX, which is the Acura-badged Civic. It does look better than a normal Civic.

author: carguy58
text:
"I saw one of those new Mazda small van things the other day. Looks very Euro"

The small van thing is called the Mazda 5.

author: ateixeira
text:
Civic sedan and M35x sedan.

-juice

author: kyfdx
text:
New Lexus GS300 AWD.. and Infiniti M35X.. right next to each other..

I like the look of the Lexus, better....

author: jcat707
text: Yesterday I saw a black VW Phaeton and earlier today I saw a white Lexus ES300 with no moonroof and cloth seats. I knew you could order them this way but I never thought people actually did.

author: prosa
text:
The other day I saw a Lincoln Zephyr for the first time, very stylish indeed. While the Fusion and Milan are far from unattractive, neither one has the Zephyr's fine looks.
It's just a guess on my part, of course, but I have a suspicion that the Zephyr will do very well for itself, providing some tough competition for the likes of Lexus, Acura etc.

author: 210delray
text: Did you see the rear end of the Zephyr? IMO, it has ugly oversized taillights. Sort of like the Olds Alero had too-big rear lights.

author: ateixeira
text:
Lincoln needs that 3.5l V6 badly. The 3.0l Duratec can't even match Honda's or even Hyundai's, never mind Acura.

What's fine for the Fusion is not for the Zephyr, and it's higher price.

Saw lots of new cars this AM:

Lexus IS - still not common around here
Civic coupe
Commander - box on wheels, chromed up so it looked cheesy
Ranger Rover Sport - huge wheels can't possibly go off road
A6 - large mouth bass
Tribeca - in that dark Maroon color

-juice

author: navigator89
text:
My first Azera seen in white heading in the opposite direction on the highway. IMO the styling is too bland, but some people might appreciate that. I sat in the Azera recently and really liked it, although white is not a good color for it. It looks too plain and boring.

Also spotted another red Hummer H3.

And then, two exoitcs. A white SL55 AMG and a greyish brown Aston Martin DB9. Both are beautiful cars.

author: ateixeira
text:
I was behind an SL55 today.
