Strange detail - the rear window isn't nearly as big as it could be. I'm not sure why, as it appears to be rigid, but the glass area is relatively small, no bigger than the one on my Miata.

-juice

author: fintail
text: I saw a new silver/grey DB9 out in the chilly rain this morning

author: stickguy
text:
a Zephyr out on the road with an actual (60ish YO women) owner drving. Looked nice.

and, a 645 convertible (yes, I made sure it wsan't a Solara).

author: lemko
text:
...the replacement for the XG350? I guess it's supposed to be Hyundai's version of an Avalon.

Spotted in my workplace's parking lot - new black HHR.

author: prosa
text:
...the replacement for the XG350?

Correct. Though it's a very safe bet that Hyundai hopes the Azera sells a lot better!

author: lemko
text: ...is that it competes with Hyundai-Kia's own Amanti. More people prefer the rather strange looking Amanti, (looks like a Buick LeSabre with an E-Class nose with a Chrysler grille) over it.

author: kyfdx
text:
..black SL55 AMG...

He has a nice car, but still has to drive to work like the rest of us..

author: ateixeira
text:
I think for that much money I'd get a private helicopter. :P

Saw a new 530i this morning. Still not digging the hump-back.

-juice

author: fintail
text:
I saw the same DB9 again this morning too, same street, same time. I think it's being used as a commuter.

Funny, living in the conspicuous consumption capital of the northwest, I see SL55s fairly frequently, several per week anyway. Just cars to some people.

author: navigator89
text:
Today I saw the new refreshed Accord - 5 times! First in silver, and then two beige and two black. The rear looks very nice now. It doesnt look similar to the Azera anymore.

And also a grey GS300, beige Toyota Avalon, black Hummer H3, and a W12 Phaeton in white.

author: carguy58
text: Seen a 2 Civic Coupes with new car tags in the past 2 weeks. Seen a new TL with new car tags. Seen a G6 with new car tags and silver Galant GTS with new car tags.

author: merc1
text:
2006 Civic Coupe, white. Interesting, and much bigger than before it seems. It looks like the size of an Accord Coupe of just a few generations ago. Still not digging the way the A-Pillar meets the body, but it looks lot better than the sedan. They seem to have gone for the "hybrid" look for all Civics.

M

author: lemko
text: ...new white 2006 Chevrolet Impala.

author: lemko
text: ...this time an orange Cobalt. Orange?

author: jcat707
text:
the new Passat in black which I'm afraid I don't like nearly as much as the previous model. Plus they've raised it's prices up to TL, 3-Series, C-Class territory.

Also, saw a blue A3. I like it but I'm not really a fan of wagons and hatchbacks.

author: teds1
text:
I was down in TN for business this week and I saw a bunch of HHRs, I hadn't seen any in New york yet. It looks better in person, the rear is a little spaceshipy. I have a feeling these looks will age FAST though and not gracefully. They better enjoy the sales while they can before it turns into a PT Crusier for them

I saw a solstice as well, I prefer the Sky, saw them both at the NY auto show

author: guss
text: A3,it had a temporary tag in the rear window.

author: amable
text:
Okay. I'm hooked! This is the hottest looking little roadster around right now, especially for the bucks! However, from what I'm reading, the 2007 will have a turbo, six speed and a removeable hard top! I'll curb my car fever and wait for this little baby! Anyone know anything else about it? Dealers are reluctant to comment on it because they have a waiting list a mile long for the 2006 models AND they are bumping the MSRP UP 5k! These greedy bastards will kill the best thing to happen to GM in decades like this! Has anyone gotten a dealer to commit to putting you on a list for the 2007? I'm willing to put the bucks down right now!

Thanks for a reply..

author: lemko
text: ...silver Lexus GS300 and a black Nissan Maxima so new its shipping wrapping was still all over the car.

author: ateixeira
text:
Jetta
GS300
Tribeca

The Tribeca looks better in dark colors. This one was black, with the lights on and the city lights reflecting off the paint, it really looks extremely modern. Much better than a white car looks in the daylight, IMO.

-juice

author: carguy58
text: A 06 Steel Gray Colored Mazda 6, a Mazda 5, Nissan Altima, and Cherry red BMW 3 Series.

author: ateixeira
text:
nothing! Went out for a walk at lunch and saw absolutely no new cars.

That's a first.

-juice

author: stickguy
text:
saw one in the parking lot at my office. have to check it out closer when I leave. Looks OK, but the top doesn't flow. Looks more like one of those kit cars where it was an afterthought.

Also a jetta still set up for shipping (OK, I was looking at a dealer).

Odd thing, VW puts on temporary windchield wipers (with a neon green frame) for shipping. Strange. That, and the tie down hook is screwed into the front (they take of the side grills by the fog lights), and it looks heacy duty enough to tow the ship with.

author: lemmer
text:
I thought I was the only person who got that kit car vibe.

I like the looks more or less, but it also reminds me of a dune buggy. I expect it to have sparkly metalflake paint.

author: ateixeira
text:
Solistice looks 1000 times better with the top down. Top up it's a mess. None of the body shapes line up.

Miata is much better sorted in that way.

-juice

author: derrado1
text:
A Volvo S60 in an odd bright aquamarine colour.

Brand new light blue BMW Z4, right in front of my house. Odd, because I don't see many really expensive cars around my neighbourhood.

author: navigator89
text:
Today I saw a white Grand Marquis, refreshed for 2006. The differences are nice but I wish they would update the car in other areas. The headlights are now separated from the grille instead of beside it, like the Crown Victoria. The taillights are red and grey instead of all grey.

Still, I say the Grand Marquis is a very handsome car, better looking that most sold today and it gets my vote as one of the best styled cars of all time.

author: carguy58
text:
Seen on Friday: a new VW Jetta in black, A mitsu Eclipse in black, and 2 Altima's although 1 of the Altima that could have been the other one with the new dealer tag that I saw the other day.

Seen 4 cars with new car dealer tags yesterday but I forgot what make or model they were.

author: lemko
text: ...black Ford Fusion.

author: navigator89
text:
I saw a blue Ferrari 360 Spider. As it drove by us, I could hear the loud roar of the vehicle despite having my windows rolled up.

And on the other end of the price spectrum, I saw a white Toyota Yaris. Too cute looking for me, and I dont like having the instrument cluster in the center. I'll take a Caliber in orange.

Also a white Avalon and H3 sighted today.

author: guss
text:
a new Avalon the other day also. Very Buickey(if thats a word)

I never got the center cluster instrument cluster either Definitely a deal breaker on any car I would be interested in.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw my 3rd in a week or so, this one light blue so I know it wasn't the same one.

-juice

author: stickguy
text:
I spell that right? A silver S model. QUite a sharp car. It was parked right behind a 911 (I know, but I will always call them tat, regardless of what Porsche calls them), and it looked notably different. I liked it, but a car this $$ needs a moonroof.

Oh, I was at a Porsche dealer so they had plenty of goodies to gawk at, including a nice new Turbo.

author: ateixeira
text:
I think they use an "a".

They wanted a rigid roof so perhaps the omission was intentional.

The only catch is a coupe should cost less than a roadster, not the other way around.

-juice

author: stickguy
text:
there is quite a curve to the roof (which isn't very big to start with) so a moonroof may not be feasible anyway.

I won't own a car that doesn't let in the sun from above some way, but this is a sharp looking one if the roof doesn't matter to you.

author: ateixeira
text:
Boxster S for less money is a no-brainer for me. If you wanted a true track car the Exige would be better suited anyway.

-juice

author: lemmer
text:
I was excited about this car, until I found out you have to pay significantly more for a fixed roof. What up widat?

I doubt BMW will pull the same trick with the Z4 coupe. They didn't with the Z3s, did they?

author: ateixeira
text:
Z4c is supposed to come in a lot cheaper than the Cayenne. We'll see.

-juice

author: lemmer
text:
Didn't you just correct Stickguy on that name?

I have to think twice every time I see it.

author: ateixeira
text:
Cayman, not Cayenne.

My bad, it's not like the massive SUV looks a whole lot like the little coupe!

-juice

author: lemmer
text:
Sorry to point out your mistake.

In the future, I will try to refrain from squeezing the juice.

author: kyfdx
text:
..has a more powerful engine than the Boxster S...

We just got a new convertible last week... Somehow, at 25 degrees, it doesn't seem all that great..

author: ateixeira
text:
I know, they planned it that way. But I'm saying they shouldn't have. At under $40k it could have been a bargain Porsche and would have done a lot of volume.

-juice

author: kyfdx
text:
I think you could still see a base Cayman (no S)... But, it would probably be priced between the Boxster and Boxster S... So, $55K-$60K?

I don't think Porsche is really interested in selling a car at the $40K price point... Unfortunately....

author: ateixeira
text:
Base price on a plain Boxster is $42,600. Cayman could have used the same engine and come in at $39,999.

I bet they'd bring a lot of new buyers to the brand.

The way they positioned it, it might end up cannibalizing 911 sales since performance is so close.

I just don't agree with the positioning. It should have been Porsche's entry-level car.

-juice

author: andre1969
text:
I dunno, there's just something about that new grille I don't like. It's almost too toothy and garish. Kinda makes me think of the Kia Optima, which had a grille something like that for awhile. Also makes me think of the old toothy Buicks and DeSotos from the 40's and early 50's.

I liked the older Grand Marquis grille from '98-04 (I think it got changed a tad for '02?) It just seemed to have more "depth" to it, and more of a quality, expensive piece.

author: lemmer
text:
I agree totally. Is a $40,000 base price really so downmarket these days? Is Lotus losing their reputation since going downmarket with the Elise?

Since it isn't a convertible, it would really cut down on the poseur sales anyway. I don't think it would dilute the brand.

author: ateixeira
text:
A show-off would opt for the Boxster for just $2600 more, since it would appear to be more expensive. Enthusiasts and track regulars would buy the Cayman. That's exactly what Porsche should want.

Elise has done wonder for Lotus' image. Elise is an aspirational car for many purists. Exige even more so.

-juice

author: lemmer
text: OK, now that the matter is decided, which one of us should draft an official letter to Porsche explaining the error of their ways?

author: kyfdx
text: Send me $30K, and I'll buy a new Cayman S... and then just tell everyone that it only cost me $40K... That'll teach 'em...

author: navigator89
text:
Today while on the road I saw an orange Lamborghini Murcielago on the other side. What a sweet design! Better looking than most Ferraris.

And speaking of Ferrari, I just saw a 360 Spider yesterday. Wow. 2 exotics in two consecutive days. Maybe tomorrow I'll get lucky and see a Carrera GT or an SLR.

author: ateixeira
text:
You just reminded me - I saw a Gallardo this weekend. Real nice, out on the road. My wife loved it.

-juice

author: jcat707
text: On my way back from class, I saw a white 07 Tahoe. First I thought it was an 06 Trailblazer LT with but as I passed it and saw the side was a bit larger, I realized it was the new Tahoe. Anyway, I don't really like the new style. It looks too plain from the side. Maybe it looks better in a color than white. Maybe that was the base model and upper models have some kind of bodyside cladding. I wasn't able to see the rear because it was backed into its parking spot so I have no idea if it had manufacturer plates, dealer plates or what.

author: ateixeira
text:
Are those for sale, or did you see an early production demo or something?

-juice

author: lemko
text: I liked the 1995-96 Grand Marquis with their rather delicate grilles and slim full-width taillights. I hated the 1992-94 because it looked like a huge Sable. I didn't care for the 1998-02 because that grille looked lumpish and square and the back end barely disguised the fact the car wasn't much different from a Crown Vic.

author: jcat707
text: I'm not sure what it was because I didn't get a chance to see it up close. I couldn't see what kind of plate was on it because it was parked facing the street that I was driving on.

author: andre1969
text:
I came up from behind on this good looking little green thing that simply said "Milan" on the back. The name wasn't registering with me, and at first I thought it was some new Alfa or something else semi-exotic.

Imagine my surprise when I passed it, got a look at the front in the side view mirror, and saw that vertical Mercury grille staring at me!

I really haven't paid any attention to the Mercury Milan, writing it off as a badge-engineered Ford Fusion. Looked nice in person, though. Nice shade of green, too.

author: andre1969
text:
Lemko, a good friend of mine had a '95 Grand Marquis, and I remember he said the same thing about the grille, compared to the '92-94...too Sable-esque! I think the problem is that on the '92-94, the grille was just too small and square for the rounded shape of the car. And the whole effect with the narrow grille and wide headlights just looked awkward.

His '95 wasn't bad looking, but I just think the '98 had a more muscular, aggressive stance to it. Not something that your typical Grand Marquis buyer is looking for, but I remember at the time I kinda wanted one.

author: kyfdx
text:
.. The new facelifted (butt-lifted?) '06 Accord sedan.. A very nice improvement.. But, still... I've only seen one.. I've seen tons of the new Sonatas, though..

Hmmmmm....

author: navigator89
text:
Yesterday I saw plenty of new vehicles.

First up in the early morning I saw a black G55 AMG. It had some really nice wheels. IMO this is one of the most senseless vehicles of all time. I couldnt believe it, this is the world's fastest SUV?? It looks like a box and it costs $100,000? It has the problem as the Hummer H1, who actually buys these vehicles? How many G55's has Mercedes sold anyway, like 20?

For the money, I'd take either a Cayenne, X5, Range Rover Sport, or even an ML63.

Then later on in the afternoon I spotted a white Sonata and H3.

In the evening, a silver DB9. The styling is beautiful.

Wow, like 3 exotics this week! Not bad!

author: lemko
text: Seen a bronze-colored DTS and a white STS. I was behind the STS with my 2002. It is significantly smaller than my car. I guess I'm getting a DTS next time.

author: teds1
text:
The DTS is officially common in NYC because of our high livery cab population. These guys turnover their vehicles every three years or so due to regulations and the heavy use they put on the cars so The DTS is already very common. It looks a little crisper than the last one but is not a revolution by any means. I do prefer to ride in them more than Town cars because those fat lazy wallowing lincoln suspensions make me nauseaous (I'd prefer to be picked up at the airport in a lotus and bounce all the way home on the expansion joints, thats just how I am).

As always my park avenue office has had its share of Uber sedans parked around it recently. Maybachs (the 4 seasons near by offers them to guests) are common if you can belive it and you can't swing a dead cat without hitting an s-class A8 w12 or 750. I think the first new style S that comes down here will be a big deal but the novelty will fade fast

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a G6 coupe on the way in, kinda swoopy but I think it looks too much like the Solara. By itself, it looks OK. I want to see how the folding hardtop works once that model comes out.

Also saw a Mercury Milan. I actually liked the styling. I think I prefer the Fusion front and the Milan rear. Still not sure why Ford is selling 3 of these clones with the same powertrains.

-juice

author: fintail
text:
Not the latest thing, but I've seen 2 XLRs this week. That's a record, seeing as I have yet to see a new DTS on the road, and STS are maybe a weekly sighting at best.

I'm seeing a Tribeca here and there about every other day. I see that nose, and still think "1965 Saab"

The new Civics are popping up a lot now.

author: teds1
text:
I saw one of these yesterday driving down from Connecticut. Taking 95 to greenwich from the city has got to be the only highway where there were multiple billboard ads for bentley dealerships. "Hello... we already know we want one... finding the dealer is the least of our problems here." How about a billboard from the delaership explaining how to make the money you would need to buy one?

The car looked fine... It was travlling fast in the other lane and is probably a good buy all things considered, but since it's the exact same thing as the coupe I am just not that exited by it.

author: anythngbutgm
text: A shame that something like that would be out in the snow and salted roads...

author: jaserb
text:
Very good viewing week for interesting newer rides.

The Solstice was on the back of a car carrier full of other Ponchos. Looked like it was from a different planet compared to the G6s, etc. Very sexy in black.

The Tribeca was notable for one reason... it had a bar code marking it as a rental car. Not a good sign at all.

MX5 - Looked very good in white. A bit of a wallflower compared to the heavily styled (overstyled?) Solstice, but also much less likely to be the "flavor of the month". Remember when everyone loved the looks of the PT Cruiser?

STS4 - This was a V8 AWD model, and had some real presence. STS wears Art & Science very well.

CLS - From some angles it looks very sexy, from others it's awkward or even downright frumpy. Strange looking car. I'd personally pick the...

Quattroporte. Dark blue. The styling is even better in person. It's just not right for a 4 door to be that attractive.

-Jason

author: ateixeira
text:
Rumor has it Subaru is considering taming down the look, it's been too controversial to sell well.

-juice

author: kyfdx
text:
Well... they added that nose to the Impreza... To me, that is the only thing that sticks out on the car (not in a good way).. I doubt they'll get rid of it, just as they are adding it to the other models...

What else can they do?

author: boomchek
text:
Transport truck just dropped off our first 2006 Si in black this evening. Looks pretty much the same as the regular coupe except for the wheels.

I love the sound of the motor. Sounds like a tuned up Prelude engine.

author: ateixeira
text:
Impreza is doing well, though. 4-500 people showed up for the 2006 STI debut at Miller Subaru in PA.

-juice

author: jaserb
text:
Well, believe it or not I saw an '06 STI just today. The new schnoz really works better here, at least on the black one I saw. Fits in nicely with the hyper-agressive styling (TWO wings?)

-Jason

author: teds1
text:
Yesterday in less than one hour of shopping around 57th and 5th (near Tiffany’s, Harry Winston, Tourneau, the plaza etc) I saw a black phantom (nobody in the rear but definitely a driver not the owner), Maybach 62, Bentley CGT (young driver with loud hip hop), an S65 (perhaps the rarest car of the bunch which nobody else seemed to notice, a CLS500 (didn’t even turn a head), and inside the Tourneau store a special display for Porsche design (they make watches now) with a black Carrera GT that you could go up and touch. All the rest of the cars were stuck in traffic or at crosswalks surrounded tightly by people.

We get a lot of luxo barges but you would have to be nuts to drive a high strung V10 with a fidgety ceramic clutch in midtown traffic on potholes so I never expected to see the Porsche up close in the city. It was pretty awesome I must say, a very special car, but from what I have read it is difficult to drive. This one had a CF shifter instead of the wood I have seen in magazine shots and peachy orange interior. I feel bad for whoever winds up with this example though, it was covered in fingerprints and had some swirls in the finish from all the up close attention.

As for the rest of the cars here is the observation:
While EVERYONE stared at the Phantom and the CGT. No one even noticed the Maybach or the S65, and this was in tightly packed midtown holiday shopping traffic
So if you are in the mood for a $400k land yacht but don’t want anyone to notice you, the Maybach is the choice The S65 is the choice for people who appreciate the engineering of the amazing motor, not for the style conscious.

author: ateixeira
text:
2 wings and top and bottom diffusers, too. I got to meet and interview Petter Solberg at the US debut of the '06 STI, and he swears they're functional, and exist so that the Group N rally cars (closer to stock than Open class) can have them.

Saw a new Impala on my drive in today.

-juice

author: andre1969
text: one of the new Impreza wagons at Arundel Mills mall in MD yesterday. I don't know what's worse...that slapped-on nose or the jumbo hood scoop that would look overkill on even the most brutal of musclecars.

author: ateixeira
text:
Rally fans eat it up, though. They see the link to the WRC and like that kind of thing.

You're too old for one of those, andre! :P

-juice

author: cheleigh
text: I saw a MB500 today. It looks like a huge Dodge Magnum, but it's still rather impressive from the exterior. It's the first time I've ever seen the vehicle.

author: prosa
text:
Quattroporte. Dark blue. The styling is even better in person. It's just not right for a 4 door to be that attractive.

I saw a Quattroporte the other day. Parked at the curb, too, so I was able to get a good long look.
Okay, it's a very attractive car, but why the Buick-esque portholes? Its front end already has a slight resemblance to the Lucerne and LaCrosse.

author: stickguy
text: HSE sport. Surprisilngly sharp looking, especially with the big wheels. LOoked smaller (and lower) than I expected, but made quite a statement. Interior looked very nice too.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw one of those new Jeep Behemoths. I can't believe how small the 3rd row is given the outer size and shape. Space efficiency seems poor.

I think the Mazda5 is just as roomy and half the size!

-juice

author: lemmer
text: Those Commanders are all over the place here, probably purchased by middle aged people who think the Scion xB and Element are hideously boxy.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a Lexus GS coming home yesterday. I think they're starting to blend in 'cause I hardly notice them any more.

-juice

author: ateixeira
text:
I think the Sienna minivan got a very minor face-lift, because the head lights look different now. I've seen a couple of the new ones, guess it just came out.

They should drop the 3.5l in there...

-juice

author: fintail
text: I spotted a new Maserati coupe this morning, and a very dirty Mercedes R-class.

author: navigator89
text:
Saw a grey Kia Rio today, it looks much better than the outgoing model.

Also a white H3 and A8.

author: andre1969
text:
did they get rid of that awkward little triangular thing in the center of the grille?

I saw another Mercury Milan today, this time in silver. Now normally I don't like badge-engineered cars, even if I've owned a couple in my time. :blush: I just like to see more of an attempt done to differentiate the models. But somehow the Milan comes off as looking nice and tasteful, and upscale from the Fusion. And it even wears that Buick/DeSoto/electric razor grille better than many Mercs.

I still don't think I've seen a Commander yet. I've seen an occasional Lexus IS. Don't really care for 'em from the rear, but I LOVE the front-end!

author: ateixeira
text:
Oddly enough I liked the Milan too, more than I thought I would.

Didn't notice the grille on the Sienna, I'll look closer next time.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...maroon Chevrolet Impala and my first sighting of a blue Pontiac Torrent. Actually, it is quite attractive - nicer than the Equinox.

author: guss
text:
as I was driving by the Hyundai dealership , a new Azera was going out on a test drive. Looked really sharp in black.

Made wonder if their is enough market for two Avalons.

author: navigator89
text:
a lot of cars.

First, three Mustangs, two black and one red. And then two black STS V8 models.

Also a white 3 series, and my second S class in white. I keep confusing it for a Maybach. I couldnt tell which model it was though.

And at a classic car dealer I saw a red 64 Mustang a gold 69 Camaro. Nice looking cars.

author: jcat707
text: I too saw a Pontiac Torrent but it was silver. I agree it looks alot better than the Equinox. Also I saw a gold/beige Fusion with new dealer tags in the window. While I love the Fusion, I did not like seeing it in "Dune Pearl". The black one I saw a few days ago looked awesome. Maybe the gold looks better in the sunlight because it was really cloudy today.

author: jcat707
text: I too saw a Pontiac Torrent but it was silver. I agree it looks alot better than the Equinox. Also I saw a gold/beige Fusion with new dealer tags in the window. While I love the Fusion, I did not like seeing it in "Dune Pearl". The black one I saw a few days ago looked awesome. Maybe the gold looks better in the sunlight because it was really cloudy today.

author: carguy58
text:
Red Toyota Camry, Toyota Corolla(forgot the color of the car though), Black Chrysler 300 Series, Mazda Tribute(I think black color), black Audi A6,and black Mitsubishi Eclipse.

BTw, I see people like the way the Torrent looks better than the Equinox. I like the way the Equinox looks myself and have since its debut.

author: ateixeira
text:
Maybe sales are picking up...

There's a silver one in the garage now, gotta figure out who here at work got one.

Saw one on the way home Friday, and then another last night on the Beltway in MD.

-juice

author: fintail
text: Seems a little new to be a "collectible"

author: lemmer
text: I searched the completed auctions and saw that very few Solstices are selling on eBay. Maybe people finally wised up about paying way over MSRP the first year, or maybe the Solstice isn't quite as hot as expected.

author: ateixeira
text:
That's quite ambitious, especially when the whole idea was a car starting under $20k (though just barely).

Fiero isn't collectible, LOL.

-juice

author: teds1
text:
Sorry about that accidental posting just now

I have to laugh... there is no way the solstice will become that big a collectible with the volume they are making and the materials used. Unless it's the awesome mallet version I read about. The sky looks better anyway.

I saw some really cool stuff recently.
Not new but one of my favorites of all time and pretty rare, a BMW 3.0 CS driving out on the town saturday night. I love those things, soooo underated as a classic

Also It's kind of cheating but walking to work this morning (transit strike Grrrrrr) I waked by the maserati/ferrari showroom (not dealership just promotional showroom) on Park ave. and saw that they have the new Birdcage concept car on display in the window. I hadn't seen this thing in person yet and the pics didn't really do it for me but Damn is it awesome... you have to see it in person to believe it, it's about two feet high. Very cool, I hope they make something like it instead of that overpriced and frankly unnatractive mc12 thing.

author: fintail
text: I saw my first Lucerne on the road today. It was silver, not a bad color. Not offensive, not groundbreaking. Reminded me A LOT of a Q45, which is debatably good as they sell about 10 of those a month nowadays.

author: chidoro
text: Saw a new R-class for the first time today. Obviously in black. It made me question whether the Toyota Matrix came in a LWB format

author: merc1
text:
Also a white 3 series, and my second S class in white.

The new 2007 S-Class?

M

author: navigator89
text:
Yes, it was the 2007 model. I didnt see the model number.

Remember I am in the Middle East and thus see a lot of European cars, and they come here first before America. For example the B Class and 1 Series are sold here but wont come there for another year or so.

The S Classes we get here are European. They have the S350 here but not in America. Similarily we get C240, E240, C200, E200. I think in America it starts off at E350, C350.

author: merc1
text:
Remember I am in the Middle East and thus see a lot of European cars, and they come here first before America.

Duh and all this time I thought you were here! :confuse:

Oh yeah the new S has been on sale over there for a while now.

M

author: fintail
text:
The S350 is actually in NA now. The B class is in Canada anyway too.

I wonder when the new S will be here. I can't wait to get a look at that interior.

author: teds1
text:
I saw a Toyota Century last night parked in front of a hotel in midtown. That is their high end limo not sold in this country, all the Japanese bigwigs have them. I have no idea what one was doing here or how much it would cost. Not diplo plates or anything either.

kinda odd

author: navigator89
text:
Which city was this in?

I read somewhere that the Century can cost upto $90,000!!

Check out these pics. It looks like one of those Soviet era KGB cars.

http://www.cars-directory.net/specs/toyota/century/1997_4/picture/8921/

author: fintail
text:
I've seen one of those in Vancouver, from the late 80s (you can ship anything 15+ yrs or older into Canada so long as it passes inspection). They are actually kind of cool, they remind me of an old Mercedes.

I see the one in that link finally has a floor shift, older ones have a very weird column shift.

author: ateixeira
text:
Seen a few of these lately, 3 or more.

Saw a new Accord sedan this AM.

A new Civic sedan as well.

Spotted a light green Tribeca on the beltway, actually followed him for a good distance.

And a Hummer H3.

-juice

author: prosa
text:
I saw my first Lucerne on the road today. It was silver, not a bad color. Not offensive, not groundbreaking. Reminded me A LOT of a Q45, which is debatably good as they sell about 10 of those a month nowadays.

At least from the front, the Lucerne looks something like the Maserati Quattroporte, right down to the port holes. Definitely not bad company!

author: fintail
text: Yeah it's not an awful looking car, it looks expensive in its own way. It will look even more expensive than it costs when you can get them for 50% MSRP after a year.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a Ferrari on a flat bed, DC plates so I'm not sure why it was being towed...

-juice

author: lemko
text:
I always thought the Maserati Quattroporte would make a beautiful Buick!

Spotted today: new Ford Explorer and a silver Pontiac Torrent.

author: jcat707
text: I saw plenty of cars today while sitting in traffic making my way to the mall. I saw like 3 or 4 06 Explorers (all Eddie Bauer models), a silver Pontiac Torrent, my first ever Izuzu Axiom, 2 Fusions(one silver and one burgandy, a Milan in a nice looking greenish-gray color, a Zephyr in a not so nice looking blue and last night I saw a Phaeton speed past me on the freeway.

author: carguy58
text: Milan this week. I like the front of it but I don't like the triangle tailights in the back.

author: carguy58
text: seen 3 Mazda 3's in the last 7 days with new car dealer tags on the plates.

author: fintail
text: I saw a black Solstice this morning

author: kyfdx
text:
Being used as a private security guard car.... the kind you see at shopping centers.. with the green light bar on top and decals, etc...

Usually, you see them in Chevy/Geo Trackers..

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a coupe, then a sedan. These are selling briskly, it seems.

Followed an LR3 to work today, also. Boy are those boxy. In a good way.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...black Buick Lucerne CXS and white Chevrolet Equinox.

author: brettn
text: I hope this gets all over the Internet. I found a picture of the new Camaro on the Internet today. It is on www.powellchevrolet.com. Its a dealer in Texas, why these pictures were on this website is beyond me, but if the new Camaro is like this, I will by one. There are a few computer drawings but one picure that seems to be a real photograph of the new Camaro. So check it out. You will love it!!

author: lemko
text: ...orange Mustang GT with white stripes being shown off by some guy to his friend in the Holiday Market parking lot on Dungan Road in Philly.

author: prosa
text:
Being used as a private security guard car.... the kind you see at shopping centers.. with the green light bar on top and decals, etc...

That's sort of a waste of such a stylish car

author: danf1
text: So, how are sales down in Texas?

author: fintail
text: I've seen 2 Lucernes today, one in black, the other in kind of a silver-gold mix. For a GM product it's not awful looking at all.

author: carguy58
text: new Ford Fusion in white. Also seen an 06 Explorer and white Acura TL with both having new dealer tags on them. Even though the Explorer along with the Big SUV market has seen a dip in sales the 06 Explorer in NJ I have seen a few sightings of so the Explorer is still a popular model.

author: carguy58
text:
"I've seen 2 Lucernes today, one in black, the other in kind of a silver-gold mix. For a GM product it's not awful looking at all."

To me the Lucrene looks better than the LaCrosse.

author: navigator89
text:
was probably the best day for spotting cars! I was on a trip to the mall to check out the Mercedes SL55 AMG and the new Mercedes ML500. The SL55 was in blue, the ML in silver. I'll try to put up pictures later.

Anyway, before we even parked I saw within a 5 minute period 3 exotics!! First a greenish/blue Bentley Continental Flying Spur, then a red Lamborghini Gallardo, and a blue Ferrari 575 Maranello. And right after that a silver Nissan Pathfinder, (my first) and a tricked out red Touareg with an aggressive body kit and huge rims.

After we left I saw a silver Ferrari 360 Modena, C6 Corvette and BMW 750Li.

WOW!! :shades:

author: lemko
text: ...another new Chevrolet Impala. This one was a dark metallic maroon color.

author: fintail
text:
I saw another Lucerne today.

No license plate frame, barcode in the back window...

In the local Avis parking lot...

author: 210delray
text: I know it's been out for awhile, but a few weeks ago back in the City of Angels, I saw two Rolls-Royce Phantoms -- one black, one white, both ugly. First time sighting for me.

author: boomchek
text: Saw the pics of the new 7 Series BMW. Much much much better improvement over the current version. And I like it better than the S Class Benz.

author: guss
text: This is the second one I have seen. Hands down the best looking sedan in my opinion. Whats the price on one of these, $50k or $60k? Now I just have to start playing the lottery.

author: navigator89
text:
Lol, a CLS 500 is more than that. The base price is around $65K, with loaded ones going upto $73K. Not cheap.

It's a shame that North America doesnt get the CLS 350. I see a lot of them in Kuwait. Sure they're less powerful but they would be a lot cheaper, I'm guessing $55K.

author: guss
text: Wow!, I guess I will always be relegated to a looker .But it sure is a handsome car.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
My wifes business partner has one. Some kind of "Designo" edition. That sucker was like 78 grand!

It definitely has a prescence to it. Love it or hate it, it gets noticed.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw two of these this morning. Looks better slightly lifted.

Also was followed by a Jetta GLI this morning.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...silver Chevrolet Impala and a beautiful dark blue Cadillac DTS.

author: gsemike
text: I saw a VW Phaeton motoring down Water St this morning just a couple of blocks south of Wall St. It looked like a CEO type behind the wheel but since he was in the Phaeton instead of a 750 or A8, I guess that he was probably just a COO. I speak in jest. That is a nice car and huge.

author: ateixeira
text:
VW's gonna can it. Great car, wrong badge to put on it. It probably only hurt the Audi A8.

-juice

author: teds1
text:
I'm not sure much can hurt the A8... It's pretty awesome, definitely the looker of the Germanic big luxe trio. It has a nice jump on the aging s class and controversial 7 in New york at least at the moment, I see more of them everyday.
The problem with the phaeton was that it pretty much was an A8. There are some differences to be sure but I don't like it when GM rebadges cadillacs as buicks, or chevys either. You have to have more distinctive products. If you could have a phaeton or an A8 you would go for the audi every time based on looks, heritage, status, etc...(price not a consideration, I hear second hand phaetons are among the best car deals in the world right now)
Personally though I was never that put off by the "high end VW" oxymoron thing. All car companies are going into new segments, the historical stratification means less and less. Judging by how the market is going now In 5-10 years we will have a Korean Lexus equivalent and won't find it odd at all.

author: lemko
text: ...a larger Korean domestic market car called the Equus.

author: ateixeira
text:
problem with the phaeton was that it pretty much was an A8

And a heavier steel-bodied one, as opposed to Aluminum, at that.

I heard they were discounted heavily, some sold for under $50k. If residuals are weak, you might be able to pick up a used one for $25k in just a couple of years.

I'd still be worried about the complexity of it all.

-juice

author: prosa
text:
Judging by how the market is going now In 5-10 years we will have a Korean Lexus equivalent and won't find it odd at all.

The Amanti and Azera are almost there.

author: ateixeira
text:
Comes closer, very nice interior. I saw this and the new Accent debut at the NY show, and the Azera is soooooo much nicer that it's hard to believe the same company manufactures both.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...silver Mustang and black GMC Denali on the Roosevelt Blvd. and a dark blue Impala in a distant neighbor's driveway.

author: carguy58
text: 1 white Ford Fusion(wasn't sure if it had a new dealer tag on it or not), 1 Black Mazda 3, 1 Explorer, 1 Jetta in steel grey, and 1 Honda CR-V.

author: navigator89
text:
my friend wanted to celebrate his birthday so he invited me and a few buddies on a limo. It was a white Cadillac Escalade on chrome dubs, and it was incredibly long about 30 feet I'd say. We saw plenty of new cars, like Hummer H3s, Toyota Avalons, Hyundai Sonatas 3 Ferrari 360 Modenas and even a Hummer H2 limo.

However the best car that night was my first Mercedes Benz SL65 AMG, in white. This car looks amazing in person, better than the pictures. The engine sounds so powerful and sonorous. I was the only one out of my buddies who wanted to be in the SL rather than the limo.

Beautiful car, 604hp, 0-60 in 4.2secs. 738lb.ft twin turbo V12, and $180,000. If only it were attainable. (Sigh)

author: lemmer
text:
I saw one of the new big Mercedes SUVs. It looked really good.

I don't think they are for sale yet, but since I am in the only big city near the headquarters of MB, it isn't unusual to see preproduction stuff.

I saw a new Tahoe on the road. The commericals say they aren't available to Jan 10, but this one had dealer plates.

author: fintail
text:
Today I saw an R-class on the road...black and dirty. I saw a couple of SL 55 (can't tell if they are brand new), a DB9, and a current style Viper.

I pulled up to a big intersection, and among the older Camcords (this is an area where cars last, and domestic passenger cars are not popular), there were 2 06 Civics and an 06 Accord.

author: navigator89
text:
How far away from Tuscaloosa are you?

http://www.autoweek.com/files/specials/2006_detroit/benz/glclass/pages/01.htm

The SUV you saw was probably the new GL class. Check out the pictures. I like the styling of this new vehicle.

author: merc1
text:
A lot of people can't stand the look of the R-Class, what do you think?

M

author: lemmer
text: That is it. I am only about 45 minutes from the Mercedes plant. Tuscaloosa is about 10 minutes on the other side of it.

author: lemko
text: ...of a 2006 Chevrolet Impala SS. This one was black. Also seen: red Pontiac Torrent.

author: stickguy
text:
saw a new R class (the wagon thingee) the other day, and shortly after that a new ML. Didn't look that much different.

The ML did look like a Kia. The R class? Kinda odd looking in person. I am not a fan of the droopy toward the tail look, and it has some odd curves and funky proportions. Just not attractive to me, and looks too long for the design (like it was taffy pulled).

To me, looked liked they probably compromised utility (people and cargo room) for style for styles sake, and not good style at that.

author: kyfdx
text: Followed a new Civic coupe up the interstate.. Very nice looking car..

author: fintail
text: I think "Pacifica" when I see it. I suppose it's not terrible, but it's not something I want.

author: guss
text:
I saw my first coupe the other day. Way nicer than the sedan, and I like the sedan.

In the parking lot at the grocery store, I spotted a G6 GTP, that is another sharp coupe! Pontiac seems to be getting their act together.

author: gsemike
text: Just came in dead last in the C & D comparison so maybe Pontiac isn't quite all the way back.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
That thing represents all that is still wrong in the world of GM. For 28 grand, the materials and assembly shouldn't mimic the defunct Cavalier...

Spotted to new ML500's, a Fusion and an 06'RAV4 over the weekend. Like others have mentioned, the Civic (No Si yet) is a'plenty around here as are refreshened Accords. Couple of restyled Pilots as well. Good showing from Honda here in Mass.

author: carguy58
text: Well from a styling prespective at least they are out of the 90's overstyling of cars and putting cladding on their cars.

author: teds1
text:
I saw a zephyr, which I quite disliked. The rear looks like some half baked concept car that should was designed to show off some engine feature (rendering the styling superflous). Just an ungainly looking thing, and I didn't get the sense of luxury at all.

I saw a new impala, 06 accord, civic coupe, and a BMW 3 series wagon as well. The wagon looks great. I drove the last version extensively and I can assure you it was one of the worst buys they had in the line up the 325xi with the extra weight of awd but no 30.0 liter engine (so as not to interfre with X5 sales... and then they introduced the X3 for some reason!) It was heavy slow and fishtailed easily. Hope this one is better.

The real beauty was a black DB9 this morning. There is no doubt that this is THE BEST LOOKING CAR ON THE ROAD when you see one in person. There really isn't a discussion here, it is not up for debate any more. Especially when he peeled out and the V12 screamed down park avenue echoing on the buildings.

I also passed a porsche dealer (cheating I know) that had a cayman in the window (as well as a carrera GT) just got a glimpse but it looked sweet.

author: imidazol97
text: I saw a Cobalt SS in a light, strong blue with an air dam on the rear. It had a fart can type muffler that didn't have the tinny, I'm a little engine, twang to it. It had a deeper bump sound.

author: navigator89
text: Was it the coupe or sedan?

author: imidazol97
text:
A coupe. And it was pretty. It fit right in with the crowd of Hondas and others that the youths tinker and tool up. But it actually sounded better than most did because of the pitch of the exhaust loud can.

I'll check the local K-Mart lot Friday/Saturday eve to see if it is among the cars that hang out there like a modern car cruise-in. Personally I like the cars that show up at Steak-n-Shake but they don't do that when it's cold.

author: boomchek
text:
Dropped into the Toyota dealer and looked at the new RAV4. Not the compact SUV anymore that it once used to be.

Saw two Bentely Continental GTs, one silver, one gold on the weekend in the rain.

On Friday we brought in a black MB CL55 AMG for a client who traded in an 05 BMW 5 series. I love the looks of the CL Benzes, absolutely stunning.

And the best one was that finally after two plus months of wheeling, dealing, and negotiating, I managed to finish the deal for my customer who wanted to trade in his 2003 SL55 AMG for a Odyssey Touring.

After it was all done I hopped in the SL and toyed around with all the switches, and the retractable hard top. Neat car I shall say.

author: guss
text: Yeah, I saw that too, but at least now they are in the comparison.

author: fintail
text:
I saw another Lucerne today...this one was kind of a light gold color, and had sporty-ish looking multispoke wheels. It must have been a higher model, and it actually was a private car.

boomcheck, do you know if Vancouver metro area is still a leader in NA for MB sales, either per capita or total? Only there would someone trade in a SL55 on a minivan. I do like the CL cars too.

author: lemko
text:
Black Scion xA
Blue-Green Chevrolet Cobalt LS
Red Saturn Vue
Black Acura TL

author: kyfdx
text: No wonder they can't sell the Echo, any more... The xA seems like twice the car for the money..

author: carguy58
text:
A black Mazda 6, A white Civic Sedan, A light green Pontiac G6, and a black Lincoln Town Car. Oh yeah, seen a BMX X3 or X5 today too.

Oh yeah I forgot to note a couple weeks ago I saw 3 Chevy Tahoe's or GMC Yukon's in a span of 5 minutes.

author: kyfdx
text:
My first Solstice.. silver..

It could have been the young lady that was driving, but my first thought was how low she was sitting in the car...the only thing you could see over the doorsill was her head..

author: ghulet
text: I saw a Solstice a week or two ago, it was a promo car (with top down, it was about 20 degrees out that day), Pontiac was signing people up to win one and giving away free stocking caps (can't GM just introduce a car IN SEASON, just once?), outside Daley Center in downtown Chicago. Haven't heard if I won the car (guess that means 'no'), but did get my cap, at least.

author: navigator89
text:
I went to watch Fun with Dick and Jane, and on the way to the theatre a yellow Porsche Carrera GT and a blue Aston Martin DB9 zoomed by us. They seemed to be racing. When we finally pulled upto them at a stoplight the Porsche left a lot of space between him and the car in front. When the light became green, he just blasted away with a lot of noise and it was amazing to see just how fast this superar could accelerate.

After we finished watching the movie, 3 hours after we first saw the car, we saw him again on the same road! Lol, he must have been cruising up and down showing off...

Also spotted today a red Murcielago convertible and a blue Maserati Quattroporte.

author: lemko
text: ...maroon Buick Lucerne and a silver Hyundai Sonata.

author: guss
text:
Gets to see Maseratis and Aston Martin's and I get to see a New Impala with a landau roof.It was silver with a black roof.

And before you ask, yes the guy driving was about eighty.

author: gsemike
text:
I'm seeing so many around here (Long Island and NYC) that it's not worth noting anymore which is good for Hyundia. I think that they've got a hit on their hands.

I saw a Mercury Montego this morning. Being that they sell about 4 x as many 500s, that's pretty unusual. I know that the differences are slight, but I think that the Montego is much better looking.

I like Mercury's corporate grill and that girl in the commercials isn't bad either ;-)

author: lemko
text: ...green Ford Escape Hybrid, silver Scion xA, black Acura CL, and blue Ford Five Hundred.

author: carguy58
text:
"I'm seeing so many around here (Long Island and NYC) that it's not worth noting anymore which is good for Hyundia. I think that they've got a hit on their hands."

I think Hyundai selling some Sonata's to rental fleets so you don;t truly know if they have a true hit on their hands. I usually look to see if the licsence plate on te car has dealer advertsising on it because I think cars that actual people buy are real sales to real people and not rental car companies.


Oh yeah I seen a new Sonata with new car dealer tags yesterday, also seen a new Honda CR-v(gold color) and VW Jetta with new car dealer tags on them. Even with a car that looks like a Corolla those Jetta's are still selling like mad around NJ.

author: jbos6
text: VERY odd ... I was coming off of a cruise ship in Tampa, FL today and couldn't help but notice a silver-colored Mercedes with a Massachusetts American-flag-style license plate (I live in Boston). It did say "CLS60" on the back, and "biturbo v-12". I'm with BGill, I'm POSITIVE it said CLS60, but can find nothing about this car on the web. Poseur, perhaps? Hey BGill, was the one you saw silver with an American-flag Mass plate on it?

author: fintail
text:
Kleeman badges its tuned cars like that...but I don't think they make a "60" version, although there is a CLS50...

I don't know if a V12 would be too tight a fit for that platform...it's either a frankenstein car someone made with a real V12, or a rebadging.

author: derrado1
text:
Saw a nice, beige-gold-y Volvo XC90. Not the best colour, but looked very smart and clean. Definitely one of the nicer SUVs out there.

Also saw a big, bad, black Cayenne with big chrome rims. Interesting....

author: gsemike
text:
I was running around all day yesterday and saw:

- Mercury Milan - It was parked so I was able to check it out. It's looks well made but I think the 500 is better looking. I think that the dash cluster looks too upright and close in on you.
- Ford 500
- VW Passat - The rear quarters may look too elongated and slab sided
- Buick Lucerne
- VW Jetta - with a big dent on the back door. Ouch!! It sucks when a new car doesn't make it a year without getting hit
- Isuzu Axiom - not new but definately an unusual sighting. How many of those do you see but they're really good looking.
- The Lincoln Truck based on the F150. What's it called?

author: navigator89
text:
"The Lincoln Truck based on the F150. What's it called? "

You mean the Mark LT. IMO it's a very handsome truck, no doubt about that - but what was Lincoln thinking when they made it??? Now that the new 403hp, six speed Escalade EXT is here, the Mark LT has no chance of competing. As an indication of how dead the Mark LT is to people, look at the Mark LT message board on edmunds. 189 posts, the last one made almost a month ago!

I give the Mark LT two years. By 2008 I'm sure Lincoln would have phased it out.

author: fintail
text:
Today I finally saw a new S class...sitting outside at the dealer. It's not as bad in some ways as I expected....but I do hate the rear end, and the dash is weird. I took some pics of it with my phone, but they don't want to send to my comp. Maybe later.

As well, I spotted a Porsche Cayman at the adjacent Porsche lot.

I also saw another Lucerne - this one kind of a candy apple red, and it appeared to be a private car. I thought it was a Passat from a distance. These seem to be doing OK here, which is somewhat surprising.

author: kyfdx
text:
That rear end just screams "Acura RL"...

Not offensive.. just sort of generic, IMO....

author: gsemike
text:
From the back, they look very similar.

I also saw the new Suzuki 4 X 4. It's pretty good looking.

author: fintail
text:
Here's the W221





Not a nice butt

Strange dash

author: prosa
text: I spotted a Maserati Quattroporte in a parking lot today. The parking lot of an exclusive country club? The parking lot of a five-star restaurant? No, it was in the parking lot of a local Target store. What'll be next, a Veyron at Wal-Mart?

author: imidazol97
text:
Is it rainy or foggy there? Seems to be a haze.

The rear is Avalonesque. The shape of the rear side windows adds to that. Maybe the trunk shaping on top is like the 745Li I saw couple days ago-saw two within a mile of each other. Rare in that part of city.

author: fintail
text:
It's damp here, and the phone camera tends to be a little hazy.

I think the rear profile of that car is really BMW-esque, and I don't mean that in a nice way.

author: imidazol97
text: I should have put a grin face after the rain fog comment!

author: fintail
text:
Hey, our rainy streak ended at 27 days here.

I've seen many new Impalas lately, but mostly rentals. I don't know how to manage the fleet sales issue, but there has to be a better way. It really cheapens the image.

author: jayayess1190
text:
VW Jetta's
VW Passat
Honda Civic
Dodge Charger
Mercedes CLS
BMW 3 Series
Hyundai Sonata
Chevy Impala
Cevy HHR
Mercury Montego
Mustang
Honda Accord
Buick Lucerne
Hummer H3

author: lemko
text: ...gold-colored Mercury Montego this morning with ultrasonic parking assist.

author: navigator89
text:
two days ago a silver Bentley Arnage on some fat tires with dubs.

And today, two restyled Honda Accords, in silver and beige. Also a white Sonata and silver Porsche Carrera S.

author: chidoro
text:
Saw a Flying Spur in black about a week ago at a gas station. The car definitely has presence.

Also saw two Azeras w/in the last two days, conservative maybe but nice looking nonetheless. One was black and the other beige.

author: stickguy
text:
In a garage (while picking up my daughter from a friends house).

A newish Range Rover (the big one) next to a new CLS500 Merc (the swoopy one). The house was nice too.

I must live on the wrong side of town, with my matching set of '05 hondas!

author: gsemike
text: Alot of people could do worse than to have two new Hondas.

author: navigator89
text:
Which other Honda do you own? Your profile only lists a Scion tc and Honda Odyssey.

Lol, you must be doing good to have two new cars.

author: chidoro
text: I just saw the car that reminded me of the Azera, it looks very familiar to the Audi A6. That's a good thing to be sure.

author: stickguy
text:
I got an Accord EX-L 5 speed to replace the Scion. Not as stylish (not that I am either..), but a whole lot more comfortable, and much more practical for family/kid duty. My 2 kids really appreciate having their own doors again, and some room to stretch out, windows that roll down, and a view of the outside world.'

I will go back to something sporty when they are out of the house (and my car!)

I even updated my profile since you mentioned it. Boy, was that out of date.

author: navigator89
text:
Thanks for replying. Im not sure why but your profile still doesnt look updated on my computer....

Anyway good luck and happy driving with your Accord.

author: stickguy
text: Who knows. Forums seems to be having some server fart problems this AM.

author: lemko
text: ...black Pontiac G6 on my way into work this morning.

author: lemko
text: ...silver Acura TL...smashed head-on into a precariously leaning utility pole! Several police cars were in attendance. I wonder if it was stolen?

author: bumpy
text:
I don't know how to manage the fleet sales issue, but there has to be a better way.

The best way is to simply forbid fleet sales until the 4th year of production (rental places can just buy from the dealer like everyone else), but GM and Ford need those basement bomber runs to prop up their volume.

Re. the W221: the 1998 Hyundai Grandeur called and asked for its trunk lid back.

author: imidazol97
text: Or keep selling them the previous version like the Malibu did when the New Version came out.

author: ateixeira
text:
Spotted yesterday, wine colored.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...white Chevrolet Equinox

author: ateixeira
text:
For me it was a new Commander.

But a bow on that thing, it is a box!

-juice

author: navigator89
text:
a light blue Hyundai Azera, my third one so far and my first not in white.

Also a white Hyundai Sonata and a black Porsche Carrera S.Then three restyled Grand Marquis, two in black, one in silver all on the same stretch of road within a minute.

I'm also seeing several restyled Land Cruisers, I think two today.

author: gsemike
text:
While waiting for the train to come in, I noticed that a couple of my fellow commuters sprung for new rides.

- One got a new Ford Fusion in black. It looks to be a fairly loaded car with alloys, leather and moonroof. As long as you get the fog lights, it's a pretty sharp car. The paint looks good for what it is.

- Someone else got an Impala. This is a more basic car with cloth interior and plastic wheel covers. It's not much to look at but I didn't get close enough to make a judgement on build quality.

The train station is an interesting place for car watching. You get all types there. There are alot of bona fide station cars that are 15 years or older. One old timer drives a clean powder blue 70s Granada and someone else drives a well preserved white 79 to 81 Trans Am with all decals intact. Someone else drive a little Triump convertible there everyday. On top of those there are some serious beaters. It's not the fanciest town that I live in, but some others have some nice rides such as a black Escalade that's never dirty and a very nice last gen BMW 5.

author: navigator89
text:
Mercedes M Class in beige, one in the morning and then on in the evening in the same color.Not sure if it's a 350 or 500.

Also a black restyled Grand Marquis.

author: fintail
text: Not a bad day today....I saw a nice Bentley GT with borderline tasteful semi-blingy wheels, and the sighting of the day, a Porsche Carrera GT. That's one you can spot from a long way off, it's unlike anything on the road.

author: stickguy
text:
at work with a temp tag.

Not notable by itself (although it might be the first in the parking lot), but this one had a leather interior.

Actually looked very nice, even factory installed quality. It was even perforated (I think) and looked like it came right out of a TSX.

WOnder how much that cost to do?

author: fintail
text:
I've seen three more Caymans yesterday and today.

2 of them were driven out of a small residential side street near my place, one yesterday and one today. Maybe a dealer lives there.

Ooh, a new style Maserati coupe just drove by

author: ateixeira
text:
There are now 2 of these in my garage at work, the more recent one an XT (turbo). I wonder if I know the owner.

Saw a Wagoneer and a Tribeca yesterday.

-juice

author: navigator89
text:
three Suzuki Grand Vitaras, one in beige, the other in gray and the last one in red. Red looks really nice on this car.

Also two Hyundai Sonatas, in silver and bluish green.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a new Civic coupe yesterday.

Then a new Bentley sedan, boy do those have presence.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...saw silver, black, and red G-6s past few days. They are getting to be pretty common around here. No, they didn't have little green and white "e" stickers!

author: guss
text:
I was behind one at a traffic light. Definitely a very different tail light setup. I liked it though.

I have a Mazda6 and it was noticeably wider.

author: ateixeira
text:
I saw my first on the roads yesterday, also.

Too bad the 3.5l wasn't ready for that car, there's quite a price spread for cars using that 3.0l engine.

-juice

author: boomchek
text:
Computer trouble prevented me from getting online during the past couple of weeks.

Fintail, I don't know if Vancouver is a leader in Mercedes Benz sales but I see a lot of the newest Benzes out here when they first come out on the market because of a lot of Hong Kong and China money.

I see the R Class on a daily basis, Beemers M3 and 7 Series every day as well.

And surprisingly since the Ford 500 came out I maybe have seen 2 on the road. Not a big seller for Ford.

author: fintail
text:
Thanks. I know Van was some kind of per capita or volume leader back when I was there more, around the end of the 90s. I always called the bugeye/W210 E-class the "Vancouver Accord" because they were so plentiful.

Here on the eastside (of the Seattle area) I am seeing R class daily, too, and CLS maybe every other day as well. I am still surprised at all the current SLs I see here...I see them almost every day. MB must sell them all in CA and WA.

author: teds1
text: I have seen a LOT of these recently. they have exploded around New York. It makes sense really, one or two months after the biggest wall street bonus season ever + a great looking but not over flashy car that is fast as #$%*! but holds four people and your golf clubs= a lot of Spurs. I even overheard a guy at a restaurant bragging to his date about the one he had on order (with a royal blue interior... bizarre) so I guess there is one more coming.

author: jcat707
text: I just saw my first R-class today. It was pewter. Looks like a Pacifica rebaged to be a Mercedes to me.

author: chidoro
text: Just saw my first Suzuki Reno on the road in blue. Sure seems like a long time they've been available before me seeing one but I imagine it's indicative of their sales. Shame too, it is a neat looking 5 door hatch.

author: lemko
text: ...black Pontiac G6 coupe. I saw it up close and it's quite nice.

author: fintail
text: I saw a new Passat yesterday...not so unusual, but this was an absolute bottom of the line car, cloth, plastic hubcaps etc.

author: prosa
text: I walked past a parked Volvo V50 today. Nice shade of blue. It occurred to me that V50's don't seem particularly common, even compared to the much more expensive XC90. Could they (and the also-not-too-common S40's) suffer from a perception that they're not real Volvos, being built in Belgium rather than Sweden and using a Ford/Mazda platform?

author: 210delray
text: That was certainly true of the last generation Volvo S40/V40 (not being true Volvos). I'm not so sure about the current cars, but the wagon sells in minuscule numbers.

author: 210delray
text:
Saw maybe my third one yesterday -- still misses the mark IMHO. This one was tan, not my favorite color. I got a good long look at it from a building next to it, because the older woman driving apparently got confused about when to move at a 3-way stop.

Those taillights are way too big, as I've said before. I still can't believe Ford really believes it can palm off the Mazda6 platform as a Lincoln. Meanwhile they're letting the LS, which could have been a good car AND a proper Lincoln, die on the vine.

author: lemko
text: Heck, Lincoln tried to palm off a Ford Granada as a Lincoln. Remember the Versailles?

author: 210delray
text:
Only too well, including the commercial with Frank Sinatra singing, "The Best is Yet to Come"! I guess one could interpret that as meaning the Versailles wasn't the best!

The Zephyr is a latter-day Versailles.

author: fintail
text:
I saw 3 black Porsche Caymans today, or what I suspect was the same car 3 times.

Also not brand new, but a dark red Ferrari 360 as well.

author: merc1
text:
Saab 9-3 SportCombi spotted with dealer plates. Nice "different" looking wagon.

M

author: ghulet
text: ....the new SAABs I see most often are 9-3 convertibles. I see them all the time (and it's February in Chicago). Clearly I no longer have a soft spot for SAABs, especially since they're now just glorified GMs (same platform as the G6, right?). That fact, combined with their traditional quality problems and resale value, make me shudder to think most convertibles sticker north of $40k. Wonder what most are actually selling for (or, more likely, what they're LEASING for).

author: lemko
text:
...for spotting new cars:

black Chevrolet Impala
silver Chevrolet Impala
red Dodge Charger
gold Cadillac DTS
silver Honda Element

author: jcat707
text: I saw a new 2006 Chevy Monte Carlo. I had no idea they redesigned them. There has been no advertising for them.

author: prosa
text: Recently I've been seeing more and more G35's. Mostly the regular sedans; the X versions and especially the coupes are much less common. I'd guess that in my area (Long Island) G35's alone seem to outnumber all Lexus models.

author: anythngbutgm
text: Looks like they're available for rent now. My buddy just had one as a rental from Avis I think.

author: jefferyg
text:
passed me on the interstate this morning. Still had the window sticker in it so it had not been sold. I saw it a couple of hours later at Day Motors in McComb, MS. It was almost maroon. Not a bad color.

It looked pretty nice coming down the road except for the grill. Something looks out of proportion about it and the Bowtie is too big for the crossmember it's on.

On the whole it looked like they borrowed a couple of designers from Nissan. The lines are very reminiscent of the Armada. Not that it looks like one, but the sheetmetal is squared off like the newer Nissans.

I didn't stop at the dealership to see the interior. I hope they've made some major upgrades from the prior models.

With all that said, my first impression was that I was not all that impressed. The new Tahoe is another generic full-sized SUV. However, if Chevy carries this design over to their full-sized trucks, while still not anything exciting, it is a marked improvement.

author: fintail
text: Cadillac Cadillac Cadillac Style

author: lemko
text: Fintail, you KNOW those Cadillacs never leave the factory like that. That car was assaulted by the dealer to sell to some drooling moron with bad taste! Cadillac should threaten to pull that dealer's franchise for such a horrendous act! Good God! I thought the market for such self-destructive add-on garbage died off ten years ago!

author: imidazol97
text: Do I remember that someone said Cadillac discouraged their dealers from doing that to a car?

author: lemko
text: Cadillac sure does discourage it, but some dealers do it anyway. It sure doesn't help Cadillac's image when some 90 year-old geezer in a straw hat wearing a pink shirt, plaid slacks pulled up to his chest with a white belt and shoes and smoking a big smelly cigar motors up to the light in his new Caddy sporting the carriage roof, gold package, faux wire wheels and Vogue tyres as the snooty yuppie Lexus driver looks on in disgust. Fortunately, my Cadillac dealer offers none of its junk. Another Cadillac dealer about 15 miles away trashes all its used cars with this crap.

author: fintail
text: Oh I know that's not a factory job...but Caddy should still raise a loud stink about this cheesy junk. They need to vert sternly talk to the guilty dealers. Those accessories work very hard against the image of more modern models.

author: bumpy
text: There's probably some clause in the dealer contract that won't let them do anything worthwhile. Cadillac is not the only badge to get that treatment; I saw a 300C with a full carriage roof a few weeks ago. We'll just have to wait for the generation that likes landau roofs and track suits to shuffle off.

author: ateixeira
text:
This morning I saw a newish Camry with a vinyl top. Yuck.

I love how they advertise them as "simulated convertibles". Toyota sells a Solara convertible if that's what you want!

-juice

author: kyfdx
text:
R-class Mercedes...

They really should have just gone ahead and made it a minivan..

author: gsemike
text:
Not a sharp car at all. I barely ever see any Pacificas around and this just looks like one of those badge engineered to be a Benz.

I've seen a couple so I guess that you can sell anything with a Benz name on it but they don't do a thing for me.

author: kyfdx
text: It actually makes the Pacifica look good.. It looks like an overgrown Toyota Matrix.. (not that there is anything wrong with that..lol.)

author: ateixeira
text:
I don't like them much, either. The B-class actually looks a lot better to me.

R-class might get a boost from the show Gastineau Girls, because it's featured fairly prominently.

-juice

author: gsemike
text:
might get a boost from the show Gastineau Girls

Well if you figure that 10 people watch it regularly, probably at least one of them can afford it so one is better than none. I guess that they're too expensive for Oprah to give away?

author: navigator89
text:
two Hyundai Sonatas, in silver and white. Not sure if they were V6 or not.

And also a red Corvette, I think it was from 1968-1970 generation. Funny, I just won the same looking car today in Midnight Club 3 DUB edition.

author: stickguy
text: saw one the other day. The back end looked like something my 3 YO nephew would put together using his box of big wood blocks. All clunky angles, and I don't car for those wagons that drop off severly toward the back (ala the Magnum). Just plain ugly.

author: toomanyfumes
text: I passed a car carrier full of 2007 Yukon's/Tahoe's.

author: 210delray
text:
I understand Lund is a very big dealership, and I'm sure Cadillac doesn't want to risk disciplining this dealer for fear of losing some much-needed sales.

Besides it's in Arizona, so you know there's a ready supply of retirees who'll absolutely LOVE this froo-froo.

author: prosa
text: A Chevrolet dealership near me, not a large establishment by any means, has four SSR's on display right out in front. I can't imagine that the dealership actually ordered that many of the notorious white elephants.

author: navigator89
text: a black Toyota Yaris hatchback four door, and a red Suzuki Grand Vitara. I love how it looks.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw an HHR, an H3, and a Commander recently. I guess those stand out more than anything else, so that's what I recall.

Also saw an '06 turbo Forester driven by a little old lady, you go girl!

-juice

author: stickguy
text:
Commander yesterday in a lot. Looks pretty bad. Way too tall and mis-proportioned

Saw an HHR at the market today. It was parked between an Odyssey and an Expedition, and looked very small. I think pictures make it look much bigger than it really is.

It was actually a commercial vehicle. Had Deitz & Watson deli stickers all over it, so must have been a company car.

author: gsemike
text:
G6 Coupe - Looked OK. The shape is kind of unusual in a not necessarily good way. I guess that if I was shopping for a Scion TC I would cross shop it.

B9 Tribeca - Unusual in a good way. If the mellow out the nose, it would be quite attractive. At least the fit and finish was clearly good.

Equinox - in the funkiest purpleish color that I've seen in a long time (thumbs down)

HHR - It looked OK but is squarer than a PT which didn't appeal to me.

author: 210delray
text:
Tribeca -- I think they're pretty ugly myself. The front end is weird, with the "airplane" 3-section grille and the headlights above the grille, just like cars had before 1960.

And that "character line" on the rear quarters that runs into the taillights -- not good. Somehow, it reminds me of a '58 Chevy without actually looking like a '58 Chevy!

author: ateixeira
text:
Subaru showed a black mesh grille, to replace the chrome one, at the Philly Auto Show. That tones it down quite a bit.

A chrome mesh might be optional, as they showed that as well. Bling Bling, I guess. I prefer the matte black.

Saw 2 Infiniti Ms this morning, an M45 and an M35x. I really like those.

-juice

author: navigator89
text:
Spotted today..

- 2 sliver Hyundai Sonatas
- 2 Range Rover Sport, in black and white
- beige CL55 AMG
- white CLS
- beige Toyota Avalon
- about 3 redesigned 7 series
- too many restyled Grand Marquis to count, maybe 10?

author: ateixeira
text:
Those are common around here, I don't even point them out any more!

-juice

author: gsemike
text: They're common on Long Island as well. I think that it's a hit and for good reason.

author: lemko
text: ...a new black Buick LaCrosse in a neighbor's driveway! This is a guy who has a Lexus RX330. He must've liked my girlfriend's ride when he saw it in my driveway. Also spotted a black Scion xA.

author: navigator89
text:
my first 2006 Kia Sedona, in white. Looks pretty good.

I forgot to mention, I also saw a white Maserati Quattroporte yesterday.

author: gsemike
text: As an import buyer, I have to admit that the black Ford Fusion that I keep seeing at the train station always catches my eye. It's a loaded black model with alloys, moonroof and fog lights. That's one car the definately needs the foggies to look balanced and complete in the front. The ones that I've seen without them look like there are big chunks missing out of the front bumper. The paint looks very good for what it is. If I was shopping now, which I'm not, I'd definately take a look at it.

author: fintail
text: Brand new DTS, white, still wearing temporary tags, driven by a 4 or 5 thousand year old man with a yappy looking lap dog, maybe going 30 in a 40.

author: guss
text:
you go. It's the 4 or 5 thousand year old's skewing Cadillac's age up.

I saw a Mustang Gt with the top down the other day.I bet he was not counting on a 65 degree day in Philly when he bought it.

author: toomanyfumes
text: I've seen a few Fusion's running around,too. The front end is pretty distinctive when you see one coming from the other direction.

author: gsemike
text:
front end is pretty distinctive

Pretty distinctive as far as copies of the CTS go

author: ateixeira
text:
Looks better out on the road than in photos. The area below the C-pillar still looks too bulky, though.

Also saw a new Explorer, but they're not as common as I thought they'd be.

-juice

author: anythngbutgm
text: I've got a group of people around my office who are wondering where that extremely loud burst of laughter came from... That was hilarious.

author: navigator89
text:
a beige Maserati Quattroporte, my second since Tuesday. Also a white Avalon.

And when I went to Starbucks, I saw a black 2007 Mercedes S500 with Saudi plates. Probably belonged to some rich oil sheik. Anyway the car really is big and looks much better than it did in the recent Edmunds Full Test. The interior is really nice, even though it's styling is heavily borrowed from the BMW 7 Series. I like the exterior styling, even though many others dont.

author: natenj1971
text:
Yesterday I saw a gray (they call is grigio touring) Maserati Quattroporte in Secaucus. Nice looking older (60s)couple in the front. Sharp car.

This morning I saw Mercedes-Benz 350R Class in black speeding eastward on 57th (and 3rd) older guy - 60s. Looks like a minivan to me (it's a lot larger in person - and extremly unattractive).

author: prosa
text: Today's Wall Street Journal listed the ten quickest-selling cars in the United States, measured by the average number of days spent on dealers' lots. All three Scion models were included but shouldn't really count given the company's sales practices. Most of the others were about what you'd expect; there was the Solstice and Prius of course, and the new/newly restyled IS350, RAV4 and Civic. I was more surprised to see the Range Rover Sport, given its high price. But the hot-selling model that really surprised me was, of all things, the Saturn VUE. Who would have imagined it?

author: gsemike
text: VUEs start off really cheap. That counts for something. I'm not crazy about the new grille, but of the vue/equinox/torrent family, the vue is the best option.

author: ateixeira
text:
In hot demand? Did they have a problem with supply or something? :confuse:

How bizarre. It just got a face-lift but I'm very surprised demand is high like that.

-juice

author: 210delray
text: Hard to believe, but GM made the VUE's front end even uglier than it was before.

author: teds1
text: I finally saw a fusion in the wild last night in a very nice red. Maybe it was the glossy new paint but even my girlfriend (who couldn't care less about cars and whined that I made her watch part of the awesome TOP GEAR Marathon on discovery last night) thought it was a damn fine looking car. The irony is that they had to make it look Japanese to finally get some attractive styling on a Ford. It is better looking than any Toyota at the moment for sure. I hope it works out for them. I have seen the other versions already (Milan Zephyr) and I was way less impressed. The chrome add ons just hide the basic fusion shape which is nice. Plus if you bought it you could save on Mach III razor blade replacements with that grill.

author: nweaver
text: New to this site. Hope someone can help. Saw two new Fords today in the UP of Michigan winter testing I guess. One a white 4 door Ranger like pick up truck. That I figured out, the other looked like the size of an Escape but it carried it's spare tire on the outside with the license plate off set in the rear door. It had a roof spoiler like they put on Windstars too. 4 doors with clear lights like is all the rage now. Both were masked but there was one Ford sticker on the pickup. I didn't know that they were doing anything to the Escape. Any ideas?? Thanks. NW :confuse:

author: jcat707
text: Could that Escape looking vehicle have been a Freelander. That truck has a spare tire on the back and it's pretty much the same size as the Escape.

author: PF_Flyer
text:
Driving home on a rural two lane, 45mph limit, I found myself behind an Insight. Nothing really unusual in that, but then he started accelerating... up to 60 mph and stayed that way until he reached his driveway where he slowed down sharply to turn in.

Not exactly hypermiling...LOL

author: navigator89
text:
a Lamborghini Murcielago merging on the highway. I dislike the color, it was a greyish silver. IMO the Murcielago should only be in red, black, orange or yellow.

Also a Rolls Royce, driven by a woman, in a weird color, blue-green.

Also saw a Hyundai Sonata today...but it was a taxi. Pretty odd and rare to see them being used as taxis.
Usually taxis are Corollas, Crown Victorias, Camrys, Lancer..

author: guss
text:
That may have been a Ford Edge. It's in addition to the Escape, not a replacement.

I did not think they were hanging the spare on the outside though.

author: fintail
text:
I saw 4 or 5 new Impalas over the weekend. They were ALL rentals. This fleet thing really needs to be modified.

In contrast, probably only half the G6 I see are rentals, and even less of the LaCrosse/Lucernes I have seen have been rentals. I see quite a few private Cobalts too.

I also saw another lowline hubcap wearing Passat, and a hubcap wearing new Jetta too. These hubcap cars look cheap, the hubcaps are just so plain. Some caps look like wheels in a way...not these.

author: gsemike
text:
Where do you live where they use Corollas and Lancers for taxies?

I saw a Licoln Zephyr today. As a Mercury it would be fine but it just does not look like a premium car. It's a step back from the LS which was bigger and rear drive w a V8 option.

author: navigator89
text: Look at my profile, I live in Kuwait.

author: imidazol97
text: I looked closely as I passed a Hertz rental. It had two Camrys, a Corolla, a Kia van, an Impala. I don't know what units they had out on rental, of course. But I notice more and more this location has foreign brands. But people may not be choosing them and taking others instead. I'll check the next time I'm going by this outstation.

author: ateixeira
text:
Could also be the new SporTrac, just out, and the new Edge crossover.

Zephyr name is dead, ain't that funny? MKS now, I believe, with the 3.5l. So just one model year for the Zephyr.

-juice

author: teds1
text:
