So I saw a really lovely 760i in a parking lot in Long Island this weekend. I got to take a look at it up close and it is of course very nice (with the rear fridge option). I paused though when I saw the baseball hat in the rear window. It said "No Coal No Electricity." Now I'm a petrolhead like anyone one else, but I do consider myself environmentally aware. It sort of struck me that this guy has an incredibly powerful and not particularly efficient engine to pull his 5000 lb luxo sled which he never probably gets over 80 mph, and is glorifying dirty fuel consumption at the same time. It's just so arrogant, like idling an H2 filled with premium just because you can.
Probably one of Cheney's hunting buddies.
little rant there sorry, I do like the car.

author: navigator89
text:
"Zephyr name is dead, ain't that funny? MKS now, I believe, with the 3.5l. So just one model year for the Zephyr. "

Actually, the Zephyr has been renamed the MKZ. The MKS is another sedan that will go into production in early 2008. We saw it at the Detroit Auto Show.

author: imidazol97
text:
The coal use in electricity production is controlled and the output is scrubbed so that the idea it's environmentally bad no longer exists, not anymore than building dams and disrupting the environment is good for the environment.

As for the political comments: how do you know it's not one of Hillary's or Shumer's buddies saying one thing in sound bites but doing another in real life!!! grin... :shades:

author: teds1
text: Ok I stand corrected on the coal issue, it is probably better than some of the other options out there. But the way the message was presented, flaunted on a baseball cap in the back window of a V12 german luxury car with a fridge, was a little "let them eat cake." given our current slate of global issues. Probably the wrong forum for this anyway. It is a rare car though and is worthy of a post just for the sighting.

author: fintail
text: I'd wonder about anyone who puts a baseball cap in the window of a highline V12 BMW...

author: 210delray
text: Maybe a former blue collar worker who won the lottery?

author: ateixeira
text:
Sounds like a level of speed. I stand corrected.

Saw a new Civic sedan, a Sonata, and then a RAV4 out on a test drive.

-juice

author: ghulet
text:
Just went to the Chicago Auto Show yesterday, so saw some new stuff. A few observations:

-liked the Toyota Yaris, and was quite impressed that the 3-door hatch starts at $11k with a/c (though if history is any indication, good luck finding a stripper), though the rear seat is laughable. Perfect car for someone who thinks the current Civics and Corollas are still a bit too much car to drive alone, park on city streets or schlep to the train. The sedan looks almost the size of a Corolla, but for a bit less money (and with a bit less engine--it has the 106hp unit from the Scions, which IIRC was the Echo engine). Speaking of Scions, the xA was one of my S.O.'s favorites, though it's been out two years. The Yaris is a bit more 'fresh', but with the xA, you don't have to mess with Toyota's maddening options bundling/unavailability, they come with everything for $133xx.

Surprisingly, I wasn't too impressed with the Hondas; the Civics seem too big, still hate the dash, and they're expensive ($17800 for an LX?). The Accords seemed pricey too (except for the EXV6 6-speed sedan, which I love, and seems a bargain at $28xxx); even the VP, with its black trim, cheapo wheel covers and two speakers MSRP was $197xx. I know most aren't paying MSRP, but still.

-I wasn't impressed with the new Camry, don't like the styling and the new trend toward the silvery plastic everything interior is not good, IMO. It looks smaller than the outgoing model.

author: navigator89
text:
while at Starbucks, a light blue Bentley Continental GT coupe. Since it was parked across from my car I got a good look at and in it. The interior is really lavish and the leather of the seats looks unbelievable. Ah, the perfect fusion of leather, chrome and wood.

Also saw two Avalons, in beige and dark blue, two Sonatas in silver and an S Class. Not sure if it was 350 or 500.

Finally a white Passat 2.0, my first Passat seen on the road.

author: odie6l
text:
does anybody know if the Camaro concept if floating around on the streets? I could have swore I saw one yesterday up near Hershey,Pa on my way to work. It looked like a vette that had a one night stand with a Caddy. I thought it was a vette at first until it turned into the Chevrolet of Hershey dealership and I got a better side profile look, but I could not slow down to take a real good look due to traffic behind me.

It was a Dark Cherry Red, and it looked really nice.

Odie

author: navigator89
text:
The Camaro concept as far as I know isnt on the streets. A story on Inside Line says that it wont see production until 2010. By then it would be old news. No one would want it. A new Mustang would be out then.

Maybe you were mistaken on what you saw?

author: odie6l
text:
Well what-ever the car was, it wasn't anywhere in sight when I went past last night, but there was a very large blocked off cubicle that was covered in the center of the showroom. I know GM is planning a big announcement concerning our new Penn State Children's Hospital that we will be building in the new few years (to separate the Children's Hospital and the Main Medical Center). Rumor has it GM is going to be making a monster donation ($5 million+). And don't forget GM is the Primary sponser of Hershey Food, Hersheypark, Penn State, The Medical Center, The Hershey Hotel, and The Chevrolet of Hershey is the only Dealership in the entire Hershey city limits. Plus inside Hersheypark, they always showcase new or upcomming models through-out the year.

Odie

author: fintail
text: I saw another Lucerne last night, in a nice looking silver. It suited the car well. I think styling is quickly evolving away from huge light assemblies though, so this car should get a facelift soon.

author: teds1
text: I have seen a few lucernes now and I think it could be a sleeper hit. I thought is was another underpowered poorly constructed GM luxo sedan for the baby boomer's parents down in Boca at first but I saw a few live and they look pretty decent. The interior is classy without being showy and they have a crisp shape. What impressed me most was the commercial where they said it starts at $26k. The small print said the "as shown" model was $31k with a V8. Supposedly they are "Lexus Quiet," as well. All of a sudden their market becomes very clear. Anyone buying an ES350/ avalon would really have to think about getting the larger more powerful buick (brand image aside). That pricing makes it really competetive since it is based on the $50k plus DTS. Now I hate soft quiet cars like that, so it is'nt for me but I know a lot of people with the es350 and this would really fit their needs well. Good job GM on this b/c the lacrosse isn't doing squat for Buick.

author: natenj1971
text: maybe you saw the caddy xlr?

author: imidazol97
text: I see a lot of LaCrosses around our area. I don't know why you would say it's not doing anything. A lot of them spend time in their garages here and are driven by people commuting to work.

author: ghulet
text: I saw it at the Chicago Auto Show, and have to say I wasn't impressed, at least not by the body (didn't check out the interior, unfortunately). Looks a bit too much like someone at Nissan figured the styling that suits the larger Altima and Maxima would carry over to a much smaller car. Not so, IMO, it looks awkward.

author: navigator89
text:
a beige Kia Sedona EX with a family sitting comfortably inside. The new one looks really big from the outside, about the same as the Odyssey. Styling is good too.

Also saw two refreshed Honda Accords, in silver and beige.

author: 210delray
text:
This was only my second sighting. What a sexy looking car! It's obvious why they are selling so well, considering their price.

This one was black, parked on the street in Arlington, VA.

author: fintail
text: I saw one of the new oval grilled Jag XKs today...it was less Taurus-like than I expected.

author: lemko
text: ...spotted a Lincoln Mark LT and a Hummer H-1.

author: rockylee
text:
Lemko,

What does the Mark LT look like in person ??? :confuse:
Better or Worse ?????

Rocky

author: lemko
text:
...trucks like this never appealed to me. If I want a truck, I want the most basic one I can find with heavy-duty vinyl seats, and thick rubber floor mats. I'd be using the vehicle for work.

A far as the LT's appearance, it looks better than the silly Blackwood and actually has a functional bed. However, I wouldn't dream of taking such a plush ride onto a construction site.

author: rockylee
text:
Well you should see the Rich farmers down here drive their Escalades, and EXT's to the farm :surprise:

A $50-60K farm vehicle I told my FIL don't you wish you were that rich of a farmer to do that ???? He says that's what my Vette is for. :confuse:

Must be nice to have the "luxury" to have a luxury or sports car as a work vehicle for buisness and pleasure.

Rocky

author: rockylee
text:
They are pretty darn expensive if you ask me. I'd take a Slade any day over the Mark LT. But hey the Mark Lt. seams alright.

Rocky

author: guss
text:
This is kind of cheating because it was sitting in a Ford dealers showroom with a $15K market adjustment sticker(total price $181K). I asked the salesman if I could just sit in. After a quizzical look he said he would need permission from the GM. I just told him not to bother.

I have seen picture of it in the auto magazines but did not realize how low to the ground it really is.

author: jcat707
text: I think I saw the new RAV4. It was red like the official pics I've seen here on Edmunds. I only got a chance to see it fro the side and the rear. I think it was the new model because it had the angled rear quarter windows like the Murano. Anyway, it looked okay. I do like the fact that it is available with the 3.5 liter engine but I still would not buy it.

author: natenj1971
text: Saw it on third ave. It passed the slow poke MTA bus I was on, so I sorta has an arial view - it was flint grey metallic and not as unattractive as I thought it was in the pics I had seen. The trunk is odd (like bmw bangle butt odd) but I must say it looked fun weaving in and out of traffic on the east side.

author: 210delray
text:
Hey you think like me. Why put carpeting and leather in a truck? I'd gladly take the thick rubber mats, but I think I'd rather stick with cloth seats (I can keep my jeans clean enough, and if not, I can always put a towel on the seat).

My Frontier is pretty basic, but it still has carpeting.

author: navigator89
text:
a silver Ferrari 360 Spider as it zoomed by me on the highway.

Also two new S Class, in black and white. Didnt get to see if they were S350 or S500.

author: 210delray
text: Obviously, the people of Kuwait much better off as a whole than the US population. Sightings like yours could only be matched in Beverly Hills/Bel Air, Westchester County, etc.

author: lemko
text: ...a new Cadillac DTS in an unusual silverish green.

author: 210delray
text:
Still an eye-catcher! Too bad it's not too practical, overweight, and most of all, overpriced.

Just think how many GM could have sold if it were priced like the Solstice!

author: chidoro
text:
Two mazda 5's on two different days, one white and one silver. A lot more narrow than I was expecting.

I also saw a lincoln zephyr. Looks great from most angles but awful from the back. Look s as if it would be pretty agile

author: fintail
text: I saw a new silver STS today...with a black carriage roof. Uugh

author: teds1
text:
I was in California (bay area and high sierras) last week and I had some good sightings.

2007 Escalade, not a great look but I liked it. It has a vaery differnt feel than the previouos generation

New S-Class, again not a great view but it looked better than it does in pictures.

Cheating but in the Redwood City Ferrari dealership (largest in the world I hear) They had a Black SuperAmerica with the roof flipped up. Pretty cool, and rare

Finally and best, the new M5 roared away from a light right in front of me. Awesome exhaust note!

Other than that I was shocked at the amount of huge suvs that I saw at Mammoth Lakes. I'm talking jacked up excursions everywhere, nothing smaller than a tahoe. Now this makes some sense in a town that has had over 13 feet of snow so far this year but the interesting thing was that every single person I talked to was from Southern california (L.A. and the O.c.) Are these people really that clueless? are they really driving these things around down there as well?

author: fintail
text: New black S550 this morning...I can almost deal with most of the exterior.

author: lemko
text: ...red Saturn Sky - the first one I've seen in the "wild."

author: prosa
text: I parked next to one at Target yesterday. Not a bad-looking car by any means, more tasteful than the Fusion IMO, though smaller than I would have thought. Milans and Fusions are still an uncommon sight in my area.

author: mack9
text: saw a 2004 (possibly) Impala with those ugly silver vinyl roofs like those old Buicks and Caddys used to have them and it was so dirty it was black!

author: mack9
text: I saw a Caliber on the roads on the Interstate 90 and it was travelling oh so fast and the sun was shining so it looked marvelous basking in the sun. It look so nice but I think it was a Caliber SE the base model with the black stuff on the exterior.

author: navigator89
text:
sage green Toyota Avalon, beige Hummer H3 and a silver Kia Sedona.

Also saw a beige RAV4, my first. Didnt get to check the model or which engine it had because it drove by pretty fast.

author: fintail
text: A black Bentley Flying Spur drove past my window not long ago

author: navigator89
text:
Dodge Charger SXT, my first. I was hoping to see an R/T.

Also a black Lamborghini Diablo, a white RAV4 and H3, and restyled LX470 and Accord.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw my first Caliber on the road. At first I thought it was a Malibu Maxx. I guess that's a good thing, given the lower price. It also reminds me a bit of the Vibe.

-juice

author: fintail
text: I spotted a new 760Li in my workplace garage. Big, black, and weird. One of the overpaid mucky mucks has a new ride.

author: jcat707
text: I saw a black 2007 Tahoe Z71. It wasn't too bad. It does look kind of bland though.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Surprisingly, there are a few Lincoln MarkLT trucks on the roads where I live. I've seen a couple actually.

Not really the same thing: Seems like others are itching for spring up here in N.E. This week I saw a couple of TT's, S2k's, PT vert. and this morning a 350Z roadster on the highway... Top Down! That is hardcore convertible ownership right there! :surprise:

author: gsemike
text:
I've been on a Jersey assignment so I've done numberous 130 mile round trips from Long Island to NJ in my 14 year old LeSabre. My sighting were too many to recount, but the highlights were:

Charger R/T - I've been pretty uniterested in those cars but the R/T is something in person. The rumble had me looking for the classis muscle car getting on to the highway. The exhaust note is sweet and it was driven by an 80 year old man!! Good for him!!

Civic Si - Definately sharp. Looks the role of the street fighter and looks much bigger than the last gen Civic. It's got to be as big as my old 89 Accord.

Impala - Stuck in the middle lane of the Belt. It was probably a rental car leaving JFK so I doubt that it was out of gas.

author: ateixeira
text:
Forgot to mention - saw a new red GTI in DC today, first one I've spotted on the road.

Looks OK, but the A3 is styled much better.

-juice

author: kyfdx
text:
A black one.. with a spoiler (do all the SRTs have those?)..

Pretty darn cool for four-door American iron..

author: lemko
text: ...champagne-colored Mercury Milan and a green Pontiac G6.

author: stickguy
text:
in a local shopping center (not real upscale either, I just stopped at a little hole in the wall pizza place)>

A new S class, first I saw on the road. Got stuck next to it at a light on the way out. Big, nice interior, but the styling is awkward, at best. The butt is particularly disjointed and ugly.

And 1 row over, a black Audi A8-L. Not really new (although this one seemed to be) but certain rare to see one in public.

author: british_rover
text: This morning when I came into work with an air suspension failure. :sick:

author: lemko
text: Did it look like a lowrider?

author: british_rover
text: Yeah it did one of the height sensors failed and so the car went into limp mode and was super low to the ground.

author: jcat707
text: Today on my way home, I saw a maroon Saab 9-7x. I completely forgot they were even out. It reminded me of the Acura MDX from the back, that's what I thought it was at first. I also saw a Dodge Caliber in orange.

author: imidazol97
text:
$1,000,000 Ferrari?

I spotted a news report about a weird accident involving said Ferrari.

"No one was injured when the rare Ferrari Enzo traveling 162 mph smashed into a power pole on Pacific Coast Highway. But the case continues to generate interest because the Ferrari is one of only 400 built, and detectives have struggled to understand what happened"

http://www.latimes.com/news/local/la-me-ferrari3mar03,0,1423392.story?coll=la-ho- me-headlines

author: gsemike
text:
I've seen a few new Rav 4s. I don't know why they had to stretch it. They left one marketspace where they were king and moved into another that is much more crowded. Also, the detail lines on the rear quarters are very similar to a Tribeca. Of course Subie will be trashed for it and nobody will say anything about Toyo.

Also, driving down the road, I had a new Forrester brhind me and there was a new Saturn Vue right next to it. The new grilles on both are very similar. I know that GM has a piece of Subie. I don't know the extent of the deal, but the 9-2X is proof of that. Is it conceivable that the two could be folded into one???

author: kyfdx
text:
Lotus Elise... in tangerine..

Also.. about five Acura TSXs.. Usually only see one per day, at most....

author: kyfdx
text:
GM sold their stake in Subaru... and Toyota bought about half of it...

So, no Subaru/Saturn merger is possible now...

author: gsemike
text: I didn't know that GM sold their stake. What's the stroy with the 9-2X then? Is GM just buying them from Subie or is it not long for this world?

author: kyfdx
text: This looks like the last year for them..

author: gsemike
text: Good. GM is destroying Saab with these rebadges.

author: fintail
text: A few goodies today...some kind of high end widebody new Porsche...2 Bentley Continental GTs, one in silver, the other dark grey, a W220 MB S600, and a Rolls Phantom.

author: jcat707
text: I saw a new Buick on the freeway yesterday. It wasn't a Lucerne or a LaCrosse. It looked pretty big. It had manufacturer plates on it. Is Buick planning on introducing another new car other than the Lucerne and LaCrosse?

author: imidazol97
text:
I notice you're around Detroit.

Some people have links to picts on here from spy photos and promo leak photos. Maybe there's one for Buick.

I saw the updated Park Avenue before it came out on I23 south of Flint. That might have been 94-did the updated Pa come out for 95?

It looked like an Aurora with the rear all covered with red plastic lenses. A few months later that was the Park Avenue design. The lady driving it was talking into a cell phone as she drove.

author: stickguy
text:
Saw my first VW Phaeton out in public. Nice interior, tons of room in the back seat. I don't think it looks all that big by itself, but it made my Accord look tiny parked next to it.

I saw it, of all odd places, in the parking lot of a rather dumpy Walmart. Wonder if it was an employee?

author: lemko
text: ...spotted a Cadillac DTS limo and strangest of all - a Chrysler 300 limo! I haven't seen a Chrysler limo since those weird K-based jobs from the early '80s.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
There is a 300C limosine in my area. It is part of a fleet this business has. Wanna see an even weirder one? You should see the Infinit FX45 limosine.

Heck Ernie Boch jr., a very big car dealer here in N.E. has a stretched Subaru Forester XT that he gets carted around in (This was a year ago)

author: navigator89
text:
I saw a PT Cruiser Limo back on Thursday. It was pretty small compared to the Escalade and H2 limos beside it, lol.

Today I saw a beige S Class, and my first Audi A3, in red.

And something really rare - a black T-Bird.

author: stickguy
text:
A couple of Calibers. OK, I cheated and stopped at the dealer at lunch, but at least I got to sit in it! Lights years ahead of the Neon at least.

Also 3 Charger SRT8s, all in the showroom. 44K sticker. Ouch.

author: toomanyfumes
text: Saw a new Pontiac Solstice drive by the house yesterday. It looked pretty good going down the road.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a red one on the road today. Have not seen very many yet.

gsemike wrote: "They left one marketspace where they were king and moved into another that is much more crowded"

Not really, the current model it outsold by the CR-V, Liberty, and Escape, all by a wide margin. Toyota wanted to play in the big leagues, i.e. 120k/year volume levels. I think they were doing about half as much.

-juice

author: stickguy
text: Plus, since it pretty much overlays the current Highlander, 3rd row and all, it will let the HL grow into another size class. it would be interesting to see what Toyota could do with a platform the size of the Freestyle.

author: teds1
text: This was all over the news a week and a half ago. It was an enzo ownerd and possibly driven at the time by a shady Swedish tech entrepeneur. A really funny story excapt for the tragedy of wrecking an enzo. I think a lot of them have been crashed but few if any wrecked. And yes they do change hands at over $1m now, go look at dupont registry online. Wouldn't have been a bad investment car if you could find a buyer after three years but I have a feeling if you had $650k in investment cash laying around you might find better returns elsewhere. Plus then you woudl have to part with the car emotionally

author: fintail
text:
I read something about a gun magazine being found alongside the wreck too, and the "driver" was supposedly someone other than the owner (right).

Sad story...money and stupidity followed each other.

author: fintail
text: Another Bentley Flying Spur today...the local agency seems to be doing quite well.

author: 210delray
text:
The alleged driver was a German known by the owner only as "Deiter." As you said, "right."

My son actually proposed naming his putative son Enzo. My wife and I weren't exactly thrilled.

author: ateixeira
text:
Those are asking prices, that doesn't mean people actually paid that much. Just something to keep in mind.

Saw a new Tahoe this morning. They look OK, I just have to wonder why GM didn't go with an indy rear suspension so the 3rd row could fold away, given most are purchased by families nowadays.

Saw a Civic sedan and an Impala as well.

-juice

author: british_rover
text: Too much money for a IRS suspension and GM does not have the cash to play around with. To design a good IRS suspension that will be fine for towing is very expensive.

author: ateixeira
text:
Ford did it for the last generation Expedition, so now they are more than a full generation behind in this regard.

GM won't make a comeback by holding back and making conservative updates.

-juice

author: british_rover
text: Exactly right and ford used Land Rover IRS technology to do it so most of the development cost was already paid. The double upside to it was the BMW owned Land Rover when the new Range Rover IRS design was created and Ford bought the company after the design was pretty much finished but before it went into production. Pretty good deal for them.

author: bumpy
text:
To design a good IRS suspension that will be fine for towing is very expensive.

Which is why they should have simply borrowed the Holden IRS setup, which is perfectly good for light and medium towing. Heavy-duty towing could have been met with a live-axle Suburban. Dolts.

author: british_rover
text:
Probably why they are going under.

You know about five or six years ago I was talking with a bunch of the techs that I worked with at the time and the consensus was that if any of the domestic automakers were going to go down Ford would be the one. Who would have thought that now Ford is probably doing the best of the three.

author: ateixeira
text:
Dunno, I'd argue that Chrysler is in the best position right now, given the success of the 300C. Ford is 2nd, GM has the biggest problems.

Just my opinion.

-juice

author: british_rover
text:
I think if you just count chrysler by itself then yes they are doing best but if you include the mercedes half of chrysler they are not doing well at all. Mercedes is in so so shape.

All of Fords Divisions are doing ok except for Jaguar and Jaguar is not that large at all in terms of volume.

author: lemko
text: ...gold Ford Five Hundred, white Mustang, and white Chevrolet Impala. That Impala actually looks pretty nice in white.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
I'd agree. Maybe they'll both get their just do's and grab the top spots, knocking GM back where it belongs (had it not bought the market with mega-incentives...)

Things are on the upswing, if these two continue to innovate and improve, they may just be able to hold ground against the ever increasing threat from Toyota.

BTW, speaking of Yota, the RAV4 is becoming ridiculously popular around here. I've seen dozens of them already. Can't tell the difference between the last gen and this one other than size though...

author: stickguy
text: always seems to have been the biggest "swinger" of the 3 (that is, yo yoing between boom and bust). Wouldn't surprise me if the hit the skids again once the 300C faded out, as most high style cars usually do. For them to stay healthy, they need to expand the line and keep things fresh.

author: prosa
text:
always seems to have been the biggest "swinger" of the 3 (that is, yo yoing between boom and bust). Wouldn't surprise me if the hit the skids again once the 300C faded out, as most high style cars usually do. For them to stay healthy, they need to expand the line and keep things fresh.

That may depend on how the Caliber does. It's probably too early to get any preliminary read. Also, the success of the redesigned minivans may be very important.

author: fintail
text: Saw a new S-class today, in that desert silver color.

author: guss
text:
in beige. Of course it looks a bit like a wide Trailblazer.It was parked in the Doctors/Nurses lot at the hospital.

I think I like the old style better.

author: navigator89
text:
black Bentley Arnage.

And on the other side of the price scale, a blue Honda Civic, my first one. I like the old one better.

Lol I dont know why everyone hates the new Tahoe design. It looks much sharper and better. The old one looks sooo dated, which it is. I see like 15 of them per day so to me that design is old and redundant.

author: lemko
text:
...but what happened to all the colors?

Spotted:

Silver-gray Mercury Montego
Silver-gray Ford Five Hundred
Silver-gray Dodge Magnum
Silver Dodge Charger
White Hino box truck

I feel like I'm in a black & white movie auto-wise.

author: teds1
text:
Black new Escalade... a LOT of chrome on that puppy

Maybach 62

Maserati gt spyder black

author: british_rover
text:
People are boring and only whte silver/gray/black vehicles a lot of times.

I had a Supercharged Range ROver Sport on the lot for about two months that I could have sold 4 times over if it was silver or black. But noooooooooooooo it was a nice blue and everyone was afraid of it.

author: rockylee
text:
Why would someone be afraid of a blue Range Rover Sport :confuse: It by far looks better than the Silver. However the Orange one is Sweeeetest of em all.

Rocky

author: british_rover
text:
It was carins blue which is a gorgeous color and we have sold several Non supercharged Range Rover Sports in that color. We figured it would be good to order a supercharged sport in that color too.

What we found out is that the market for the Supercharged Sport is very very conservative. The only two colors anyone wants is Silver and Black. We tryed swapping that car for Silver and Black SC Sports for people and no one wanted it. Everyone was afraid of the car even though it looked great.

We did finaly swap it out for a boring silver one because someone half way across the country wanted that particular color Supercharged Sport. We had the only one in the whole country so we were able to get a silver one in return to sell to someone who had already put a deposit down. As far as I know only a couple of Supercharged Sports have been ordered in that color.

Back on topic. I saw the first new eciplse the other day. Looked good and was also in a very slick blue color. Still won't be a real eclipse till it has AWD again.

author: merc1
text:
A carrier of brand new Mercedes S-Classes bracketed by a carriers loaded with new Camrys and Yukons. All of them headed for our dealers row here.

M

author: lemko
text:
Coolest thing I ever saw on a carrier was a bunch of new Checker taxicabs headed east on I-80 toward NYC.

Anyway I spotted a new Hyundai Sonata and Dodge Durango.

author: rockylee
text:
I spotted a couple of cattle down the road since I haven't been out of the house in 3 days

Rocky

author: gsemike
text: I stayed in a hotel in Edison NJ last night because of work. About half the parking lot were new Impalas. I guess that they must be selling a load of them to rental fleets

author: lemko
text: ...I spotted a new Impala at lunchtime today. It was sort of a purplish blue. Sorry, no little "e" sticker!

author: jcat707
text:
I see plenty of Impalas around here and 95% of the time, they are rentals. They either have the little green and white "e" sticker or a white bar code label in the rear window.

Speaking of rental cars, yesterday I saw a Jetta with Canada plates and it had Enterprise bumper sticker instead of the usual small e. Maybe it's a Canadian thing.

author: fintail
text: Yesterday I saw a chrome wheeled G6 with a barcode. They are pretty discreet.

author: imidazol97
text: Are barcodes used on lease cars?

author: gsemike
text: I saw my first Solstice yesterday. It's a sharp little car. The one that I saw was a little too red, but looked classy with the tan-ish top. I'm not crazy about the two Batman-ey humps on the trunk lid. They look useless when the top is up. I suppose that they help the appearance when the top is down.

author: gsemike
text: Today is the first truly nice day on Long Island in what feels like 5 years or so. The convertibles and bikes are really out. The one car that really stood out was a sweet black C6 Corvette with the top down. It had really sharp polished factory wheels. That car was really something.

author: ubbermotor
text: Almost missed it. It was silver, and didn't stand out as much as I thought it would. Still not sure about the look, need to see one in color.

author: natenj1971
text: I saw a red Solstice yesterday too - in Newburgh NY. The guy had the top down and looked like he was stuffed in their pretty tight - top of his head was over the top of the windshield.

author: natenj1971
text: Saw a smart car driving south on NY State Thruway between New Paltz and Newburgh exit. Maybe coming from Canada? That's the only place I've seen a smart car.

author: teds1
text: I also saw a new Solstice yesterday in NYC. I have seen them before and I agree, they look weird with the top up and very small. I am 5' 10" and it would have been a squeeze for me to fit in there with the top up. The Sky looks better and I would still take an S2000 over these cars any day. S2000s are like the forgotten sports cars, you never hear of them any more though they are still pretty competitive for the segment even though they are discontinued. The prices have held up well. I also saw an NSX, Continental GT, Arnage, Every generation of M3, and a Viper Srt-10 walking around in the village Saturday

author: lemko
text: ...my first Lincoln Zephyr outside of a car show. This one was black.

author: ateixeira
text:
Spotted this weekend.

-juice

author: navigator89
text: saw it yesterday while picking up someone at the airport. Pretty neat, leaving the arrival terminal and having the first car you see a Ferrari.

author: fintail
text: Saw a couple new Tahoes this weekend, and a Bentley GT

author: imidazol97
text: I saw a Lincoln Mark LT this evening. Had to look it up to figure out what it is. Tooooo big!

author: navigator89
text: a beige Honda Civic, my second. I dont like the redesign at all, but apparently many do because they keep selling so well.

author: ateixeira
text:
Following me to work today.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...nice yellow Cobalt coupe. Love those taillights! The Impala would look good with three Cobalt coupe taillights on each side.

author: imidazol97
text: Love the taillights. The Impala would be great with them too. They probably would have been ridiculed to death by a couple of folks for having something 'old.'

author: fintail
text: I saw not one but two Gallardos today, a yellow one and a blue one.

author: lemko
text:
...spotted two new Corvettes - one in yellow and the other a sort of bronzish color.

I saw a yellow Gallardo a few months ago near my house.

author: navigator89
text:
Rolls Royce Phantom, in white! It was coming on the other side of the road so I only caught a quick glimpse, but what a car!

Also saw a grey Range Rover Sport and a beige H3.

author: lemko
text: ...white Buick Lucerne CXS. NICE!!!

author: lemko
text: ...Buick Lucerne - a maroon one this time. Couldn't tell what series as I only saw the front end.

author: ateixeira
text:
I've seen a few of these also, and they look good. Elegant, basically. Not my cup of tea, but not a bad looking car.

-juice

author: gsemike
text: I have yet to see one on the street, but I saw that an area dealer is selling them at a $3000 markdown. This was an automatic, a/c car for $12,999. This thing is getting marked down faster than the Chevy SSR was when it came out. Maybe America doesn't want a mini-magnum?

author: ateixeira
text:
In the Caliber thread people are reporting buying them up pretty quickly, so maybe it's a regional thing. I think there is a $500 incentive already, but Dodge prices their cars with incentives built-in.

-juice

author: fintail
text: Today I saw both a Buick Terazza and a Saturn Relay. They were both from a distance, so I couldn't tell if they were private cars or not. So, they've sold 2 of them anyway! Maybe this should be in the "I wouldn't be caught dead" thread...

author: fintail
text: I saw my first Caliber today, in black. Kind of like a teeny tiny SUV in style...I suspect these will do pretty well, I think there's a market for it

author: ghulet
text: ...2007 Mercedes S-class was spotted Friday. Unfortunately, I was getting in the elevator of the parking garage at work and didn't have time to check it out. The trunk (the only angle I saw) looked vaguely Bangle-esque, though far more restrained (not so 'afterthought' looking, IMO).

author: rockylee
text:
Have you seen the Acura RDX ? Honda obviously agrees. Hell those smaller SUV's offer decent interior room, while saving the driver a few bucks at the pump. The RDX looks sporty and appears to have a good suspension that should give it sport/lux sedan driving characteristics. Unfortunatly GM doesn't have one yet. The Enclave is a little to large, and I'm not sure how big the next Envoy/Trailblazer will be. What I'd like to see is a return of a GMC Syclone/Typhoon edition. Of course a bit larger but just as kick butt.

Rocky

author: fintail
text:
That's just a concept though, right? If it becomes real, I'll see lots of em here...that demographic is huge where I live, I swear I see a million Lexus RX a day.

I saw my first new Escalade in the flesh today...certainly an improvement, but I don't care for the odd jig in the windowline near the C-pillar/end of the rear door. It's disjointed.

author: stickguy
text:
took my daughter to a BDay party at an indoor soccer place (they also have indoor lacrosse, and a baseball academy). Happened to glance around the parking lot, and at 1 time, I could see 4 Range Rovers! 1 new sport, the other 3 seemed to be current generation normal models.

2 I know who they belonged to, since they are in the family of friends of my daughter, but still odd to see that many in one place. Made my Accord seem uncommon in this lot!

author: navigator89
text:
two new RAV4s, in silver and white.

And on the highway, I saw what I believe was a 1960s Ferrari Dino on the highway. Im not very good with older cars, but I really liked the classic Ferrari lines.

author: ateixeira
text:
Driving to work today.

-juice

author: fintail
text:
I guess the RDX isn't a concept. I'll keep my eyes out.

I saw another Lucerne this morning, it really is the best looking Buick in some time. Also a Maserati sedan, which shares some cues with the Buick. A CLS55 AMG and the local guy who commutes in a DB9 is driving it again, as the weather has improved.

author: natenj1971
text: Saw a Ford GT in Midnight Blue on NY State Thruway on Sunday late morning. I was driving north and could not miss the blue bullet sans stripes speeding south.

author: lemko
text: ...a white Mercedes S550 in Newtown, PA. Nice car, but it was parallel parked between two SUVs near a bar on St. Patrick's day. The owner must have a lot of guts and bucks.

author: stickguy
text: Had my first ride in one on Saturday (passenger, not driver). It is surprisingly nice inside. If I was in the market, I would certainly check it out.

author: teds1
text: Saw one on the highway saturday... didn't really like it, it can't decide if it is a hatchback or a dakota pickup truck. Sorry Chrysler, don't change sedans to hatches. You either Subaru, don't think I haven't heard those WRX Hatch for the next generation rumors.

author: rockylee
text:
RDX, I'm not sure when "we'll" see one, but I do think it will be a awesome vehicle. I heard it was coming this fall. I'd also like to know "how much" I wished they'd slap a 6 speed manuel in it and it would be
"BA BA BA Bad, Bad to the Bone"

Rocky

author: british_rover
text:
I am of the opinion that all vehicles should be avaliable with a 6 speed manual.

But then I heel and toe downshift in my MINI for fun.

author: lemko
text: ...black CTS-V in Newtown, PA. Nice. Newtown is a good place to go to spot upscale rides. I also saw a Porsche 911 turbo and a Mercedes S550 there. The kids drive around in beater 5 and 7-Series BMWs. Probably Mom and Pops old rides. The Chevrolet dealer has more Corvettes and Tahoes than other vehicles. I spotted one lone Impala and no Cobalts or Malibus.

author: guss
text:
Saturn Relay. How long have these been out ? I am guessing a year.

Also,my first Caliber. I like it's looks alot better in the wild than I did at the auto show.

author: 210delray
text: The first one I've seen up close -- bright red with a black top, 18-inch chromed alloys. Sharp!

author: fintail
text: I saw a current/facelift Altima "SE-R" today. Are these rare? I've never noticed that trim level before.

author: kyfdx
text: ..I work near a Toyota parts distribution facility, so there are always a lot of new Toyotas with MFR tags around.. It looks a lot like the new Sonata from the rear...

author: bumpy
text: It's something Nissan whipped out a year or two ago: a V6 Altima with a slightly tigher suspension and a few more ponies out of the VQ35. It's not a real SE-R.

author: gsemike
text:
I like it, but it's probably too understated for today's market. Ironically, they run the ads touting it as the official car of funky town and the car is practically bling-less.

With is monochromatic paint, dark wheels and spoiler that's actually lower profile than the standard spoiler, it should have been positioned as a no-nonsense bruiser. The Impala SS even has more bling. Throwing in the 280 hp version of the 3.5 would have helped the no-nonsense image.

author: anythngbutgm
text: New model Camry SE in a sharp Midnight blue color, rear wing, larger wheels. subtle ground effects. Wow, I can't believe I found a Camry sexy. Nice looking car.Also a couple of new GTI's and new Passat's.

author: lemko
text: ...maroon Chevrolet Impala and maroon Lincoln Mark LT truck.

author: navigator89
text:
black Toyota RAV4, white Hyundai Azera, and two Yaris (Yarii??) in red and white.

Also a previous generation BMW M5 in dark blue. I'm still keeping my eyes peeled for the new one.....

author: stickguy
text:
on a local back road on my way to work. Not where I expected to see one!

Also saw a new local Porsche yesterday. Couldn't quite read the tag, but from the back it looked like a GT2 (?) Is that the one that is basically a hot rodded Carerra?

whatever it was, I wanted it!

author: anythngbutgm
text: New RAV 4's are ridiculously common around here. I swear every other vehicle I see is a new model. Makes the Highlander look like a rare bird!

author: navigator89
text:
that I also saw an orange Range Rover Sport. The driver just blasted across the highway lanes weaving in and out.

I see a ton of restyled Grand Marquis everyday. Probably 10 today alone. The rear spoiler makes them look pretty good.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw one of each yesterday.

-juice

author: british_rover
text:
Saturn Sky last night. It was dark so kind of hard to tell but did not look like the front end of the solstice at all.

Are the Skys out yet?

author: ateixeira
text:
Yes, I drove by a Saturn dealer today and the sign outside said "Sky is here".

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...black Mercedes R-Class and a red Chevrolet Cobalt coupe.

author: british_rover
text:
Is it just me or does the R-Class look like an oversized Scion Xa.

R-Class


Xa

author: ateixeira
text:
In some ways they are similar, I guess, but I perceive the R-class as rounded off overall, whereas the xA is boxier and with more edges. Put it this way, it's half-way between the R-class and the xB.

-juice

author: ateixeira
text:
Ate lunch out, so I saw a lot of new cars...

Malibu Maxx: new front is better, still not as nice as the original Opel.

325i

Pathfinder

2 XTerras

Uplander: that nose still looks awkward to me

Pilot: new one with the chrome grille looks like they put braces on the old one

750: face-lift is only slightly less ugly

Sonata: very common nowadays

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...spotted a black SLK350 and a silver CLK.

author: navigator89
text:
for spotting cars.

First off, I saw two Range Rover Sport parked at an upscale restaurant. One was black, the other orange.

I also saw two Grand Vitaras, both in beige. Two H3s as well both in black. And about 4-5 Hyundai Sonatas today, in beige, white, silver, grey. They sure are gaining popularity.

And as a nice finish to the day I saw a silver DB9 and a black Cayman, my first one yet.

author: prosa
text: Saw my first one just a little while ago. It was (a) bigger and (b) more attractive than I had thought.

author: british_rover
text:
Was it really orange or was it more of a red color?

Only 100 something Vesivius Orange Range Rover Sports were brought into the US so if you saw one then that is a very rare automobile.

The Rimini Red under certain lighting conditions looks like a Supercharged Vesivuius Sport sometimes.

author: stickguy
text: Mr. Nav sees all the neat stuff since he is in the middle east someplace (

author: rockylee
text:
I spotted a Black I-Roc Z-28 The hillbilly didn't take care of it either. I was very :mad: since they are becoming very rare. It was a 5.7 TPI to boot. :sick:

Rocky

author: teds1
text: I saw the new S class up very close last night. The driver was pulling out and we talked for a moment about it. He was young guy and was VERY proud of it. It's huge for starters, definitely Mayback length (57 at least) and form the rear that is what it resembles. The wheel arches don't make any sense with the form but aren't as silly looking in person. The wheels this particular one had were awesome, they reminded me of M3 wheels. The interior is very jewel like. He was backing up and the rear view camera was being shown on about a 10" screen in high def. It was a much better image than I have seen on them before. Just gorgeous inside really. I'll still take an A8 instead though and buy a WRX with what I saved.

author: lemko
text: ..black 2007 Cadillac Escalade.

author: ghulet
text:
I saw a new Mercedes S550 (not up close, it was in a parking garage and I was getting on the elevator) the other day, a new Hyundai Azzera (I liked it, but it looks dated somehow, perhaps it's too roundy--in any case, lots better than the XG it replaces, though), MANY new Hyundai Sonatas and quite a few new Lexus GS, too.

As an aside, I do find the Azzera commercials irritating, where they compare Azzera's interior room to the BMW 760i (which isn't even sold in NA), as if anyone is cross-shopping the two. Why not just compare it to its natural rivals (Avalon, the two Buick sedans, Ford 500, maybe the ES330 or TL as even a bit of a stretch)?

author: bumpy
text: a Buick Lucerne yesterday. Has that big open-mouth front end, looks like a Chrysler 300M from the side and a Jetta from the rear.

author: navigator89
text:
a silver Porsche Carrera S and an orange Toyota Yaris.

Also two Hummer H3s in yellow and black.

author: fintail
text: I saw an 07 Camry today...the sides are OK, but that sure is an ugly nose. Pig-schnozz. Toyota and styling, they just don't get along.

author: rockylee
text:
They are pretty darn neat if you ask me. I can't wait until I get a chance to see a new Slade and Denali. :shades:

Rocky

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw my first Yaris sedan out on a test drive. Doesn't look as good in person as it did in photos. It's sort of tall and pointy-nosed, not unlike the front-end of the new Camry.

Saw a new Camry, too, and I agree with fintail about that schooze. I'd seen it at a car show but this was the first out on the street.

Saw my 2nd Caliber. Showed my wife, and she didn't really like it much. Too bad the SRT-4 won't come with the AWD option.

Finally, saw one of the new Devilles. It's hard to distinguish from the old one, as the design hasn't really changed much in, oh, 18 years or so.

-juice

author: stickguy
text:
a Mazda 5 and a Caliber, both in owners hands. I have seen a few 5s, but not that often.

I have seen enough S class models now that they are old hat.

author: stickguy
text:
saw that one at the Phila car show. Yuck. I would like to see the Nissan Versa though, that looked neat up on the stand.

I just can't handle a center instrument pod, unless you want to give me a free Z8, in which case I will live with it.

author: ateixeira
text:
The Versa also gets a 6 speed manual and more conventional guages. That's the one I'd want in that segment.

-juice

author: kyfdx
text:
Two... in the last two days.. Distinctive from the front view... I really like them.. Of course, I've liked all of them..

Saw Mazda5 commercials during March Madness... first time that I've seen them advertised...

author: navigator89
text: two Nissan Tiidas (Versas) hatchbacks in bright green and blue. I really like the styling, better than the Yaris.

author: lemko
text: ...black BMW 525i, yellow Corvette convertible, and blue Corvette convertible.

author: ateixeira
text:
Is the Versa out already? I didn't think it would arrive so soon.

I have seen a new Yaris, and the Fit is supposed to come in April. Looks like these are coming all at once!

-juice

author: gsemike
text: They're all coming at once and what are the domestics countering with? The Calibur which looks downright silly. You think that they're going to miss the boat again?

author: ateixeira
text:
Caliber is a bit bigger and will probably be one price segment up from those.

I think those will compete with the Aveo, Accent, xA, smaller cars like that.

-juice

author: gsemike
text:
"I think those will compete with the Aveo, Accent, xA, smaller cars like that."

Exactly... they're missing the boat again. The only thing that the domestics will offer in the segment is the Aveo which is not going to be nearly as sporty or stylish.

author: ateixeira
text:
Maybe, but the Aveo sells well, isn't it the current segment sales leader?

Plus GM builds those for next to nothing probably, in Korea.

-juice

author: navigator89
text:
There are rumors of Dodge bringing the Hornet concept to production in 2008 and Ford might have a Fiesta ready by then.

Until then the only domestic will be the Caliber, which is a pretty strong contender.

author: ateixeira
text:
I really liked the Hornet. Maybe delete the suidice doors, but it has a lot of potential. If they built an SRT-4 version I could see it going up against the Mini Cooper S.

-juice

author: bumpy
text: Naah, the Caliber is a HHR or Toyota Matrix-sized thing. The domestics have squat on deck for the subcompact market except the rebodied Aveo sedan, which bombed its Euro crash tests.

author: ubbermotor
text: Keep in mind that the Caliber is supposed to be up market of these cars, which makes room for the possibility of the Hornet making it to production.

author: stickguy
text:
you would think that Ford could get one of their (nice I think) Euro models over here without too much trouble. Or maybe not, considering they can't get the new Focus here!

Actually, if Ford could get a nice Fiesta-ish car in the US, they could justify the C1 platform Focus replacement, since it wouldn't have to cover the real cheapo bottom end.

author: ateixeira
text:
I'm sure they'll be watching the Yaris/Fit/Versa class closely.

-juice

author: gsemike
text:
So they'll watch it very closely and then react to it when it's too late. If a car isn't in the pipeline yet, when could a competitor possible see the light of day?

The market is ready for these cars and they're giving the imports a huge head start.... AGAIN.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
With the nice weather coming around here in N.E. people are starting to drag out the convertibles and bikes. Driving home yesterday, I spotted a couple of SL500's, Boxsters, S2k's (Woohoo) and my first Saturn Sky. It was silver like the ones that have been making their way around the auto show curcuit.

Looks kinda cool, like a squashed mini XLR. Something about the huge rubber makes it look awkward, with such a pancaked body it looks like it was dropped on the chassis of a monster truck... Haven't seen any new Miata's yet and only 2 Solstice's including a really cool Forest Green one (NICE COLOR!)

author: ateixeira
text:
They haven't ever been able to make a profit in those segments, so they may not want to even try.

Interesting, C&D just came out with a timely comparo, and they liked the Fit and the Versa. Caliber was in the same comparo and scored poorly. Even though it's a lot longer, it's not nearly as space efficient and the Versa was actually a lot roomier, they said.

-juice

author: bumpy
text: I've seen three or four new Miatas around (the hood doesn't reach all the way to the headlights, kinda like the NX), but none of the GM twins. That's probably not a good sign.

author: stickguy
text:
I found the Caliber to be surprisingly roomy when i sat in it. I would have no problem with the interior size if I had one.

So, if the Versa is roomier, that is going to be an awesome package, especially since it will come with a 6 speed stick!

Might just make me sorry I bought the Accord in December instead of waiting.

Oh well, time for a stop in the CCBA forum.

author: odie6l
text:
When I'm looking at purchasing a new vehicle (like I am now) I always watch to see how many of the particular veihicle I see running around.

My current list of replacement vehicles for my '01 Escape XLT are; (not in any order)
1. '06 Scion xB
2. '06 Mazda MPV LX
3. '06 Mazda 5 Tourer
4. '06 Saturn Vue Redline
5. '06 Ford Freestyle SEL
6. '06 Pontiac SV6
7. '06 Pontiac Torrent

Out of all the cars, I very rarely see the xB's. The xB is actually high up on the list of replacements because of both price and MPG's. As for all the other they are everywhere. One other thing is if there are not that many xB's out on the road mine would standout a little bit.

Odie

author: stickguy
text: a new one. Looks better than the 5 or 7 IMO. Real sharp looking.

author: fintail
text: I wonder how long til we're relegated to this kind of stuff

author: navigator89
text:
Toyota Yaris, two of them in white and red.

Also a black RAV4.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a RAV4 this morning also.

Odie - MPV is discontinued I think. $4000 rebate right now, just hurry if you want any kind of selection.

-juice

author: british_rover
text: New Toyota FJ40 Land Cruiser or whatever they are calling that thing. It was in yellow looked pretty good.

author: navigator89
text: The MPV is indeed being discontinued to make room for the Mazda CX-9, which will be larger than the CX-7 with a third row. It will also use the 3.5L V6 from Ford.

author: ateixeira
text:
MPV is dirt cheap right now, though, if you like 'em. I always have, but keep in mind the 3rd row does not split fold, so it's a 4 seater or a 7 seater, nothing between.

-juice

author: bobw3
text: From your list, you can probably narrow it down by determining if you need seating for more than 5, since that will eliminate some of them.

author: guss
text:
Hybrid, with the funky streamlined wheels. Unfortunately it was at the body shop with a crushed front end.

Hypothetical question, where does that braking energy go if you don't use it to STOP!

author: gsemike
text:
It's got to be the worst thing to bang up your car when it's new. That's a sure when to take off the newness and never get it back.

When I take my train in from Long Island to NYC, we pass by many body shops and I've noted the following cars sitting in the lots in various states of disrepair:
05/6 Altima (3/4 nose)
06 Vette (complete nose)
06 Accord (rear clip)
06 DTS (complete nose - probably totaled)
06 Passat (t boned)

author: lemko
text: ...two Cobalt coupes - one blue, the other red. Also spotted new Honda Civic in a bronzish color. This is the first one I've seen since last fall. I guess they're not selling too well around here. Did anybody catch the new "South Park" about the hybrid cars?

author: stickguy
text: it goes out as heat. Ever see how hot the rotors can get if you have to ride the brakes down a long steep hill? Also the reason you get brake "fade"

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a black one on Canal Road today. Looks better in dark colors, the grille stands out less.

The 07 will get black inserts (instead of chrome) so it should look even better in black.

You've gotta be crazy to pick a black car, though, they look dirty 5 seconds after you wash them.

-juice

author: fintail
text: I saw another pig-snout Camry this morning. I'm not liking this thing, it seems such base design. Which means it will probably be a hit.

author: navigator89
text:
3 Grand Vitaras, two silvers and one beige. 2 Mercedes S Class, in white and maroon. Also a blue Passat, black Range Rover Sport, black Bentley Continental GT with the optional factory chrome wheels.

Also four H3s, in black, yellow and beige. The fourth one was also yellow, but the entire body was, including the bumpers while the other had black bumpers. The all yellow H3 reminded me of a school bus!

Best of all, I saw a golden yellow Toyota Supra tuner with full body kit, huge rear wing, hood scoop. Make it orange and it would look like the one Paul Walker had in Fast and the Furious.

author: british_rover
text:
Look up the defnition of No Soul in the dictionary and you see toyota.

Great cars from a technical stand point but just beyond boring. Even Hondas, well Acuras really, have more soul then Toyotas.

author: fintail
text: I think I'd take the Accord anyway, and certainly something like a TSX over a Camry.

author: ateixeira
text:
Out today for lunch, spotted:

2 Uplanders (fleet, though)
Jetta
Ridgeline
R class
Outback Sport
SLK350
A6

-juice

author: chiny
text: one day last year, i saw an SLR mclaren, bentley arnage, london cab.All this in canada

author: gsemike
text: I am seeing a number of Grand Vitaras around. They look good for what they are. Weird thing is, I have no idea where the Suzuki dealer may be by me and I can name every other manufacturer's local dealer off the top of my head.

author: odie6l
text:
I was told by the local Mazda / Toyota / Scion dealer that I am able to order a MPV up until May 20th. After that they are in a holding pattern to find out if they will be allocated any orders between May 20th and May 31st (End of run).

I saw the New Toyota FJ at the dealer today (Silver with Black Roof) and it looked awesome. And the new CX-9 will start at $35k, the CX-7 is starting about $29k.

Odie

author: ateixeira
text:
Actually the CX7 starts in the $24k range, but that's FWD. AWD starts around $27k IIRC.

Most will end up close too $30k optioned up.

-juice

author: prosa
text:
When I take my train in from Long Island to NYC, we pass by many body shops and I've noted the following cars sitting in the lots in various states of disrepair:
05/6 Altima (3/4 nose)
06 Vette (complete nose)
06 Accord (rear clip)
06 DTS (complete nose - probably totaled)
06 Passat (t boned)

Where are these lots? I take the Ronkonkoma line into work, maybe I can see some of them.

author: gsemike
text: Prosa, I'm on the Babylon line so we take a slow ride up Sunrise Hwy. Did you ever notice that one shop just East of Jamaica that has a Model T type car sitting on the roof? That's pretty weird.

author: prosa
text: You're right, you can see many auto-related businesses from the Babylon line - including, as far as I can tell, dealerships for just about every car brand except the real super-exotics.

author: navigator89
text: two Hummer H3s, in red and black, as well as a dark blue Lexus GS300 and a grey Suzuki Grand Vitara.

author: jcat707
text: I saw a new 07 Camry. It was black and looked alot better in person than it has in pictures.

text:
LOL

Rocky

author: teds1
text: I have a few sightings to catch the forum up on as I was in California last week (always good spotting out there). I saw an fj cruiser which I love (I'm kind of obsessed with the original FJs), drove behind a Ferrari 456 for a long time on a highway, lots of new S550s, Slk55, Lambo Gallardo (in NJ of all places), a countach (in a very modest condo building's parking lot covered up... weird priorities out there) some solstices, new 911 4, elise, etc... They have a large Lambo dealership in downtown San Fran which doesn't count but was cool. Also a classic car club with quite a cool inventory on display.

author: fintail
text:
I saw an Azera today. I really don't like that rear quarter window.

I saw another pig-snout Camry too.

author: ateixeira
text:
LOL at the typo in my title. They can get up there in price.

author: natenj1971
text: Saw a black on black G6 Coupe on 57th and 2nd this morning. Thought it was much better looking in person.

author: solarflame331
text: Spotted an Infiniti FX SUV today. The tires were huge. SUV's sure aren't what they used to be.

author: ateixeira
text:
20" rims I believe.

-juice

author: 210delray
text:
Hey, are you ragging on my favorite car (Camry)?

But I agree, the front end is a loser in my book; I much prefer the '04 and '05s that I have now.

Someone in the Camry boards called the oversize emblem a "hanging globulus."

author: 210delray
text: ...my first FJ Cruiser over the weekend in that cool blue color with a white roof. This is going to be another home run for Toyota.

author: navigator89
text:
Just got a new 2006 Camry V6 yesterday, and while it doesn't have the interior or power of the 2007 version, the styling really is great, very sleek and aerodrynamic.

The new car, I don't know....just doesn't looks good to me.

author: lemko
text: ...white Hummer H2 Recovery Vehicle. That's what the nameplate on back read.

author: navigator89
text:
two Range Rover Sport in black. Also saw a refreshed 2006 Rang Rover in sage green. The front looks better.

Also saw a white Jaguar S Type R, " Superbly Mediocre Car" according to Editor Karl. I thought it looked pretty good.

author: ateixeira
text:
More than spotted, I actually test drove one. Wife had a $50 offer from AMEX if I did a test drive, so that motivated me to go in.

Yawn. Kinda dull to be honest. Drove a 4 cyl automatic Premier model, loaded up minus a moonroof. Interior is nice enough, a little inconsistent, with some good and some cheap plastics, leather that doesn't match the vinyl around it, and mixed textures.

Engine noise and road noise were a bit high for the class.

But overall, no strong impression either way. Not memorable and certainly not compelling enough to make me want to own one.

-juice

author: gsemike
text: I've seen a couple. When I look close, I'm put off by the center stack which seems too upright. I think that the Fusion is nicer looing. The Zephyr is just a mess.

author: british_rover
text: Hyundai Azerea things yesterday. It was white with a tan interior so very blah but the inside looked nice. I would like to sit down in one to see how comfortable the seats are the leather at least looked nice and soft.

author: gsemike
text:
Two cars when I went out tonight:

Lincoln Zephyr - I'm surprised by how many of these that I see. I've seen about a dozen of them to only 3 or 4 Lucernes. If I was 70, I would definately go for the Lucerne. I just don't think that the Zephyr looks like a premium car at all. So, the Zephyr I saw tonight had a carriage top on it!! Way to go after the younger buyer FoMoCo.

Bentley Flying Spur - Now that looks like a premium car. It is smooth and classy. The one thing that I noticed, is that the taillights look kind of dim when they're on. If I was driving a 6 figure ride, I'd want those things to be incredibly bright.

author: fintail
text:
I saw a new Mercedes GL SUV today. It's an order in size larger than the ML for sure...should be successful in these parts anyway.

Will the carriage top ever die?

author: rockylee
text:
Will the carriage top ever die?

Great Question ?

Rocky

author: fintail
text: I thought the people who thought that to be cool/in good taste had died off by now. There hasn't been a car made in about 20 years that has looked even remotely correct with a padded vinyl top. Everything since is some kind of weird joke.

author: rockylee
text:
Cadillac tried to bring a few back last year. One of ya'll posted it on Edmunds and nobody wanted it (STS)

Rocky

author: navigator89
text:
two Range Rover Sports, in white and silver. Two Dodge Charger SXTs as well in black and blue.

Also a grey Hummer H3, white Hyundai Sonata, and a blue-green Toyota RAV4.

author: solarflame331
text:
I spotted a Dodge Sprinter, the tall van, and a Cadillac STS. I know the STS has been out for a little while, but this is the first time I have seen one. The tail lights are very distinctive.
The Dodge Sprinter certainly does stand out. There is nothing else like it.

author: rockylee
text:
The STS is very stylish. I saw a black STS a few weeks ago and wished I was the driver. :shades:

Rocky

author: fintail
text: Spotted a FJ Cruiser today...a little weird, but I think it will do well enough

author: rockylee
text:
I saw a yellow one the other day and it looked very different. It looked like a H3 that had a run in with a car compactor. :surprise:

Rocky

author: kyfdx
text: I saw the full carriage roof on a Chrysler 300 yesterday.. It made the purple Prelude in the next space look positively tasteful..

author: navigator89
text: a peacock blue Nissan Tiida (Versa) and a black Dodge Charger. I'm pretty sure it was the SRT8, as I think I saw that badge. It blazed down the highway too fast to tell.

text: I saw two Charger "Daytona" models yesterday

author: lemko
text: ...in downtown Philly - orange Dodge Charger with bold black HEMI graphics.

author: ghulet
text: The other day on I-94 in Chicago, I saw what I thought at first was a new Toyota Yaris or something, turned out to be a Mercedes-Benz B200, with Ontario plates. It's a mini (probably a bit smaller than a Mazda 3) five-door hatchback. Wonder what it costs, or what it would cost were it sold in the U.S., what with the three-pointed star and all.

author: ateixeira
text:
I don't think Mercedes could sell it here for much less than $25k. If they could, it would probably already be here.

-juice

author: lemko
text:
...but one for the "who do they think they're fooling" file.

I was coming home from downtown Philly a stopped at a light next to a lady in a type of Lexus I've never seen before. It kind of looked like an ES300, but something wasn't right about it. As I pulled away from the stoplight, I saw the front of the car and it turned out to be a 1992-era Camry with Lexus "L" badges and nameplates on it in place of the Toyota crossed ovals "T" and nameplates. Nice try, sister!

author: rockylee
text:
LOL

Rocky

author: fintail
text:
There are a few other-market MB I'd like to see brought to the US, but I dunno about that B-class. I went to the MB Canada site, specced one out to the highest level of trim, and it was 57K CDN! Not far from an E-class, for heavens sake. It's a neat enough looking little package, but that's just insane pricing. I am sure it can be cheaper, but

Not as bad as the fake Lexus, but a couple weeks ago I got behind a ca. 1995 Camry coupe...and instead of Camry it said "626". I don't see the point.

author: ghulet
text:
Yesterday (high at Midway was 55F, but as bright and sunny as any Summer's day; I was near the lake so it was actually cooler), I saw TWO topless Lotus Elises, in red and yellow. Saw lots of people in shorts, with convertible tops down, one guy walking around shirtless, too (not necessarily one you'd want to see that way, either, naturally). The first signs of nice weather in Chicago always brings out an amusing amount of undress overkill the first few weeks of Spring. I swear you woulda thought we were sitting at a cafe on Miami's A1A in June. But I digress.

I've also seen I think two FJ Cruisers. They're pretty darn big, and at $23-something (I think that's base, and offer surprisingly few options), they seem to be a pretty good value, especially for a Toyota.

Alas, I clicked on Toyota's website, and it appears that the '07 Camry with manual transmission isn't even offered in the Chicago region. Shocking, I know.

author: british_rover
text: If I had an Elise I would drive it every day of the year that was not raining and/or snowing.

author: kyfdx
text: I had the top down today... 64 F

author: bumpy
text: Cobalt SS and 2007 Tahoe yesterday. The giant wing actually improves the looks of the Cobalt, but the Tahoe just looks bloated. Think Fat Elvis.

author: fintail
text: I've seen a few of them in white now, and I will agree with the "Fat Elvis" idea...not the best color for the vehicle

author: anythngbutgm
text: Pulled up next to a Blue Lotus Elise at the stoplight last evening. Cute Brunette driving kept my attention away fromthe car though. :surprise:

author: teds1
text:
So I saw the new Camry and I kind of think it's hideous. Not like Tribeca Hideous, but the nose is terrible. First off, I don't know if it's the Euro pedestrian safety regulations or what but the whole front end looks too high to me. It should slope downwards more. To have that Totoya symbol crowning that high front end like a rhino horn is not a good look. They need to make some aftermarket grills for that thing STAT.

Also I have seen a bunch of new S550s now and while they are not as bad as they seemed in pictures, the headlights don't really match the body curves and the trunk is bangled something awful. It's looks worst in light colors like white or silver. Interior is beyond gorgeous though.

Saw an H1 wagon in a magenta purple in midtown today parked. pretty bizzare to think they were fashionable at one point. I think Coolio had one

author: fintail
text:
ROFL at the Coolio car. I saw a H1 yesterday too, it was the 4 door pickup version, in kind of a candy apple red. There are many fakes out there now though, so I don't know if it was even real.

Over the weekend I saw a H2 pulling a boat! I've never seen one of those ridiculous things towing anything before.

author: ubbermotor
text: They had just started replace our vehicles (All Jeeps, Gamma-Goats, and Mules, and some of the pickups and SUV's) with HUMMV's the last year I was in the army. The thing was insanely wide, keeping it from going alot of places the Jeeps could go, but they told us it was impossible to roll (The man don't know Joe). It was the trick suspension the made them killer off road, but the only thing that the H2 and H3 carried over was the look. In my mind they should be th P2 and P3 (Poser).

author: i_luv_toyota
text:
Saw a couple new Tahoes the past week. Personally I think it looks like a rolling block, as opposed to the popular "bloated" opinion on these forums. I think the last generation Tahoe looked more bloated than this new one does.

I also saw a 2006 Civic full on from the front for the first time (it was sitting at a stop light going in the opposite direction as me) today. Looked like it had a fat lip worse than the Scion xB does. Also with a front plate it looked like it had buck teeth.

author: british_rover
text:
We got a H2 stuck on our test track behind the dealership. We had a big yellow one that we took in trade so we were going to drive it onto the boulders behind the test track. Thought it would make a good billboard.

Well our F&I guy drove it into the 24 inch deep by 42 inch wide ditch that is the entrance to our test track. As the front drivers side tire started to come up the other side of the ditch the frame was tweaked so badly that the driveline bound up. The truck could not move forward our backward and the body was pinching all of the doors shut. He had to call on his cellphone for help.

After a few of the techs sat on the opposite side of the hood and stood on the back bumper they were able to take enough of the stress off the driveline that he could back out.

We don't let any other vehicles but Land Rovers on the test track now.

On topic:

Had a 2005 Mercedes SL600 come into the dealership today. Owner was looking at our supercharged Range Rover Sport.

author: 210delray
text: I know from a Toyota insider that the Camry hoodline was in fact raised because of the pedestrian regulations. He agreed with me that the older design looked better.

author: british_rover
text: Yaris or whatever that new tiny Toyota is. Not sure if I liked it will have to wait till I see one up close.

author: kyfdx
text:
New Yaris sedan... They should have made the 4-door a hatchback...

Also, right behind it.... a new '07 Camry.. The XLE model... I kind of like it.. Not as boring as before..

author: gsemike
text:
I've started seeing a number of new Lexus IS250s and 350s. What is the big deal? If you put a split grill on it, it would look pretty Potiac-ey. The side windows are right off of a grand prix.

I've seen my first couple of Camrys. It's pretty sharp... not headturning but nice looking. Definately not nearly as bland as the last.

author: british_rover
text: I agree I do not like the new IS's at all. The IS 300 was a good looking car and I liked the 3.0 I6 over he four cylinder or V6 they offer now.

author: 210delray
text: What 4-cylinder? In the good ol' USA, you get a V6 or V8!

author: merc1
text:
A co-worker just got one of these new Camrys and I have to say it looks so much better than the previous model. It's actually very sleek and what not. I wish Toyota didn't feel the need to saddle the SE model with that somewhat generic looking body kit, but the biggest fly in the buttermilk is that snout, specifically that emblem. Yuck. You'd think that with such a good looking design overall (for a Toyota) they would have been able to intergrate Toyota's symbol (whatever it is) better than that. Really messes up the front end big time to me. Still though there has never been a better looking Camry. We'll see how it looks after the first 500K units hit the road.

M

author: british_rover
text:
Actually the orginal Turbo 4 cylinder offered in the Altezza, what the IS300 was called in the Japan, was superior to any of the engines offered in the US.

That motor had more power then the IS300, more power then the IS250 and about the same power as the IS350. The real advantage was that the engine was very small, light and pushed far back against the firewall for improved weight distribution. I think the Altezza had a nearly 50/50 weight balance.

author: anythngbutgm
text: But I passed a DB7 on the way to work this morning. Back roads, line of cars probably moving about 40-45 mph, I was heading the other way doing probably the same (Or just a wee bit more ) The exhaust drone literally shook my car, but it was oh so beautiful and the rumbling note was music to my ears...

author: ateixeira
text:
That is a big snooze, just saw another one. Pedestrian friendly, at least, I'd hope.

-juice

text:
Maybe a Long Horn for the Texas market?

-juice

author: lemko
text:
Camry's New Slogan:

Pedestrian and pedestrian friendly.

author: 210delray
text: I didn't notice it until it passed me, so I got only a rear 3/4 view. Big and boxy, nothing stood out from that angle.

author: jefferyg
text: Actually saw it yesterday. Nice-looking crossover - better looks than I had expected. It's easy to identify as a Dodge with the big crossbar grille. It looks fun, not really an overgrown car and yet not a truck either. If I was in the market for something smaller I think I'd have to at least give it a closer look.

author: stickguy
text:
A couple of Calibers. Seem to be selling OK.

A new Tahoe. OK, but nothing exciting

A Caddy CTS-V in my parking lot at work. Nice to see a stick shift caddy.
