text: I don't think the Caliber is really being marketed as a crossover though. I mean they are not even offering it with AWD yet.

author: rockylee
text:
I saw a black Pontiac Soltice on my commute from work a couple of days ago. They are very cool. :shades:

Rocky

author: kyfdx
text: Pretty cool!

author: lemko
text: ...blue Honda Civic. Third one I've seen since September. They must be catching on.

author: teds1
text: It was the first truly nice day in NY on Saturday and I saw many people taking advantage of the weather with their rides. On the Long Island Expessway I saw, 1980s vintage M3 and M6 both in showroom condition, Ferrari 575, Austin Healey 3000, a Viper Club (at least 5 in a line) an NSX, and a Solstice (top up for some reason). I am hitting up the auto show tommorow, can't wait. The trick is to go midweek. The opening weekend crowds are ridiculous and you can't get near a car let alone sit in one unless it's something no one cares about like that Saab truck or a cobalt.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw every new car out there, basically.

-juice

author: gregisgod13
text: ya i saw a new 2008 bmw 3 series coupe online. it seems awsome. it even has a hardtop convertable. does anybody know when it will be coming out in dealerships in the unites states. and price to would be kool.

author: ubbermotor
text: Black, causing a lot of rubbernecking. Didn't think they were delivering them yet. Look much cooler in person.

author: rockylee
text:
WOW, Loren (miata1) saw one in a dealership. So they do look good, eh ?

I'm glad you like em' I can't wait to see one. Dad said he really likes em' too. :blush:

Way to go GM !!!!!! :shades:

Rocky

author: gsemike
text:
I went out of my way to see it at the auto show. It's definately handsome and more masculine than that Solstice. It looks like it costs more than 25k inside and out.

But.... at 5'7", I couldn't stretch out in the passenger seat with the seat all the way back and with the top down, there is practically no storage space. These are fatal flaws. What good is a roadster when I can't throw a bag in the trunk, drop the top and take a 4 or 5 hour trip upstate?

author: teds1
text:
I also went to the NY Auto show yesterday for about 4 hours (My friends were annoyed but it's my Mecca).
Some Thoughts and Finds
-The AM Vantage V8 is actually that amazing looking up close, even in white like the demo they had. It is just perfect design, Equvalent to the 911 in it's classic shape. They will be collecting them in 50-75 years for sure.
-The Sky is much better looking than the solstice but I have to agree with the above threads, both cars are too small. I am 5' 9" and my legs were cramped in the footwells and I couldn't move the seat back to a comfortable position. there is no way I would buy a roadster this small unless it was made by Lotus. On a side note the funniest point in the evening was when I had a 6' 8" friend (not a typo) try and sit in an S2000. It wasn't even close.
-The BMW Z4 Coupe looks fantastic in person... it has just jumped up many notches on my "I want it list."
-The New AMGs with the 6.3 liter motors almost look like overkill now, these aren't Q ships anymore as they are clearly the biggest flashiest most badged up Benzes out there. Also some are going to say this is sacrilege but the SLR looks dated for some reason.
-Caymans look great in Black, ok in silver, terrible in red
-The Bentley GTC is much ado about an obvious idea
-The New G35 is lovely and the old ones are still some of my favorite cars to sit in. I am legitimately looking at the coupe.
-Perhaps the most fun car at the show and my favorite t play around in was the FJ Cruiser. I am not an suv off roader type at all but this toyish Tonka truck that looks like a hotrodded classic FJ has captured my heart. For only $22k nicely equipt you will want one too. It is too much fun.
-The Lucerne is very nice inside and a bargain compared to the lexus competition. Low power and bad fuel milage from that crappy GM V8 though.
-Saab is not going to be around so long I think
-The new CX9 Mazda van thing looks great, so does the Buick concept van thing. It is very lux and will probably sell well.
-The TT is kind of chunky, not as svelte as pictures
-The Mazdaspeed 6 is less impressive than I expected, less good looking even than the regular 6s. Kind of a let down.
-The GTI (My Fast hates plaid seats) is pretty cool up close. I like the wheels but I have too many bad VW quality horror stories to ever go down that route again.
- Ferrari made poor choices in it's display cars, an odd two toned Scaglietti, a decaled up 430 CS with limited appeal, and a nice grey 430 spyder which they hid begind a podium. I guess they don't have to care too much but still they could have done a better presentation.
-Those Dodge Chrysler muscle car hemi variations have really crappy build quality, Panel gaps, loose seals were evident. Not impressive
-The aspen is about 7 years too late
-Only Russian Mobsters are still admiring the H2
-The new Navigator grill is obscene... you will see what I mean when they hit the streets...

Sorry about the long post but it was too much fun. Go to the show if you can and play around in those FJs, I like the Yellow one.

author: ateixeira
text:
Aston Martin has easily the best looking lineup of cars in the industry, bar none. People would just stand there and stare, mouth agape.

Sky Redline looked good. But I dunno, I kind of like the idea of a $20k toy more than a high 20s sports car.

Z4 coupe I did not like, but I was with Bob H. and he loved it.

G35 looked better. A lot like the old model, but evolutionay improvements. We both liked it, minus the chrome spoiler on the back.

FJ is hot and trendy, and both models on the floor were PACKED with people (compared to a ghost-town surrounding the Acura MDX). But...ergonomics are awful. The seat belt is anchored in the door, so to let someone out of the back seat you have to take your seatbelt off, which is absurd.

Funny thing is the Element is the same way, but the concept Honda showed had the seat belt integrated into the seats, like in the Chrysler Sebring and some GM pickups. Much better execution.

FJ also has horrible blind spots, and wasn't as easy to climb in as the Element.

I liked the CX9 as much as you did, but the CX7 seemed a lot smaller than I expected so that disappointed me.

GTI plaid looks awful. Agreed.

I also agree about the Ferrari stand, weakest I've ever seen from them. No brochures at all, either.

H2 was crowded when I was there. Must still be a lot of mobsters in NY.

Navigator and Escalade both have cartoonishly large grilles. I'd go with the GMC version for that reason alone, or even a Tahoe. But GM was dumb not to put magic 3rd row seats in there.

I liked the Fit too. Space is incredible. Reminds me of the xB a little, but with less rear leg room and more cargo room.

-juice

author: gsemike
text: The Fit is impressive. It uses space very well. It could definatley be good for a small family and will get 35 mpg doing it.

author: navigator89
text:
a white Range Rover Sport, light blue Bentley Continental GT. Also spotted 2 Chargers, in red and grey. Both were V6 models.

Wish I could visit the NY Auto Show. The Kuwait Auto Show wont come back here until 2007!! :mad:

author: lemko
text: Saw a typical trophy wife driving a new taxi yellow Hummer H3. Guess hubby must be an oil exec.

author: fintail
text: Not a brand new car, but today I spotted a black Bentley Azure cruising on I90, top down

author: rockylee
text:
LMAO :P

Rocky

author: natenj1971
text:
Saw two new GTI's one after the other in New Paltz NY, one gray, one red.
Saw a beige Lucerne (rear end damage) back in NJ.

author: gsemike
text:
Nate,

R U a student there? It's always nice to meet a fellow hawk.

author: natenj1971
text:
I grew up in New Paltz. My parents still live there. I was driving them home from Newark airport when I saw the GTi pair.
Could Main St be more crowded???
I've only seen a couple new GTi's down in NJ and days apart.

author: gsemike
text: I graduated in 91. It's unbelievable how much the town has changed since then. It used to be a ghost town on weekends but now it like Times Square. I think it's been good for the town because there are nice shops and restaurants, but it's a different vibe.

author: lemko
text: Last time I was there was 1977! Anyway, I spotted three new cars at lunchtime: gray Dodge Charger with the 3.5 V-6, a blue Mustang convertible, and a gray Cadillac CTS.

author: natenj1971
text: I just saw a red new camry SE on 57th and third and for an instant through it was a BMW. It was a passenger side view. Not so crazy about that spoiler package but it does make the car look meaner.

author: lemko
text: ...black Pontiac GTO. If GM's now selling these at fire sale prices, I'll take one!

author: lemko
text: ...black Ford 500 at lunchtime. One thing I'd change about it is to give it a Fusion-like grille. I don't care much for that black mesh look.

author: british_rover
text:
Dark blue Bentley Continental GT with camel colored interior.

Drops of a very nice looking woman who says she is picking up her Freelander.

That just blows my mind.

author: fintail
text: Yeah I'd think someone with the taste of a Continental would choose better than a Freelander lol

author: british_rover
text:
Yeah the woman that dropped off was considerably younger then the male driver makes me wonder.

Daughter maybe mistress possibly.

author: bumpy
text: The 500 gets the Fusion grill for either 2007 or 8, whenever they throw the 3.5 in there.

author: odie6l
text:
Local Honda dealer got 5 2007 Honda Fit's on the lot today. One of each color except black and white ones. Kinda neat but I will still look at the Mazda5.

Odie

author: bigo08
text: A Rolls Royce Phantom, at the mall

author: rockylee
text:
a new Lincoln mark LT. It was Silver, and wasn't a bad looking F-150

Rocky

author: ghulet
text: I saw my first Yaris 'on the street' last night, a nice-looking silver or silver-blue sedan.

author: navigator89
text: Spotted a black Hyundai Azera and a light blue Hyundai Sonata yesterday.

author: ateixeira
text:
Spotted a couple of these this weekend. I haven't seen as many around as I thought. I wonder if they have enough supply already.

Daughter maybe mistress possibly



Isn't that why memory seats have 3 buttons?

-juice

author: fintail
text: I saw a new SL55 today, in that subdued yet eyecatching red you rarely see these cars wearing. Tasty.

author: navigator89
text: a great looking grey-black Aston Martin DB9 and a Range Rover Sport.

author: guss
text:
yesterday in blue. It was a the 2 door and it looked tiny.

I have been seeing alot of Civics around. I have come to the conclusion that I love the 2 door and hate the 4 door. Somehow the roof line just looks weird to me on the 4.

author: bumpy
text: Mazda5 this morning. Nice throwback to the days when "mini" vans weren't the bloated battletanks they are now.

author: gsemike
text: I saw a Toyota Prius being driven very agressively. The way this girl was weaving in and out, you'd think that she was drag racing but then again, who possibly would drag race against a Prius.

author: carguy58
text:
talking about on this board...The new Camry..its definately way more interesting than the last one on the styling but its still not a looker. It does go with Toyota's core buying audience though: pleasent to look at but conservative looking. About the grille it does look like there is something wrong with it but its still not hideous.

06 Honda Civic: the coupe looks cool...alot better than the last generation Civic Coupe but the Sedan is still a yawner.

author: 210delray
text:
Nice throwback to the days when "mini" vans weren't the bloated battletanks they are now.

LOL! Yeah, they're pushing 4500 lbs. now, more than the biggest Chevy, Ford, and Plymouth sedans back in the 70s! The few surviving first-gen Chrysler minivans definitely look small now!

author: prosa
text:
LOL! Yeah, they're pushing 4500 lbs. now, more than the biggest Chevy, Ford, and Plymouth sedans back in the 70s! The few surviving first-gen Chrysler minivans definitely look small now!

I recently saw a 1997 Odyssey parked right behind a 2006 Odyssey. The size difference between the two was amazing.

author: rockylee
text:
It was Pearl Red, but was at a decent distance

Rocky

author: teds1
text:
I saw a Dark grey one yesterday. It looks sooooo good from behind (the rear 3/4 angle) but only so so front and side. Still I'd love to drive one.

Also another 50,000 S550s. Midtown Manhattan has officially discovered them.

Couple of blinged out M45/35xs as well, seems the DUB magazine set has figured out they are a good deal and you can still afford some 24" deep rim spreewells to go along.

author: ateixeira
text:
Two of each today, while out at lunch.

-juice

author: navigator89
text: a black Mercedes S350 and a white S500. Also a brown Ford Explorer, my first, and a silver Mercedes ML Class.

author: british_rover
text:
The first Black S550 before I had only seen silver and white.

If previous history is a guide we should be taking one in trade for a Range Rover within 6 months.

I also saw the first black Sky. I had previously seen only white.

author: rockylee
text:
WOW, you live around a buncha rich folks of their in Washington. They must be illegal canadian alien border hoppers. :blush:

Rocky

author: fintail
text:
I saw a new GTI today, of course in white. It's one of the very few cars that seems to be able to pull off white.

Also a Honda Fit in my workplace parking garage, along with a new SLK.

And to top it off, a black Lambo Gallardo, a Maserati sedan in dark blue, and a Maserati coupe in kind of a burgundy.

author: fintail
text: There's probably too much money here for a lot of these people's own good...but I think a bigger part of it is people living above their means, and people cashing in on home equity. Real estate here is insane.

author: gsemike
text: I am seeing so many of these. I can't figure it out. The LS was left to die on the vine and now it's smaller, front drive replacement is a big hit??? It's just a dressed up Mazda 6 and doesn't look any classier than the Mercury version. Just why is this car selling????????

author: guss
text:
It's just a dressed up Mazda 6

I think you answered your own question. If Buick dressed up an Accord they would sell alot of them also.

author: odie6l
text:
"I think you answered your own question. If Buick dressed up an Accord they would sell alot of them also."
But there is the problem.. GM doesn't own the Honda Accord unlike Ford owns the Mazda6.

Odie
Odie's Garage

author: guss
text:
Ford owns the Mazda6

Well, technically no, just a controlling interest(less than 50%).

The Accord was only hypothetical.Maybe a dressed up Legacy ,back when GM owned more of a stake in Subaru would have been a better example.

author: gsemike
text:
The Mazda6 isn't exactly an Accord. I actually test drive a 6 a couple of times and ended up buying an Altima.

Mazda has made nice in-roads but still have a ways to go in terms on perceived reliability, performance and gas mileage before their held in the same regard as Honda. How much zoom zoom are you getting when the V6 only gives you 220 hp?

author: navigator89
text:
a red Mercedes SL55 AMG, and a red Dodge Ram SRT-10 being very aggressively. The driver was tailgating and weaving in and out of traffic.

Also saw a silver Hyundai Sonata and a beige Lexus GS300.

author: lemko
text: ...silver Mercury Milan

author: fintail
text: Spotted today - pig-snout Camry, Bentley Flying Spur, Aston DB9, and although it isn't new, a white Lambo Diablo

author: teds1
text:
Three SL 55s last night in NOHO one bright red with Red rims... Ummmmm... yeah... Not that I would kick it out of bed for eating crackers but Mercedes really shouldn't sell red cars, it just doesn't fit.

A couple of New Rav 4s pretty bland if you ask me. I barely noticed them.

Ram SRT 10 King cab in midtown. Worst fuel economy of any vehicle sold in the states apparently (worse than H1). I'm sure it would be a blast to drive, but they are a bit much given the climbing Fuel costs.

author: fintail
text: Red wheels on a SL55? Money doesn't buy taste...

author: lemko
text:
...black Cadillac DTS
...white Chrysler Crossfire
...red Chrysler Sebring convertible

author: ateixeira
text:
A new RAV4 in my parking garage, and a Camry yesterday.

Toyota's position reminds me of Ford about a decade ago, remember when they had 5 of the top 10 sellers in the country?

But...when you're on top like that, there's nowhere to go but down. I wonder how long Toyota's roll will last.

-juice

author: anythngbutgm
text:
RAV 4 sales are ridiculous. Sales were up 128% or something last month :surprise: At 29 mpg HW for a 268hp V6, there is nothing currently on the market that can match it. Combined with HSD for the Camry and a slick new Avalon, Toyota's run should go for a while.

Now guys, how about something a bit sporting? That doesn't cost 40 grand and come slushbox only (IS350)? :mad: Not like you don't have the money to do so...

author: ateixeira
text:
They sure did up the ante...

Remember, though, Ford did the same thing with the Explorer. The Blazer only had 2 doors at the time, and the Cherokee was too small. Chevy added a 4 door model but it was a band-aid, so Explorer basically owned the hottest segment for quite a while.

They got complacent, though.

-juice

author: natenj1971
text: Around 9:30 this morning on Rt 17 North in NNJ I passed a black G6 convertible (with the top down) pulling out of a gas station. Nice looking automobile. Too bad side air bags aren't standard and you can't get the 5 speed auto tranny with it.

author: prosa
text: Today I parked near a black 2006 TSX. Black paint seems to go really well with that particular vehicle. What was really out of the ordinary, however, were its (New York) license plates which read "H8 ON ME", in other words "Hate on me." What in the world is that supposed to mean? Some sort of raging inferiority complex?

author: navigator89
text: I think he may have been trying to say Hit on me, which would make a bit more sense. If you say it in a certain way, H8 can also sound like hit.

author: ghulet
text: I think the TSX driver is trying to incite jealousy or envy (as in, 'don't hate me cuz I'm beautiful'). I swear 75 percent of people buy their first near-lux car (like this one) do so to make others envious, or at least try to. Very fitting.

author: fintail
text: Yeah that's right...."hate on me" is kind of like "envy me". Kind of funny, as although a TSX is a nice car, it's not exactly a super-status luxobeast.

author: 210delray
text: on the road. No, I didn't see the "pig snout." Yes, it was silver. No, my wife didn't like it, prefers our '04 and '05s.

author: imidazol97
text: True or false: the Camry is on the same chassis as the Avalon and the ES3XX all Toyotas.

author: rockylee
text:
You need to buy one fintail, so you can drive a flawless luxo-beast that is better than any German Engineered Car. If you find this information to be false, just ask em' (CR) :P

Rocky

author: british_rover
text: As far as I know yeah. The basic platform of the camry is the same as the ES/RX/Highlander/Avalon.

author: fintail
text:
I wouldn't complain if one was given to me - I like the TSX - especially the diesel engined Honda badged versions the rest of the world gets. It also comes in a strange but cool wagon variant.

Today I saw a couple of Ferrari Spyders, a black one and a grey one. I guess these would be 360 or 430 Modenas...I haven't yet learned to differentiate them. I also spotted that red SL55 again, being driven by a trophy wife looking woman who looked much more expensive than the car itself.

author: rockylee
text:
LOL, Those Trophey Wifes, can be very expensive. "It's cheaper to keep her"

Rocky

author: british_rover
text:
I saw some kind of Ferrari spyder today but it blew past me so no idea on the model.

I saw two Range Rover Sports, both cars I sold actually so kind of funny, back to back. The first one was artic Frost with Ivory/Aspen interior and the second was Java black with ebony interior.

author: british_rover
text:
Well the current body style Range Rover has been out since about this time in 2002 so there are a fair amount of them around now. Even at the fairly low sales volume that Range Rovers are sold at. LRNA sold around 13,000 Range Rovers in the US and a about a 1,000 in Canada during CY 2005.

You could by a 2003 Range Rover with just over 50,000 miles for low 30's right now probably.

author: fintail
text:
Those Sports are very popular too here, it seems. Every time I spend any time in traffic here, I see one. I think our Rover dealer does a decent volume.

The normal Rovers are quite common...there's a couple in my building alone. I'm surprised, given what they cost.

author: rockylee
text:
Well are they driven by Trophey wives on their cell phones like I see down here ?

The funny thing I saw was a new 07' Black Escalade racing a Orange RR Sport(what it looked like) a day ago on the way home from work. The RR Trophey Wife, was racing a Guy in a Escalade. The Slade had 22's on it. The funny thing was the embarrassment look on the Trophey Wife's face after she just glared at the guy in the Slade. It took me a few seconds to catch up with them. I was laughing so hard that I almost spit out the Sprite I just half swallowed.

Rocky

author: carguy58
text:
"Mazda has made nice in-roads but still have a ways to go in terms on perceived reliability, performance and gas mileage before their held in the same regard as Honda. How much zoom zoom are you getting when the V6 only gives you 220 hp?"

I agree on the gas mileadge Mazda's don't have as good as gas mileadge as Honda's. 220 HP is still alot though but it still not up to Nissan and Honda's HP number's in their V6's. I like the 6 too. Nice style to it. I just took a look at them a few hours ago too at my local Mazda dealership. I like the 6 in lapis blue with sport package and spoiler.

author: fintail
text:
Yeah, with the RRs and RX and ML, the trophy wife market is covered here. They don't go for the larger domestic vehicles so much here. Now and then you'll see one, but a G-wagen or big Lexus SUV is usually as far as they will go. Some of them even slum it and drive Sequoias.

I once had a guy in a Slade try to race me. It was over with quickly. I hope the guy's dad finds out what his son was doing in his car.

I wasn't aware the normal RR sold so well. I guess that would explain it...I am not surprised to see they depreciate pretty heartily. I am sure there are some sweetheart lease deals out there too, esp here in the land of luxo-leasers.

author: carguy58
text:
"I am seeing so many of these. I can't figure it out. The LS was left to die on the vine and now it's smaller, front drive replacement is a big hit??? It's just a dressed up Mazda 6 and doesn't look any classier than the Mercury version. Just why is this car selling????????"

Yeah I see some Zephyrs popping up too in NJ. I don;t think it has anything to with that its based on a Japanese Car. I think people like the outside of the Zephyr. I personally don;t like it. When I first saw the Zephyr I thought it was a flop but according to one article I read on the internet one salesman that works at a Lincoln dealership said he can't keep them in stock. I sat in one too I didn;t like it.

author: carguy58
text:
"A couple of New Rav 4s pretty bland if you ask me. I barely noticed them."

I don;t like the way the new RAV 4's look. The last RAV4 looked better to me and had a sleeker style to it.

author: derrado1
text:
I think the Zephyr's look pretty damn good... the big taillights are a bit weird though, kind of makes the rear look narrow (I suppose they were aiming for the opposite?). The interior looks absolutely stunning! I haven't had the chance to actually sit _in_ one but from pictures, it looks like nothing else. Love it. Wish they sold 'em down here...

Looking at the sales figures for March, it seems the Zephyr and Milan are selling neck and neck. Only a few units seperate them. With those two sitting at a Lincoln-Mercury dealer, I'd imagine people being impressed by the Zephyr, but lured by the Milan's price.

author: chidoro
text: Saw a new Yaris sedan at the supermarket yesterday. Cute car. I can't deal with the center console thing, but an otherwise decent looking car.

author: lemko
text: ...black Mercedes G-wagon. Unusual sighting.

author: navigator89
text:
black Range Rover Sport and a silver Hyundai Sonata.

Also a rare sight, a black VW Phaeton. Great looking car, too bad its gone.

author: teds1
text: There is a white 745 Bmw in my neighboorhood with the plates "H8 Me" It's kind of a played out late 90s Puff Daddy thing. Now the Subaru I saw with plate reading "RonMexco," was just hilarious (for you fottball fans out there)

author: teds1
text:
So apparently they are just giving Bentley's away in Long Island now or so it seems. I saw like 10 CGTs on the LIE today and a spur. It makes sense though, in these Nassau county towns where everyone makes at least $500k and the home all cost $2m+ a CGT is an expensive but within reach aspirational purchase for most residents. I bet 50% of the population in the county could afford one if they really wanted to. It just kills the exclusivity factor for what should be a pretty exotic car.
Also a Maserati Spyder and a bunch of sl55s. This morning I saw a silver F430 spyder on the upper west side which was sort of odd.

Saturday night a Blue Vanquish was parked outside the starbucks in Astor Place... sweeeeet and rare.
Ferrari 308 black out for a Sunday Drive as well.
My new favorite the Toyota FJ in Black on saturday night as well. Screw the ergonomics and practicality, it looks so damn fun!
Re: the RR discussion, the sport is getting very common in NYC (the big RR was already a uniform for the fashion set they comprise at least 50% of all garages south of houston), not the supercharged ones though. It is a very good looking truck, although I don't think people who live in NYC should be buying Sporty SUVs.

author: fintail
text: I was watching a news report this morning with a reporter at some random roadside spot talking about something or other...in the traffic passing by I spot a Bentley Azure. That's two of these things in as many weeks.

author: british_rover
text:
Bentely is overstocked across the boards as far as I know.

I have a customer who has a 2005 Arnage T with less then 5,000 miles that I am trying to help him unload.

MSRP of the car was over $250,000 with gas guzzler tax and I think he paid $235,000 something plus tax for a left over 2005 model.

The best we could do on the wholesale side was $165,000. We might take it to auction under consignment and have one of our wholesale buyers represent the car see how much we can get.

author: fintail
text: I think those older style Bentleys will take a big hit in residuals. The market is going to move to the smoother sportier Conti/Spur.

author: PF_Flyer
text: Early Saturday afternoon in the Lincoln Tunnel, headed into NYC... a red (what other color is there?) Ferarri F430 coupe. Got the good overhead look at it as I was riding in a bus (chaperoning a school trip). How could you have a car like that with an automatic???

author: rockylee
text:
It made me wish I was driving my former 05' It was doing about 80-85 mph

Rocky

author: ghulet
text:
Last I knew, you had a TL?
Only 'notable' new cars I've seen recently are (my first) '07 Camry (pretty basic, in semi-pale blue) and a Civic Si coupe, in a kind of metallic cinammon-gum burgandy, very nice. I'd just as soon have an EX sedan with a stick, two-door cars are a pain.

author: lemko
text: ...this morning - white "pig-nosed" Camry. What were those designers thinking? I guess you could slap the Toyota crossed ovals or Honda "H" on any ugly old thing an it'll sell.

author: navigator89
text:
a white Toyota Yaris sedan. I first saw them on my trip to Alexandria, Egypt two weeks ago but I forgot to mention it.

And on the opposite end of the price range, I saw a sweet looking orange Lamborghini Gallardo at a fast food plaza. It was super clean, in mint condition, and it even had orange brake calipers to match. I should have stopped for a picture.

author: ateixeira
text:
In DC today.

-juice

author: stickguy
text:
on my way to work, on a back neighborhood road, a newish looking Quatroporte

Yesterday, outside a nice local steak house (with valet parking, rare for the 'burbs around here), an AM convert. Not sure which model, but it had split taillights. Nasty khaki green with tan top color combo.

author: fintail
text: Today's sights have been the thousandth 07 Camry I've spotted, and a black 07 S550

author: lemko
text:
...if this should be in the "Spotted a New Car" or "Spotted an Obscure Car" discussion:

I spotted a silver Mitsubishi Outlander yesterday.

author: lemko
text: ...not sure if it's new, but does Isuzu still make the Axiom? I saw a silver-blue one at lunchtime. The car appeared to be in like-new condition and the owner had a nice heavy chrome licence plate frame that proudly proclaimed the vehicle "ISUZU."

author: navigator89
text:
Wow, yesterday I see a Gallardo and now this.
On the highway today a white Audi Q7 passed me. I didnt even know that they were out! has anyone else seen a Q7?

And ten minutes later I saw a white Bentley Flying Spur. Looks great.

Lemko, I see a lot of Mitsubishi Outlanders everyday. Mitsubishi has very, very strong presence in Kuwait, mainly because their cars are used in fleet sales.

author: carguy58
text:
...this morning - white "pig-nosed" Camry. What were those designers thinking? I guess you could slap the Toyota crossed ovals or Honda "H" on any ugly old thing an it'll sell."

Toyota yes they could put anything with their name on it and it well sell like Hotcakes. Honda uhh no. The current Accord and last generation 01-05 Civic were criticzed by the Honda faithful for their conservative styling. Remember mid to late 90's Acura struggled too after they axed the Legend. It wasn't until the release of the 99 TL and 01 MDX that the Acura brand got back on track.

The problem is with Toyota is they have no style of their own. Now their take styling cues off of Mazda cars and in the late 90's they were taking styling cues off of Mercedes for their Lexus brand. I respect Toyota and what they have done but styling is not a strength of theirs.

author: ateixeira
text:
Axiom stopped production a while ago, Subaru took over that assembly line and builds the Tribeca there (SIA) for about the past year. Dealers might have leftovers as they sold very slowly.

-juice

author: british_rover
text:
today on my day off.

Saw a Maserati Quatrope(SP?) in dark blue with a deep tan interior. If I had a little over a 100,000 to spend on a car and needed a four door sedan then that is the car for me.

Saw two S550 one in white the other in black. The S550 looks much better in black then white.

author: ateixeira
text:
First I saw a CLS AMG, then an M5, then an Impala SS.

OK, the last one isn't my idea of super, but it has the acronym SS.

-juice

author: chidoro
text: A neighbor around the corner from my house purchased a new Camry LE in silver. It looks pretty nice even though I know I'd never own one. There is also someone up near Bernards, NJ that owns a smart four-two. You can't not turn your head to look at the thing. It was silver with a black backside.

author: ateixeira
text:
Is it ZAP that sells gray market Smart cars in the US? Because Smart still doesn't sell them here as far as I know.

-juice

author: british_rover
text: One of my car collector customers just bought a Smart Car in Vermont about a month ago.

author: ateixeira
text:
From what gray market source? I'm curious.

-juice

author: british_rover
text: A Smart car dealers that was in Vermont. I don't remember the name I would have to go look it up.

author: navigator89
text:
Spotted today a white Nissan Skyline R34 GTR, which is an EXTREMELY rare sight anywhere outside of East Asia. It was probably doing 160km/h in the fast lane, and I could hear it's engine wail.

I also saw a new green-grey Jaguar XK coupe, parked in someone's house. I had no idea they were out. The back looks pretty nice, the front looks like a fish, IMO.

author: teds1
text:
Dead on with the Jag. The rear is quite nice on the coupe at least but I don't think anyone is wild about the front clip or grill on this version. Maybe I can get my uncle to sell me his 2000 at a nice price, they have aged pretty well IMO.

I also saw a Q7 BTW, it just looks heavy and way too late to the party. I have no interest whatsoever, which is unusual b/c I love audis.

I saw a Flying spur yesterday, Maybach 62, 360, and about 10 S550s, they are very common already in the city

author: anythngbutgm
text: Black Saturn Sky at the Gym this morning. And while not new I saw a very rare Supra TT with the 6-speeder last night at work. Customers car, it was black with the loop wing and was completely stock. Very nice.

author: lemko
text: ...two Chevrolet Impalas - a white one and a bronzish colored one. Sorry, no little "e" stickers! I like the factory alloy wheels.

author: gsemike
text: The alloys are a must on that car. The wheel covers are plastic crap.

author: kyfdx
text:
Dodge Charger R/T Daytona.. with the graphics package and black hood... pretty cool..

But, even better... A new BMW M5.... Yowza!!

author: derrado1
text:
Chrysler's only recently arrived in Australia (last decade or so) and Dodge is only just coming. I've seen a couple of 300's already, which is a good sign as they've only just been released here. Lordy lordy, they are hot! Maybe the novelty factor's worn off over there as they're relatively common but here they're more or less a niche player.

Dodge will be releasing the Caliber in a month or so, and a little while after the Nitro. I think then we'll get the new Avenger, but apparently the bosses don't want to bring the Charger over here because there's too much of an overlap between it and the 300.

Shame, 'cause they look hot and if they brought over a base V6 & V8 they could steal some Commodore/Falcon sales, and an R/T could steal a few Falcon XR/Commodore SS sales. The journos are already pitching the 300 SRT as a FPV (Ford Performance Vehicles) and HSV (Holden Special Vehicles) killer.

author: 210delray
text:
Statute of limitations has expired on spotting new Impalas.

I mean, they're now as common as...as... as flies on a fresh pile of horse dung, not to impugn GM or anything! Hey, look at my user name and profile.

Besides, I think the Lucerne pretty much hits the mark; too bad GM can't make more mainstream cars like this.

And you can get back at me when my ride, the Camry, gets spotted for upteenth time come August or so!

author: prosa
text:
I got a good look at a parked CLS500 today and decided it's sort of like a tuxedo at a barbecue. I mean, it could be a very stylish, well-fitting and costly tuxedo that looks terrific on you, but it's totally out of place at a barbecue. The CLS500 is a beautiful, stylish car, but it simply doesn't look like a Mercedes sedan should look.
Okay, that's today's ridiculous analogy

author: navigator89
text: Yesterday I saw a red Aston Martin Vanquish, a silver Ferrari 360 Modena, and I passed by the all too familiar house with a Maybach 57 and a Rolls Royce Phantom parked in the driveway.

author: nshah23
text: I saw a Ford GT in front of this one guy's house in my subdivision, I also saw a new Shelby GT500 at the same persons house, I saw a silver Ferrari 360 Modena Spyder on the highway, and then i saw another silver one, but not a spyder, on the road, I also saw a Lamborghini Countach which was pretty sweet, but i guess it isn't new, and neither are the ferraris but you don't see them that often.

author: fintail
text:
I saw the new Supercamry ES today. Nicer face than the old one, with it's 'too many facelifts' eyes.

Several new Camrys too, these are now so common here I won't mention them.

Not much else...a red Fit, and some kind of special souped up new stule Mustang, maybe a Saleen or Roush or something.

author: lemko
text: ...black Pontiac G6 GTP last night.

author: fintail
text: I saw a Smart this morning

author: ateixeira
text:
Funny, first I saw the new XK coupe, and later the same day I saw my first roadster.

I like the rear view, but I still say the front looks like the old Taurus. Too "large mouth bass" for me.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...beautiful dark blue Buick Lucerne CXS. Also had my first sighting of a Honda Fit on the road.

author: fintail
text: I've seen a FJ Cruiser (blue of course) and a Bentley Flying Spur so far too

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a silver Camry and a maroon Tribeca.

-juice

author: natenj1971
text: On my way into NYC - via Linc Tunnel I saw a black Lamborghini Gallardo - it appeared to be a flat black color with yellow highlights on parts of the black rims - like running on spare tires - it was slipping in and out of car lanes as traffic was backed up to the turnpike.

author: fintail
text: Yellow FJ Cruiser this morning

author: lemko
text: ...white Mercury Milan following a champagne-colored Montego with a beige carriage roof (aaarrrghhh!!!).

author: ateixeira
text:
Mercury just can't shake that image...I've seen them called "simulated convertibles". :sick:

-juice

author: anythngbutgm
text: Silver FJ Cruiser and Silver Cayman S. Mixed in with about 1000 new RAV4's... Not really, but they are ridiculously common here.

author: navigator89
text:
white Audi Q7. It might have been the same one that I saw the first time as I spotted it on the same road at the same time. The car was only launched here like last week.

Also saw a brown Ford Explorer, the refreshed one. Looks pretty good.

author: ateixeira
text:
Civic hybrid - 2 of them!

350Z convertible (not new but rare)

CLS500

Cayman S (first I've seen, same as anythngbutgm's)

Impala

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...new BMW Z4 roadster with the top down.

author: kyfdx
text:
... at a classmate's house yesterday.. Garage door up (4 car garage), and inside.. C6 Corvette and C5 Corvette Z06...

I told him he can't play there anymore.. it depresses me..

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a Z4 myself, top up, parked across from GW Hospital. Near by was an RX8.

Neither is new, but they're still not very common around here.

-juice

author: gsemike
text:
On a drive from Long Island to NJ today, I saw two new Escalades, one black and one gold. I guess that despite the gad prices and ridiculous mark-up from the GMC Yukon Denali, people are still buying them.

I also saw an F-series Ford truck in what looked like it said a "King Ranch" package. I didn't know that such a package existed but this truck was sharp. It was a 2 door extended cab and had two tone paint, white above the trim line and bronze below. I liked it. It was huge and looked tough and classy at the same time.

author: anythngbutgm
text: Dealer down the street from me just got a pair of "Nascar Edition" F-150's. Massachusetts doesn't have a huge Nascar fanbase so I would imagine the line of people just itching to buy one of them will be very short. :blush:

author: teds1
text:
So I am out in Indianapolis on business and I have seen in a last day a flying spur and a quattroporte. I was kinda surprised, they must be Eli Lilly execs or Pacers. Also went over to the race track for practice laps and saw a sky in the wild for the first time...
Oh yeah and Danica Patrick doing 220 20 feet from me. I had never been to an actual auto race and I was kind of blown away. The noise is so loud that the vibrations made me physically nauseaous... So cool.

author: lemko
text: ...beautiful young woman driving a sleek black Mercedes CLS-500. Either she has a very good job or Daddy is very generous.

author: PF_Flyer
text:
Let's be careful about the tone of posts from time to time. Had to take down the last one, not because it wasn't true, but because it danced over that fuzzy edge... even with a key w**d disguised.

General rule of thumb: If you feel like you have to hide a word with ***'s, you probably should not make the post.

author: fintail
text: Silver S550 today...these are catching on here now a little more...growing on me ever so slightly

author: british_rover
text:
about a dozen new pig snout camrys so those are out as new cars.

I saw one Escalade in white and I was not impressed.

author: fintail
text: Silver FJ Cruiser, and a new Passat wagon

author: lemko
text:
Bronzish colored Pontiac Grand Prix
Black Dodge Caliber
Black Infiniti QX56
Silver "pig-nosed" Camry

author: gsemike
text: I'm starting to see a few Calibers. Those models with the big wheels (I guess they're AWD), just look silly. They look like roller skates to me.

author: british_rover
text:
That is just it though as far as I know no Calibers are AWD.

That is just stupid.

author: ateixeira
text:
Civic coupe in silver, not an Si.

Then a blue FJ Cruiser. Boy do those grab attention.

Finally, a silver RAV4 pulled in to my parking lot. 2nd one in the building already.

-juice

author: gsemike
text:
The C & D review said that the Calibur would be offered in AWD but was not yet available.

What is just stupid?

author: british_rover
text:
The last information I had about the caliber was that it would not be offeredin AWD. That is what I said was stupid.

If they have changed that position then that is good.

author: navigator89
text:
while at Subway, a white Bentley Continental. I was eating outside and had a good chance to really check it out, what a fabulous car.

Also spotted many H3s, in grey, yellow, red, white.

author: chuck1959
text: I actually saw a brand new 2006 Grand Marquis today. The first one I spotted.

author: chuck1959
text:
As for Phaetons, I haven't seen one on the road yet at all.

I saw my first and only Phaeton about 3 months ago. Tragically it was in New Orleans and it had been submerged in water completely in the driveway of their home! :sick:

author: navigator89
text:
Lol, I see Grand Marquis every day, about 10-15! The new refresh is pretty tasteful on the outside. One thing I dont like about the Grand Marquis is the rear seat. I find it really small, with less room than my Camry.

As for Phaetons, they are very rare indeed. Since they came out, I've only seen somewhere between 5-10!

author: bumpy
text: I saw a Ridgeline with a cap this morning.

author: british_rover
text:
How funky did that look?

Saw that same Maser Quatroppe last night. Finally found out that it belongs to the owner of a local restaurant

author: bumpy
text: Surprisingly unfunky. The cap does a nice job of rectifying the weird lines of the Ridgeline's bed.

author: ateixeira
text:
To me the weirdness lies in the fact that the tail gate does not line up with the sides of the bed. I'm sure that's for visibility, but it just looks off.

-juice

author: natenj1971
text: Saw what I thought was a redone/refreshioned silver corolla yesterday ...but on the trunk --> there is was KIA. You've come a long way baby!

author: ateixeira
text:
The new Elantra is interesting, IMO it's one of the few new designs out of Korea that really doesn't look like something else. I was happy to see them design something uniquely theirs.

-juice

author: lemko
text:
...about the Koreans - their cars looked like nobody elses. I dig the Kia Amanti because it is so funky. Who else would think to cross a Buick LeSabre with an E-Class front end with a Chrysler grille? Cool! Shoot, even the Kia Optima has a look all its own and nobody offers anything like the Tiburon.

Now Hyundai comes along and virtually copies a Honda Accord and an older Toyota Camry! Feh!

author: lemko
text: ...neighbor across the street just bought a new dark-gray metallic Ford Five Hundred.

author: kyfdx
text:
Maserati Quattroporte..

WOW

author: chuck1959
text: Here is Houston, that '06 GM is only 1 out of 2 '06's I have seen. I see dozens on the previous year.

author: british_rover
text:
Exactly.

The owner of the Italian place across the street from me has one.

Stunning car.

So 120,000 for a top of the line Quattroporte Exectutive GT with a nearly 400 hp Ferrari engine or...

An A8 for about the same money a little more HP but boring looking.

A 7 Series and XJR can be had for about the same money but only the XJR is near as sexy.

The S-class costs more and is about as common as a Honda Civic in some parts of the country.

I know what I would buy with my money.

author: kyfdx
text:
Well.. maybe... If it was just the $120K..

And, you.... working at a Land Rover store might not think twice about it... but, how much do you think it is going to cost to maintain that Maserati? Most 4-doors aren't weekend cars that you take out when it is sunny... A car like that will probably be driven 10K-20K miles/yr...

Those Italian cars... Don't they use Extra Virgin Olive Oil at $50/qt.?

At least with the BMW, the only thing you'll pay for in the next four years is tires....

author: navigator89
text: white Dodge Charger SXT and a grey Kia Rio, 2006.

author: jcat707
text: During all the traffic I was in today while on the way to the mall, I spotted the redesigned Saab 9-5, the new Yukon and Tahoe, a new Caliber, and the 07 redesigned Lincoln Navigator. The grille wasn't a bad as it looked in pictures. In fact because of the grille, I immediately knew it was an 07.

author: lemko
text: ...of Smart cars at a Montgomery County Mercedes dealer. One looked as if it was supposed to be a Smart pickup.

author: lemko
text: ...two Toyota FJ Cruisers - one blue with a white top and the other black with a white top and also a yellow Lamborghini Gallardo.

author: stickguy
text: A red with black fade hemi decals, so I guess that was an R/T. Just before that, a bright Yellow Daytona. That one was hard to miss.

author: teds1
text: I had a nice long view of a white Gallardo spyder (top up, Mass. Plates) at a light this morning on the way to work. I have no idea what someone is doing driving a Lambo in Manhattan on a Monday morning in the rain. A white one no less. I think these are barely out yet in the states so I thought it was a good sighting

author: fintail
text:
I saw maybe half a dozen 07 Escalades today, so those are now off the "new car" list. Also spotted a Mazda 5, only the second one I've seen on the road.

Not new, but I saw 2 XLRs today...I see about 30 current SLs for every XLR, so that was unsual.

author: british_rover
text:
That wouldn't surprise me. Infiniti has this technology out now that mounts cameras in multiple locations around the vehicle to give you some vision to make up for their poor body designs.

Land Rover had a concept a couple of years ago called Land_e that had clear composite built into the lower portions of the doors and front/rear fenders to give better visibility. Maybe not very practical but useful when driving off-road or in a tight spot.

author: fintail
text: Spotted a Yaris hatch tonight...not bad save for the wannabe-Camry nose. That center instrument cluster still seems wrong to be though

author: jcat707
text: Today I saw a Honda Fit and a Jaguar X-Type wagon. That was the first X-type wagon I've ever seen in public and from the rear, it looks exactly like the old Volvo V40.

author: kyfdx
text:
What a coincidence... I saw my first X-type wagon, yesterday...

It does have a resemblance to the Volvo from the rear.. but, I think it is much better looking, overall..

It has better lines than the sedan... Doesn't look as small..

author: navigator89
text: a white Dodge Charger SXT and a white Range Rover Sport.

author: gsemike
text: I saw my first Honda Fit on the road yesterday. It was a total base model. It's remarkable how lame it can look without the body accents and alloy wheels. I thought that the one I saw at the auto show looked really sharp, but this one was a total wallflower.

author: chuck1959
text: I have spotted 2 Yaris sedans today. I agree about that center instrument cluster. That would make me (if I was in the market for a new car) not even consider it.

author: ateixeira
text:
Interestingly saw my first of each on the same day. The Yaris was a hatch.

-juice

author: teds1
text: I think a lot of wall street bonuses were sitting in money market accounts waiting for the S550 to come out. They are literally everywhere now. I saw one last night next to a Maybach 57 and I have to say presence wise they are about equal. Makes the maybach look like an even bigger waste of money.

author: lemko
text: ...gold Buick Lucerne CX - only three portholes per side.

author: navigator89
text:
a lot of cars today. A white Dodge Charger SXT, white Yaris sedan, silver Yaris hatchback, a black Hyundai Azera, a gold Ferrari 360. Also saw a white Mercedes S500 with AMG wheels, and an orange Escalade with some very wide tires.

The best of all was the Mercedes CLS55 AMG that I saw, in black. It was the second I saw, the first one being in Egypt of all places. Anyway the car looked stunning as it blasted down the highway, and I know what I'd buy if I had $100K to spend on a car.

author: odie6l
text:
It seems now I'm seeing xB's all over the place. I don't know if it's because of the gas rates or what, but I've also noticed that I have only seen 2 or 3 Mazda5's (the other vehicle I'm looking at) running around. Has anybody else noticed many Mazda5's, or is it a UTR vehicle.

Odie
Odie's Garage

author: fintail
text:
Today I saw a CLS55 too, silver. I am still not completely won over by that design, esp from the rear, but if I was to have one, I would certainly go AMG.

Also spotted a dark grey S550 - they are becoming less unusual here now, I am sure I could see one daily if I looked.

Also not new, but I saw a Bentley Arnage...it amused me because I could see it from some distance, it just looks BIG compared to most cars.

author: merc1
text:
For a while I didn't see any either, now they're everywhere! Saw a W221 S600 today with the optional 19 inch wheels, stunning.

Downtown Chicago is just crawling with W221s now.

M

author: merc1
text:
The CLS is no longer a rare sighting around here.

Neither is the Bentley Coupe.

I'm still waiting to see the Maybach 57S on the road though. Hopefully it will look a little better than the regular 57 and the truly ungainly 62.

M

author: british_rover
text:
one of my customers came in to pick up his Range Rover from service in his brand new Maserati Quattroporte Executive GT.

I must say that was a stunning stunning car. Firt time I have had a chance to sit in one and check out the inside.

All I can say is wow. He loves it and he is starting to get used to the funny F1 style transmission.

author: teds1
text: Sorry to dissapoint, I've seen two 57s models (not in the wild) and they are pretty much the same as the regular ones. The badging is subtle and there really aren't any exterior styling cues. The interior is a pretty unique art deco looking piano black but I'm not sure I was my car to look like an industrial age skyscraper lobby.

author: chidoro
text: spotted an orange yaris hatchback last night on the way home from work. It's a pretty cool looking car but I too would never own a car w/ a center console. I guess I'm just getting too old and stodgy for that demographic (at only 36 ).

author: navigator89
text:
Today I spotted a silver Mercedes ML350, my second or third. Also yet another white Range Rover Sport.

But the best was seeing the deep blue Porsche Cayenne Turbo S, the 520hp king of SUVs. I'd love to own one.....

author: british_rover
text: The Range Rover is the King of SUVs. The pepper is only a pretender.

author: merc1
text:
All shux....

M

author: lemko
text: ...black Lincoln Zephyr followed by a red Mustang GT.

author: bumpy
text: Impala SS this morning. I had thought they were only sold in black.

author: teds1
text:
Saw the new XK Convertible last night... I haven't seen a coupe yet but they looked better to me at the auto shows than the convertibles. They seem to have lost the grace and sleeknes of the earlier models. It looks a bit more Db7 like now I think.

Also Black Cayman S... wow Black is the color for this car. Red is awful, silver is generic, blue would be a waste. The Cayman is one of the most color sensitive cars ever, wait till you see a black one rip by at night... wow. Sounds great too.

author: chidoro
text: Spotted a new black M5 at lunch today. While I'd never purchase a BMW for personal reasons, it was a sharp looking car.

author: teds1
text:
I spent a significant portion of the weekend stuck in Subway Series related traffic so I saw a lot of cars. Coolest was a white Lotus Exige, not an Elise on the Long Island Expressway
Also a few calibers (I just don't see the point), a fit (not really sure what all the fuss is about), the usual Long Island Bentley contingent, some S550s, a Maserati GT, and a DB7 Vantage Volante.

author: ateixeira
text:
Spent the weekend in Ocean City, MD, and it was Cruisers weekend, i.e. all the hot rods were out. Saw a lot of like-new cars from the 60s and 70s, but also a few from the 40s and 50s. Very fun.

Not many new cars, but I did see a new Escalade, an SSR, and a couple of Tribecas along the way.

-juice

author: fintail
text: Not the newest thing...but I saw a grey STS today. It was a nice color and had nice-ish stock wheels, etc. But to ruin it all it had a black vinyl top. When will this end?

author: i_luv_toyota
text:
Saw a bright blue FJ Cruiser while I was in Park City, Utah visiting my sister last week. Only saw the back end of it, but from what I saw it looked as cool as it does in the pictures, maybe even better!

I have yet to see one on the roads here in CT, though, only in dealership lots...

author: british_rover
text: I have seen several in CT. Even had one drive onto our lot because we have the offroad test course. He wanted to drive on it but for insurance reasons we could not let him.

author: lemko
text: ...black VW GLI and dark gray Dodge Caliber.

author: rockylee
text:
Spotted a Yellow Toyota FJ Cruiser

Rocky

P.S. 4 days ago I spotted a beatiful Black Legacy GT with a very pretty lady that reminded me of Kristie I had to take a double take because I was like that's Kristie.

Rocky

author: navigator89
text:
a white Bentley Continental Flying Spur on the highway. Also a grey Hyundai Sonata, and a white Dodge Charger.

In addition, I saw a weird sight, a white Nissan Armada that was tricked out....it had huge rims, probably 24", a custom bumper design and a billet grille. Probably had TVs and a killer sound system inside too. IMO Navigators and Escalades look better when tricked out.

author: british_rover
text: That is cause the Armada is about the ugliest mass produced vehicle currently made with the Q56 being the ugliest one.

author: fintail
text: They look best when in the wrecking yard

author: rockylee
text:
Hey we agree. I can't stand the "tuning fork" effect one gets from shutting those plasticky doors. clunkzzzzzzzzzz lol :surprise:

Rocky

author: fintail
text: Today I saw a black CLS55 AMG and a blue Maserati coupe. The Maserati was memorable as it had Nevada plates.

author: chuck1959
text: Today I saw a brand new black Rolls Royce Pheaton. I has just stopped at a red light and it came flying past me through the red light!

author: ateixeira
text:
OK, the Audi was not new, but it's not every day you see an RS6 sedan. I heard the turbo whistle and it caught my eye, the fenders bulge out nicely. Pretty nice sleeper Q ship if you ask me.

-juice

author: navigator89
text:
a new silver Nissan Pathfinder, which is I think the second one I've seen on the road. My friend remarked "It looks like a bus."

Also saw a light green Yaris sedan.

author: derrado1
text:
Damn, those Pathfinders look great in the metal! The old ones were pretty nondescript but the new ones are very muscular.

I don't see many luxury/executive sedans around the 'burbs, but suddenly Australia's gotten into the lux-SUV culture. Saw an RX330 this morning, not to mention _another_ Discovery 3 (that makes about five within a few blocks of my home in a week), an X5 the other day, there's a new ML down by the new townhouses, and I'm sure there was an LX470 in there somewhere.

This is in a suburb where you'd be hard pressed to see a 5-Series or E-Class or any of that ilk. Although a bright red new Saab 9-3 often resides a few blocks away.

author: ateixeira
text:
2 things kill the Pathy for me - my kids can't even come close to reaching the rear door handle (forget self-sufficiency), and gas mileage. I like it otherwise.

-juice

author: derrado1
text: Spotted, as I pulled out of the parking lot at 6pm, a Porsche Cayenne. Silver, I think ('twas very dark)

author: stickguy
text: saw my first FJ cruiser out in public. Bright yellow. If nothing else, you notice it. It was also bigger (taller, and seemingly wider) than I expected.

author: chuck1959
text: I saw a blue one.

author: derrado1
text: First Crossfire in the metal. Saw it driving through the parking lot a few rows away. Black coupe and I must say, it looked a helluva lot better in the metal than in pictures. It has the whole long-front, short-back thing going and black's quite flattering. When I parked and was heading inside, I saw the driver had parked it by the entrance, so I walked past. My, it looks very small when you're close to it. Tiny little cabin. But it looks great! This is from someone who always thought it looked a little weird and disproportionate in pictures.

author: ghulet
text: I saw, in my own neighborhood (as opposed to downtown, where you'd expect to see it) a 120" stretch Porsche Cayenne. I almost lost my lunch.

author: british_rover
text: Prom season?

author: fintail
text:
I saw a CLS with a Brabus package today...it was a bit rice-racerish for my tastes.

I also got behind a current CL55 in city traffic, and boy did it sound nice.

Also a Ford GT, and not one but two Ferrari 550/575 (might not be new, but still not exactly hard on the eyes).

author: prosa
text:
No, couldn't be ... not with the speed limit signs

I made about a round-trip drive of about 20 miles each way on the Long Island Expressway (I-495) this evening. Westbound traffic was quite heavy what with people returning from their holiday weekends in the Hamptons. And, as one might imagine, the cars were definitely on the upscale side. I saw so many Mercedes and BMW's that for a moment I thought I'd been teleported to Germany! Audis and Porsches (mainly Cayennes) were also in ample supply. Which isn't to say that all of the costly vehicles were German; Lexuses and, to a slightly lesser extent, Infinitis were common too, though there weren't too many Acuras. American luxury vehicles, in contrast, were a rare sight, with just a handful of Escalades and Navigators.

The more I think of it, the single most unusual thing about the vehicles I saw was the unusually high number of Range Rovers. I wasn't counting them at first, but after seeing a steady progress of them I started keeping count. Believe it or not, I counted 17 of them in the space of 20 minutes.

author: teds1
text: Yeah the LIE on a summer weekend can really skew your perspective of what an average car is. This weekend on my trips I saw an sl65, a couple of elises, and yes MANY Range rovers

author: british_rover
text:
Range Rovers are very popular in that area. The trick is to spot the 2006 ones from the rest of them.

2006 Range Rovers have clear upper tail lights instead of the orange from the 2003-2005. They have clear side markers instead of the orange from 2003-2005.

The last bit is that their lower halogen headlights are set inboard from the main upper bi-xenon light cutting slightly into the grill. The 2003-2005 Ranges have the halogen lights are directly underneath the bi-xenon light.

This morning already we have had three range Rovers, of course duh, but a truck did drop off our next Supercharged Range Rover that is of course already pre-sold.

Also one of my customers came by to drop off his range for service and left in his brand new M6.

That is a nice vehicle in everyway except the trunk looks like a total afterthought.

It is almost like they got to the end of the vehicle and just got tired of drawing.

Stupid bangel butt.

author: gsemike
text:
Seeing a new Sonata around here (Long Island) is no longer noteworthy because they're all over. However, I did see one yesterday that was the first one that I saw completely decked out with options. This car had moonroof, polished wheels, rear spoiler, etc. Every box was checked.

I saw the car in a rather well to do neighborhood so I guess that's a good sign for Hyundai that they're gaining cred as a respectable car for the middles and upper middles.

author: lemko
text: ...black Buick Lucerne with four portholes - probably a CXL or CXS! Nice! Three holers are rare.

author: fintail
text: I saw another CLS with an aftermarket bodykit (kind of vulgar) and a Maserati sedan, which is Buick-esque with its portholes.

author: prosa
text:
Sure seems like one. While walking around lower Manhattan at lunch today I saw a S550 double-parked outside a very expensive apartment house, as a fat 50ish man put a suitcase in the trunk and then got behind the wheel. What a beautiful vehicle. It was a sort of metallic blue with what I believe were the optional 19" alloys. And the way it shone in the sunlight, it was almost painful to look at!

Oh, as for the mobster bit ... as the driver was putting the suitcase in the trunk his suit jacket gaped open revealing a holstered pistol. Now, it's almost impossible to get a concealed-carry permit in NYC, and I'd rather doubt many cops could afford an S-class or to live in the adjacent apartment building (not to mention that he was at least 50 pounds beyond even the most lenient physical-fitness standards for law enforcement officers). The driver didn't seem to care that his pistol was visible, which seems to rule out an ordinary citizen carrying an illegal weapon or the average criminal type. Now, a top-level Mob boss wouldn't care, so that's who I think he was.

Hmmmm ... now I'm wondering exactly what - or whom - was in that suitcase

author: kyfdx
text: My first one.. Reminds me of the Mitsubishi Expo LRV, with the sliding doors..

author: navigator89
text:
over the past few days.

I saw three new Nissan Pathfinders, in black, beige and grey. I found black to be the best looking color.

Also saw three new Mercedes S Class, two in maroon, one in beige.

Three RAV4s, in beige, grey and red also.

Also saw my first new Hyundai Accent, in white. Looks very plain to me, just like the full test said. Also saw a white Yaris sedan, and two Nissan Versas in red and beige.

The best was seeing the black Rolls Royce Phantom, and the maroon Jaguar XK convertible yesterday. Wow! They both look great!!

author: lemko
text: ...spotted a Suzuki maroon Grand Vitara and a dark gray Honda Ridgeline yesterday. They're both quite scarce around here.

author: rockylee
text:
It was a sharp car and liked it. Hope the next Generation will be even nicer.

Rocky

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a Mazda5 yesterday.

Chevy Equinox at lunch, too.

Pathfinder as well, those have been out for a while, now.

Tribeca - the light seafoam color, sort of light greenish.

-juice

author: lemko
text:
Ford Explorer
VW Toureg
Mitsubishi Eclipse

author: fintail
text: I've seen many new style Lexus ES Supercamrys lately...better looking than the previous one

author: ateixeira
text: It finally got a worthy engine...

author: navigator89
text:
a ton of new Explorers today, probably about 6, in mineral grey and beige. Looks great.

Also saw a black Nissan Pathfinder, and a light green Range Rover Sport.

And also a beige Kia Optima EX-V6, my first one. It was parked so I only saw the back end, and it looks great!

author: odie6l
text:
The Mazda5, even though I see a bunch on the lots, are still a vehicle that seems to be UTR (Under The Radar).

Odie

author: lemko
text: ...another Buick Lucerne CXL - silver gray one.

author: gsemike
text:
I saw my first recently as well. I really really like it. As I'm heading into my child rearing years (my first is on the way), I'm glad that someone is making a minivan that is actually mini. It looks like it would be plenty big enough for a family of 4 and could actually remain a little agile.

I almost bought a 6 a few years ago but I hated the seats. If I get into van mode, let's see if I can handle the seats in the 5.

author: prosa
text:
Around noon today I spotted my first CX-7. Not on the road, but parked in front of the local Mazda dealership in a spot visible to everyone driving by on the main road. I first thought it was a 6 wagon. It was a bit smaller than I would have expected. Not bad looking, though I wonder if rear visibility might be limited given the low roofline. Also, has Mazda given any thought as to whether the CX-7 might compete with the 5?
Later in the day I saw a Milan in the next lane with a Fusion following right behind. Both were white, which actually made it easier to compare the two. Seeing them close together clearly illustrates what "badge engineering" really means. Even someone who didn't know anything about cars could see at a glance that they are basically the same vehicle. That being said, I'd say the Milan is the more attractive of the two - or, more accurately, that the Fusion is the less attractive of the two, given its cheap-looking taillights and that ghastly Multiblade Shaving System grille!
Finally, in the evening I saw an orange Gallardo heading eastbound on the Long Island Expressway, no doubt on the way home from a weekend in the Hamptons. I actually heard it overtaking me before it came into sight. Its license plate read "Sunny 06." Well heck, dude, of course 2006's been a bright sunny year for you, seeing that you can afford a Gallardo - rub it in a little more, won't you :P

author: carguy58
text: seen a couple 06 Miata's pop of late. I guess its the weather this time of year that people are going to start buying cars with soft-tops. You have to keep in mind I live in NJ where it gets cold in October and snows maybe until March. Reportedly, Mazda has a very low inventory of Miata's now.

author: merc1
text:
Top down, two new Jaguar XKs. Stunning, but that front end....

Also saw a new Volvo C70 with its top down on I-290. Nice.

M

author: ateixeira
text:
I see a lot of them, maybe they are just popular around here.

It drives really well, you should try one out. I went to Zoom Zoom Live and took one on the autocross course, it was quicker than any van has the right to be.

The CX7 has less space but had AWD and the turbo. That plus prices will keep them from overlapping.

The 5 lacks stability control, AWD, and perhaps an upgrade engine to really sell in big numbers. But it has exceeded targets.

-juice

author: fintail
text:
I saw a new M5 today...it was nice of course...you could tell what it was from the way it sat.

Also a F430 Spider, red of course...it was amusing as the driver looked like a real-life embodiment of a grown up Martin Prince from 'The Simpsons'....dorky looking kinda fat middle aged guy in a weird visor/hat and odd glasses. Another Microsoft millionaire maybe.

author: ghulet
text: ...forgive me for being lazy, but what's its pricing like? I'm assuming they've kept the high-tech stuff and larger engines off to keep prices down. I think, if they promote it right, it could do well versus lower-priced minivans or smaller SUVs. It seems to bridge the gap pretty well. The TV commercial I saw for the CX7 showed an example that stickered a bit north of $30k, so I imagine the 5 is considerably cheaper, again to compete with the smaller vehicles (I'm guessing/hoping $19-25k or so). Considering how large and costly some 'mini' vans have become, I think there should be a considerable market for something a bit more reasonable, especially for small, young families who don't want the stigma of a minivan or the piggishness of most SUVs.

author: fintail
text: I was standing in my living room not long ago, and something caught the corner of my eye driving down my street...I spotted a tan car with a carriage top, so I looked over to see what kind of vintage car was driving by. It was an 06 DTS, in light tan with a darker carriage top. Classy!

author: kyfdx
text:
I'm pretty sure that most Mazda5's are selling for under $20K...

Mazda5: Prices Paid & Buying Experience

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a Honda Fit, while I was getting gas. I swear he looked over and stuck out his tongue. :P



-juice

author: lemko
text: ...a white Buick Lucerne - uncommon three-holer. Also spotted new black Honda Accord with the revised taillights.

author: teds1
text:
I saw two f430 spyders in the last few days (one parked in my waaay uptown neighborhood) as well as a Flying spur.
The new Merc GL450 in white
Another SL65
M6 ... Vader's car, very cool although I don't think I'd buy one.
There is a car under a sheet in my father's garage (which also has a maybach 57 in it as well as the M6 mentioned above)that I swear is a 959 although I can't be sure. I can't think of any other porsche's with that exact shape. If it is one that is hyper rare

author: stickguy
text:
CX-7. I stopped at the dealer (is that cheating?), and they had two out front. One was fro driving, but I didn't bother (or get to sit inside, since I never spoke to a salesperson).

I think it looks OK, certainly not generic styling! The interior looks pretty sharp, and seems to have plenty of rear leg room, and cargo space too.

The front drive touring was 17.2ish K, and the GT AWD was just a tick over 30K, so probably comparable to the new Acura.

I would be curious to see how they drive, but MPG wasn't too hot considering it is a 4 cyl, although a pretty hot one, and I imagine that the CX is pretty porky.

Actually, speaking of porky, I saw a test the other day (in one of my magazines I haven't gotten around to reading) of the RDX (that the right name for the Acura?), and it weighed in at about 3,950 pounds. What a blimp for something that small.

author: ateixeira
text:
If it really was $17.2k please tell me where because I'll go buy it right now.

-juice

author: odie6l
text:
(all prices include destination as of 06/06/06 from Mazda USA)
Mazda5 Sport - Base MSRP - $17,995.
Mazda5 Sport - Loaded - (5spd)$20,110, (4auto)$21,350.

Mazda5 Touring - Base MSRP - $19,510.
Mazda5 Touring - Loaded - (5spd)$22,075, (4auto)$23,325.

You can only get the Nav system, and I did not add the Sirius Radio upgrade on any of the vehicles, but otherwise, the prices above have EVERY OPTION.

So prices range from $18k - $24k (includeing Sirius).

Odie
Odie's Garage

author: navigator89
text:
a white Aston Martin DB9. Looks really nice.

Also saw a blue Porsche Carrera Cabriolet, a red Porsche Carrera 4S.

author: lemko
text: ...red Ford Fusion and silver Mazda RX8.

author: gsemike
text:
I was in a hotel partking lot last night where I got to see a Lucerne CXS close up. I think that it is a nice looking car, but why does it have four bolt holes across the back bumper? Granted, they color key the covers, but there remains a dark outline that is visible from a distance. It's a very low rent touch and has no place on the "American Lexus". There was alos a new Impala and that didn't have the bolt holes. Even Kias and Suzukis don't have them anymore.

It's dumb stuff like that lack of attention to detail that turns people off to GM.

author: chuck1959
text: I could be mistaken, but I beilieve those "bolt holes" are sensors, that while backing up it sounds an alert to the driver if there is anything behind them.

author: imidazol97
text: Those "bolt holes" are on many cars, including the other more accepted foreign brands IIRC. They are sensors for the ultrasonic sensors that sense objects nearing the bumper. It's on many cars. I suspect if they are spotted on a Mercedes or Lexus, they would not have been criticized; on a GM, criticize?

author: british_rover
text:
I love it when people just jump to anti-GM biasis instantly. The guy probably has no idea wat Park Distance Control is and has never seen it before.

Something I have noticed on mostly ford products that have Park Distance control is that instead of color coding the sensors they leave them black. Looks really really bad and is just very poorly done. How much more would it cost to have them color coded to match the bumper?

author: ateixeira
text:
They should be mounted in the license plate area somewhere. Or just use a camera instead of sonar. I think they look tacky, too. I can't imagine they can't make that seamless.

To be an equal-opportunity critic, nothing it worse than the exhaust plug on some Volvos. Some models have dual exhaust, and others don't. But they cost-cut and only made one bumper. So the single-exhaust models have a cheesy looking plug to cover the hole where the 2nd exhaust tip would have been. Horrendous.

Any how, saw a Ridgeline in DC today, not many of those in the city.

Also saw a RAV4 Limited, they're everywhere now.

Finally, saw an STS.

-juice

author: british_rover
text:
In order to get equal coverage all around and to see the corners of the car some they must be precisly mounted in key locations so that their scan area overlaps. Every once in a while I see a car that only has two mounted by the rear license plate and that means there is a big gap in coverage. Basicly the automaker is being cheap.

To get complete coverage including corners you must mount at least four sensors and the two outboard ones must be mounted at an angle near the edge of the bumpers.

Next time you see a Range Rover up close take a look at their PDC sensor coverage it is nearly perfect. I can navigate those cars in the showroom almost purely with the PDC system and no spotters.

author: ateixeira
text:
Are those seamless? I'm sure it's possible. They could mount behind the bumper. It's sonar, no line of sight required.

-juice

author: british_rover
text: They are flush to the bumper skin but you can still see their outline and you do need Line of site in order for the sensor to process the return signal. If they tried to do it through plastic it would not work.

author: ateixeira
text:
Thanks, I stand corrected.

I'd prefer a camera, and with NAV screens becoming more common that's an easy upgrade.

Pioneer sells in-dash NAV systems and the camera adds just $100 to the overall cost of the system.

-juice

author: british_rover
text: After for working for UPS, all of their trucks have back up cameras but they are trained to use them in conjuction with the main mirrors, cameras are kind of overrated. The problem is that even with fisheye lenses people rely on them to heavily. They should just be used as a guide and not focused on exclusively.

author: ateixeira
text:
I make it a habit of checking what's behind me before I get in the car!

Then you have to keep looking at the mirrors to see if anything comes in to your path, though.

-juice

author: gsemike
text: Just to clarify, I do have an anti GM bias based on personal experience and I wouldn't like the holes on any car.

author: navigator89

a white Range Rover Sport, and two redesigned Explorers, in silver and beige.

Also a blue Nissan Tiida (Versa).

author: lemko

author: ateixeira
text:

It might be the only one in the country, for all I know. It was debadged so I'm not sure which model it was, but it was a 5 door, silver.

author: teds1
text:
Wow that is a good one. I love seeing something whcih clearly doesn't belong here like the right hand drive Alpine I saw last year.
The 1 series is cool although I don't think that Euro "hot hatch" culture would go over here too well. Driving my rented Fiat panda in Italy last year (awesome little car BTW) I was passed by many 130ds which made me jealous. Unfortunately they make people here think of the woeful 318 hatch.

author: ateixeira
text:
Yeah, at a party I met a guy with a Renault Espace, he even gave me a ride in it.

-juice

author: navigator89

author: prosa
