author: kyfdx
text:
These two were side by side, about 50 yards in front of me, heading down the street...

Remarkably similar shape from behind..

Really.... I know, I know.. it was just the first thing I thought when I saw them...

author: carguy58
text:
Yeah I have seen a few Fits popping up around NJ. As a matter of fact I saw a Fit with new car dealer tags today outside a shopping mall that I went too.

BTW, Doesn't the Fit look like a car esentially designed for the European market instead of the NA market? As a Honda fan it(the Fit) in my opinion doesn't blend in styling DNA wise with the rest of the Honda line-up. I should also add the plastics in the interior look very high quality in the Fit that I saw today.

author: prosa
text:
BTW, Doesn't the Fit look like a car esentially designed for the European market instead of the NA market? As a Honda fan it(the Fit) in my opinion doesn't blend in styling DNA wise with the rest of the Honda line-up.

You are right. There's a sort of "Honda look" that the existing models have, but the Fit doesn't. It's hard to be more precise.

author: odie6l
text:
I was up in Mt. Gretna at The Jigger Shop Ice Cream Parlor with my daughter and got to see 2 Lamborghini Gallardo's, one yellow, and one black. Talk about a nice car, but boy did it look small on the inside.

Odie
Odie's Carspace Garage

author: stickguy
text:
I think my first on on the road.

Driven by the target demo: A couple that looked to be at least 65-75 YO. They could have been the parents of the couple in "American Gothic"

author: fintail
text: I saw a couple of those newly grilled Lincoln pickups today. Not as pimpy as the photos made it look, but still pretty stupid.

author: navigator89
text:
a deep blue Range Rover Sport, and another one in grey. Blue looks good.

Also saw a light blue Hyundai Sonata.

author: lemko
text: ...I was washing my 1988 Buick Park Ave in front of the house and I see this young twenty-something dude in a silver metallic Cadillac CTS-V! Wow, he must be doing pretty well!

author: prosa
text:
I was on the Long Island Expressway (I-495) for about 45 minutes yesterday evening, and as usual for summer Sunday evenings the westbound lanes were filled with expensive vehicles coming back from a weekend in the Hamptons. There were a few unusual sightings in addition to the typical array of Range Rovers, 7-Series and S-Classes: a very new-looking G55 (grey market?), a black Q45 (which I initially mistook for an A8), and an Elise. Speaking of A8's, I must've seen at least a dozen of them, it looks as if the 7-Series is facing some tough competition from the Hamptons crowd.
The most amusing sighting, during a brief traffic slowdown that allowed me a good look, was a CLK 320 (one of four that I saw) with the personalized license plate "OFF CALL." It was driven by a 60-ish man with a very hot blonde in her early 20's in the passenger seat. I guess there's only one question to ask: mistress or trophy wife

author: rockylee
text:
Yep he must be....OTOH I did see a 04-06 Black Acura TL leave the plant the other day with tinted windows. It was very sharp !!!!!

Rocky

author: rockylee
text:
He watched me almost get cut off by a guy in a Sebring which I posted in the inconsiderate drivers forum. The SSR was very cool and the guy gave me a thumbs up because he saw the almost accident take place. The SSR had the LS-2 and was very cool. I will be sad to see this very cool retro car be axed.

Rocky

author: lemko
text: ...not sure if it was new, but it is uncommon - red Acura NSX.

author: rockylee
text:
those are nice !!!!

Rocky

author: teds1
text:
I was up in Bedford NY this weekend which is a wealthy suburb on NY in westchester county. If you live there you probably don't know that you can get a car for less than $40k or one built in the states b/c I saw none from either category.
Coolest was the New Z4 M convertible. That had to be one of the first in the states.
A vanquish passed me on a fun country road... I was very jealous
A kid (20 yr old) I know up there just got a Z3 M Coupe by putting himself into debt for the next 5 years. I thought this was dumb unil I got a ride in it and now all I can think of is why I haven't done that yet... It is sooo fast

author: ateixeira
text:
Fit isn't new, it's about 6 years old I've heard. So it really corresponds to the last generation of Honda design.

Ironically, I like it better than most current Hondas. In some ways, the more simple, honest, straight forward design is better than the newer designs that seem to try too hard (Civic's instruments, for instance).

Interior size is what impresses me. I swear it has as much space as the gigantic FX45.

-juice

In the parking lot where I go for lunch...

New Mercedes ML-class...

New body-style Saleen Mustang.. (281?)

Both in silver..

author: kyfdx
text:
Honda Fit Sport... in red..

I want one..

author: chuck1959

author: fintail
text:

Also form a distance I thought I saw a Lucerne with no portholes...but it was a Q45

author: lemko
text: Actually, I think the Torrent is better-looking than the Equinox. Funny about mistaking a Q45 for a Lucerne. I recall seeing the TV commercial for the Lucerne and thinking, "Wow! That looks like a really nice Infiniti! Cadillac's in trouble!" I was quite surprised when it turned out to be the Lucerne!

author: prosa
text:
I've seen a parked one, but never one actually being driven. It was about 15 minutes ago heading uptown on Hudson Street in Manhattan, a silver model occupied by two middle-aged women. Most likely they had come in from New Jersey through the Holland Tunnel. Parked, a SMART looks strange but otherwise vehicle-like; in motion, it looks, well, not like any other vehicle I've seen before
As the SMART passed me I got a look at the license plates, figuring it would be from Canada; to my surprise, it had Illinois manufacturer plates.

author: fintail
text:
Both of those little soft-roaders seem like runts to me. And that engine...sorry, I could never go there.

I really don't mind the Lucerne, it is so much nicer than that it replaced. Unfortunately, it will likely woo only existing customers.

author: merc1
text:
Not new, but rare...a Maybach 57. There is was riding along in rush hour traffic on 95th Street in Oak Lawn (for you Chicago folks). It was one of those 2-tone jobs.

M

author: stickguy

one of those Chrysler 300 4 door convertibles, on the road and driving around. Saw it first with the top up. Not quite right at the back (IMO), but still better than a SOlstice!

Also saw it with the top down, and it looked real good that way.

author: kyfdx
text: In gray... A rare sighting...

author: PF_Flyer

author: fintail

There are few Prowlers running around the Hershey area, but only when the Temp or day is perfect. I still think Chrysler had a good car, but either neede more power or less $$$ for what it had.

Odie's Carspace

Saturn Sky. Very, very nice, prefer it to the Solstice.

author: anythngbutgm

Speaking of Prowlers, I saw a purple on e over the weekend, with the matching trailer. Still quite the eye catcher...

And I actually saw a Crossfire! I think those are about as rare as the Prowler.

author: lemko
text: ...spotted a Cadillac SRX, Buick Rendezvous, Jeep Grand Cherokee, and a Hummer H2 in that order at lunch today. What did they all have in common? They were all driven by women.

author: chuck1959
text:
And I actually saw a Crossfire! I think those are about as rare as the Prowler.

Not really. In the past week here (Houston, Tx) I have seen 4 Crossfires 1 Black(my fav) 2 Silver and 1 White (first time to see a white one) I haven't seen a Prowler a couple of months and it was Yellow.

author: carguy58
text:
a black Mazdaspeed 6 at the Jersey Shore on Friday. On the exterior design why does the radiator have to be so big? The radiator design almost takes up the whole bottom of the front end.

Oh yeah also saw a new Black Ford Fusion with new car dealer tags at the Jersey Shore too. I was like wow thats nice looking for a Ford!

When I saw my first Fusion, I thought the taillights looked alot like the last model year Prelude.

author: merc1
text:

text: ...first Yaris I've seen on the street - this one was a green low-end sedan, (plastic hubcaps).

author: carguy58
text:
"When I saw my first Fusion, I thought the taillights looked alot like the last model year Prelude."

No that wasn't the last model years Prelude that the tailights of the Fusion remind you of. The 92-96 Prelude was the second to last generation of Prelude. The 97-01 or 02(forgot what exact model year the Prelude got discontinued)was the last generation of Prelude.

As a matter of fact doesn't the Front of the Fusion remind anybody of the 97-01 or 02 Preludes front end? They are very close looking resemblance wise in terms of headlights design. The grille design of the 97-01 Prelude and Fusion are very different though.

hahahahahaha..... That's funny because my oldest one watches Sponge Bob and I know what ur talking about

Black Bently Continental sedan... Whoa.

3 series wagon, too.

Dealer package I'm sure. I guess some geezers just insist on them, and for dealers it's a profit maker. One local dealer calls them "simulated convertibles". LOL

text:
LOL, good luck reselling that

author: imidazol97
text: A certain dealer here adds them to tradeins to make them more saleable. Also adds portholes and gold name emblems.

Really.....YUCK !

author: chuck1959
text:

Chrome was made to be on CARS and gold is made to be for jewelry!

author: ateixeira
text:
I don't even like chrome.

This was really cool - I saw a brand new Porsche Cayman S parked in ... a handicap spot! :shades:

-juice

author: chuck1959
text:
This was really cool - I saw a brand new Porsche Cayman S parked in ... a handicap spot!

Being a handicapped person myself I just have to ask.
What's your point with that comment. You think ALL handicapped people are poor?

author: PF_Flyer
text: Please don't make things personal.

author: gsemike
text:
Maybe he's thinging "Isn't it great that this person has soem type of physical ailment but is still enjoying life and treated themselves to this amazing car"

Good for them I say

author: ateixeira
text:
Absolutely, and it brought a smile to my face.

It's not about income at all. I'm sure it's more complex to fit hand controls on a compact sports car versus, say, a more common mid-size sedan, or even a Chrysler van, where standard kits exist.

I'm glad to see a company make a fitment for a low-volume Porsche, and a brand new one at that. That's why I was impressed. :shades:

-juice

author: teds1
text:
I have been on the road for a bit but I have some new sightings to report.
two Bentley CGTs, two bentley flying spurs
An M6, Bentley azure, DB9, and a quattroporte on one intersection in about 30 seconds of traffic on 3rd avenue
a yellow prowler (in florida), a red Z06 (Louisiana)
Many new S classes, calibers (I have taken to saying ewwwww when I see one), skys, solstices, and a CX-7

Also whoever wrote in about the MB Lemon a page or two back, that wasn't an SLR, it was a CLK-GTR which was a homologated le mans car, the same type which caught air and flipped over in the famous internet clip. A much more rare and exclusive car than the SLR actually. I have NEVER seen one of those and don't expect to since they aren't street legal here.

author: chuck1959
text: I know it's not about income. I was once in a wheelchair (it's a miracle I no longer am) I had a fully loaded T & C you'd be surprised how many times someone would say " having a disablity must really pay well!

author: fintail
text:
Yellow Murcielago roadster followed by a red new style Viper.

Earlier I saw a Continental GT

Funny about that T&C comment...that seemed to be the royalty of minivans for awhile. My dad bought a completely loaded one in 97, it was expensive. Now, they've decontented them and the name has lost value.

author: gsemike
text: Not everyone that is entitled to a handicapped placard are necessarily in a wheelchair. My father has a fused ankle and has the placard. He can walk without aid and his car in not modified, but he can't walk very far before it becomes painful

author: prosa
text: I still haven't seen an FJ Cruiser, CX-7 or Sky on the road, though I've seen a CX-7 parked in front of a dealership.

author: derrado1
text:
A silver Jeep Commander, the first I've seen on the road... but it kept getting away! Looks nice, though, even if I only saw the rear.

Also, an '06 Camry at the traffic lights behind an '05 Lexus ES. Certainly an interesting pair... the ES seems to be ever-so-slightly bigger in every dimension. As much as I don't like cars of its ilk (plush, boring V6 FWD luxo-mobiles), and as much as I despise the last-generation Camry (don't even get me started on it...), the last-gen ES certainly looks interesting, and I admire it for that. Reminds me of a big, content cat, and I love cats. Maybe it's not as sleek or as agile as a Jaguar or a jaguar, but certainly has its allure to me nonetheless.

I also saw a blue/blue Mini Cooper Cabrio, and a normal black Mini Cooper. Both are nice little cars, and not too cutesy or kitsch. A VW New Beetle you couldn't pay me too drive, but I wouldn't mind being given the keys to a Mini Cooper.

author: ateixeira
text:
I've only seen one. Well, two, but one was parked in a dealer lot, then 15 seconds later we saw one at a Costco. Sharp looking blue color.

-juice

author: gsemike
text: I haven't see a CX7 yet either. I've seen one Mazda5 and I've seen plenty of Saturn Skys.

author: odie6l
text:
one of my neighbors got a Sky just before all these massive storms and flooding happened. I have had to give him rides 3 times this week because he would be able to get out of our development due to the height of the water at the end of the development. Otherwise the vehicle is pretty sharp looking.

Odie
Odie's Carspace

author: gsemike
text: I saw a nice black one yesterday on the triborough bridge. He was going like a bat out of hell and that car sounded sweeeeeeeeeeeeet. It's definately got a nice exhaust note.

author: prosa
text: Parked in front of a local Suzuki dealer, for all the world to see, a white '06 Grand Vitara convertible conversion! Don't get me wrong, the new Grand Vitara is a decent-looking vehicle, but this monstrosity was just ... just ... ah, mere words cannot convey its absolute loathesomeness

author: navigator89
text:
and boy, the car scene sure is different from the Middle East! I'm seeing all these cars that aren't sold in the ME, and its great! So far I've seen....
Malibus, Cobalts, Equinoxes, Siennas, Quests, Highlanders, Matrixes, Vibes, Allures, G6s, Grand Prixs, and a few others.
As for 2006/2007 models,
- silver Ridgeline
- purple HHR
- 3 Civics, 2 grey, 1 blue
- black Lucerne at dealer
- 2 Torrents, in grey and white
- 2 Calibers in red and blue
- 2 07 Camrys in silver
- blue 07 ES350
- black Impala SS
- grey M35x

Now I'm just waiting to spot things like a Fusion, Solstice, CX-7, Commander, FJ Cruiser.

author: fintail
text: I saw a Phaeton yesteday. Not new, but still unusual. I see more Ferraris or Lamborginis or Bentleys than I do Phaetons.

author: fintail
text: It's funny, if I visited Kuwait or elsewhere in that area, I'd probably be as excited at all the cars you would consider normal and boring. You might be the first person to care about seeing a current Grand Prix!

author: british_rover
text: Huh I saw a Pheaeton today to at Big lots of all places. I actually liked the Pheaton thought it was better looking then the A8.

author: fintail
text: I don't mind them either...very understated, and a great interior. However, the marketing/positioning aspect of the car doomed it so resale will be disastrous...might be a good used buy soon. A friend of mine wants one...he keeps track of used ones on offer...he's seen them down to around 40K now. They'll be less than half that in a couple years I bet.

author: british_rover
text: If I got one it would have to have the TDI v10 did they import that model?

author: derrado1
text: Ah bah bah... you're looking at a huge Pontiac Grand Prix fan here. Yes, I know they're crap, I like them anyway. :P

author: british_rover
text: I always liked the Grand Prix and the Bonneville. Even better with the SC motor.

author: fintail
text:
Nope, we never got a diesel

I hear that V10 diesel is a sweet unit

author: fintail
text:
I like those cars too...through about 1970 or so. Pretty hard times after that.

An old coworker of mine had an immaculate 91 Bonneville, whatever the top of the line model was. It had a very cheesy leather interior, strange bolstering.

author: fintail
text: I saw something odd this evening...I'm sitting at a light, and I notice something odd coming up behind me. It looked like a Rolls Phantom, but as it got closer it looked too small, somehow. As it got close I could see why...it was a Chrysler 300 with a Rolls style front end. The headlights and grille were both fake Rolls. It turned before I could get a pic.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
2 Q7's in Boston Today. If someone told me that those suckers weighed 10 tons, I'd believe it. They looked awfully heavy as they lumbered along Mass ave. :sick:

Also, while not new, I saw two TR-6's, a couple of MGB's, a Delorean, and a Beautiful white 57' Chevy roaring down Storrow Dr.

author: british_rover
text:
Yeah the 1970s version of those were not so good. They got better throught he late 80s early 90's up untill today.

I still kind of like them actually one of the few GM products I would possibly buy new.

The 1991 model you saw was probably a SSE model bonne. For the day they were pretty advanced with digital dash, auto dimming rear view mirror and a bunch of other electronic stuff that is going to be broken now.

I agree the interior on those were a bit too pimped out.

The later SSEis were supercharged and had HUD units.

author: fintail
text:
That 91 was that kind of candy apple red-ish color that so many of those Bonne's recived back in the day. His was really mint...he had a hard time finding a buyer when he bought a Scion tC though. The interior had football-like leather and weird looking seats.

I remember the 92+ ones seemed pretty modern when new. But, just nothing to push my buttons.

author: lemko
text: I spotted a black Chrysler 300-C four-door convertible with the top down!!! It had a huge roll bar where the B-pillars would've been. I'm sure this was some kind of custom, but it's been a l-o-n-g time since I saw a new four-door convertible.

author: british_rover
text: Some company in Canada I think has been talks with DCX on making a four door convertiable out of the 300C. I think Motor Trend reported on it a few months ago.

author: stickguy
text: I saw one in NJ a few weeks back. Looks better with the top down (I saw it parked, than later on it drove by with the top down).

author: british_rover
text:
I think the idea that this company was proposing involved an electronic hardtop convertiable.

Looked good in pictures but who knows.

author: teds1
text:
I got a really good long look at a triple black M6 on the LIE yesterday. Yeah I know it's not the purest form (but it's still good looking), and supposedly the transmission sucks, and it's too much money, and an M3 is pretty much the same inside and just as fast... but it's pretty sexy all the same.

Also an NSX, Porsche 911 4s (always my favorite variant).

Also a tricked out Steeda Mustang, not sure what that means but I am going to look it up

author: quantifire
text: Spotted one today on I-5 in Sacramento, looks like it had Canadian plates. Nice looking, looked a lot like a beefier CR-V. It had similar back windows to the CR-V.

author: ateixeira
text:
OK, so we're driving around on July 4th looking for a dock on the water to watch some fireworks, and I drive by a bay-front house with not one but TWO Lamborghini Gallardos, one a roadster. Out front there was a Cayenne S, too.

I'm surprised the Cayenne was not a turbo.

No boat, but my guess is this guy was out on the water to see the fireworks.

Now that's quite a fleet!

-juice

author: fintail
text:
Drug runner?

I saw a silver Phaeton today, along with 3 Mazda 5s (I think that's what they are), a Yaris hatch, and a Fit

author: lemko
text: ...blue Ford Five Hundred and a white Pontiac G6.

author: gsemike
text:
Today I saw a Saturn Relay and a Trailblazer SS. I think that's the first that I've seen of each.

Lemko, how did you spot the 500 and G6? Those cars are so bland, I wouldn't notice them if they were sitting between my car and a white wall.

author: fintail
text: I saw a new Lexus ES Supercamry today...in a less than pleasant bright gold color. It was wearing a blacked-out panorama roof....hmmm where did I see that a few years ago...

author: teds1
text:
I went to a local Car Show out in Long Island which is totally cheating but since some of the best cars to be seen were actually parked outside the show, it's probably ok. Also almost none of these were new but certainly rare so you guys should appreciate it.
Bentley Conti GT, 2 58 Vettes, Cobra (continuation series not a kit), immaculate 914 Porsche, 69 El Camino (all parked outside).
Best stuff in the show was a GT500 Shelby, 58 Impala, 34 Packard, a bunch of well done Rat Rods, and a Yenko Camaro (whoa!)
On the LIE coming back I got a long look at a DB9 convertible and a Smoking light orange Elise on the Triboro bridge

author: british_rover
text:
a white Bentely Conntinental GT with a dark tan kind of camel colored interior.

and my camrea is at home.

author: gsemike
text: teds1, where was the car show? Is it a regular thing? I went to the Bellmore train station last Friday and it was quite impressive. There had to be 100 hundred cars that were worth a glance.

author: ateixeira
text:
I've seen a couple of these lately, they're becoming common.

Silver Tribeca yesterday, as well.

The CX7 I saw at Costco is not yet sold. I found out the dealer stores cars there.

-juice

author: teds1
text: It was a local thing in Mattituck on the North Fork put on by the lion's Club. There are usually 3-4 a summer like it out there

author: gsemike
text: Cool. Mattituck is one of the towns that I've never been to (as far as I know). Can I lure the wife there under the guise of it being a nice village to visit?

author: i_luv_toyota
text:
I saw my first Honda Fit the other day. Looks like a minivan that was left in the dryer too long. Can you say "Honey, I shrunk the minivan?"

Also saw a Mazda CX7 with dealer tags. Looks pretty decent until you see the back end and those ugly clear taillights! Look how Lexus messed up the RX with clear taillights, although the RX is just an ugly beast all around anyway.

author: derrado1
text:
Drove into the city today but didn't see anything that remarkable. Quite a few Priuses though, I think the city council owns a few.

On the way back, I saw a BMW X3 and I remembered how much I didn't like them. It's weird, I can't stand the X3, but I love the X5.

Our Taiwan-sourced facelifted Ford Escape has a really nice new interior, I noticed when I was on the net last night. Same console and dashboard (and same ugly circa 1995 Ford Probe steering wheel), but nice woodtrim, lights etc. It's weird, though, that over in the US the Tribute doesn't sell very well (correct me if I'm wrong) but over here it sells much better than the Ford Escape. But then, Mazda is enormously popular down under - often Number 4 in manufacturer overall sales, which is quite an achievement.

author: gsemike
text: Comparing the X5 to the X3, there are obvious signs of cost cutting that make it look really chintzy next to the X5. Those flat black bumpers don't even belong on a Suzuki.

author: natenj1971
text:
Saw a silver Acura RDX in traffic trying to get into NYC from the NJ turnpike this morning. Thought it was a subaru or mitsubishi outlander at first but it was indeed the RDX. The guy driving looked 900 years old.
It looks really tiny. Like Pinto Station wagon tiny.

author: fintail
text: I saw a new DTS today....double line redline tires, big (19 or 20) chromes, and a vinyl top. Cadillac, Cadillac, Cadillac style...

author: lemko
text:
Blame the owner, not Cadillac, for such tacky add-on trash. People who do stuff like that to their Caddies should have them confiscated and made to drive '86 Hyundai Excels.

Anyway, I spotted a gray Jaguar XK and a black VW Phaeton.

author: rockylee
text:
A silver Lucerne CXS, what looked like a ZR-1, and on my way home I saw a white brand new Camry.

Rocky

author: gsemike
text: I saw my first one yesterday. It's a closer relative of the Toureg than I thought. Correct me if I'm wrong, but they look very similar.

author: ateixeira
text:
The Q7 has a longer wheelbase, it's lower and longer, more car-like basically. I'm not sure if it gets all the off-road stuff that the Touareg gets, either.

I prefer the Q7. I'm not taking a $40k+ vehicle off road any time soon, and it has more room inside.

-juice

author: fintail
text: There's gotta be something Caddy can do about dealers defacing the cars

author: british_rover
text:
They share a platform from what I remember just like the Cayenne. I have seen a couple and I think they look like big whales espesialy in white.

I am sure we will get one in trade before the end of the year. Will be interesting to see how they drive.

The R-Class we took in trade drove like crap.

author: teds1
text:
Yesterday I saw some seriously rare cars including one I know was one of a kind.
First at lunch I saw a black Lambo Gallardo Spyder on a flatbed going down 3rd avenue... Someone is getting a very nice delivery.

Then I saw a 356 speedster Porsche kind of blinged out, coudn't tell if it was a kit or not but it sounded great

Finally the weirdest of all was Wyclef Jean's White G-class Maybach... That is not a mistake, a while back I read in one of those DUBesque magazines that the Haitian singer had installed a maybach like interior in a white G500 down to the logo on the grill and seats. It still looked like a Gelandewagen but with no external trim, a different and a satelite dish. Really odd and kind of ugly for a guy who has the taste to collect Zondas and the almighty F1 McLaren. Wyclef was not driving it and was not in the car.

author: chuck1959
text: Why should they? At least there are buyers for these cars they are "defacing".

author: fintail
text:
But at what expense to the image of the company?

Of course, the damage is already done.

author: chuck1959
text: Good point.

author: teds1
text: I can not believe that I saw my third Gallardo spyder yesterday and second in two days. I usually average a Lambo every three years or so in NYC because the streets tend to tear the bottoms off them and they are pretty rare anyway. Now I've seen three in two months (white black and yellow) Maybe there was an event or something and I just lucked out seeing all the arrivals. They sometimes drive exhibition cars down to the city rather than flat bed them.

author: ateixeira
text:
As much as they'd like to control that, they really can't. These are cash cows for dealers, I'm sure the markups are enough that they make more profit from these add-ons than they do from selling the car (none nowadays).

Dealers are also independently owned and operated. At most GM could try to limit the supply, but that hurts dealer relations.

-juice

author: fintail
text:
Maybe GM could just publicly bash or start a campaign against such nonsense. I am sure many potential customers have shook their heads at these cars, thinking the modernization of the brand is incomplete.

If I wanted that look, I'd buy a concours quality 75-76 or even a 77-78 Fleetwood and save 30 grand.

author: teds1
text:
"I am sure many potential customers have shook their heads at these cars, thinking the modernization of the brand is incomplete."

I don't know about that, it seems to me most people realize that this is not how the cars come these days or are supposed to look. People still buy civics after seeing them with tacky aftermarket wings and bolt on kits. GM can't really control the aftermarket and in fact should embrace certain aspects of it. The demand for landau tops will die out naturally very soon and it will be a non issue but I don't think it is detering other potential customers of Caddy's and the like.
The bigger issue IMO is that they have painted themselves into a corner with the love it or hate it styling. There is always going to be a % of the vehicle buying public who just doesn't like the look.

author: fintail
text:
Well, most pimped Civics aren't current model year, at least not around here. They also aren't trying to be prestige cars.

You're right about the styling though...I don't see the edgy for the sake of edgy look really being a hit. Different, yes, at a time when the brand needed a change. But nobody is copying it, and Caddy will end up abandoning it.

author: merc1
text:
The newly facelifted Saab 9-5. It doesn't look as bad as I thought it would in real life. You can tell the design is old though because of the long, flat hood and longish front overhang. Talk about cosmetic surgery, every body panel has been played with in search of a youthful appearance.

M

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw my first 4 door Rabbit (don't say Golf!) on the streets yesterday. Not bad, but what took so long? It's been in europe for years.

-juice

author: rockylee
text:
A 2000'(s)PBR Dodge Dulley pulling a trailer full of bulls. I think the driver was a professional Bull Rider and he had 2 trucks ahead of him with Rodeo gear and Bulls in front of him also. If my memory is working right the guys last name was Sims.

Rocky

author: prosa
text:
I spotted a distinct rarity in the driveway of a house not far from me, a silver 9-2x Aero. I thought at first it was an Outback Sport WRX model but then saw the Saab name on the rear. Of course it would've been immediately apparent had I been able to see the front instead of just the side and rear.

There also was a blue '06 Legacy in the driveway. Assuming both vehicles belonged to the same household the choice of the Saabaru instead of a WRX was sort of odd. After all the people must like Subarus, why not just go for the less-expensive WRX?

author: ateixeira
text:
Depends upon the timing. Last summer you could get a 9-2x Aero for $19.4k with employee pricing, and Saab tosses in 2 free years of service (though you give up the roof rack). That's cheaper than any WRX.

Even now I think you can get 6 years 0%.

-juice

author: ateixeira
text:
Not driving, but parked at Dulles airport in VA.

Also saw a Honda Fit and a new Caliber.

-juice

author: fintail
text: I saw another Phaeton today...not remarkable save for that it had German plates, front and back.

author: natenj1971
text: sage green rabbit going into the lincoln tunnel. Was a 4door. First one I have seen. Was a stripper model.

author: ateixeira
text:
I saw a couple of these over the past few days. Still not common, though.

-juice

author: odie6l
text:
My wife and I took the kids down to Dutch Wonderland (amusement park for little kids) on Thursday and among the 100's of gargantuan MINIvans was 1 Mazda5, and I just happened to end up parking my Escape next to it. My wife who has only seen it in the brochure thought it looked cute.

Odie
Odie's Carspace

author: kyfdx
text:
It looked like a new one.. in red, naturally..

As near as I could tell, it was a new F430.. 2-seat mid-engine model... In the major metropolis of Jonesboro, Arkansas.. :surprise:

author: british_rover
text:
I saw an F430 Spyder in "downtown" Torrington, CT.

Did not expect that at all.

author: kyfdx
text:
Yeah... I'm pulling out of a Burger King in my Honda, and my 12-year-old says, "Dad, look! A Ferrari!

I'm thinking.. Right, a Fiero with a body-kit... I'm not positive on the model, but it was new enough and exotic-looking enough for my son (who is a car-freak..go figure) to yell out that he thinks it is an Enzo..

Driven by a 20-something female.. In Podunk, USA.. Who would have guessed?

author: british_rover
text:
Hmhh wonder if it was a paddle shifter F1 style.

One of my customers waited an extra 6 months for his F430 so he could get one with a real manual tranny. He said he could not stand how unconnected he felt with the F1 style tranny.

author: lemko
text: ...and saw plenty of Buick Allures and a car that looks like an Aveo but has a Pontiac grille. Didn't see the nameplate. The Canadian Cobalt is the Pursuit.

author: chuck1959
text: I think it's possibly a Pontiac Wave? They come in hatchback and sedans IIRC.

author: navigator89
text:
a silver Mercedes S500 driving in the rain. That car has presence. Also a green Lexus ES 350.

I'm also seeing many FJ Cruisers. I saw one yesterday in blue, and it really stands out.

Best of all, I saw a red Jaguar E-Type yesterday. Looks really nice.

author: teds1
text:
I also saw a red 430 spyder in Greenport long island (little old whaling town two hours from Manhattan). Made a great noise but everyone else in the car couldn't understand why I was so exited... They don't get it.
Also was stuck on the highway yestaerday between a DB7 vantage and an Xk8 coupe (always liked it, tell me honestly lose the leather and electronics, drop it down an inch or two add a wing on the back, and that's a nice GT racer a la DBR-9)

author: fintail
text: I saw a black Flying Spur today....it was exhibiting poor lane manners, kind of weaving around in its own lane. I imagined the driver as the tipsy Mr. Howell character from 'It's a Mad Mad Mad Mad World'

author: chuck1959
text: Crossfire. The 5th one this month. I guess the owners are getting good deals on them?

author: alloway70
text: "Aveo but has a Pontiac grille"...Is the Pontiac Wave (hatch & sedan) although you can also get the Chevy Aveo in Canada...it's just like the old days of bad American rebadging..."The Canadian Cobalt is the Pursuit"...actually and again there is still the Chevy Cobalt in Canada, but also the Pontiac G5 Pursuit (Coupe). Check out www.gmcanada.com for all the latest re-badging. I'm sure American's will be driving a Pontiac G5 soon....

author: gsemike
text:
"I'm sure American's will be driving a Pontiac G5 soon...."

Well, GM will be selling it. How many people will actually be driving it, we'll see.

author: anythngbutgm
text: Hey, people bought the Sunfire for the years that IT was on the market... :confuse:

author: crimsona
text:
The Canadian Cobalt is still a Cobalt...

http://www.gmcanada.com/english/showroom/chev_cobalt.html

author: ateixeira
text:
Blue Honda Fit, looked nice.

A couple of Yaris sedans, too.

When will Versas start showing up?

-juice

author: astegman
text:
"When will Versas start showing up?"

I think I saw one this past Sunday (Wilton, Connecticut). Is that a new Nissan car? I was in a parking lot and stopped to let a car back out of its spot. It was a silver car, with the Nissan logo, and the name of the car on the left rear definitely started with a "V". At first I thought it said "Vespa," but of course that is not possible...then I thought it said "Vesta." Maybe it's time to go to the eye doctor!!

OK, a quick Google check confirms that yes, what I saw was indeed a Versa. Kinda small, sorta interesting looking.

author: ateixeira
text:
Yep, that's the one! :shades:

-juice

author: fintail
text: I saw that black SLR in traffic today...just a bizarre thing

author: navigator89
text: 3 Hyundai Santa Fe's at Kingscross Hyundai in Toronto. I saw a beige 3.3L AWD Limited for $31K. It really seems a good value, and the interior is great. I'm sure Hyundai will have no trouble selling this.

author: lemko
text: Spotted a bright yellow Lotus Elise on the way home from work yesterday.

author: gsemike
text: Is there a new Sata Fe coming out? I mean, 31 grand???? My God.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
I saw one of these near my work on the awu home last evening. Silver, looked pretty sharp but totally unoriginal. Front end was Infiniti-like while the hind quarters were very Toureg in style.

31 grand is a lot for that vehicle... But as Hyundai quality supposedly climbs, the value quotient appears to be dropping as Hyundai feels they can price their vehicles at or higher than the competition.

author: fintail
text:
$31K CDN, I assume. Hyundai better price carefully, as residuals are still very weak IIRC...

The current Santa Fe is a blobby nightmare, so the new one has to be better.

author: gsemike
text: I checked the Hyundia website. The top of the line models lists just under 26. It comes with alot of stuff, but once you add on awd, dvd, 3rd row I guess it could hit 31. It kind of looks like a big Suburu Forrester to me.

author: ateixeira
text:
Keep in mind the new model offers a 3rd row and looks a lot nicer than the outgoing one. It's grown up, now that the Tucson took the place of the old model.

Edmunds RAV4, which competes with it, stickered at $33.4k. With no 3rd row, no DVD player, and no GPS (not offered yet). So prices will probably hit $36k+ eventually.

-juice

author: derrado1
text:
Hyundai's Veracruz is going to be pretty big, I bet. The new Santa Fe looks nice, Hyundai's advertising a lot more here and they have these smart, effective ads for the Santa Fe where they say "Neighbourhood watch in Santa Fe" "Clubs in Santa Fe" etc etc

I saw a new RAV4 today. They look really nice, even if they do have a rear-mounted wheel. Between the new RAV and the new Camry, my respect of Toyota is increasing. And I have NEVER been a Toyota fan, they struck me as precisely the most non-enthusiast cars ever. Perhaps they still are, but at least they're more desirable. The new Corolla better not disappoint, it's in a tough segment (can anyone say "Mazda3"?)

author: ateixeira
text:
Their new 3.5l V6 is a gem - both powerful and fuel efficient. Very competitive.

Saw a Caliber while out at lunch.

A Honda Fit as well.

-juice

author: toomanyfumes
text: A new S600 in black parked in a driveway a few houses down. I don't like the wheel arches, the previous model is a cleaner design.

author: fintail
text:
I saw a Versa today...very French looking.

I saw another Flying Spur yesterday.

author: chuck1959
text: I noticed yesterday an elderly lady in my condo complex bought a red Caliber....she traded a year old Neon.

author: gsemike
text:
I saw a couple of S550s this weekend and agree with you. What is up with the front fenders. The back is pretty Maybachish and looks good.

I'm also starting to see a few Fits. There is a package that steps you up from the base models that gets body accets and rims. That is a must have for those cars.

author: logic1
text:
Could tell it was the forthcoming model as it had the fog lights incorporated in the bumper, was slightly larger than the existing wrangler, and had the three part plastic roof.

This one was a shiny red model. Maybe a bit too shiny for a jeep. The overall look is more aggressive if that is possible. It was going by just fast enough I could not get a real good look at the new interior.

The Wrangler had Michigan plates. I imagine it is either an early production or pre-production model in Manhattan for some promotion or another.

All in all, I would say Daimler has done a good job updating an icon without going to far. Now if only Daimler would hurry up with the emissions legal diesel already!

author: ateixeira
text: Looks like these are becoming common...

author: fintail
text: I saw another Flying Spur this morning...that makes 3 in the past week. A black one, a silver one, and today's was a light gold kind of like MB desert silver.

author: ateixeira
text:
I saw a Rolls Royce on I-270 yesterday, told my wife it costs more than our condo! :surprise:

-juice

author: fintail
text: Are W221 (new S-class) AMG cars out yet? I swear I saw one today...it had larger than normal wheels, it looked to be sitting more aggressively, and the roof panel almost looked blacked out or something. The car was gray, and pretty sharp.

author: teds1
text:
So the chairman of the NYC MTA Peter Kalikow (who made a lot of money as a real estate developer first) commisioned a special one of a kind Ferrari from pininfarina. It is a rebodied scaglietti but the changes are very subtle although a lot was done. Edmunds and several other sites had pieces about it. very cool very exclusive etc...
Well it drove by me this morniing on my way to work... Peter at the wheel of course.

author: fintail
text: Today I saw a Rabbit with Michigan plates...I'm probably 2000 miles from Michigan. I wonder what that was about...maybe a magazine fleet car on a long test drive?

author: fintail
text:
At lunch spotted another Flying Spur...this one kind of a medium grey.
And not the newest thing, but I saw a CLS55 AMG...these seem scarcer than other AMG cars. Also a normal CLS with awful blingy wheels with a driver who appeared to be maybe 17 years old...useless Medina or Yarrow Point trust funder maybe.

Also, I got behind a rental Impala LT, and noticed it had dual exhaust. Surprising.

author: lemko
text: ...a nice new silver Corvette driven by an equally attractive blonde lady. Also spotted white Cobalt coupe and black three-holer Lucerne.

author: lemko
text: ...two Mazda RX-8s: a silver one and a red one.

author: astegman
text: Saw one earlier this week in my town (in Connecticut). What a joke. The first thing I thought of was how nasty our New England winters can be, and how hilly our area is. Now I know some people are able to have more than one car, so I hope that the driver of this idiotic Smart thing has something else lined up for winter...or, is a snowbird and will take the Smart down south. Just a ridiculous vehicle - looks totally unsafe and screams out "Gimmick!" to me.

author: british_rover
text:
It is rear engine and rear wheel drive so with the traction control and ESP/DSC program I bet it will do pretty well in the winter.

I bet with snow tires it will do even better.

Depending on what part of CT you are in that could very well be my customer the car collector as well. He bought a smart about four months ago in VT.

author: astegman
text:
I live in Ridgefield, which is 10 miles south of Danbury, and about 60+ miles north of Manhattan.

I know you are a car expert (and what I know about cars fits on the head of a pin) so I will take your word that the Smart can perform in the snow, but boy, we have snowdrifts here bigger than that car!

Since your customer is a collector, then I will assume he's got other vehicles for the winter - the Smart just doesn't look safe at all, regardless of the season! I would think twice about driving it on a busy highway with trucks and the like. However, to each his/her own! If your customer - or any other Smart owner - loves the car, then more power to him!

author: gsemike
text: You see Samrts all over Europe and many of the Northern countries have winters just as bad as ours. They're usually driven in the cities, but they can handle the winter.

author: ateixeira
text:
The owner probably thinks all the Suburbans he sees with only the driver in it are even more ridiculous.

Smart ForTwo is a purpose-built commuter car, good at doing just that task. It's not a highway/trip/long distance car. It's an urban vehicle that's easy to park in tight spots, maneuverable, and fuel efficient.

If he's getting 60 mpg doing so, and that Suburban is getting 12, which one is the idiot?

And they're not necessarily unsafe, check out this impressive crash test video:

http://youtube.com/w/Crash-Test---Smart%2C-Opel-Corsa-%28Comparativa%29?v=Q3uv9a- 4t0rM&search=crash%20test

I work in DC, just 5 blocks from the White House. Believe me, around here a large US is a nuisance - there's simply nowhere to park 'em. You won't find street parking wide enough.

The Smart can squeeze in anywhere.

-juice

author: astegman
text:
*waving white flag* OK, OK, so I don't know jack about the Smart and have certainly been proved wrong regarding its safety and wintertime ability. Uncle, I say, uncle! I surrender.

As I said, if the owner/buyer loves the car - and it suits his needs - more power to him! As the saying goes, there's a lid for every pot.

That video was indeed pretty cool. I'm glad to see that the Smart did well in its crash tests - thank goodness! Happy and safe driving, all you Smart owners!

author: ateixeira
text:
What surprises me is the location - CT. 60 miles away from Manhattan?

I'm familiar with Stamford, Darien, Norwalk, and Milford, and none of those places seem like the ideal locale for a city car like that. Stamford may be close, but still.

-juice

author: british_rover
text:
Yeah I doubt that was my customer he lives near hartford proper and stores about half of his cars at his house and half at a warehouse.

I have another video for you.

Who speaks german??

Smart VS S-Class

author: astegman
text:
British Rover said his client bought one in Vermont...so go figure! I've been to enough cities in Europe to know that a car like that does indeed work quite well there - those crazy old narrow alleys and the like can't accomodate some large sedan. So, who knows...the guy I saw was driving north through town, heading towards parts even more rural (maybe back to Vermont, if it was British Rover's client? I didn't catch the license plate to see what state it was).

**I don't type fast enough; British Rover just posted that it couldn't have been his client...*** :confuse:

author: british_rover
text:
Oh it might have been I just doubt it. I know he drove the car down from VT to CT but I think right now he is keeping it in CT and not at his house in VT.

Hmhh and thursdays I think he works in Chicago anyway so could not be him at all.

author: navigator89
text:
a lot of cars in the past couple of days.

- maroon 2007 Yukon XL, and a beige 2007 Suburban, they look really good
- maroon Yukon
- 2 FJ Cruisers, in maroon and blue
- white Lucerne
- silver Fit
- 2 CX-7s, both silver
- 2 Santa Fe's, in navy blue and maroon

My hotel is right next to an automall featuring 10 dealers, so I've seen plenty of goodies already. They have a blue FJ Cruiser with a manual, 3 Avalanches, in LS, LT LTZ trim, lots of Fits with automatics, and 3 CX-7s, two silver and one black, no navigation. Also there are a few Santa Fe's and Entourages. I really want to see a CX-7 in Copper Red, silver doesnt do it justice. There was also what I think was a 2007 Chevrolet Aveo out there.

BTW, I also saw my first Acura RL in more than a month of me being here. It was beige. Also saw a white STS with the landau roof, or whatever you call it.

author: navigator89
text:
I posted a link to view my 2007 Chevrolet Aveo pics in the 2007 Chevrolet Aveo forum. You can view the pics at:

http://www.carspace.com/navigator89

author: lemko
text: ...white Honda Fit with Florida tags this morning.

author: astegman
text:
Hmhh and thursdays I think he works in Chicago anyway so could not be him at all.

British Rover, I saw the car last weekend...that would be pretty funny if it was your client - it's a very small world indeed.

author: british_rover
text:
Yeah that would be too funny too bad you did not see the plate.

What color was the Smart? I haven't seen his car so not sure what color it is but I will ask him next time I see him.

author: teds1
text:
Last night at a play I saw a red F430 in times square. There is no way in the world to call more attention to yourself than to rev your ferrari in times square. Kinda cheesy although at least he got the color and model (coupe) right.
Also I saw a rolls waiting for someone outside the theater and I'm not sure what it was. It was clearly pre phantom but looked like an arnage body. Only saw it from the front so no name plates. Any ideas what they were called pre phantom?

author: natenj1971
text: Saw a black VW Eos this morning. It was sitting in a lot on 120 in East Rutherford, NJ. Nissan, Toyota, VW all store new cars on the lot. It was still covered in the transport wrap.

author: matthattan1587
text:
Saw a new Dark Green Jeep Compass on Central Ave in Yonkers, NY.

Don't like the looks of it....resembles caliber too much.

author: astegman
text: I'm having a brain freeze regarding the color of the Smart I saw; maybe blue? When you're as old as I am (44), the mind starts getting fuzzy!! For some reason, I'm thinking it was two-toned - blue and white - is that possible? I simply can't recall. If you ask your client, see if he was driving north through Ridgefield on Route 116 (aka North Salem Road).

author: british_rover
text:
Yeah I will ask him. The Smart cars have interchangable pannels so you can change the color whenever you want.

My client only buys new cars that are black but his antiques are are a rainbow of colors.

author: fintail
text: That would be a Silver Seraph IIRC

author: fintail
text:
Last night I saw a Ford GT. Probably the same one I've seen around.

Today I saw an Audi RS4, or at least it was badged as such

author: chuck1959
text:
Just a ridiculous vehicle - looks totally unsafe and screams out "Gimmick!" to me.

I couldn't agree with you more! It certainly isn't a vehicle I'd ever consider. Not the way people here (Houston, Tx) drive. Can you just imagine getting rear ended by an Escalade!! :sick: Now if you lived in a small town (pop. 2000 and less)it would make more sense, but then again not all that much.

author: british_rover
text:
Getting rear ended by a big SUV in anything is pretty much going to ruin your day. In the Smart car you might at least have a chance to pull into the next lane and get out of the way because it is so small.

People used to ask me that all the time when I had the MINI. Aren't you worried about getting rear ended by a Suburban?

My normal answer was something like, "The trick is to drive it a bit more like a motorcycle since it is so small and easy to maneuver. If you are in a motorcycle and see someone coming up to fast on you you are going to either jump out of the way or pull the bike into the next lane."

Normally people would look at me with this dumb expression on their face and say something like, "Wow I never pay attention to what is going on behind me when I am stopped at a red light."

:confuse: How the human race has survived as long as it has blows my mind.

Additonaly the SMART is really more suited for very congested urban areas like New York, San Francisco, Chicago, Boston etc. Although I can see it being a great car to leave at say a lake house or beach house and also a great dingy car to pull behind a motor home.

author: navigator89
text: a white Lucerne rental from Enterprise, and a white 07 Camry XLE with Pennsylvania plates.

author: fintail
text: I saw a BMW Z4 coupe last night

author: lemko
text: ...if it was new, but it is very rare. I spotted a black VW Phaeton at the rest stop near the Lehigh Valley exit on the NE Extension of the PA Turnpike.

author: astegman
text: Saw one this past Saturday parked outside the Barnes & Noble in Danbury, CT. Not sure how "new" this vehicle is, but it seems unusual.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a base models with steel wheels. Not very common.

-juice

author: fintail
text: Not new, but I saw a latest version W220 S class - maybe an 05 or 06 model - with Hawaii plates. That must have been fun to ship over.

author: stickguy
text:
in a ritzy town in NJ, with an ungodly amount of wealth floating around, all kinds of stuff. Let's see what I can remember:

-A Phaeton
-A Quattroporte
- A driveway with a collection including an Aston coupe, Porsche turbo convert, a new Vette, and a couple of Range Rovers.
- More assorted RRs and convertible Mercs than I could keep track of.

Back home, a CX-7 on the road (not a dealer car). I like it!

author: navigator89
text:
at Niagara Falls, a beige 2007 Chevy Suburban, and a minute later, a beige GMC Yukon XL, also in beige. Also a white Cadillac Escalade. I think GM nailed the interior and exterior styling on it's new SUVs, as they really are class leaders now.

Also saw a couple of Calibers in red and white, and a few DTS in silver, black and white.

At Niagara Falls you see a lot of cars with American plates. Most are from NY, NJ, PA, OH, MI, but I also cars with plates from as far away as TX, FL, AL, VA, CA, NB.

author: lemko
text: ...this morning - black Mercedes R-Class.

author: british_rover
text: I am sorry. Did you manage to hang on to your breakfast.

author: fintail
text:
I saw 3 FJ Cruisers yesterday, and a Mercedes GL.

I probably see an R class every other day...perfect vehicle for the trophy wife who can't admit she needs a minivan.

author: ateixeira
text:
At the mall. Where else?

Saw a black Fit, too.

-juice

author: gsemike
text: They're starting to get around. That car really needs that sport package that adds the alloys and body accents.

author: ateixeira
text:
Agreed, problem is the price gets up around $16k, slightly more for the auto.

At that price, I'm looking at a Scion tC or a Mazda 3s.

But what do I know? Fit it selling briskly.

-juice

author: gsemike
text: I definately take the tC over it, but once you put the automatic in there, it's higher than 16, isn't it?

author: ateixeira
text:
Yes, both are over $16k with auto. The Fit is commanding MSRP, if you can even find one. That sort of kills the idea of getting a good value, at least to me it does.

I just think the others (tC, 3s) and more substantial, and the bigger engines can better handle the burden of a slushbox.

-juice

author: navigator89
text:
a bunch of Calibers in white, black, grey and red.

Regarding the Fit, I saw a bunch at the Automall Honda dealer yesterday. They all had automatic transmissions. I was kinda taken aback to see the price for that tiny car to be $19K CAD. For that money Im sure you could get something better and cheaper. A 4cyl Malibu was only slightly more there. I also saw a 2003 Lincoln LS V8 with nav and leather for about $20K. I'd rather take that than buy a small $20K car.

Anyway this is my last day in Toronto, so it's back to Kuwait for me. Time to start checking out the Ferraris, Porsches and Lamborghinis again.........

author: matthattan1587
text: I saw a new Acura RDX at Curry Acura in Scarsdale, NY.

author: gsemike
text: Be safe in Kuwait

author: cjshow
text: I spotted my first (and only so far) Honda Fit outside of the dealership at my apartment parking lot: it was a silver sport. Very nice looking in silver. I also saw a silver Dodge caliber at PetSmart: that thing is not a sub-compact. Looks more like a mid-sized to my eyes. I also saw a new Mazda 5 in green-silver. I didn't know what it was at first, especially with those huge taillights. Thought it was a spaceship. But the color was very nice. Still have yet to see a Versa on the dealer lots or on the streets.

author: stickguy
text:
Dark colored Charger. Not that notable, but this one belonged to the NY state police, and was sitting in the median of the Thruway.

ALso, a 300C super stretch limo. I think it looked better that way!

And a loaded up Denali, Black again. Actually, I spent 2 days riding around in it (it belongs to my BIL). Surprisingly nice inside, and a great V8 rumble, but tall and ponderous.

And who needs power folding 2nd row seats anyway?

author: lemko
text: ...if anybody makes a 300-C hearse? I can imagine seeing a 300-C hearse at the head of the funeral procession with a vanity plate that reads "Yeah...It's got a Hemi!"

author: fintail
text: I just remembered...a couple days ago I saw a Smart...not too noteworthy as several are running around my area...but this one sounded very much like a diesel.

author: ateixeira
text:
I've seen a couple more Calibers lately. They seem to be popular.

-juice

author: british_rover
text:
I saw another Pheaton today and then I ran across this video...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cLJKvfNeSiw

I must say this car impresses me a lot more now.

author: navigator89
text: and stopped over at Amsterdam on the way here. I did a city tour and saw some really neat cars like an old Volvo wagon, an old Mercdes sedan, and best of all a grey Lotus Exige!!!! Pictures to go up soon on my carspace. Also saw a black Caliber in Amsterdam. Nice change from all the European hatches you see there.

author: teds1
text:
Just got back from a Quebec road trip.
For starters it is kinda interesting to see the car culture differences up there (I used to live in MTl but didn't notice it as much) a bit more Euro with a small car focus.
I would say one out of every three cars on the road is a Mazda 3, so at least they have good taste
Plenty of smart cars (including the convertible) as well as others we don't get here like Nissan Xtrails, Ladas, Merc B classes (ugly if you ask me) etc...
Saw a bunch of mid engine Ferraris (like 7)in MTL and Quebec city, not surprising given the formula one popularity and the Mt. Tremblant driving school for ferrari owners.
also the same orange elise twice on two different days... It had to be the same one b/c we were in the middle of no where.
One of the coolest things I saw had to be a Red E-type Jag coupe pulling a camping trailer heading up North. Not exactly their intended purpose but what the hell right?

author: chuck1959
text: I saw a red GTO today....the first one in months.

author: fintail
text: I saw another Flying Spur today, dark blue and dirty

author: kyfdx
text:
..which isn't that amazing...

But, this was the new model (or old model with sport pkg) with the body color bumpers...

Looks better.. just enough black plastic near the bottom to look good..

author: lemko
text: ...a silver Lincoln Zephyr this morning.

author: rockylee
text:
Did you like it (Zephyr) ? I can't wait until you get to spot Rocky in a Lincoln MKS. :P

Rocky

author: lemko
text:
I've sat in one at the Philadelphia Auto Show

Likes:

Front end is decent.
Like the dashboard that appears to ape the classic 1961-64 Continental.

Dislikes:

Really a Mazda underneath.
Not nearly as nice-looking as the concept.
Back end looks too much like that of my Dad's lousy 1981 Thunderbird.
Cheesy prop rod for the hood.

author: gsemike
text:
I see alot of Zephyrs and I just don't get it. To me, I don't think that it looks like anymore of a premium car than a Mercury Milan. Not to be combative, but I hate the dashboard. It's too tall and blocky.

The proposed MKZ looks like a fancied up 500 to me.

author: fintail
text: Looking out on I-90 today (I've had ample time as the system I use has been down all day) I've seen a Ferrari 360/430, and something I wish I could have photographed - a dark blue Bentley GT on a flatbed tow truck.

author: gsemike
text:
I saw my first Versa this morning. Someone at my train station got one. It's grouped in with this new wave of micocars, but it doesn't look too micro. It was parked between a Caravan and a Durango and still looked pretty substantial.

The car had flat plastic hubcaps that cheapened the look. Everything can't have alloy wheels, but these were particularly bad. They should have something that looks more like a spoked wheel.

This particular one was a stick. The car doesn't have much of a console and the shifter looked like a straight metal rod sticking out of the floor, much like an old European car. I know that they have to do these things to meet price targets, but these shortfalls really stood out on a car that otherwise looked pretty nice.

author: derrado1
text:
You're thinking about the forthcoming MKS, which is based on the D3 platform, shared with the Ford Five Hundred/Freestyle, Mercury Montego and Volvo S80.

Styling is subjective but I like the front of the Zephyr/MKZ, and I LOVE the interior. It's unique and very striking, and looks best in the cream/light wood combination (it loses its presence in black). Now if the Zephyr/MKZ had RWD and a better engine (oh and shrink those taillights, while you're at it), I would probably buy it over a 3-Series/IS. Well, maybe. It'd be more of a heart purchase than a head.

author: stickguy
text:
a Versa near my house, I think the first one I have seen on the road. Looks nice.

And on the NY Thruway, heading North so probably with Canadian plates, a Nissan X-trail. Nicer looking than the stuff they sell hear, it would probably do OK these days with the right engine.

author: ateixeira
text:
I love how he pronounces it "FEE-Tawn".

While on vacation I spotted a lot of the new small cars - Caliber and Fit mostly.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...black Mercedes S600 V-12.

author: ateixeira
text:
I've seen a few of these around now, probably 3 or so total. Saw one this morning, just after seeing a new Boxster.

I prefer the roadster, but the look of the Cayman is growing on me. It's sure a lot nicer looking than the Z4 coupe.

-juice

author: merc1
text:
A nice big and pretty Chyrsler Aspen. I'll say one thing it is a lot prettier than the Durango will ever be.

M

author: anythngbutgm
text:
But over the weekend on a trip from SE MA to Burlington, VT I saw a black AMV8 Aston, a Maserati Quattroporte, and a Gray w/white stripe Saleen Mustang (absolutely gorgeous car)

For mainstream, I saw about 30 Ridgeline PU's, countless new RAV4's, 2 RDX's and about 2 dozen FJ cruisers (Those sell like gangbusters around here)

author: ateixeira
text:
It's funny you say that, because the face-lifted Durango is basically a clone of the Aspen with the Dodge grille. They actually look identical now.

-juice

author: ateixeira
text:
I've noticed a lot of FJs as well, but it might just be that they stand out so you notice every single one that passes by.

-juice

author: anythngbutgm
text: Absolutely, hard to miss. Even more so since the Hummers have pretty much disappeared from the landscape. I think I saw 1 H3 over the weekend and I can't remember the last time I saw an H2!

author: british_rover
text:
I saw a H2 lifted with probably 38x14.50 inch tires following a MINI Cooper S down the road the other night.

Talk about a comparisson.

author: ateixeira
text:
I see H3s once in a while, still not common though. I've seen 3 times as many FJs, or at least noticed 3 times as many.

-juice

author: kyfdx
text:
Had dealer plates.. first one I've spotted...

Is it a Pontiac G6 variant? Looks decent..

author: merc1
text:
Kinda ridiculous huh?

M

author: gsemike
text:
I took another PA trip yesterday. Driving 130 miles to work affords an opportunity to see what's out there.

Caddy XLR-V - Definately stands out but the exhaust note was surprisingly subdude. Doesn't look like 100k, but it is hot

Caddy Escalade - First one turned into a limo. Looked slightly smaller than a 747

Porsche Cayenne - Another limo. Didn't look to big and it wasn't white, so I don't know what it'd be used for

Saab 9-3 Wagon - Surprisingly small. It looked like a compact wagon

Porsche Cayman - Very sharp. Looks very agile. Has it's own personality. It's not just a wannabe 911 for those that can't afford the real thing.

author: lemko
text: ...black Cadillac Escalade EXT - looks a lot cleaner than the previous model. The new Avalanche is also a looker. It no longer appears as if it were the victim of a rockfall.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw another FJ parked on the streets of DC today.

Aura is on the G6's platform, but it's actually an Opel Vectra clone. So think of it as a euro-flavor G6.

-juice

author: ateixeira
text:
Also saw one of these lowered Blazers. So lame to put the Saab name on these...

-juice

author: subarufan1
text: spoted yesterday in silicon valley suburb maserati mc12 and ferarri enzo back to back! would really like to know who owns them?? there is a ferrari dealer in the town over, maybe a test drive?? forgot to note that the exhaust note was something straight from heaven, you can never imagine how sweet those cars sound, just amazing.

author: navigator89
text:
Spotted a greyish brown Chevrolet Tahoe LT, and then a white Cadillac Escalade with navigation, xenon and the 22" rims.

Also saw a black Kia Sedona, with Bahrain plates. It looks really long from the side. The cabin looks pretty good.

author: gsemike
text: I saw a new Suburban. It's hard to say why, but it looked more svelte than its predecessor. It's still humungous, but somehow looked more sleek.

author: ateixeira
text:
Only thing I don't like about the new Sedona (and Entourage) is the new headlights.

-juice

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Dimensionally, how much bigger is a School bus compared to the Suburban? Seriously, I can imagine parking the two of them next to one another and finding they are not different dimensionally. Unless I owned a 40ft Yacht or trailer, or just feel like taking my house for a spin every now and then, I can't fathom the idea of owning one of those. :confuse:

The new GMT-900 SUV's are extremely rare around these parts and when I do see one, it is driven by some 110lb trophy wife doing "a buck ten" down the highway blowing people of the damn road. :mad: Pointless, absolutley pointless.

author: chuck1959
text: I agree with you it is more svelte looking. IMO much better design...doesn't seem so "truck" like.

author: gsemike
text: It's funny. It looks more svelte when I'm walking by, but then when I stop and soak up the dimensions, it's freakin humongous.

author: ateixeira
text:
Did you ever hear that song, "90 lb Suburban Housewife Driving in Her SUV"?

It was hilarious. They put a country music background to it, but if they ever come out with a dance mix I'll buy it off iTunes.

-juice

author: teds1
text:
Redwood City has the world's largest ferrari dealership (look it up) My bro lives near there and he was taken me by to window shop (unfortunately no enzo that time but there was a superamerica which is almost as rare 500 made vs 300 enzos). There is so much silly money in that area nothing surprises me. I saw an add recently somewhere for a canary yellow McLaren f1 in Los Gatos.
I saw an MC12 at the ny auto show two years ago and it looks almost too much like a race car for my tastes. You really wouldn't want to drive it anywhere and the cookie monster blue interior is awful. However, one of my favorite top gear segments involves a wealth Brit sliding his around in the snow (minorly damaging it) hilarious if you can find it

author: anythngbutgm
text: No, but it sounds like a hoot. I'm gonna have to go look for that.

author: subarufan1
text: i went to this place today to look and there is an enzo in the showroom, maybe i could sell my house and live in the car? :P

author: bumpy
text:
Jeep Compass today. Looks nice from there (never did see the front), but wouldn't have known what it was except for the name on the bumper. The Pathfinder-style door handle in the c-pillar did look a bit odd. The Caliber and Compass would both look better if they swapped their back ends, though.

Also new to me, a LR Freelander. I was wondering why a Ford Escape had a rear-mount spare with a Land Rover tire cover. :P

author: ateixeira
text:
Noticed a Fit and a new FJ at the beach this weekend.

-juice

author: crimsona
text:
Went to the beach yesterday, told my friends who were coming later to look for the silver Fit (considering how rare they are, I thought it would have been easy).

Took forever for them to find me, in their words: "There's only one Fit, but there were 4 other cars that looked exactly the same (Suzuki Aerio, Chevy Aveo, Pontiac Wave)"

I sighed.

author: fintail
text: Today I spotted a black F430 Spider and a new face 911 convertible

author: teds1
text:
Random stuff
Black DB9 parked... even my car illiterate girlfriend was impressed, Buick Grand National (it lives in my neighborhood)
Not my sighting but my brother caled to ask what a Qvale Mangusta was b/c he was stuck in traffic behind one.
Bunch of FJs, Maybachs, etc... an M6
One very odd looking Acura RL. Did it get a facelift or have I just not seen one in a while?
Also a silver Gallardo in Naples FL last week.

author: merc1
text:
VW Eos....good looking car as usual for VWs. Can't help but think it of as a girly car though in same way of the old VW "Cabriolet".

M

author: british_rover
text:
Oh its not nearly as girly as the old cabrio or the current Beetle convertiable.

And you can get that wicked DSG gearbox in it as well.

author: ateixeira
text:
I'm with you on this, the powertrain alone will bring more male buyers than the Cabrio ever saw.

I was a bit surprised. For the price of a Pontiac G6, it seems closer to the Volvo hardtop.

Saw 2 Fits today, an orange one and a red one.

I wonder if gas prices dropping slow sales?

-juice

author: british_rover
text: We have a volvo dealer and a VW dealer. I haven't driven both of those new convertiables yet but I have sat in each one. Honestly for the money it would be the Eos all the way. The only real advantage the C70 seems to have is a more usable back seat but that is not worth 10,000 dollars more.

author: teds1
text: I like the new Volvo C70 more of the two. The eos looks a little boxy and weird to me. I have unfortunately spent waaaay too much time driving a new beetle (Mom's) and I have nothing but hatred for VWs these days. I know their recent quality issues are now well known but this car (a 2000 model year) is the biggest lemon I have ever encountered. You wouldn't believe how often simple mechanical stuff breaks at only 55k miles. At least it's a 5 speed. I'm just very wary of their products these days as a result.

author: teds1
text: Price being no object of course... Naturally I am not buying either of these "chick" cars anytime soon

author: ateixeira
text:
Volvo has their share of problems, too. I'm not sure that's a big advantage for them.

-juice

author: kyfdx
text: 4-door Sport model... Looks like a mini-Camry.. in some really light shade of green.. :surprise:

author: chuck1959
text: I like the Eos...but what kind of name is that! :confuse:

author: british_rover
text:
Eos was the titan goddes of the dawn from greek mythology.

http://www.greek-gods-and-goddesses.com/eos-the-goddess-of-dawn.html

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eos

Kind of makes sense as the entire fuction of Eos in Greek Myth was to open the gates for the sun to come into the world.

I think it is very fitting but if you hadn't studied greek myth then you wouldn't know that.

author: odie6l
text:
I saw a customized Scion xB convertable today. Boy howdy, Toyota should make that a true model, it was a sweet looking ride. Kinda reminded me of the older VW Cabriolet.

Odie
Odie's Carspace

author: kyfdx
text:
The new swoopier body....

Not as big a difference in person, as it seems in pictures..

author: chuck1959
text:
I think it is very fitting but if you hadn't studied greek myth then you wouldn't know that.

True! Thanks for the bit of education there.:) Now that you explained it....the name makes more sense now.

author: merc1
text:
Yeah I agree, but still that shape just isn't sporty enough IMO. I guess I'd want an R version.

M

author: gsemike
text:
The styling of the new G is definately evolutionary rather than revolutionary. I guess Infiniti thinks that they have a good thing going. I like the appearance of the new car and the interior is a major step forward. I'm told that the driving dynamics are greatly improved as well.

I want one!!!!!!!!!!

author: kyfdx
text: Black... in a restaurant parking lot..

author: merc1
text:
So what did you think of it? At times I think it is a good looking little truck in pictures, and I've only seen them on a carrier so far, not on the road.

M

author: kyfdx
text:
Well.... going by at 35 mph through an intersection, it looked pretty good...

It was one of those double-take things... So, didn't get a real good look at it... My initial thought is that it is attractive and sporty... Sort of like the Mazda CX-7, but with a little better proportions...

Too quick of a peek to get any details, though..

regards,
kyfdx

author: gsemike
text: What's up with the grill on those things? It looks like it's got broken teeth.

author: ateixeira
text:
One of the first I've seen on the roads...

-juice

author: teds1
text:
My first Ford GT, a Red one in the financial district near wall street. The guy had the engine cover up exposing all the goodies inside... very cool... One more supercar off my list to see in the wild... now if only I could get the elusive enzo...

I also saw two M5s today including one which drove by me twice... really great sound from that thing

author: navigator89
text:
Within the past 24 hours I had the chance to see all 3 of the new GM SUVs. Yesterday I watched a soccer match (Kuwait vs. Australia, Kuwait won 2-0) and as I was exiting I saw a bluish green Yukon. I really like the taillights and grille.

Then today I saw an Escalade in beige with those shiny factory rims. That's the first I've seen in that color, but I like black better. Also saw a grey Tahoe.

GM sure nailed the styling on these SUVs. Each has its own personality, the Tahoe looks tough, the Yukon is like a budget Escalade and the Escalade is the king of full size SUVs.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a light blue parked about a block away from my house. Must've been a parent of one of the kids at the local Elementary School, which was having an open house.

RAV4s are so abundant now, it's incredible. I must have seen about 6 of them this morning.

Also saw a Honda Fit.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...for Philly - a silver Suzuki Reno. Looks like they were trying to copy the Mazda 6 rear but slightly canted the taillights.

author: fintail
text: I saw a grey VW Eos last night...smaller than I expected.

author: ateixeira
text:
New or new-ish...

Impala - 2 of them, one a fleet car.

DTS - nice, I like the squared off corners. But it's still FWD so the STS would get my vote.

Jetta - but Rabbits are still rare.

5 series and a 3 sedan, still no coupe though.

LR3 and a Range Rover Sport.

HHR - still hasn't really grown on me. Wifey calls it the Clown Car.

Cobalt sedan. I hear we're getting a G5 coupe version for Pontiac.

SLK350. Nice.

XLR - pretty rare, but I've seen a couple lately.

Infiniti M45 - love it. Hadn't seen one in a while.

-juice

author: teds1
text: I had an early meeting this morning down here and I saw a flying Spur and a Z8 Alpina on their way in to work. Must be a nice way to commute. The Z8 had a dealer sticker from Southhampton so you know that the owner has a home out there as well as his sweet ride

author: british_rover
text:
New York to deliver a Range Rover yesterday I saw...

Two Lotos Elises one in bright yellow and the other in a neon lime green.

Blue Ferrari 612 Scaglietti.

and most unusual of all.

Two Hummer H2s actually towing something. One was towing a 30 foot trailer loaded up with equipment and another was towing a big trailer with a bobcat and some other equipment.

First time I have ever seen H2 towing anything besides a little utility trailer.

author: teds1
text:
Not new of course but yesterday on the LIE I saw a pair of 72' 3.0 Cs BMWs, perfectly restored... Gorgeous. I love these cars and I think they will appreciate in value really soon. I want to get one while they are still under $20k
Also a Cayman S next to our car. My Dad really liked it...(Here's hoping he has a 60th birthday crisis!)
Friday in two blocks in Manhattan I saw an M5, M6, CLS55, and two Maybachs... That is just ridiulous, who says NYC isn't a car loving town?

author: anythngbutgm
text: Silver and a white Acura RDX's, bunch of Ridgelines, RAV4's, a Mazda CX-7 and a slick Saleen Mustang. And my neighbor bought a new MX-5 (Miata) so we got to comparing notes. Very nice car.

author: fintail
text: I sae a black Bentley Flying Spur today. That's nothing too unusual in and of itself. This one had big 20"-ish blingy wheels. The driver had the window down, so I assumed it might be one of our always-choking pro athletes showing off a prize paid for indirectly via taxpayer funds. But instead the guy driving it looked to be a solid 75-80 years old. Seemed kinda silly.

author: merc1
text:
Probably his son's (an always-choking pro athlete) car..lol!

M

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw an orange one and then a red one, same day.

-juice

author: navigator89
text:
a white Bentley Continental, silver Lexus ES350 and beige Kia Optima 2.4

Best of all, I saw a white Mercedes E55 AMG, my first one seen. The only AMGs I ever see are SLs.

author: kyfdx
text:
..the new one..

I like how you can be green with Honda, and still drive a normal car..

author: fintail
text: Today's beauty - a new style DTS, blingy chrome wheels, redline tires, pearl white paint, thickly padded brown vinyl top, gold emblems. The only way to travel is Cadillac style!

author: rockylee
text:
Hold the vinyl top for me.

Rocky

author: merc1
text:
The Cadillac dealer here has a convertible DTS, has had it for a while. I might get some pics of it.

M

author: fintail
text: I bet the cowl shake is audible.

author: rockylee
text:
I'd also like to see picks of that.

Rocky

author: kyfdx
text:
Infiniti Q45 (I never see these)

Bentley 4-door... No idea what the model is... looked new.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a BMW Z8 today, parked right in front of my house! Right behind my Miata.

I'm not sure if the next door neighbor had an overnight guest, or if the house across the street sold to the owner of the Z8, but it was there overnight.

I'll have to find out tonight, I know enough people to figure out who it belongs to.

-juice

author: ateixeira
text:
I see a lot of these, two in the last 24 hours. Maybe I see the same ones over and over, but I run across them frequently.

-juice

author: british_rover
text: Also saw a Z8 yesterday accelerating out of a shopping mall. Man those things have a nice sound.

author: ateixeira
text:
I've only seen them parked, never driving. The other one I saw was at a Marina in Ocean City, right next to Harpoon Hannah's.

-juice

author: gsemike
text: I just saw a nice A6 L is double black. It was so new that it still had the temporary tags on it. I'm not sure what the L means, but it definately looked like a premium car.

author: british_rover
text:
Hmhh Sure it was not a A8 L? I don't think they make a A6 L.

The L referes to long wheelbase version of the A8.

author: navigator89
text:
Spotted grey 2007 Yukon and Tahoe.

Also a white Bentley Continental GT, with those optional chrome wheels. Looked really nice although I'd take mine in black.

author: gsemike
text:
I saw a black M6 on the street today. That car is really something. My God, it looks mean.

I'm pretty sure that car I saw this morning was an A6 L but I could have been mistaken. If you google A6 L, there are a few results for it but nothing on the Audi USA site.

author: chuck1959
text: 2 VW Tourangs one silver 1 black....first time I saw 2 in one day!

author: jaserb
text:
That's Power Retractable Hard Top, y'all. I saw it at the dealer when I went to pick up my truck from being serviced. It almost came home with me. This was a copper red 6 speed Grand Touring with the tan leather interior. The sales guy made it do its folding top routine for me and man, was it ever cool.

This is going to be Mazda's secret weapon against the Kappa cars. Totally loaded up WITH the hardtop it barely cracked $26k! So much for the Pontiac G6 being the only retractable hardtop under $30k.

-Jason

author: anythngbutgm
text: 26 grand for the H/T Miata is a bargain. :surprise:

author: lemko
text: ...big black Audi A8 driven by a dude that looked like some captain of industry.

author: kyfdx
text:
Acura RDX... in white..

I'm ambivalent.. :confuse:

author: british_rover
text: Hmhhh that does sound like a very good bargin.

author: ateixeira
text:
The long one, brand new in black. They're so gigantic next to my Miata.

-juice

author: jaserb
text:
