The amazing thing is that they were able to avoid the usual drawback to retractable hardtops - it takes up no trunk space. It folds in roughly the same location as the clothtop. In fact, the PHRT has slightly MORE trunk space than a standard Miata, since the deck lid is a bit higher.

-Jason

author: merc1
text:
The Q7, rolling along side me for the first time. Gorgeous.

M

author: lemko
text: ...first Toyota Camry Hybrid I've ever seen. However, it was on parked to the curb and hit in two places - once in the left rear corner of the back bumper and in the driver's door. Must've just happened that morning. Aren't there special procedures firefighters must follow when a hybrid is in an accident?

author: anythngbutgm
text:
In the spring I witnessed a 2006 Honda Civic Hybrid get sideswiped by another car (Buick Lacrosse). T-boned the guy at an intersection, hit him probably at 40mph. Wiped out the whole side of the car and the impact caused the backend to swing around and tag the opposite side rear quarter of the car, right where the cells were located. It was pretty bad, but the battery pack remained intact and a typical flatbed came and picked up the car. There were no special treatments like roping off, laying down PIG mats or guys running around in orange jumpsuits. Just two guys and a wrecker.

Oh, and once the wreck was taken away, the guy hopped into his wifes car (who showed up in the meantime) and left. The lady in the Buick left in an ambulance.

author: chuck1959
text:
WOW! Just like that VW Jetta commercial!
Actually I had been wondering about how a hybrid would do in a crash like that. No the mess I thought with the battery pack.

author: british_rover
text: If they have to cut into the vehicle with the jaws of life they need to be more careful and follow some special procedures but that is it.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Yeah, it was pretty wild. I was waiting at an inspection station getting stickers done on my cars. I heard the initial hit and when I looked up I caught the rear end swing away and crunch a telephone pole. The pole pretty much obliterated the trunk section and the battery pack was exposed through the trunk lid which blew open in the crash.

I was expecting much worse results being that it was the first accident involving a hybrid that I had seen. But the crew in the wrecker treated it just like any other accident.

author: ateixeira
text:
Not for minor damage like a bumper and a door skin. Maybe if the batteries are compromised, but that would take a pretty major crash.

Every car has 'em, hybrids just have a few more.

Saw a black MX-5 at lunch, looked very sharp. I think she was paddle shifting, so automatic.

-juice

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw an blue S4, then an A3.

Then a red Fit.

Then a brand new S class. Those are growing on me. They look better in person than in pictures.

Another RAV4 (I see millions).

BMW 3 series, sedan though.

-juice

author: teds1
text:
Saw a brand new maroon S-Class. I actually liked it, it kinda suits the big girl.
Viper in midtown traffic, and a Rolls Corniche yesterday.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a new Bentley Conty GT coupe this morning. Light blue. Nice.

-juice

author: navigator89
text: Spotted two white 07 Camrys and an 07 Tahoe.

author: derrado1
text:
No matter what country we dwell in, I think we've all seen tons of the new RAV4s. I bet navigator89 even sees a few in Kuwait. Usually where I live is a bit slow with rotation of cars, but even I have seen tons. More so than new Camrys or Commodores or anything.

I must say, I usually find Toyotas deeply unattractive ('01-'06 Camry, Lexus ES, Corolla) even though they do have their good points... but the new RAV4 and Camry are pretty damn good in my books! Especially now that Camrys are equipped with handling, and now feature those fancy wheels that, oh, actually look proportionate to the rest of the car.

author: merc1
text:
Hyundai Santa Fe, looks like every other SUV on the road, but nothing about it offends.

M

author: gsemike
text: To me, the front actually looks kind of Suburu-ish. It actually would have been a good addition to Subie's lineup. Not having that size SUV is a surprising gap in their lineup.

author: rockylee
text:
I was on my way to work and I believe it was blueish Aura I saw heading the other way on HWY 287.

Rocky

author: lemko
text: ...a blue Hummer H3 with "0%/60" in vinyl letters on the windshield. Probably being test driven by some chump lulled into a false sense of security by (temporarily) lower fuel prices.

author: rockylee
text:
Hey, what's wrong with a H3 ? It gets over 20 mpg.

Rocky

author: ateixeira
text:
Tribeca is a bit bigger, Forester a bit smaller.

The next Forester (due for MY08) should grow in wheelbase and might be that big, though Hyundai slotted the Tucson in to the compact segment.

I've seen maybe two new Santa Fes, and I like them. Big improvement over the strange looking predecessor.

-juice

author: stickguy
text: Saturn Aura, and Volvo C70 (hardtop up since it was raining).

author: teds1
text: Oh good god was it sweet... It looks so much more intense than any other A4. Even the seat stiching looks fast. This one was in a ridiculous royal/sky blue that you have to see in person... very cool car

author: rockylee
text:
stickguy, Did you get a good look at both ?

I'd like to see a C70 in person. The Aura, which I believe I saw the other day was cool. It was smooth and wasn't so bland like the camcords IMHO.

Rocky

author: fintail
text: I've seen 2 R class so far today...probably the only place in the world they are selling

author: rockylee
text:
Well not everyone is rich like y'all up their rubbing elbows with Gates. :P

Rocky

author: stickguy
text: The C70 was parked a few spots down, and I only saw the rear end. The Saturn passed me so I mostly caught the rear end as it passed by.

author: fintail
text: It's all the trophy wives here. Get a gussied up minivan, slap a star on it, and it will sell. They also love the new Mercedes GL, I've been seeing those a lot lately too.

author: rockylee
text:
ROTFLMAO- So to be a star, by god you better drive one and it better be brand new.

Well at least Mercedes, has a few sales working for them. The same can't be said about the Chrysler end.

Rocky

author: british_rover
text:
You can lease a well equiped R-Class for about 350 a month if you don't need a lot of miles.

One of the wholesalers we work with was at the mercedes dealership doing some business. As they were finishing up the GM told him they were one sale away from hitting a bonus incentive from Mercedes. They told him he couldn't leave till he bought a car.

He was like no way I am not buying a car today I don't need one. The GM says I can get you into a R-500 for about 400 bucks a month but for you and to hit the bonus level I will cut it down to dead cost and make it 350 a month.

He thinks about it for a minute and then just decides to do it. He wholesaled his wife's navigator away the next week.

author: fintail
text:
Wow, that's quite a deal. Not my kind of vehicle, but for that money...a no-brainer.

I bet there are some sweet deals on the last of the W220 S-class too. I remember last year some 699/month leases on them.

"Well at least Mercedes, has a few sales working for them. The same can't be said about the Chrysler end."

That's true...I might not agree with everything MB does, but they seem to be doing relatively OK now. The new S is a hit, and the 6.3 engines look excellent.

author: rockylee
text:
I still want that Big Body Benz S600? you showed me a few months ago fintail. You need to be a pal and pick that one up for me. :blush:

Rocky

author: fintail
text:
Get the wrong one and your maintenance will come close to leasing a nice new Acura... An old V12 has to be some kind of labor of love, as they offer very little over a V8. I don't think the new ones are any different either. I talked to the guy who runs the independent MB shop where my cars go...says he has a customer with a W220 S600...every time it comes in for routine maintenance something needs fixing.

Are you talking about that James Bond style rig? I want that one too.

author: rockylee
text:
Get the wrong one and your maintenance will come close to leasing a nice new Acura

So it really is that expensive....Ouch !!!

An old V12 has to be some kind of labor of love, as they offer very little over a V8.

So the S500 V-8 pretty maintence free ?

I don't think the new ones are any different either. I talked to the guy who runs the independent MB shop where my cars go...says he has a customer with a W220 S600...every time it comes in for routine maintenance something needs fixing.

Why are they so unreliable I wonder ? One would think the German Engineering would yield very reliability. :surprise:

Are you talking about that James Bond style rig? I want that one too.

Yeah I think that is the one pal. :blush: I'm amazed the Germans couldn't engineer a superb V-12. :confuse: They engineered the greatest engine ever in the ZR-1 LT-5. I suppose that engine wasn't without flaws since it was known for blown head gaskets which were $1500 mininum a pop. :surprise:

Rocky

author: fintail
text:
It's an old extremely complex car. It will not be like a Civic from the same period. No MB is maintenance free, even the diesels require some tuning from time to time. All of that engineeing creates a painfully complex car, and there's usually an inverse relationship between complexity and reliability. It's just that they drive so well when everything is working, and people get hooked.

The engines themselves are almost always fine...it's the electricals and a few ancillary systems such as HVAC that are usually the problem. MB create this myth about lifetime transmission fluid in some 90s era cars that causes failures, too.

author: rockylee
text:
Well if I rich like you, I think I'd like to own a Big Body S600 V-12 to see what that ownership is all about. :shades:

Rocky

author: fintail
text: Just keep a few grand in savings for when the car gives you a surprise. You could handle it, although I doubt there's a good MB mechanic in your little town

author: ateixeira
text:
Seems smaller in person.

-juice

author: rockylee
text:
Fintail,

I will have you come down and diagnose and fix my S600 Big Body V-12. Yeah Fintail, I think I'd like to own a Black S600 though.

Rocky

P.S. How much are they pal....A low mileage copy ? Weren't they like $140,000 new ?

author: bumpy
text: An S600 will eat you out of house and home. You need to get a nice S420. The maintenance requirements on one of those will be merely prodigious instead of ruinous.

author: rockylee
text:
A S420 has no power. The lowest model I'd consider might be a S500. I'd love to have a S600, but agree it would eat me out of house and home.

Rocky

author: rockylee
text:
Can you buy a warranty for them ?

Rocky

author: bumpy
text:
If you want fast, then you have to pay for fast. An S500 isn't going faster enough than an S420 to be worth the extra pennies.

You can get an aftermarket warranty for just about anything you want, but you will pay for it. If you want a V12 luxobarge with low maintenance needs, then the Toyota Century is your only option.

author: rockylee
text:
ROTFFLMAO !!!!! You showed me that "pile" I think a while back. I'd rather pay through the nose on a V-12 Benz over a Japanese mock Benz. Did they even sell those cars over here ? If so I don't remember them. I really appreciate the suggestion pal, but I just find those cars amusing so don't take offense because I'm not laughing at you. Only the car. It almost reminds me of a Chin-E Class car :P

Neways are the 750 IL Bimmers in the same boat with there
V-12 ? Hell I would appreciate some charity so I can get my dream car a Ferrari 512 TR. It has a Straight 12 right ? The Ferrari 512TR is by far and away the Sexiest automobile ever made and god willing I will own one someday.

Rocky

author: fintail
text:
You should be able to find a really pristine late W140 S600 in the 20s. Heck, I've seen 2002 S600s for just over 40K. I kinda like the strange wheel design they have, but nothing else makes me excited. You pay an awful lot for a marginal performance gain, and you get bad mileage and psychotic maintenance costs as a free gift. V12 just seems silly to me. You'll barely notice the difference over a S420 or S500. The later S320s aren't too bad either, on the road. It's a big boat, so it's hard to feel performance.

A W140 600SEL was maybe 120K back ca. 1993. Prices didn't change a lot through the model run, and even today they aren't a whole lot more.

author: rockylee
text:
So the W140 is the Big Body Benz like the one Princess Diana died in ? Like the James Bond car you showed me ? How much is a S500 Big Body ? It had a 5.0 V-8 rated at 302 hp right ? Wasn't the V-12 rated at 389 hp ?

How much are the SL's ? Aren't they hardtops ?

Rocky

author: fintail
text:
Yeah, that's a W140. Diana was in a lowline S280 IIRC. I can't imagine the mintest S500 bringing 20K anymore, even one with the bugs sorted out - they have a knack for a couple HVAC and wiring issues. I think you are right on those power ratings, yes.

Nice SLs from the late 90s are usually in the 20s. That style ceased in 2002, some of the last ones still carry high 30-40K prices, especially the final "silver arrow" editions. They are removeable hardtops.

author: rockylee
text:
Okay thanx. I was very fond of them in my teen years.

Yeah the S500 would be a nice choice I suppose. I've always like the SL's alot. The only difference between a S500 and S600 is the engines right ?

Rocky

author: bumpy
text:
Neways are the 750 IL Bimmers in the same boat with there V-12 ?

BMW's are even worse. Ferraris are ten times worse than that. :surprise: :sick:

Sorry Rocky, apart from the Toyota and the old GMC Twin Six, the terms "v12" and "low maintenance" simply don't belong together.

author: rockylee
text:
What in the hell is a GMC twin six ? :surprise:

Rocky ??????? :confuse:

author: rockylee
text:
Ferrari's only rquire a oil change every 3K and a tune-up every 100k whether it needs it or not. :blush: J/K

Rocky

author: fintail
text:
I was fond of them as a teen too.

Those old SLs are classy beasts, like all SLs the design is aging well, and they are still old school in design and engineering.

An S500 could have a few less gadgets than a S600, and I have seen many two tone interiors in the 600 cars, never one in a 500. But from the outside, the only difference is a badge, yes.

author: rockylee
text:
So is a S600 going to break down every few months fintail ?
How much a yr. for repairs would you est. ? "Only if you know owners of them like friends of course"

Rocky

author: bumpy
text: BIIIIIG (11.5 liters) truck motor. You could get them in crackerboxes and stuff in the early 1960s.

author: rockylee
text:
LOL, okay....thanx....I never heard of them before. :blush:

Rocky

author: fintail
text:
Not so much breaking down as just developing little issues. The AC might stop working or some electricals may die. I'd budget maybe 2-3K year for maintenance and repairs...IF the known bugs have already been dealt with. If you drive a lot, increase that number...I'm talking for maybe 10K miles per year.

I believe MB was on the lifetime transmission fluid lie by the end of W140 production too, so make sure it is changed by maybe 50-60K miles...a tranny one one of these has to run 5K.

author: rockylee
text:
OUCH !!! Now you guys aren't a kiddin' on repair costs. I was figuring $1-2K annually. Are C43's that expensive ? How much for one like your AMG Fintail ?

Rocky

author: fintail
text:
A C43 won't be so much. Not as complex, and the hand-built engines are pretty solid. Just keep the transmission serviced and do everything else by the book.

I've had mine for over a year now. In that time I've had a couple of $90 oil changes (8 qts synthetic, I'm too lazy to do it myself and I have the 'I live in an apartment' excuse), and a 60K mile service (I did it early becaus of age), which came to $600 or so, and included maintenance of a sticky gear in the starter. The starter issue (sometimes you'd have to turn the key a couple times to get it to recognize you were trying to start it) has been my only repair. It's been a very reliable car. A super-pristine lower mileage C43, and by that I mean one I would consider nice, should be 18-20K,

author: rockylee
text:
So the C43 is a AMG right ? What is the hp rating if you don't mind me asking ? 0-60 if you know ?

Rocky

author: fintail
text: Yes, it's AMG, with no supercharger. HP is officially 302, same for torque. 0-60 in 5.8 or so. Back in its day, that was really something.

author: rockylee
text:
It still is something... I saw Michael Jordan about 8 or 9 years ago driving a White CL600. I've always thought they were cool. I'm sure they are just as costly as the Big Body's :sick:

Rocky

author: fintail
text: A coupe runs maybe 20% more than a sedan. Those S/CL coupes are weird...they are kind of ugly in a way, but at the same time I kind of like them. Maintenance would be the same, yes,

author: rockylee
text:
:sick:

Neways

What about those CLK convertibles from a few years back.
(4-5 seater) I kinda like them. I'd want a AMG one of course. They were sharp. :blush: Have you looked at them to see how expensive they are ?

Rocky

author: fintail
text: A nice CLK55 AMG should run you in the 30s, same engine as a period E55, so it's a decent unit.

author: rockylee
text:
That wouldn't be a bad choice then. I think they are rated at 362 hp. too. So it would be pretty fast. I might have to look into those also pal. 2001 was the first yr. right ?

Back a few years ago when they first came out I liked the Bose subwoofer that was placed in-between the seats in the rear.

Rocky

author: kyfdx
text: ... spot a NEW model?

author: rockylee
text:
My wife said she saw a new Dodge Charger and what she thought was a Shelby Mustang GT 500 on her errands.

Rocky

author: phinneas519
text: I just saw a black one of these today while running an errand. Normally not a big deal, but this is northcentral Wisconsin. :P

author: fintail
text:
Yeah, 2001 for those.

I saw another new-front Navigator lately, and a nice grey W221 S-class...it's grown on me. Lots of the new GM big SUVs around, the profesional shoppers/trophies are eating them up.

author: cluedweasel
text: I saw a new Smart Car here in Bend, Oregon yesterday. Saw a Citroen 2CV too. And a new White Bentley. It's all happening here

author: kyfdx
text:
In my little suburb...

Bentley Continental GT.. :surprise:

Wow

author: rockylee
text:
You hosts probably get one as a company car.

Rocky

author: kyfdx
text:
Plus... a manicurist is on staff full-time... painting my toe-nails, as we speak..

Jeeves!! Another bottle of Cristal, please!! chop-chop!!

author: rockylee
text:
I wouldn't doubt it.

Rocky

P.S.

Wife saw a new red Corvette, while she was running errands today

author: navigator89
text:
a beige Tahoe, and a BMW 760Li V12. Wow, that car is loooooong and really has presence. That was the first I've seen.

Also saw a previous generation Escalade EXT truck, sadly the rear two tires were flat.

author: kyfdx
text:
Toyota Camry Hybrid..

Porsche Cayenne with a rear-mounted spare... Never seen that before..

author: british_rover
text:
Porsche Cayenne with a rear-mounted spare... Never seen that before..

Means they have the off-road tech package.

author: kyfdx
text: Really? I've never seen one before... This one had the tire exposed, but it had a body-colored piece behind it.. It looked like it probably had a front piece that covered the tire, as well... but, just didn't have it attached..

author: british_rover
text: I took one in trade once. The cayenne is worthless off-road unless you get the off-road tech package. I think there are two versions of it and the advanced off-road package actually makes the Cayenne a pretty formidable vehicle in the dirt.

author: jaserb
text:
Looks a lot like a Saturn Vue.

Only difference is that it gets to drive in the HOV lane with only one person on board, even though there are conventional gas cars that use less gas AND have fewer emissions. 'Splain that one to me...

-Jason

author: teds1
text:
This had to be one of the first ones imported, they JUST came out. The guy had a silver one parked showing it to his friends. I couldn't tell if it was the 335 from my angle but I think it was due to the aggressive wheel and tire package it was sporting. He got an automatic though... the putz.
Actually it looks way better than in pictures. It is significantly larger than the last version in my eyes and has a distinctive look from the sedan, even from the front.
The gap between the trailing edge of the door and the rear fender is not so bad in person. Pretty sharp looking but I'd still rather have the last gen M3 right now if it came down to it.

author: teds1
text:
Black this time... 2nd this week...damn it looks good. the wheels my god the wheels...
I loooove this car

author: lemko
text: ...silver Honda Accord in front of my Buick Park Ave as I was filling up at the Sunoco for my trip to Carlisle tommorrow.

author: kyfdx
text: 4-door Toyota Yaris hatchback

author: fintail
text: Mexican plates or something?

author: fintail
text: Saw a S550 today...not so unusual anymore, but this one was a color I have never seen...a stark white. Non-metallic. Certainly the worst color for this vehicle (and most others). Uuugh money and taste part ways again...

author: jcat707
text:
Today I saw a red Saturn Outlook. It had regular plates so I'm guessing that they're out now. Anyway it looked ok, nothing spectacular, nothing horrible.

Also saw my first Mazda CX-7. That was pretty nice looking.

author: kyfdx
text: Canadian..

author: fintail
text: Was it the old style Yaris? Yeah they got those in Canada a few years ago, quite popular in urban areas.

author: kyfdx
text: I don't know where they got it.... but, this was a brand-new model...

author: fintail
text: Weird...I am not familiar with that one. It's on the Toyota Canada site though

author: kyfdx
text:
Yup.. there ya go..

I passed it on the interstate.... and I knew it had a Toyota emblem on it... But, I started second-guessing myself, because it looked a little like the Versa from the rear...

So, I slowed down and took another look when he came back past me... Definitely a 4-door Yaris hatchback..

This was near Lexington, KY..

author: fintail
text: I wonder why it isn't sold in the US. Canada got the 2 door hatch Yaris some time ago, so maybe it will be here ca. 2010.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Element SC, couple of Fit's, CX-7, a Mazdaspeed6, 2 CLS's, and a Ridgeline with a cap. I don't even notice the new RAV4's and Avalons anymore because there are just so many of them now that they "blend in".

And my local roofing co. on my way to work has replaced all his Silverado trucks with Ridgeline's, decked out with ladder bars and toolboxes. Got about 5 of them sitting there on the way in to work this morning, monogramed and all.

author: kyfdx
text: Do they have the Scion in Canada? The Scion xA is a 4-door hatchback, and virtually identical...

author: fintail
text: They don't....that might explain it. It's a baffling move, as Canada has long been more open to small cars. I think Toyota claimed the marketing expenses wouldn't be worth it.

author: derrado1
text: A silver Mazda6 MPS (Mazdaspeed 6 to you), stuck in a long line of traffic. Looks good, but I imagine some people would miss it, especially seeing as how common Mazda6's are around here (Mazda at the moment is No. 4 in marketshare, after Holden, Toyota and Ford - in that order)

author: lemko
text: ...black Lincoln Zephyr and champagne-colored Tahoe.

author: navigator89
text: beige Yukon and black Escalade.

author: gsemike
text:
There is a yellow and black Lamborghini convertible parked outside of the Stock Exchange (Wall and Broad St). They're selling raffle tickets to win it for a thousand a pop. I think it said the ticket sales were limited to 400 or 500. I guess that it's for a good cause but I didn't catch what it was.

The car is sharp but when the top is up, the hardtop definately looks better.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw one of these on the road, nice. One of the better looking of the new batch of compacts. Doesn't look like a toy, like most others do.

-juice

author: teds1
text:
They do that sort of thing in airports in Europe (3k $100 tickets sold for a raffle of some exotic etc...) It seems like better odds than the lotto and just think how cool the prize is. Of course the taxes would kill you and you can't exactly sell off part of your new Lambo to pay them.

If you have the means why not?...

FYI gsemike there will be a parade on 53nd and Park next wednesday of the new Audi R8, the R10 Le mans winner, and some of Audi's other hottest rides to celebrate the opening of their new show room. if you can you should check it out

author: kyfdx
text: 9-3 SportCombi..

author: fintail
text:
I saw one of those yesterday, too. I've seen 2 or 3 of them, that's it.

On the same note, I saw a 9-2 today...The third I've ever seen. I think that is very telling in this area, where both Saabs and Subarus usually do quite well. All I can say is shame on GM.

author: rockylee
text:
I agree, thankfully Saab, is going to get new product starting next year. Maybe they will be good enough for me to buy one if I don't buy a new vehicle this year ? I wished they would clone a 2007' Volvo S80

Rocky

author: chuck1959
text: '07 Navigator. First one in the streets.

author: gsemike
text:
Thanks for the heads up but I can't make it all the way up there during the day.

Selling the tickets in front of Federal Hall was a good move. The corner is opposite the exchange. You'd figure that alot of working class Wall St guys making 250k would but a ticket figuring that they can afford to own the car for a while but couldn't afford to buy the car.

author: teds1
text:
I saw a yellow Gallardo in Manhattan on 81st and columbus... it's about 2 feet high but very cool. I also saw a Red 360 Modena Spider and a Bentley CGT on the west side a bit later on. Today I saw a Maybach 57 and I could actually see the passenger for once (those curtains work well) I didn't recognize him though, had to be one of our captain of industry types.
We have several FJ Cruisers in my neighborhood now... kinda gives me hope that they could be practical in a city afterall (I know I'm dreaming)

author: fintail
text: I saw a silver Cayman today...not so unusual, but this one was missing the entire front clip/lights/etc. I assume being driven from or to a body shop.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
I think the Alfa car club was out for a drivwe this weekend. drove past a group of Spyders and a couple of misc. ones going the opposite direction on Saturday. Also saw some unique ones. A G-wagon, a Type-R teg, and a couple of old 911 S/C's.

On the new car front, I saw a bunch of FJ's, a new CRV, a 911 GT3 (hawt) and a couple of Nissan Versa's.

author: fintail
text: Murcielago roadster this morning...yellow...as loud as a couple of sportbikes.

author: fintail
text: Black Ferrari F430 Spider this evening...intoxicating sound

author: boomchek
text: Saw one on the road last night, very nice looking vehicle. From afar the stance reminds me of the Pontiac G6 (I guess it was based on that).

author: merc1
text:
A new LS460 with dealer tags. It was driven by the same guy that always has the latest and greatest Lexus, the local dealer GM or something.

M

author: teds1
text: Was over in Northern NJ today near the famous Alpine area... saw some huge houses and nice cars... One restaurant had a row of 15 black german cars all over $85 k parked out front including a new 911 Turbo (soooooo sick). We also saw a blue Elise, Flying Spur, red modena, a bunch of FJs, several SL55s etc... I missed theAudi parade on Park Ave. but I might go see if they left the R8 at the dealer!

author: teds1
text: So I know it's cheating but for the new R8 come on... a dealership counts right? As mentioned above I went over to the new Audi showroom on 47th and Park. Very cool, if you are in the neighborhood or visiting NY I would definitely reccomend a quick stopover. They still had the 1934 Auto Union Type D racer which was phenomenal to see in person. They also had a Q7 (who cares), a kitted out A8 W12 (incredible interor... you wouldn't want to spill a coke back in there let me tell you), a bright yellow RS4... one of my current favorites to see in person, and the R8. The R8 is very approachable on the spinning podium and I got some great views. They said it would probably start at $100k (not $120k as has been reported) for the V8. The interior was very cool, classic Audi and there is a glass engine cover like on a 360/430 to show off the goods. There is a small front trunk which I saw opened, pretty tiny really... with no rear trunk or behind seat room one would be pressed to go somewhere for the weekend in one of these. The overall shape looks even better in person but I think it would be prettier with a matching color airblade. Of course, since the blade is carbon fibre that means you have to get a black car b/c painting it over would be a crime. The headlights are some of the best I have ever seen. There were several suede loaferedferrari owning types in the showroom drooling over it and asking questions. Awesome car overall

author: ateixeira
text:
I've already seen a couple of these on the road, though it looked like one had dealer plates and was out on a test drive.

The Honda dealer on 355 in MD also had a new shipment of CR-Vs, but I have yet to see one on the roads.

-juice

author: boomchek
text:
Also saw an 07 Navigator at the Ford dealer next to us. Still not sure about the styling or those 70's gauges inside.

We just got some 07 Element SCs in stock. Much better looking than the previous Elements.

author: gsemike
text: teds, where do you work at? I miss midtown.

author: natenj1971
text: 2007 Blue CRV EX-L parked at Best Buy in Wayne NJ. Much better looking in person.

author: british_rover
text:
One of my car collector clients just pulled up in his new 2006 F430 with his assistant following him in his other Ferrari a 575M.

I guess I am going for a ride today.

author: boomchek
text: lucky bugger

author: british_rover
text:
OMG I have driven a lot of hot cars over the past couple of years because of the clients that I have but none of them compare to that F430.

I am talking hand of god acceleration and telepathic steering along with the most comfortable sport seats I have ever sat in.

I don't even mind the flappy paddle F1 gear box.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Couple of new CRV's, buncha Ridgelines, two RDX's and a jacked up "Monster" FJ cruiser riding on big superswampers or something like that. Caught a bunch of Bimmers heading to a meet so there was a nice collection of 2002's, M's and even a Z8. Then there was the CL55 :shades:

Oh and I also saw a Saturn Aura in a parking garage. Not bad I guess, but the front end has that Neon "smiling" look to the nose. Kinda dorky looking and the 20 million spoke wheels are hideous.

author: imidazol97
text:
I've seen some on the road that I noticed. If this car were to have come from Honda, GM haters would love everything about it. "Wonderful design." "Perfect choice for wheel styling to fit the car." "That company is just so knowledgeable about how to design a car for today's world." And on and on.

They did good.

author: gsemike
text:
Waaaaaiiiiiiit a second!!! That car is a Saturn???? What was I thinking?? I almost liked it!!! What were they thinking with that wheel styling??? Honda would never do that. That company is just so knowledgeable about how to design a car for today's world.

Note: tongue is firmly in cheek

author: imidazol97
text:
I hear you.

I like the appearance. I'll stop and look one over.

author: ateixeira
text:
I don't quite see the big deal. It look like a Pontiac G6 clone to me. Same chassis, same engines, only slightly cleaner style.

Everyone is so into this "euro" look but it just isn't all that different from a G6. Where is the substance? It's a G6 in a tailored european suit.

-juice

author: boomchek
text: But it looks much better than any other cars from Saturn for that matter. So for Saturn or GM I think it si a big deal.

author: gsemike
text:
It's definately a stronger contender in the mid-size class than GM has had:

The good:
- The interior is nicest ever on a Saturn and is a million years better than a G6
- It's got clean styling and is somewhat distinctive

The bad:
- No 4 cyl option
- Inflated price due to no 4 cyl option
- Front fascia is a little bug eyed and love it or hate it
- Rear looks like a current gen Status sedan

It's not the class leading world beater that the General's loyalists claim but it's a major step up for Saturn.

author: kyfdx
text:
New CR-V... In a lighter blue metallic color...

Looks pretty good going down the road.. Didn't notice the underbite at all, though this might be more of an issue standing still..

This one had a roof rack and step bars.. From the pictures, I thought I'd hate the D-pillar treatment, but that didn't jump out at me, either..

I don't it will be any more or less popular than the old model, from a visual standpoint. It is generic enough that it will probably gain as many admirers as it loses..

author: odie6l
text:
1st - I also got to see a new CR-V on the road. It kinda looks like the Becca to me.

2nd - I saw a car on the way into work today that looked like a Toyota MR2 / Lotus Elise, but it had T E S L A written across the back and a little shield under the name with a T in it. Boy was the thing quiet and fast. It was very nicely done.

Odie
Odie's Carspace

author: boomchek
text: You just saw one of the new Tesla elecric cars based on the Elise. It is a pure electric car, that's why you didn't hear any noise from it. Chck out this month's Automobile mag to get full detailsonit.

author: anythngbutgm
text: News-hottie, Natalie Morales from the Today Show had a segment with the Tesla roadster last week. That sucker did 0 - 60 in something like 4.5 seconds and it looks stunning doing it. It did break down on them due to clutch issues though and they mentioned that there were still some buge to work out. But man, what a cool little roadster. If I had the 100 grand asking price, I'd be willing to trade my S2000 for one.

author: ateixeira
text:
The L series was bland, I guess. I did like the Vectra that is was loosely based on, though, with the side mirrors that blended in to the front hood. My brother owned a Chevrolet Vectra in Brazil, that's what they were called.

So Aura is better than the L series. Ion is still awful and needs replacing ASAP.

-juice

author: british_rover
text: Man what are the odds of seeing a Tesla around. I think they have only made three or four of them.

author: odie6l
text:
It did have NEW YORK Plates. We get A LOT of rare cars where I am with Carlisle being kinda close, but more so because of Hersheypark and the Stadiums. It was probably a hockey players car, there was a Hershey Bears game that night.

Odie
Odie's Carspace

author: explorerx4
text: cls 6 3 amg.

author: stickguy
text:
a new Camry, on the dealer lot, with a stick shift! Not an SE, but a 4 cyl base car (pretty well equipped, but still base).

I will go back and visit it at Xmas, maybe Easter too.

At least Honda makes the shift lever/boot/knob look stylish and expensive. The one in the Camry was an all rubber monstrosity that looked like it came out of a 1984 Dodge COlt.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Yeah, unfortunately, Toyota doesn't really take the stick shift seriously which is one of the big reasons I think keeps Lexus away from being an actual BMW competitor (Amongst other things but still...)

I bet the shifter action is sloppy, the clutch is spongy and the manual would be a penalty rather than a pleasure. Toyota probably just slaps a couple together just to keep the price down...

author: teds1
text:
I know a couple of guys that played minor league hockey and I am sure that none of them could buy a $100k car! Plus most of them wouldn't fit in a little Tesla.

Very sweet sighting though

I saw a Z8 this morning... I know they are pretty rare but I swear they must have sold 90% of them in NYC. you definitely see them around

author: fintail
text:
Yeah unless one of those Bears had an NHL contract, they are likely making under 75K per year. I hope people who make that much refrain from buying 100K cars.

Right now I am out in the sticks in rural eastern WA...my C43 is by far the most exotic thing on these streets.

author: lemko
text: ...New Dodge Charger in Philadelphia Police livery. This is the first time I've seen a Philadelphia Police Charger.

author: rockylee
text:
That Charger won't catch your Caddy when she's running on 94' Ultra and a 104 octane booster. :shades:

Rocky

author: ateixeira
text:
In our garage, someone here at work must have bought one.

Still not digging the underbite, but an easy refresh would address that.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...a new 2007 Escalade in the same "white diamond" color as my Seville.

author: rockylee
text:
Did it have 22's ? :shades:

Rocky

author: lemko
text: No, it had the stock rims. We've got a young guy who just started in my office. He has a 1995 BMW 325. Somebody asked if he put aftermarket rims on it and he replied, "no." In fact he said it was stupid to spend so much on rims and they messed up the handling of the car anyway. Seems there's hope for the youth of America after all!

author: british_rover
text: Yeah but you can get factor 22 inch rims on the Escalade now... :sick:

author: rockylee
text:
Yeah british_rover, is right. The Escalade was designed straight from the factory to accomidate 22's.

I guess perhaps of my age, find nothing wrong with DUBS on vehicles. It just sets the vehicle off in appearance IMHO. :shades:

Rocky

author: teds1
text:
They have been purchased by a lot of the livery companies as limos. I saw 4 black extended versions parked in a row outside my building just now. They are freaking huge. Once I took the older Escalade from Vancouver to Whistler with 7 people including the driver and ski equipment. It was useful that day but I can't imagine any other time you would want one.
Utility and size are great but you have to consider how often you need it vs how often you will look stupid driving a bus around for basic errands.
I have no real issue wth Dubs on trucks but they don't really do it for me... Loved the scene at the end of CARS with the tricked out hmmer taking the off road class!

author: boomchek
text: are you from Vancouver teds1?

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Spotted a C55 in a parking lot at the hospital. Gotta give the nod to MB for a timeless design with the current C-class. Looks-wise, I find the MB elegance more appealing than the flamin Bimmer.

The C55 looked pretty badass.

author: teds1
text: NYC... But I love the Van City

author: boomchek
text: I love this place too. And because there's so much money in VanCity (especially Richmond), Beemers and Benzes are dime a dozen, and so are many other exotics or high end cars.

author: natenj1971
text: Saw 4 2007 CRV's in 45 minutes this morning (NNJ). A black EX, a silver EXL, a light blue LX, and a navy blue EXL. EX and EXL models were driven by women, the LX by a guy. It's a lot wider then the previous model - at least it looks it on the road. The profile is pretty bizarre up front, the hood sticks so much further out then the grill that it almost looks like there is a piece of grill missing. Otherwise it looks like a pretty nice upgrade.

author: fintail
text: I remember back in the 90s Van was MB W140 S-class heaven, you couldn't toss a ball without hitting a dozen of them. I am sure there are some nice older low mileage cars languishing away too. Van is a great Mercedes spotting place...I still recall I spotted my first C36, W210, W208, and my first C215 there.

author: boomchek
text:
Porsches are so common here too, you see at least 2 or 3 a day(seen the Cayman a few times already, Cayanne once a day usually). I see Maseratis a few times a month, Ferraris a couple times a month, and Bentleys here and there.

Lambo is probably the rarest, maybe once every a couple of months on the road. :P

What's sad is that I'm not the one driving them.

author: fintail
text: Down here on the east side of Seattle, I get to see everything. If a week goes by where I don't see at least a Ferrari and a Lambo, it is unusual. New money needs recognition of the passerby here.. I've seen an Enzo, SLR, Carrera GT etc. MB dealer is less than 2 miles from me too, so I get to see those. I wouldn't mind driving them...but I like what I drive, too.

author: boomchek
text: Never seen an SLR or Enzo on the street myself, but seen a few Muricelagos, Gallardos regulars and Spyders

author: bumpy
text: 2007 Chrysler Sebring. Kinda chunky-looking four-door with pinstripes on the hood.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Was what appeared to be a Nitro! Are these things on the market yet? I thought it was still concept, but lo and behold, on the lot next to a row of Magnums was a deep red one. I wish I had my camera.

This was also after hours so the dealer was closed.

author: lemko
text: ...black Pontiac Solstice.

author: Kirstie_H
text: Toyota FJ Cruiser, bright yellow. A rather startling sight before 8am on a Monday morning.

author: ateixeira
text:
Nissan Versa.

Then a silver FJ.

CX7 in a parking lot.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...white Dodge Caliber.

author: lemko
text: ...spotted a new black Mitsubishi Raider crew cab pickup truck last night. It kind of looked like what the "Bat Truck" might look like if Bruce Wayne was a rural superhero in Gotham County. Isn't this truck really a Dodge Dakota underneath?

author: ateixeira
text:
Just a clone, yep.

Remember when Raider was a name Dodge used for a Mitsubishi Montero 2 door clone? Things have come full circle.

-juice

author: boomchek
text: A wholesaler pulled up in one today. Blue with tan leather. Must be the third I've seen since they came out. Not many of them around.

author: gsemike
text:
I think that Raider is pretty good looking and probably a better deal than a Dakota. A couple of days ago, I saw one of the Isuzu rebadges of the Colorado. It's got some numeric name that escapes me now, maybe 7000-something?

Being that the Isuzu and Mitsubishi offer better warranties than Chevy and Dodge respectively, why not go for the rebadge?

author: andre1969
text:
I saw a new Saturn Aura parked out in front, in a spot where one of the secretaries normally parks. She had a light green Infiniti I30 which, strangely enough, I quit seeing in the parking lot the next workday after an identical one rear-ended me! At first I thought it might have been this secretary's daughter driving her Mom's car or something, but then I found out that the secretary's car just ended up needing a cost-prohibitive amount of maintenance/repair work done.

So I'm guessing she dumped it for the Saturn. Overall I think it's a nice looking little car, although I still think it looks an awful lot like a facelift done to a 2001 Stratus. This one was a nice dark blue and had the 3.6. It also had that interesting burnt-orange/brownish looking leather interior. That interior color is interesting. Something about it just seems kinda high quality and almost a bit nostalgic, like something you might find in a 1953 Cadillac convertible.

Might be tempting enough to warrant a look the next time I buy a new car.

author: andre1969
text: I've never seen a Raider on the streets, only at auto shows. However, I'll agree that it's a pretty good looking truck. I think I actually prefer its style to the Dakota!

author: ateixeira
text:
At least until GM went to a 100k powertrain warranty.

The i280 and i350 don't get much attention, I bet a lot of folks haven't ever even seen one.

At the NY Auto Show, Isuzu gave out free folding chairs to the press, it was the only way they could get enough people to show up for their press release.

I skipped it. Subaru was next and I wanted a front-row seat.

-juice

author: gsemike
text: Doesn't Isuzu offer a 7/70 bumper to bumper warranty? I'd take that over the 5/100 with 3/36 bumper to bumper. Less than 5% of the population drives 20k a year. I don't even drive 10.

author: anythngbutgm
text: Isuzu was at 10yrs/120k! miles a few years ago. Goes to show that a long warranty doesn't always solve your problems...

author: ateixeira
text:
Will they even be around to honor that warranty, though? GM may have to do it for them.

-juice

author: chuck1959
text: Well they might as well....it just a rebadge Chevy/GMC.

author: british_rover
text: Saw a new XK in silver yesterday. Very hot.

author: kyfdx
text:
Mercedes E350 wagon

Any chump can buy a Mercedes... You know its old money driving the wagons...

Actually, it was stunning..

author: boomchek
text:
Audi A6 Wagon 2006 or 2007, loved the lines. I think my first one for the new gen A6.

Also a Lotus Elise, yellow in color.

author: anythngbutgm
text: Spotted a bunch of new CRV's. I think they are becoming as common as the new RAV4's which is crazy.

author: ateixeira
text:
Oddly enough I saw 2 of them as well. One at the Sears parking lot, another out on the road. They seem to be getting out there quickly.

-juice

author: andre1969
text: I saw a Saturn Sky. First time I've seen one outside of the auto shows.

author: fintail
text: I'm not sure what it was, a F360 or F430 roadster. I saw it from my office building, where I was 4 floors up, so I could look down and see the engine through the transparent cover. Pretty cool.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
They look much much better in person than on camera. They have a Cranberry red color that really looks quite sharp for a curvy SUV...

Saw a couple of them at the restaurant we visited this evening. Both of them white. Ironically, a Silver Acura RDX was parked smack dab in the middle of both of them!

author: chuck1959
text: Saturn Aura. Personally I was not too impressed with the styling. Now that I have seen it in person.

author: fintail
text: My first new CRV today. Looks taller and boxier in person than in print. Somehow, it's less offensive too.

author: british_rover
text:
I dont like the under bite.
Looks funny.

author: fintail
text:
Yeah, it's no beauty queen. Just another slightly ugly little soft-roader...lots of them out there these days.

Maybe it's that ex-Saturn designer at work.

author: anythngbutgm
text: Went out for drinks and saw a few more CRV's and a brand spankin new ES350 in Triple Black. Pretty sharp looking car in that color with the big 18" wheels. Also saw an S3 and a new Laguna Blue S2000.

author: teds1
text: They really must have just dumped the new CRVs out in the states... I saw about 5 this weekend... not a fan at all... in anyway. Yukk.

author: fintail
text:
I saw about everything new yesterday morning.

Those "warts" underneath the CRV are painful, and the underbite aint pretty up close either. Who designed it?

author: ateixeira
text:
I saw one in my garage and those warts are less noticeable, maybe because they're at ground level.

-juice

author: kyfdx
text:
In white.... sort of generic.. but, non-offensive..

It doesn't make me want to part with over $30K..

author: explorerx4
text: i've seen plenty of fj's; blue, white, black, silver. more than the 07 camry, locally.

author: fintail
text: I saw 3 07 Escalades today, and a CLS55 AMG (or at least it was badged as such)

author: kyfdx
text: Almost every CLS that I see is an AMG model... Out of the ten or so... I think I've only seen one non-AMG..

author: odie6l
text:
I saw a Mercedes G-Wagon today. Boy does that thing look like an old Land Rover. But the thing that caught my eye wasn't the vehicle itself, but the amount of mud that was on it, the guy was doing some serious OR'n, this wasn't the throw the mud (like Jeep commercial) on either. I've been OR many times and can tell the difference.

Odie
Odie's Carspace

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw an Escalade while on Trick-or-Treating with my kids.

-juice

author: ateixeira
text:
A new Camry, and later a 2nd one.

An A6 with the wide-mouth bass grille.

Tacoma fleet truck. Toyota seems to sell more and more to fleets.

Caliber - then a 2nd one a little later. These are getting around quickly.

Civic.

Suburban. Boy these still seem too huge.

Malibu, with the new front end. A little cleaner but I still prefer the Opel.

Subaru Tribeca. Nice seafoam color.

-juice

author: fintail
text: Must have been an old grey market car...around here anyway, the only time a G-wagen goes off road is when it is in the shopping mall parking garage.

author: british_rover
text:
Eos a base model that was being detailed in our detail shop today.

The top is so cool in that car.

author: navigator89
text:
two Camrys, the first was oddly enough in lime green, the second was white with a sport package.

Also spotted a black Hummer H1. Up close, that thing is ginormous.

author: lemko
text: ...a bronze-colored Saturn Aura on Roosevelt Blvd above Grant in NE Philly. This is the first one I've seen outside of a car show.

author: natenj1971
text: Saw a new Rav4 that appeared to have been hit my a new VW Passat. Half the rear bumper on Rav was gone. Front left side of Passat was wrecked pretty nicely. Someone must have rear ended the Passat as there was some damage to the rear bumper but the freaky part was that the rear window has shattered, all the glass was in the back seat. Don't think you'll be seeing that in one of VW's "Oh Sh*t" commercials.

author: lemko
text: ...saw a white Chevrolet Colorado work truck with a Reading body that appeared to have dual rectangular sealed-beam headlamps in place of the regular composite lights. I find it strange that GM would use sealed-beam units in this truck and go through the extra expense of tooling the sockets and bezels to accept them. It didn't look like somebody's home-made attempt. It kind of reminded me of what Chrysler did with its 1957 cars for states in which quad headlamps were not yet legal.

author: ateixeira
text:
These may not be considered "new" any more, but saw another one.

Also a 3 series sedan and a Subaru Tribeca.

I guess when I start seeing the G35, I'll consider the M35 no longer new.

-juice

author: odie6l
text:
I got to see 9 2007 BMW X3 today, they were on a auto carrier that I'm assuming was headed for a BMW dealership.

Odie
Odie's Carspace

author: teds1
text:
I actually saw a G280 the other day. Those are the original grey market imports from the 1980s-90s before they officially started selling the G500/G55 through dealerships. Looks the same but is cooler for those reasons.

Also I have seen a few 335 coupes which I am beyond sold on... fantastic design.

Can't be sure (saw from a cab) but I think the Maserati showroom on Park has an MC12! Got to check THAT one out as there are only 25 in the world.

bunch of Rav4s and CRVs too.

author: lemko
text: ...upstate on the NE Extension of the PA Turpike - a silver Saturn Sky with a black top. Also spotted a silver-green Cadillac DTS.

author: rockylee
text:
Those Sky's are sure nice. I wished they were a lil' bigger so I could atleast consider one. The new DTS's are nice. The only things like I've said before that are missing is RWD, and the Bose studio 5.1 surround sound system. 350 hp. wouldn't hurt either. I remember back in the early 90's Cadillac was a leader in horsepower, now they have slipped behind the eight ball in that area. Hope fully GM will get it's mojo back and startbeing very competitive once again in that area. GM, needs to dump all supercharging and either go to turbocharging or use modern engine technology plus increase displacement to make the base V-8 have atleast 400 hp. I think a new modern OHC Northstar, needs to hit the shelf here in the very near future.

Rocky

author: bumpy
text:
I remember back in the early 90's Cadillac was a leader in horsepower

Which early '90s was this? The LS400 had 250hp and the Q45 was around 310hp in 1989 (the 276hp rating was an artifact of the Japanese market), while Cadillac had nothing better than a 200hp pushrod V8 as late as 1992.

author: rockylee
text:
Which early '90s was this? The LS400 had 250hp and the Q45 was around 310hp in 1989 (the 276hp rating was an artifact of the Japanese market)

The Q45's power rating back in the day was over hyped just like it was in 2005-2006 thus causing SAE loss overall for the Japanese cars. Lexus has 250 hp, seriously whoopie and I'm not sure why you brought them up ? :P

The 1993 and beyond Cadillac Seville/Eldorado STS-ETC ran 0-60 in 6.2-6.4 and topped out 155 mph. *elect. limited

Rocky

author: fintail
text: Bah, I'll just take a MB 500E from that time

author: british_rover
text: thing caddy was a leader of back in the 1990s was senior transportation.

author: fintail
text: Very cool, that would be quite an old G too.

author: gsemike
text: but I saw an Aston Martin DB9 yesterday parked in front of a startbucks in Glen Cove Long Island. People have money over there but not like that. That car really really turns heads.

author: boomchek
text: Ferrari F430 in red last night driving in a rainstorm.

author: british_rover
text:
I drove one of those a couple of weeks ago. Such a hot car.

Yesterday one of my car collector clients brought in his Smart Car that he bought back in March. I didn't get a chance to drive it but it drew quite a crowd as it pulled up and parked next to a Range Rover.

author: odie6l
text:
Ran into the driver up at a local shopping center. I know from all the accessories he has on it. I asked him what year his G was and he replied a well driven 2003. He has almost 175,000 miles on it, but purchased it at the Manheim Auto Auction with 75,000 in late 2004. I asked him about all the mud and he said he wanted to prove to his wife and sister-in-law that the car could handle anything the hunting trail could throw at him, plus he had just come home from Bow hunting up near Laporte,Pa. I wish I had my camera with me.

Odie
Odie's Carspace

author: gsemike
text: You're not talking about a G35 are you?

author: british_rover
text: He meant a G500.

author: fintail
text:
That's fantastic. If I had a G I would see about the off-road hobby.

I actually had a dream I had a G the other night...but it was a 2 door with a plaid interior... :blush:

author: fintail
text: Oh yeah...I swear I saw an R55 AMG today, or some kind of souped up Pacifica.

author: british_rover
text:
Ughh you know those are by special order only?

Someone had to actually go into a MB dealership and say, "I want a butt ugly over priced, 500 horespower minivan please."

Is it going to be a R55 or a R63?

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Drove a new Sebring at the Boston Auto Show yesterday. Gotta admit, it is a handsome car on the exterior and the interior was well done. The one I drove had the 2.7 which was peppy and the car itself was very tight (solid). I'd put it on par with the excellent Fusion triplets and even the Saturn Aura. Made the G6 and ESPECIALLY the Malibu look like outdated clunklers.

Also, checked out most of the new 07's so I can't narrow any sighting down to just one car since I saw all of them! But some of the new models that really impressed:

Mitsu Outlander - Ton of effort there. Very impressive.

Acura MDX - The concept kinda gave me a cold shoulder, but the finished product came oout awesome. I want one.

Ford Edge - seem well built and competitive. The Lincoln nose ruins the look IMO.

Honda CRV- The nose is fine. The interior is top notch. They'l sell a ton of them.

Some of the most impressive current offerings:
- Infiniti M
- Toyota RAV4
- Lexus LS and GS
- Mercedes. These guys are coming back with a vengence. Outstanding build quality and paint quality. AMG's abound there...
- Honda Ody Touring
- Mazda MX-5 H/T
- Acura RDX, same scenario I had with the MDX. Good job.
- Best of all, the new Tundra was there. One of them and it was HUGE! Pricing was unavailable, but this one matched the Titan and the domestics on a lot of fronts.

Outside the show, on the way home, I spotted 2 new GL450's, a couple of Volvo R's, 2 Acura RDX's, a bunch of new CRV's and RAV4's, 2 Habenero Red Civic Si's, a couple of Honda Fit's and FJ cruisers on all sorts of colors. It was a great day for car spotting, that's for sure.

author: fintail
text:
The one I saw had AMG body cladding, wheels, and it was sitting lower than a normal R. I didn't get to see the rear (and I am not complaining).

I've heard both R55 and R63 talked about...but I don't know.

author: kyfdx
text:
It is still a FWD-biased mommy-mobile... But, now it has an improved AWD system (SH-AWD) and 300hp.. Plus, they butched up the looks a little..

Not my kind of vehicle, but I think they'll sell a ton of them.

author: british_rover
text: Oh I am sure they will. Our dealership is right next to an Acura place.

author: fintail
text:
The new one looks smaller anyway.

I suspect they sharpened the looks to get a male audience (like Toyota tried with the 2002 Camry)...when you try too hard, you won't meet the exact goal.

But yeah, they'll sell every one they bring to my area anyway, it's the sister car to the RX, with the same stereotypes.

author: teds1
text:
Yesterday driving back from a meeting I passed
my first RDX... Not especially eyecatching but at least I noticed it, my first LS460, actually very nice looking, another sebring, a nitro, a maybach 62, and a black Z06 all on Lexington avenue in about 20 blocks

author: fintail
text:
I stopped by a MB dealer today, and saw both a E63 and CLS63. I'd take either.

They also had just about everything from the non-AMG lineup. The new-nose E class really has a beak when you stand up next to it, odd somehow.

author: ateixeira
text:
I saw one, too. First and only so far.

I like everything except that grille, it just looks tacked on.

-juice

author: british_rover
text: I agree on the grill/nose. As sloopy as the CLS and new E-Class are the nose should be less pointy more sloopy.

author: navigator89
text: a beautiful red Ferrari 360 Spider in heavy traffic. I was right beside and was able to admire the scoops, the brakes, the engine, the tires. Wow.

author: fintail
text: Yeah, a smoother more laid back front clip would work better on those cars. The way the the front bumper on the E appears to angle down from the ends is odd too. And about the Ferrari, I love the 360/430 because you can see the engine. Awesome design.

author: british_rover
text: The 430 has the most comfortable Sport seats I have ever been in. It only took me about 30 seconds to adjust them the way I wanted and man is that F1 tranny smooth. I didn't even get a chance to open her up and it felt like hand of god acceleration.

author: andys120
text: I saw two of the new Smarts will visiting in Phoenix's East Valley area.

author: boomchek
text:
New BMW X5 on a test drive. Looks smaller than the older one, but I like it.

Also see RDXs around, and MDXs.

author: ateixeira
text:
Same here, saw an RDX yesterday and a new MDX before that.

Not sure I like the MDX grille, but maybe it'll grow on me. Looks smaller than the old model, at least it appears that way.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...champage-colored GMC Denali.

author: rockylee
text:
A 2007 ?

Rocky

author: lemko
text: Yes. This is the second one I've seen this week.

author: rockylee
text:
WOW, I'm yet to see a 07' Denali down here. I've seen plenty of Escalades though.

Rocky

author: rockylee
text:
Lemko, if you get a chance for fun take a Escalade for a test drive. I'd like to hear your reaction.

Rocky

author: lemko
text: ...what appeared to be a red Pontiac G5. I didn't know it was already out. Maybe it was a Canadian Pursuit?

author: rockylee
text:
lemko, it must of been a Pursuit because the G5 to the best of my knowledge isn't out yet.

Rocky

author: fintail
text: Funny that Canada got what is in effect the G5 from the time the Cobalt was introduced. Then again, Canada does tend to be more progressive.

author: rockylee
text:
LOL, I like Canada alot but you might offended others in this forum.

Rocky

author: british_rover
text:
Silly canadians.

BLAME CANADA :P

author: bumpy
text: The G5 has been trickling out since around September, and I've seen one or two around here. All GM had to do was rearrange the parts bins at Lordstown. I think the G5 is coupe-only for now, though.

author: natenj1971
text: Green 2007 Mx-5 Miata on 66th steet and York Ave. Couldn't figure out what was so differnt about it till I realized it had the new folding hardtop.

author: ateixeira
text:
One of the big ones, ESV I think. Man that thing is a boat.

-juice

author: kyfdx
text: I followed one to school today..

author: anythngbutgm
text: Was there a pun intended with that? Cause if so, I see about 10 Slades parked outside the school in my town every morning!

author: kyfdx
text: LOL.. no pun intended... It just came to mind.. Local celebrity's wife was driving it... He does car commercials for the dealership group..

author: boomchek
text:
We get a lot of cars you guys don't like the Acura 1.6/1.7EL, Acura CSX, the Smart car.

What are you blaming us for? :P

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw plenty of new/newish cars...

Rabbit
Yaris sedan
Suburban (this morning actually)
Pathfinder
Charger
DTS
5 series
Yukon XL
SLK350
Galant
Crossfire roadster

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...big silver-gray Lexus GX470 driven by a rather smallish woman.

author: ateixeira
text:
Last night, actually.

I really enjoyed the SLK350 I drove, wonder if the 280 is as fun.

-juice

author: fintail
text: Excellent, talk about meeting the stereotype.

author: ateixeira
text:
I really like these. And there are a few Nissan products that I don't like much at all (Sentra, Quest, even 350Z for some reason).

Not sure why but I like Infiniti's products a lot better.

-juice

author: kyfdx
text: RWD?

author: ateixeira
text:
I like RWD, but that's not it. The Z is RWD.

I think in the pass/fail test for the interior, the Nissans fail while the luxury cars more than pass. The M looks gorgeous inside, while some Nissans look and feel cheap.

Of course I haven't looked in a couple of years and I'm sure they've improved.

-juice

author: odie6l
text:
I just noticed a Chrysler that looks about as big if not bigger than a Durango today. Boy is it huge. It was sharp looking, but the ridges the entire way across the hood looked out of place.

Odie
Odie's Carspace

author: kyfdx
text: Chrysler Aspen..

author: boomchek
text: I think you saw the new Chrysler Aspen, which is based on the Durango. Speaking of durangos I rarely see any on the road anymore.

author: lemko
text: ...light gray Lincoln Zephyr and dark gray Acura TL.

author: gsemike
text:
"I think in the pass/fail test for the interior, the Nissans fail while the luxury cars more than pass. The M looks gorgeous inside, while some Nissans look and feel cheap."

They are cheap compared to Infinitis. I very much like their new offerings

author: silverado21
text: I've seen several new Silveradoes in dealerships and one on the road the other day. I also saw a new Sierra pulled up at my local gas station. Mega Cabs are all over the roads now where I live and so are new Tahoes, Suburbans and Aspens. There is also an EL that I've spotted several times running errands around town.

author: ateixeira
text:
Went to a Chrysler/Jeep dealer and saw a bunch of new Wranglers. They had no 4 doors in stock, said they can't get 'em fast enough.

I like the new 3 piece hard top, seems very flexible.

-juice

author: boomchek
text: Burgundy Bentley Flying Spur, and a BMW M6, also in burgundy color.

author: fintail
text:
Not new anymore, but I saw a black Maybach 57 in Seattle today...

Also spotted a couple Audi Q7

author: lemko
text: ...new dark gray Chrysler Aspen. Let's just hope people don't remember the Dodge Aspen of 1976-80.

author: ateixeira
text:
Looks smaller than the old one, for some reason. I guess that's a good thing.

-juice

author: british_rover
text:
Its not.

It is actually larger then the old one but with less interior room... :confuse:

author: ateixeira
text:
Less practical shape, I guess.

It did feel a little tighter inside. OK for my needs, though. Too rich for my budget, though.

-juice

author: british_rover
text:
They are trying to market the MDX as a more pratical, affordable, reliable X5.

We will have to wait and see how sucessful that is.

author: anythngbutgm
text: Spotted a couple of new Nissan Sentra's, two 3-series coupes, and CLS55AMG and a new Navigator in Bada$$ Black.

author: kyfdx
text:
The new C70 convertible.. my first spotting of this model..

Kind of boring with the top up...

author: ateixeira
text:
Well, at least the blind spots are about 1/4 as big as with the old C70 'vert.

Is it still called C70? I thought it was now S40 based. :confuse:

-juice

author: kyfdx
text: Yup... still called C70..

author: ateixeira
text:
It should be the C40. But I guess with a $40k price tag they couldn't do that, eh?

The Eos, G6, and Sebring seem like much better values, starting around $10 grand less.

-juice

author: teds1
text: I saw 3of these this week. I like it, it really looks like the old one even up close but smoothes out the awkwards angles and views of the first body style. Hopefully this will push prices on the older ones down into a range I can afford! Especially the coupe which I have always liked a lot.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw one of these. I still think the outer shape resembles the G6 too much. This car is getting a lot of hype, though.

-juice

author: fintail
text:
Ferrari 599 or 612 - couldn't tell as it was moving in traffic.

Also, a F360 or 430, again hard to tell in traffic.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw another one of those.

-juice

author: kyfdx
text:
I saw my first new X5 on the road (well... in a parking lot)..

It is amazing how similar it is in looks to the MDX.. It looks smaller than it actually is..

author: teds1
text:
599 fiorano in a showroom... still cool I don't care. No "Satan is my co-pilot wheels though," bummer.
aewsome looking overall.

Saw the new MDX as well and more ugly Crvs

author: fintail
text:
I am seeing too many of those CRVs as well. Let me tell ya, the underbite is not a positive styling cue. Is this thing a product of the guy who apparently defected from Saturn?

I've also seen about 100 Audi Q7 lately.

author: ateixeira
text:
Almost back to back. I thought they were the same vehicle until I realized he would have had to make about 5 U-turns to get there.

-juice

author: lemko
text: Spotted a gray Honda Fit sedan and then a gray Lexus GS430.

author: bumpy
text:
gray Honda Fit sedan

Really? :surprise:

author: rorr
text:
"gray Honda Fit sedan...."

Probably parked right next to that Impala minivan.....

author: lemko
text: OK, should've said four-door with hatch. They're uncommon around here.

author: natenj1971
text: 5 2007 Honda CRV's while waiting for the bus on York Ave in NYC. 3 Silver, 1 light blue, 1 black. This was all in the 10 minutes of waiting for the bus. All were EX models.

author: kyfdx
text:
Mercedes CL600... Not sure if it is brand-new, but had the new body style front end..

'07 Tahoe.. FlexFuel

'07 Acura MDX.. much more attractive than the previous model...

author: lemko
text: ...dark blue Honda Civic sedan and red Mazda RX-8.

author: boomchek
text: A red Ferrari F430. That car turns heads everywhere.

author: natenj1971
text: First saw a dark gray Edge in Rutherford NJ. An hour later the Mercury version (looked to be a cream color) pulling out of a Merc dealer on Rt 3.

author: gsemike
text: I saw my first all new Altima. It's definately sharp but it's a little hard to tell it from a Maxima. I guess that's good for the Alt, not so much for the Max.

author: chuck1959
text: I though there was going to be only a Ford and Lincoln version, no Mercury?

author: bumpy
text:
Chrysler certainly has cornered the market on stunningly ugly SUVs.

I also saw what must be the world's nicest plum Beretta Z26, driven by an old guy in a track suit, thick glasses, slicked-back hair, both hands on the wheel, and head craned forward. The plates were from Florida, of course.

author: gsemike
text: I'll second your opinion on the Nitro. What are they trying to do with it? Maybe it's supposed to be retro with more up to date cues injected than a PT or HHR?

author: gsemike
text:
I haven't spotted it yet, but I just downloaded a little video podcast of the new Altima coupe that will be available this summer. It's going to be interesting to see how it goes.

They're going after the market of the Solara, Accord coupe and Monte Carlo, but the car will be more aggresive than any of them. The silouhette is very close to the G35 coupe and the only sheetmetal shared with the sedan will be the hood.

When I see the other coupes, they seem like retirement cars to me (unless they're pimped). They're for people that equate sportiness with 2 doors but still want that upright seating position and usable backseat. It will be very interesting to see how a coupe of this size with more sporting intentions fares.

author: navigator89
text:
a black Lamborghini Gallardo, and the new Expedition, also in black.

Also saw many, many 2007 H3s, Tahoes, Yukons and Escalades.

author: fintail
text: Not new, but all of a sudden there are two Land Rover Freelanders living in my apartment parking garage. I barely see these things in normal traffic.

author: kyfdx
text:
That is because they are usually in the shop...

Want to see something scary? Read over the Freelander discussion..

author: british_rover
text: Yeah it is a sad little car. Find the people who own those freelanders and demand they get an extended warranty.

author: kyfdx
text:
Better yet... dump it at the earliest opportunity..

I always liked the vehicle.... too bad it ended up with so many problems...

Too good that I never swung a deal for one... I was close a couple of times.. My wife really likes them.

author: fintail
text:
I won't say anything about the demographics of who drives those things here...but yeah...

I was thinking one might be a parts car for the other.

Oh, also new in my parking garage is an 07 Camry with that wacky body cladding, I guess that means its a sport model. Looks like some old Pontiac stylists found work with the enemy.

author: seminole_kev
text: Shows how rusty I'm getting at staying current with cars, but I saw a Pontiac G5 (yes five, not six) yesterday at the mall. Basically the Pontiac twin of the Chevy Cobalt, but I had no idea they were making those. I actually thought it was a Canadian car (as GM often plays around with the badging for cars up there) until I saw they were actually selling those here.

author: bigo08
text:
Saw Silver Bently Flying Spur
Lincoln MKX on the 405 Freeway
and a few 07 Expeditons.

author: lemko
text: ...silver Lincoln Zephyr, (or is it an MKZ now?). Also spotted gray Toyota Yaris - a rare sight around here. There is a red Prius down the block from me.

author: boomchek
text: Maserati Quattroporte. And about 3 or 4 BMW 6 Series coupes (the new ones).

author: navigator89
text: I also spotted a Bentley Continental Flying Spur. It pulled up in traffic beside me and proceeded to make a left turn. The color was brownish silverish the kind in all the road tests. It was my first time coming so close.

author: chuck1959
text: 3 days ago I saw a white Maserati Quattroporte. Nice looking car.

author: seminole_kev
text: Oh me likely the Quattroporte.....great looking sedan.

author: boomchek
text:
We have a 2005 Lexus LS430 on our lot. I took it for a spin, but I much rather be sitting in the back....

-rear reclining seats
-rear armrest pops down and has it's own control panel for the climate, and audio
-rear seats are heated, ventilated, and massaging
-sunshades of all sorts popping out of every rear window

This car has more gadgets in the back than many cars have in the front!

After playing with the car my fiancee called me at work just to chat, and I tell her I just came back from a massage.

She asks "From who?"

I say "From a Lexus"

She says "Who's Alexis?"

:P

After a few minutes she finally got it. :P

author: british_rover
text: Oohh yeah that could get you in a whole lot of trouble.

author: teds1
text: Well I know where more than a few of those much ballyhooed wall st. bonuses went... There has been an explosion of flying spurs in midtown manhattan, I see 3-6 a day now. It does look awesome, much more gentile than the coupe and a total bargain compared to it's ultra lux competitors like the arnage, phantom and Maybach. It gives these guys something bespoke and rarified that is actually a blast to drive and relatively affordable. Seems like a hit.

author: lemko
text: ...I was behind a silver Jeep Compass. I don't know what's up with Jeep, but they seem to have become bloated with a lot of redundant models.

author: boomchek
text: Bentley Continental GT convertible in silver. I think that's the name for it.

author: fintail
text: That's the GTC, impressive machine. I haven't seen one yet, but I am sure I will soon as normal Continentals and Flying Spurs are not too rare here.

author: navigator89
text: Over the past few days, I've seen quite a few exotics. First it was red Ferrari F430 coupe, just cruising along. On the next day it was a red Ferrari F430 Spider and a yellow Lamborghini Gallardo Spyder racing. It was just crazy to watch them accelerate. And finally, a light blue 360 Modena yesterday. Also a Hummer H1 pickup.

author: boomchek
text:
Hey Navi,

Since there are so many exotics in Kuwait, and I assume many long open roads, how strict are the police on speeding there? Can you take out a car to the desert and rip it?

author: lemko
text: ...black Dodge Caliber and white Audi A3 2.0T.

author: british_rover
text:
2006 Aston Martin DB9.

Pulled in today to look at a Range Rover.

author: explorerx4
text:
just let me drive his new carrera s. about 250 miles on it.
i was nervous! the clutch was pretty easy to get used to, and i liked the short throw shift. hearing the engine from the back felt unusual.

author: stickguy
text:
new (upcoming) Hyundai Veracruz SUV. This is the bigish 7 seater, supposed to compete with the Pilot/Lexus/Mdx/B9, etc. Fairly large, super nice interior, looked quite upscale.

I think the are supposed to be out in the spring sometime. A guy I know works for Hyundai corporate and was driving it, so I got to sit in the thing. You could stick a lexus label on it and plenty of people would believe it.

author: lemko
text: ...at least three Saturn Auras - one black, one silver, another bronze-colored. They seem to be off to a good start in the Philly market.

author: rockylee
text:
Yeah the Car of the Year is pretty hott !!!!

So is the Truck of the Year

Rocky

author: teds1
text:
I like the rear view of the new MDX but that grill is so goofy it kills me. The old one was a somewhat boring but exceedingly competent and competitive X5 fighter (at least on paper) The new one looks like it's in a jousting competition at Medieval times with that shield motif!

I have seen a bunch of Nitros around as well and they look ok. Not sure why they need to exist though, and those macho commercials are dumb.

Silver Phantom RR at lunch today, most road presence of any car by far...

author: chuck1959
text:
I have seen a bunch of Nitros around as well and they look ok. Not sure why they need to exist though, and those macho commercials are dumb.

I agree. I'm not really sure why not only the Nitro but also the Compass and Patriot even exist.

author: boomchek
text:
Seems like I see a couple of MB R Class vans a day now, pretty common around here.

Saw a gold Maserati Qauttroporte today.

Also saw a red F430 driving in the rain (I think it's the same driver I saw a few weeks ago).

And for the first time I saw a Jeep Compass. Totally unappealing to me. I especially don't like the way the front bumper is molded, just screams of cheapness. But then again for $20k it will probably appeal to some who always wanted a Jeep.

author: seminole_kev
text: You know, the thing I really don't like is actually how the rear bumper is molded with "Compass" in it. That looks especially cheap/tacky to me.

author: british_rover
text: Yuck who would buy a gold Quattroporte.

author: navigator89
text:
Lol the police hardly care if someone speeds, which is why most do.

The best place to really blast a car to top speed would be on the desert highway leading to Saudi Arabia where there almost no cars. I've travelled thats stretch doing 150 km/h.

author: kyfdx
text: E550 4-matic.. Appeared to be brand-new.

author: boomchek
text: Must be anice place to be with an exotic if you can go as fast as you can.

author: lemko
text: Gray Lincoln MKZ. I've been seeing a lot of Saturn Auras lately.

author: teds1
text:
Nuff said... sexy although the mags and reviewers have been trashing the M6. I would get a 335 and an A8 for the same money myself.

I agree by the way that one of the worst features of the compass is that stupid rear bumper with the logo in it.

author: boomchek
text: I think the whole car just looks cheap and plasticky. Like one of those molded cheap toy cars that you see in dollar stores.

author: stickguy
text: on the road. Noticed that it had a bulgier hood, so it must have been one.

author: bumpy
text: Saturn Sky this morning. The top looks as awful as everyone says- like an incompetently-assembled pup tent. :sick:

author: ateixeira
text:
An Outlook and a G6 convertible. Also saw my first G5, but all unsold.

Outlooks was very nice, solid, but awful visibility with wide pillars and a high rear hatch. 2nd and 3rd row seats were uncomfortable as well. Steering and ride, plus engine and trans, all quite impressive.

G6 was not nearly as impressive dynamically, but had great visibility for a convertible. So it was the exact opposite.

-juice

author: danf1
text: Was it a white one?

author: stickguy
text: Silver. In S. NJ.

author: boomchek
text: New Chrysler Sebring. Don't like the looks at all. The tailights are all round, the front end is wedgy, and has those lines on the hood, really odd looking car. I'm surprised that the same company that brought out the 300C and the Charger, could come up with such an inconsistent design.

author: kyfdx
text:
Three of them!!

Okay.. I cheated.. it was at the Porsche dealership..

Just stopped in to window shop.. it's what I do for entertainment..

author: kyfdx
text:
In the parking lot...

Audi RS6 (what do those go for?) :surprise:

Cadillac CTS-V..

Parked next to each other..

author: british_rover
text:
slalom

80K isssshh I think.

author: danf1
text: Our district service rep is driving a white one. It doesn't have a roof rack which makes it look incomplete. I hope that they will have one when they get here.

author: navigator89
text: a 2007 Honda CRV in white, my first one. Looks very different from the 10 years of bland and boxy CR-Vs. Also saw a blue Evo racing down the highway.

author: gsemike
text: That car is ridiculously bad. With the Crossfire pretty much a flop, why did they borrow so many styling cues from it for the Sebring. Chrysler seriously needed this car to do well as it's a better bet as a mass market car than the 300, but the Sebring is DOA.

author: boomchek
text:
I totally agree with you. I saw one a few days ago, and nothing looks right about it.

I'd get a Kia Optima over this any day.

author: merc1
text:
S80 V8 AWD, good looking car.

M

author: chuck1959
