text: I agree too...the car needs more rear overhang. Then it wouldn't look so bad.

author: gsemike
text:
Just look at this mess:



What were they thinking? In the new C&D, this car came in dead last. The Kia Optima placed a respectable third behind the Altima and Accord and ahead of the Camry.

This is 100 times nicer looking than the Sebring:



I mean, even the Malibu looks better than the Sebring.

author: ateixeira
text:
I agree, the Sebring is a miss. That thing will be in rental fleets ... well, it probably already is!

I don't even like the new Sebring convertible. And I may need a 4 seat 'vert to replace the Miata.

Saw a new CR-V at lunch today.

-juice

author: seminole_kev
text:
That thing is really dis-jointed. Just looks cobbled together. Really, it almost looks as if the rear doors on back were grafted onto a different car from the drivers door on up.

Whomever designed this must have had some weird hardpoints that he/she had to meet up with. Yuck.

author: Kirstie_H
text:
What do you think?
Chat tonight with Ian Beavis, VP of Marketing for Kia Motors America.
Join us 6-7pm PT, 9-10pm ET and bring some good questions!

author: anythngbutgm
text: Wow, that's harsh. Call me a minority as I actually like the new Sebring. Took one for a spin at the NE auto show and found it to be a solid and substantial ride. It was quiet, smooth and competent. And the polarizing looks are unique in that they don't look like anything else in its class. it isn't as sleek as say, a Mazda6 but I think it could be much worse.

author: teds1
text: Today going to grab a sandwich (only two blocks away) I saw a New XKR Coupe (awesome, I really like the new XKs) a Ford Edge, Audi S8 (the new Lambo engined one) and a Black Flying Spur. That's three firsts for me, not bad for a days work.

author: chuck1959
text:
I don't even like the new Sebring convertible. And I may need a 4 seat 'vert to replace the Miata.

Why not? I love the hardtop convert option. The design looks a lot better than the old one. Looks like there is more back seat room.

author: ateixeira
text:
Inside I even like the old one. I'm sure the new one would be OK.

I'm not crazy about the stripes on the hood or the headlights. It's not like they're a deal killer, but I don't find it attractive.

-juice

author: anythngbutgm
text: but two new Chrysler Aspens! Also what appeared to be a Nissan Versa sedan (had no idea they were making that version). Combine that with a gazillion new RAV4's and CRV's and I'd say it was a slow evening for spotting.

author: ateixeira
text:
Was it the new Sentra? They look alike now.

Saw an MDX and then a white BMW 3 series coupe.

-juice

author: andys120
text:
Seen recently,

Ford Edge not bad looking, several were on display at the preview to the Barrett-Jackson Auction. I suspect they'll become invisible in a short time.

Mercedes R-Class seem to be all over Phoenix, Scottsdale and Mesa, for some reason they're all black. My wife says they don't look expensive enough to be Benzes. I think she's right, an E-class wagon looks a lot classier.

Audi Q7 I can't wrap my head around the concept of an ugly Audi but I'm not the only one, the Q7 seems to be a pretty rare bird. IMO it's the least good looking of the Cayenne/Toureg family. To my eyes the Toureg is the best looking.... go figure.

In the non-CUV category I saw a couple of new 328i coup[es and a convertible that was probably a 335ci. They look just as good as the photos suggest. BMW is moving away from Banglization and back to clean, understated but handsome styling.. Hooray!

author: kyfdx
text: My first one in the wild.. Looks bigger in person..

author: ateixeira
text:
Seeing quite a few of these, they seem to be off to a quick start. Far more than the RDXs I've seen, and it came out later.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...red Mazda MX5 Miata and red Honda S2000. I must see at least 20 Miatas to each S2000. S2000s are scarce around here.

author: navigator89
text:
from a ten day stay in the Netherlands and I saw some pretty interesting rides. The new Volvo S80 is all over the place, and it looks great. I also saw a white BMW M coupe, my very first one. It also looks much better than the Z4 roadster. Those small mini European city cars were everywhere. Some of them are pretty nice, like the Seat Leon and Ibiza.

Also spotted two Bentley Continentals and some other vehicles that you wouldn't expect to find in Europe, such as a Mustang GT, Trailblazer, Yukon, Suburban, Windstar, Sienna, and two Navigators. Gas is very expensive there, like 1.3 euros.

author: rockylee
text: Rocky

author: lemko
text: ...black VW Eos.

author: ateixeira
text:
I think I saw 3 this weekend.

Also saw a new Dodge Nitro. It's smaller than I expected.

-juice

author: bumpy
text:
The S2000 is fairly rare, and must be super-rare in a domestic holdout like Philly. Honda has sold maybe 40,000 of them in the US since summer 1999, while Mazda sells that many Miatas in 18 months. I do see them around every so often (and I see mine every day) Someone else in my dinky county has a black 2.2, and I saw a black one at the Scion dealer the other day.

I also saw a new Senta this morning. Looks a bit like a compact-size Ford Fusion. Also saw a bronze C6 Corvette at the dealer. That color works for the Murano and 350Z, but the 'vette is too bulgy in the wrong places to carry it off.

author: ateixeira
text:
I think there's something like 700,000 Miatas on the road.

Most of them in Florida.

-juice

author: anythngbutgm
text:
No, I'm familiar with the new Sentra, but this was clearly a Versa sedan. It wasn't blocky like the new Sentra.

And yes, S2k's are scarce, the Miata sells somehting like 5:1. Up here in MA, you are more likely to see an S2k than a new Solstice though. Those are rare birds.

author: navigator89
text:
a really nice looking Ferrari F430 in red. It's the only the second one I've seen and it looks lots better than the Modena.

Also saw a grey Yukon XL and a black Escalade.

author: fintail
text:
I saw like 5 Audi Q7 today. I kinda like these in a weird way...I think they can look sort of sinister.

Also 2 Bentley Flying Spurs, black and silver.

author: kyfdx
text:
Subaru WRX STi.. the new facelifted model. (still needs a nose job). With a nice lip spoiler, instead of the monster wing.

Mercedes CLK350 convertible.

Nissan Sentra

author: ateixeira
text:
You saw an 07 STI Limited, then. The fly-under-the-radar version of the STI.

Pretty smart, IMHO, they added nice heated leather seats and a moonroof, and delete the boy-racer spoilers and wild paint, for a sleeper sports sedan look. It appeals to a different buyer then the regular STI, too, which is much more showy.

Best part? The price is the same.

BTW, the current look for the Impreza is selling quite well, sales are way up despite the model being very dated (it came out in 2002).

-juice

author: kyfdx
text:
Well.... the new corporate nose isn't pretty.. but, the old Impreza was already an ugly duckling, so I doubt it makes much difference...

With 300hp, they will only see you from behind, anyway..

author: Kirstie_H
text:
Saw one of these at the auto show... electrifying!

I have photos, which I may be able to load up in the next 24 hrs. I took several while they were in the process of retracting and folding the top.

author: teds1
text: A DeLorean!!! Always cheers me up to see one of those. It seems to me one could make a nice little business buying crappy DMC shells and putting modern Japanese drive trains in them. Who wouldn't buy a Delorean with accord or camry insides (way more poerful than the original car btw)for $30-40k? I would be on that like white on rice

author: wylldshark
text:
Me! I'd rather modify the PRV with the Stage I & Stage II upgrades from DMCH. Stage III is coming out rather soon adn will crank out close to 300hp! Of course, you could always find an old race version PRV or try a Lotus swap.

There is a guy who made a two-engine D, one in front and one in the back. The one in the front was from a Prelude.

John Z. was going to partner with Nissan and buy engines from them for his new car, but alas nothing came to fruition and now he's gone.

If there was no other choice but to choose from a Japanese manufacturer, I would go with Nissan. The words small, peppy, exciting and powerful comes to mind. In fact, there's a guy with an Infiniti engine in his D now.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw 2 Altimas yesterday. They're getting around fast, it seems. They look better in person than they do in photos.

Also saw a new maroon MDX next to me in traffic today.

-juice

author: lemko
text: ...blue 2007 Chrysler Sebring sedan. I guess somebody likes the oddball styling.

author: gsemike
text:
"It seems to me one could make a nice little business buying crappy DMC shells and putting modern Japanese drive trains in them. Who wouldn't buy a Delorean with accord or camry insides (way more poerful than the original car btw)for $30-40k?"

I don't know about that Ted. Do you know all the sweet cars that can be had for 40 grand? You could have a new G35 coupe with 300 horsepower or a Delorean with an Accord engine? DeLoreans are curiosities but it would take a load of work to get more than 10 grand for one. Maybe if you tubbed one out and put a blown 350 Chevy in it, you could be 15.

author: gsemike
text:
"It seems to me one could make a nice little business buying crappy DMC shells and putting modern Japanese drive trains in them. Who wouldn't buy a Delorean with accord or camry insides (way more poerful than the original car btw)for $30-40k?"

I don't know about that Ted. Do you know all the sweet cars that can be had for 40 grand? You could have a new G35 coupe with 300 horsepower or a Delorean with an Accord engine? DeLoreans are curiosities but it would take a load of work to get more than 10 grand for one. Maybe if you tubbed one out and put a blown 350 Chevy in it, you could be 15.

author: fintail
text: Not new cars...but today I saw a car hauler with 2 Discoveries, a Freelander, a LR3, a Jag S-Type, and a Volvo XC. That load could put a mechanic's kids through college!

author: boomchek
text: Saw a Ford GT, and a Jag XK coupe. The GT is really impressive in person because it's so low and wide.

author: navigator89
text:
beige Bentley Continental GT, grey CLS55 AMG, and a maroon Cayenne Turbo S.

But best of all was the Ferrari F430 Spider that zoomed by me.

author: wylldshark
text:
Actually a great DeLorean that needs no work done to it goes for $21K-27K. A perfect one will set you back upper $20's, lower $30's. Or you could get a frame-off restored D from DMCH for $45. Even has a warranty! :O ) Or $75 if you went to D1 in Cali. OF you don't mind doing a little recondtioning you can find a pretty good one in the upper teens and make it into a very nice driver.

Also, there is a DeLorean that has an Infiniti engine, not the G35 though. And there is one with a 350 too. Pretty nice setup the guy has!

author: boomchek
text:
of the new BMW X5s driving around.

Saw a new Expedition XL with the blacked out grill and all, not too bad either.

author: navigator89
text: black Lexus LS460, my very first. Also a black Expedition, looks good with all the chrome, and a white Compass.

author: teds1
text:
My thought was sort of sparked by the company which puts honda engines in original mini bodies (apparently they are ridiculously fast). Why should the resto rod phenomenon get to be enjoyed by the muscle care guys only? I am all for stuffing modern drivetrains in all sorts of quirky but underpowered older cars like DMCs, VW things, Scouts (there are a few with LS1s!), volvo 240s etc...

Of course you can get a great modern car for $30-40k but that's not really the point. I am imagining a unique headturner like a DMC with the practicalilty to drive on a regular basis. Much more of a fun car than a real competetitor.

author: wylldshark
text:
I got ya.

Most people don't realize the PRV in the D is a good reliable engine - it's a Volvo engine for pete's sake! :O )

You can get upgrades from DMC in Texas that will produce 245 horses for the DeLorean, which to me is great! The Stage III will crank out over 300hp!

That's what I plan on doing to mine!

If you google around, you can actually find some of the conversions people have done, one of the best site's being Tamir Ardon's: http://www.entermyworld.com

He's got a lot if information on his site with pics of some of the diff. engine setups folks have did!

author: gsemike
text: I looked em up on Yahoo and am blown away by how much they go for. I see its appeal as a curiosity, but inside and out, it looks like outdated cheese. If it wasn't for back to the future, would anyone even remember what they were?

author: bumpy
text: GMC Acadia, or whatever it's called. Looks like an oversized Pacifica crossed with a Mazda6.

author: rockylee
text:
W/E :P

Rocky

author: bumpy
text:
It would have looked decent if it had been the size of an Equinox or Santa Fe, but the shape and styling just doesn't work on something that large.

Also, Lutz should commit seppuku for allowing a front-wheel drive SUV to be sold as a GMC. The old Caballero was pushing it, but this is too much.

author: ateixeira
text:
Nah, Pacifica has soft, rounded corners, and the Mazda6 is low to the ground and looks like a door wedge.

Outlook is more huge wagon shaped, and boxier than either by far.

While out at lunch I saw a G6 coupe (still uncommon here) and an Escalade ESV.

-juice

author: navigator89
text: my FIRST BMW M6, in silver! It was stuck in traffic so I really got to see it. Also spotted a silver Lamborghini Gallrdo.

author: ateixeira
text:
I still don't see it.

The Outlook is boxy and has that wide, body color C-pillar missing from both others.

The Pacifica looks round and bloated, while the Outlook is boxy and chiseled.

Basically:

* the Pacifica looks like a minivan
* the Outlook seems more like a tall wagon
* the Mazda6 looks more like a sports wagon

I actually think the Outlook resembles the Ford Freestyle more, i.e. a boxy but tall wagon:



-juice

author: ateixeira
text:
Replying to myself here, and wow, looking at both pictures on the same screen, check out that resemblance.

Look at the roof rack. The other two don't even have that.

Look at the C-pillar.

Check out the window Tint.

Check out the fender flares.

GM did it better, but there is an undeniable resemblance there.

-juice

author: boomchek
text:
Cadillac XLR in RED! Driven by a middle aged lady.

Volvo C30 at the Volvo lot, not a bad looking car. It's going to be competing with the Minis and MB C230s.

New Volvo S80. Looks like a S60, almost hard to tell apart.

Lotus Elise in yellow. Turns a lot of heads.

Porsche Cayman, looks better in real life than in pictures.

And a bunch of the new BMW X5s. About 2 or 3 a day. I always like the X5 even the old version. It's probably the best looking SUV out there right now imo.

Light blue Lambo Murcielago. And a white Gallardo.

Also the new F Superduty trucks. I think the only redesign is the front end on them. they're not all new.

author: fintail
text:
I saw a few new X5s today too, and both of the Acura SUVs.

Also about 5 Ford Edge, a couple new Lexus LS, and an Aston DB9

author: navigator89
text: white Maserati Quattorporte stuck in traffic, and also a blue Cayenne Turbo S and a grey DB9.

author: teds1
text:
Buick Rainier SUV, I think they just killed this one. Definitely the first I've noticed and if it is at the end of it's lifecycle that is not good. I've seen more Chevy 9-7Xs than these.

Nothing really fun has been out recently with the snow in NYC

author: boomchek
text: New Aston Martin V8 Vantage. It was behind me and the inside edge of the headlights have LEDs, so I thought it has to be a different kind of car. When I slowed down to let him pass me I saw the Aston grille. It looks really trippy.

author: boomchek
text: Saw a VW Phaeton, I think my second one. Not too many of them around, and a Bentley Arnage. Both at high end hotels.

author: bigo08
text:
Maserati Quattorporte
Lincoln MKX (finally)
tons of Range Rovers
and Toyota Camrys at every light

author: lemko
text: ...silver Mercedes CLK AMG.

author: teds1
text:
I saw an R55 today... "what's that?" you ask...
Why it's an AMG Tuned R class Merc... the most useless form of supercharged v8 power known to man... On top of that (literally) it had a giant Thule ski box starpped to the roof for extra aerodynamic effect.

What a tool

author: ateixeira
text:
New X5, first one I've seen on the roads.

Two Fits. They went in hiding during the snow, but now that it's melting I started seeing them again.

Maserati coupe behind me in traffic, too.

A few Auras, too.

-juice

author: zxw
text:
Saw a '58 Edsel Bermuda wagon today ... now this is NOTEWORTHY!

ZXW Robb

author: ateixeira
text:
These things are all over the place.

Also saw an RDX, but it came out sooner and I see many more MDXs.

-juice

author: lemko
text:
...yellow Honda S2000 with black top.
...white Cadillac SRX.
...green Chevrolet Malibu Maxx.

author: ateixeira
text:
Mercedes ML350

Chevy HHR

Slow new car day, I usually see 4-5 new ones.

-juice

author: boomchek
text:
Aston Martin, this one a convertible, and an older model (early 2000)

Also a yellow Ferrari F430 Spyder.

Maserati Coupe in blue yesterday.

Ford Expedition XL all black.

author: ateixeira
text:
Very disappointing because the top fit was dreadful. All kinds of wrinkles and simply horrible fit.

They're what, a year old now? Gotta re-engineer those tops.

I have a 14 year old Miata with a cheap aftermarket top that I put on by myself and it fits 10 times better. GM should be embarassed.

-juice

author: kyfdx
text:
I wasn't even sure what an Outlook was, until I saw this today.... I guess it is a twin to the GMC Acadia?

Pretty attractive, if you go for the SUV thing.. Much better looking than the Trailblazer/Envoy models..

author: ateixeira
text:
That's exactly right. Only minor differences between the two, mostly on the interior. The Buick Enclave is far more differentiated.

I saw an Acadia on Wednesday when my wife got a test drive offer for a Buick (we didn't even actually drive the car), and the no-haggle price was $41k (already discounted). Yikes. It was loaded up, but still. And that's with the $1k rebate.

I test drove an Outlook a few weeks ago that was a base, FWD model and the list price was under $30k, so it seems like they cover a very broad range of prices.

-juice

author: boomchek
text:
Came into our dealership for a lease for someone. I sat in it while in the detail shop. Black on black.

I love the sound of the motor. Overall interior was very well done but a couple things disappointed me:

The key is exactly the same as used in VW (the rectangle switchblade key) except it has a Bentley logo on it.


The tranny shifter pattern plate looks similar to ones in a VW or Audi.

It's kind of disappointing whenb you're spending that much dough on a car.

Sorta like Aston Martins of early 980s were using Ford Taurus steering wheels for a while (because of the airbags).

Or Lotus Esprits were using Saturn SC1 steering wheels as well for the same reason.

author: giancarlo51
text:
I saw these all around the University of Washington campus in Seattle, all in one day:

2 gold GL SUVs, they're HOT

1 new silver S550

3-4 old S-classes

and 3-4 Honda S2000s, strange seeing how I rarely see them and now in one day, in one area, I see multiple S2000s

author: boomchek
text:
Saw a nice Aston Martin DB7 convertible in light blue.

Lots of Scion TCs (we don't have them in Canada).

author: lemko
text: ...a black Ford Edge. Heck, this lumpy crossover thingie is about as edgy as a butter knife used to slice a piece of granite.

author: fintail
text: I saw a grey CL550 today, the first I have seen on the road. I'll take one, please.

author: dialm4speed
text: I spotted a Ford Edge. It was dark so I couldn't see much but I immediately recognized what it was. Looked nice from what little I saw.

author: andys120
text:
I saw my first Gen II BMW X5, or is it X5/v 2.0.
It looked just like the gray one seen in the Nurburgring commercial, very nice and oddly doesn't look any bigger than the v 1s.

When the X5 first came out I thought it didn't look as nice as the contemporary E39 5-series Touring (wagon). FWIW the new one looks much nicer than the Bangleized E60 Touring.

author: ateixeira
text:
I've seen one on the roads, and also think it looks better than the old model. Good update.

-juice

author: bumpy
text: 2007 Sentra and a 2007 Tundra 5.7L crew cab. The Tundra is hilariously chunky, and actually manages to make GM's new trucks look almost svelte.

author: lemko
text: ...black Mercury Montego. I got to drive a new Fusion last night. My girlfriend likes the car, but I think her current LaCrosse is a nicer car with better features.

author: ateixeira
text:
First one I've seen with steelies. They actually styled the wheels so they sort of look like alloys, even though they're not.

Previous models had some seriously ugly steelies, these look much better.

That's something competitors like the Forester and RAV4 have been doing all along. Who says a steel wheels has to look bad?

-juice

PS Also saw an RD-X yesterday

author: kyfdx
text:
One of the "features" on my '77 Cobra II..

Styled Steel Wheels.. came with trim rings and center caps... woo hoo!!

author: teds1
text:
I saw both in the village last night about a block apart. I always try and see who is in them (usually without success due to the curtains). One of these passenger's actually had some kind of spot light on his face, I guess he really wanted people to see him being driven around.
Also saw a 60's Mustang fastback and an M5

author: kyfdx
text:
Big deal, right?

This was a TAXI!!

author: alltorque
text:
150 km/h ? Hey that's just over 90mph. What happened.......gearbox jammed in 2nd ? :blush:

Was watching an old episode of Top Gear recently where one of the guys was tooling a Bentley Arnage along a desert highway at between 160 and 180 mph.................and looking very relaxed as he did so.

author: teds1
text:
There is at least one Rx400 Hybrid taxi in NY. I thought that was an odd choice.
Usually they highly regulate what cab drivers can use but they seem to have exceptions if you are willing to buy a much nicer car than the crown vics that fill the ranks. I also saw a Merc E350 a few years ago.

author: ateixeira
text:
Escape hybrids are more common. They use a bunch of those.

Hybrid makes sense for stop-n-go city driving.

But a luxury SUV does not. :lemon:

-juice

author: fintail
text:
Warm dry day here today, got behind and alongside a new unplated DB9, sounded very nice...the driver was concentrating very hard, so it looked - death grip on the wheel and never moving his head. Also a new Jag convertible with a weird looking older woman driving it.

I also saw a modified W203 C-class badged "S666"

author: lemko
text: ...spotted last night - black Impala SS followed by a yellow Corvette convertible with a black top.

author: lemko
text: ...red Jeep Compass.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw one yesterday while going home. Oddly it almost seems bigger than the Sentra.

-juice

author: kyfdx
text:
Hey.. me too!!

From the back, they do look narrower, though..

Compared to the Fit and Yaris, the Versa seems Lexus-like in its interior appointments... I think I could give up 2-4 highway MPG to get the extra creature comforts of the Versa.. and, I'm really not much of a Nissan fan...

author: ateixeira
text:
Plus the base engine is a 1.8l, and you can get a 6 speed.

It's a shame they didn't tune it for sportier driving.

Imagine a Versa SE-R, with a 2.0l or so engine, and the same 6 speed manual? I'd be test driving one, that's for sure.

-juice

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Tundras, Tundras, Tundras. I pass a few of them each day and one of the guys here at work just bought a 5.7 DC over the weekend. They seem to be really taking off.

Followed a Toyota Prius home from work yesterday that was tagged with a bumper sticker "Voltswagen". Got a chuckle out of it.

author: kyfdx
text: Does the new Mercedes E-class come in a coupe version? I could swear that is what I saw this morning... :surprise:

author: bumpy
text: A CL maybe? Or a CLK, or an SL, or an SLK? I can't keep the alphabet soup of recent MB models straight either.

author: fintail
text:
Nope, the CLK is the closest thing size-wise.

The big new CL550 is just beginning to hit the streets here, maybe it was one of those?

author: kyfdx
text:
Maybe the CL550.. I passed it on the fly.. I see CLK models every day, so I don't think that's it...

Also, saw a CLS today... I'm kind of over that look... Either make a coupe... or a nice looking sedan (like a Jag).. Just not digging the 4-door coupe.

author: fintail
text: I am not into the CLS either. They are eyecatching, but I wouldn't want one every day. I am too tall, and those windows are too short.

author: kyfdx
text:
The CL-coupe is 8.5" longer than the E-class... The CLK-coupe is 8.5" shorter..

Maybe it was a CL.. I'm sure it wasn't a CLK..

author: ateixeira
text:
Finally saw my first Ford Edge on the road.

Also saw a Lincoln clone.

Both look OK, but I can't help but wonder why they're so big outside without even a 3rd row option.

A new G35 passed me today, boy does it look good. Evolutionary, but they fixed it in all the right places.

author: gsemike
text:
I agree with you on both counts. The Edge just looks so damn porky. How did it baloon to 4500 pounds?

The last gen G is a sweet ride and they made the new one even nicer inside, out and under the hood. That's a car to lust after.

author: ateixeira
text:
Look at how much better the packaging for the Freestlye is. Too bad it's a bit dull.

I wouldn't mind having Freestyle space with Edge styling.

-juice

author: boomchek
text:
I always liked the Freestyle, even though it's not a huge seller for Ford.

As a recreational vehicle, or a family wagon, I wouldn't hesitate getting one. The Pacifica is also another one I like.

author: andys120
text:
I spotted a new CX-7 in traffic, it's bigger than
I thought it would be. I was sure I was looking at a CX-9
but the badge told me otherwise.

It looked Murano-sized, very handsome in silver.

author: boomchek
text: So hard to tell those two apart (CX7 and CX9).

author: ateixeira
text:
A couple more of these. Saw an old one and a new one side-by-side, and while subtle, the improvements are very significant. It's quite a handsome sedan now, making the old one look just a tad awkward.

I also see 1-2 MDXs every day now. It's gotta be outselling the RDX because I only see those once a week or so.

Also saw a Mistu Outlander. Seems tiny for a 3 row crossover.

author: teds1
text: In San Juan PR of all places. I saw a bunch of 4 door wranglers down there as well. back in NYC I saw the Black S8 that parks in my office again, also two phantoms out the window this morning

author: matthattan1587
text:
I spotted a new GMC Acadia parking on my block, GMC really hit the mark on this one, good looking vehicle. I also saw the new Lincoln MKZ and Ford Edge...I don't really like the styling of these two.

I have seen multiple Mazda CX-7's and a Cx-9. The CX-7 is a good looking vehicle, the front looks very sharp. The CX-9 is more like a large minivan, think they should have just made the CX-7.

Lastly I have seen some new Altimas out there, not a big fan of these either, liked the older Altimas better and a brand new Ford Escape, it looked sharp, but pictures of its cousin the Mazda Tribute looks even better!

author: matthattan1587
text: I have seen this lexus RX400 on the FDR Drive, it is the only one in NYC. Yesterday in Union Sq I saw a brand new Toyota Prius Cab!

author: ateixeira
text:
They needed the CX9 to replace the MPV.

The CX7 is very small, much too small for someone who would be shopping for a people mover. I ruled it out for its small size.

author: kyfdx
text: Mazda doesn't have a regular mini-van, anymore? I guess I missed that.. :surprise:

author: ateixeira
text:
Nope, last year was the final year for the MPV.

They sandwiched it between the small Mazda5 and the big CX9.

I should take a closer look at the CX9. Saw it at the DC auto show but don't remember much about it (that's not a good sign...).

author: kyfdx
text:
Take all the sport out of a CX-7 and add some pork and you have the CX-9... amazingly generic...

No mini-van? What a marketing mistake.. :surprise:

author: ateixeira
text:
MPV couldn't sell even with a $4000 rebate, $18k for an LX! :surprise:

I'm sure they make more profit per car selling a $26,000 crossover.

author: kyfdx
text:
Assuming they can move the minivan driver to an SUV.. I'm guessing that they lose about 90% of them..

The MPV was 4 years behind the times on size... Even Kia and Hyundai can sell full-size minivans... How is that for an oxymoron!!??

author: ateixeira
text:
Well, they weren't many MPV customers, so they didn't have much to lose in the first place.

The crossover should do similar volume at a much higher price level, and that would still be a success for Mazda.

author: chuck1959
text: Actually I thought they both did.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
have seen many of the revamped Altimas around these parts. Sharp looking redesign IMO.

Also the MDX and RDX seem to be selling about equal, I see a few during my commute to work and back.

At the local Starbucks where I get my coffee in the morning, I saw a couple of contractors trucks from the same business parking in the back row. 2 new Tundras and a third pulled in while I was waiting in line. Glad to see those trucks are selling well.

author: ateixeira
text:
Guess so. They never got rid of the Tribute, so the CX7 and CX9 sandwiched the old MPV.

Got a $25 certificate (gift card) offer from Mazda so I may go drive a CX9 soon.

-juice

author: kyfdx
text:
in navy blue.. dog dish hubcaps, tinted windows..

Yup.. it was a KY State Police vehicle.. :surprise:

author: boomchek
text: GMC Acadia in white. A very nice looking SUV imo. I think GM's styling is sorta getting back on track. It would be nice if their reliability would do the same.

author: lemko
text: The Philadelphia city police have a few Dodge Charger cruisers. They are really cool-looking police cars. The other police cars are mostly Crown Victorias and Impalas.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a 3 series coupe on my way in. Looks much better than the sedan, IMO.

-juice

author: fintail
text:
Not brand new, but yesterday I saw a MB C32 AMG wagon. Yeah, something that was never sold here. I am sure it was just a crafty rebadge, but it was well done - all the right badges, exhaust tip, etc. Or maybe somehow someone brought one in?

I also saw a couple of Ferrari 430s, in the morning rain.

author: teds1
text:
Drove for a while next to a silver Phantom, single woman driving it alone... usually they have chaufeuer and a grey haired plutocrat in the back.

Also a Vanquish pulled up next to me at one point, pretty rare.

Finally we saw a purple cayman S. That car looks good in almost every color even purple.

author: ateixeira
text: Saw a Fit yesterday, and then a Suburban this morning with a broken tail light (already?). :sick:

author: lemko
text: ...spotted a heavily customized new Corvette modified to resemble a '53 'Vette. It was white with a black top, had a red interior, the rocket-like taillights and a front end with sunken headlamps with gravel covers and a toothy chrome grille. You had to see it!

author: ateixeira
text: See those a lot lately.

author: kyfdx
text: Yup.. me too.. Also saw an RDX, today.. in white..

author: anythngbutgm
text: Saw one of those in black today. Parked next to it was a new TL-S, 6-spd also in black.

author: teds1
text: I also just saw a TL-S, I had forgotten they were coming out but I noticed a good looking black TL with smoked rear lenses and quad exhaust pipes, and lo and behold that is what is was. If TLs were anything but front wheel drive I would really consider one.

author: boomchek
text: I think there's a company that does that. IMO it's kinda ugly.

author: teds1
text:
Shark Grey 599 GTB Fiorano right up Park avenue... My whole office stopped and stared out the window...

That car is ridiculous

author: boomchek
text:
Sat in the new MB CL coupe. Very nice car, love its lines.

Suzuki XL7: Looks nicer in pictures than in person. Really odd proportions to it, especially the overhangs.

New Mitsu Lancer: nice outside, ho hum interior

Will go back to see more when I have some more time.

author: fintail
text: Heh...I sat in that same CL. Lovely thing indeed.

author: fintail
text:
Oh yeah, not a totally new car...but when I went down to the gas station to put some expensive fuel in the beast, I pulled up alongside this Ford. I had my phone, so I snapped a pic:



The guy left the door open when he went in to pay! I think the car belongs to a local high end lot, though.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a pair of new Elantras....

Then a pair of new Auras.

Then a pair of new Fords, but one Escape and one Edge, not the same model.

author: boomchek
text: Did you drive down here for the show?

author: fintail
text: Yep

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Silver bullet went flying by me this morning on the highway.

Also NH state police have some new cars...

(Not actual photo)

Seeing one of these in your rear view mirror is unsettling.

author: andys120
text:
NH State cops have had those Chargers for about a year now, saw 15-20 of them parked at the barn in Concord last summer, mostly in black.

They do look more intimidating than Crown Vics. :surprise:

Watch out for unmarked black ones!

author: anythngbutgm
text: Thanks Andy, I didn't know that. I've been working in Manchester for about 6 weeks so today was my first sighting. Unmarked Black ones? Thanks for the heads up!

author: boomchek
text:
Your a dedictated car nut, to drive down for the auto show.

I'm going to go this week for the third time, cause when Iu worked there I didn't have too much time mto see stuff, and when I went with my fiancee, it was a quick walk as well.

author: fintail
text:
I made it up in just a little over 2 hours, it wasn't too bad. The E55, with fast-ish highway driving, city traffic, and 25 minutes of border waste time on the way back still averaged 23 mpg, too.

IMO the Vancouver show is better than the Seattle show (they let you sit in more high end cars in Van), it's a nice day trip. I've gone to it for years, as once I didn't have to really travel to attend.

author: ateixeira
text: Edge this morning, and then a Lexus LS.

author: paisan
text:
I've been seeing Lexus LSs and Edges for a few months now.

-mike

author: ateixeira
text: Took me a while to see an Edge on the road. I still think I've only seen a total of 3 or 4.

author: teds1
text: Is it just me or is it tough to tell the new LS from the ES Lexus at a glance? Both are vast improvements from their last version but I don't find the overall shapes and details different enough. Whatever Lexi (?) aren't my thing anyway

author: ateixeira
text:
The new ES looks much better than the outgoing one, which had those pulled-back eye lids.

Nothing wrong with a family resemblance.

author: lemko
text: ...champagne-colored GMC Arcadia on Rising Sun near Comly at lunchtime.

author: boomchek
text:
You're not the only one. I have to do a double take to check which model I'm looking at.

Either way both the ES and LS have much better styling than the outgoing models.

author: boomchek
text:
for some brochures, and to have a look at everything I didn't get a chance to see while working.

I was surprised by the GMC Acadia SUVs. Very well finished and equipped for the price. They even have digital control panel for the back seats with climate control and audio controls.

I noticed many new cars these days have a cheap feel to them. Door handles feel cheap and flimsy, interior plastics rmind me of those on the old hot wheel/matchbox gas station/parkade playsets. You tap on them and feel a hollow sound.

Saw the new VW Jetta wagon. I thought it was a Saab 9-3 wagoin at first because the angles and propotions are very similar, but it was the Jetta. I like the previous gen better in terms of looks.

Audis had top noitch interiors as always, very well finsihed, and laid out. I played around with their MMI (Audi's iDrive) because the stereo was on, and I still don't know why high end manufacturers can't just have simple controls for things like the stereo and climate.

New X5 was sweet too in and out. Once again my fav SUV out there.

Couple Hyundais that caught my eye: the Accent and the Azera. The Accent has very stylish lines to it for a subcompact, has that euro minicar flair to it. If I'd be in the market for the cheapest new car, I'd probably get the hatchback.
They had a silver Azera there, I think they only look good in black.

Other than that nothing much else excites me because we get many 1 or 2 year old trade ins on the lot at work, so I usually get to see and drive them at work. Currently we have an 06 RX8, 03 E500, SL55AMG, had an 05 LS430.

And surprisingly Kia wasn't at the show at all.

author: guss
text:
the Gmc Acacia and Saturn Outlook at the Philly show and was also impressed. Although the price climbs pretty quickly when you start adding options, I thought the bare bones Outlook was a decent deal.

I saw a VW Eos pulled over to the side of the highway, she(of course) may have been trying to figure out how to get the top down because it was one of the first nice days around here.

author: stever
text: Did you see the Volvo?

author: british_rover
text: I see about a dozen LR2s outside my office. :surprise:

author: chuck1959
text: I noticed that too. What I saw driving past me I thought the LS until it past and the I noticed it was an ES, surprised me, That's what I get for missing an auto show!

author: teds1
text:
It was just a matter of time but I saw one of these today. Looked good.

Also those new Acadia things aren't bad looking either, I saw a few of them recently.

Hitting the NYIAS this afternoon... so pumped!

author: kyfdx
text: I agree.... the Lexus ES is a big improvement in looks.. I have a hard time telling it from the IS, from the rear..

author: boomchek
text:
No, the Vancouver Auto Show didn't have that Volvo here.

Saw the new C30 though, neat little car. Chick car.

author: ateixeira
text: No kidding, the local dealer had just one AWD model in stock and it was $42k after discounts. :surprise:

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Well the wife and I visited Chicago for the weekend (what a beautiful city) and there were car sightings a plenty the entire weekend.

My imppressions:
Range Rover central: There were more RR and RRS there than I have seen in my entire life.

BMW 3-series were the car of choice, from regular 328's to 335i sedans and coupes. I don;t know if I was seeing things or not, but I thought I saw a new bodystyle coupe with quad exhaust pipes (new M3 sighting? :surprise: ) Sure sounded like it...

Up the street from the hotel was an Infiniti store that had a window display with some exotics (tradeins I think) and they Bentley GTC vert and a gorgeous Saleen S7. They also had an SLR Mercedes.

There were many more sightings, but these were probably the coolest. Even more beautiful than the cars was the Chicago Library with the gigantic petina'd copper forms looming from the roof. Can't wait to go back. :shades:

author: guss
text:
$42K For a Eos. :confuse: I thought it was carrying on the line of the Rabbit convertible/ Cabriolet. At that price were talking more Mercedes CL K.

Funny thing is, I thought it looked a bit like a 2 door Ford Escort.

author: lemko
text: ...a black 2007 Nissan Sentra. Sentras aren't as common as Altimas despite being lower priced.

author: kyfdx
text: You'll start seeing a lot of them... We rented from Alamo at the PHX airport last week.. They had a dozen of them, still with temporary tags (which is why I didn't take one of them).

author: rockylee
text: Rocky

author: kyfdx
text:
Pontiac G5 (Cobalt clone?).. my first one.

Mercedes SL55 AMG..

author: guss
text:
That's alot of 5's, you should play 555 it in the lottery.

I saw a new Escape, the front end looks too much like the Explorer.

author: lemko
text: ...silver BMW X3 this morning.

author: anythngbutgm
text: but I saw a Subaru SVX on the way to work this morning. Remember those?

author: ateixeira
text:
Yep, full canopy and all. You can open the windows in a down pour and not get the interior wet. paisan had one.

Too bad, it was a car before its time. The idea of an upscale AWD touring coupe just came too early.

Now that the SUV boom is pretty much over, a lot of those buyers are getting AWD sedans, the SVX would have offered a nice alternative.

I guess you can get an A5 Quattro soon enough. :shades:

author: kyfdx
text:
I think the SVX's biggest problem was the price... Along with the Mitsubishi 3000GT VR4, it was about $10K higher than anything else that the dealer had on the lot...

It would be like Mitsu or Subaru selling a vehicle for $50K today.. It would be a tough sell.. Just ask Honda about the NSX... :surprise:

author: giancarlo51
text:
New cars galore around Seattle:

...a blue Acura TL Type-S was tailgating me this morning, looks even better in person (the photos of the blue one at the acura site does not do justice)

...new black MDX - also much better looking in person

...black MB S550 parked by Safeco Field, UGLY [non-permissible content removed] rims, but otherwise great design

...souped up black MB CL600 with black rims, not the way I like my 100K+ cars

author: andre1969
text:
about a week ago, but forgot to post. On the Balt-Wash Parkway in Maryland, near BWI Airport, I saw a Nissan X-trail. Are these things being sold in the United States now? I wasn't under the impression that they were.

And Maryland seems kinda far from the border to be seeing something that might be offered in Canada or Mexico. Although once I did see a Chrysler Intrepid at a local movie theater parking lot.

author: stever
text:
I don't think they are sold here - just in Canada and Mexico (and Japan). We may get the Qashqai here in the States (now on sale in the UK) instead of the X-Trail.

Nissan X-Trail (we want it!)

I'd take the Bonavista Edition one myself.

author: ateixeira
text: I bet it was Canadian. We're not that far from Canada here in MD.

author: fintail
text: Bentley Continental GTC, in black

author: guss
text: a Kia Rondo, the little mini-van thing. I am a Mazda fan, but I liked the look of the Rondo better than the Mazda 5. It was a little more car like with the regular rear doors.

author: ateixeira
text:
Sliders are very handy, though. Wider opening, less space.

I saw my first Mazda CX9 out on the road. Looks good.

Also saw my first Dodge Stratus. That looks a bit cartoonish, with very exaggerated "styling" features.

author: fintail
text: I saw a Saab 97-X today. I see more new Bentleys than I see these "Saabs". What a disaster.

author: boomchek
text:
What's funny about badge engineered cars is that usually in the ads they claim they were designed and engineered from the ground up for (insert car brand here) customers who demand more.

Ummm, no they were desgned to be your run of the mill car/truck, with interchangeable panels so that it could be adopted to 5 different brand names out there.

author: gagrice
text: I rarely see a Saab or a Bentley of any type in San Diego. You must live in an affluent neighborhood. All we have down here are Mercedes, BMWs and a load of lifted PU trucks and SUVs. If you see one of these let us know.

author: ateixeira
text:
Coupe, pulled right in front of me in traffic today.

Also saw an RD-X this morning.

Last night I was with my wife and walked by a parked Ford Edge. I still think it's big outside, small inside.

author: fintail
text: And in the case of the Saab, being little different from the clones that cost a lot less. That vehicle is old-school GM thinking at its finest.

author: ateixeira
text: I saw the Dub Edition 9-7x and NYIAS and had to just laugh. This is not what the Saab founders had in mind. :sick:

author: lemko
text: ...saw a Subaru Tribeca at lunchtime today.

author: ateixeira
text:
They're common around me. There's one at my kid's school that parks there every day (must be a teacher's) and two here in the garage at work.

The 08 is far more conventional looking:

author: bhill2
text:
I rarely see a Saab or a Bentley of any type in San Diego

Go north to Rancho Santa Fe. I used to drive through there all of the time. The less fortunate families only have one Bentley.

author: gagrice
text: The last time I was up there Hale Bopp was flying over looking for Heaven's Gate cult members. You are right that would be the place to spot them.

author: fintail
text: It's not an Edsel anymore!

author: ateixeira
text:
Nope.

It's actually the Saabeca, i.e. the stillborn Saab 9-6x project.

FHI was developing a clone for Saab to sell, and when GM decided to sell its shares of FHI to Toyota, that stalled the project.

They recycled everything, the headlights are identical to ones from a test mule of the Saab 9-6x.

So basically Subaru is selling what would have been the Saabeca. I guess the good thing is that it cost them nothing to develop because they had already developed it!

author: kyfdx
text: Wow... is that a big improvement, or what?

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Letting Subaru go was the best thing GM has done in the past 30 years...

I also saw the new Tribeca in NY. It's an improvement, definitely. The new WRX sedan is awesome as well.

author: andre1969
text: That's one pretty impressive facelift on the Tribeca! It's nice to see that Subaru can react quickly when they have to.

author: guss
text:
It's nice to see Subaru can admit to a mistake and make the appropriate changes.

Now all they need is a retrofit kit for the Tribeca's previously sold.

author: ateixeira
text:
Well, like I said, they already had a 2nd design for the Saab 9-6x, so it wasn't so much a reaction. They just finished development of that clone, and swapped the badge.

The grille does look like it could be in the Chrysler family, but I wouldn't say it looks like one overall (just the grille):

author: lemko
text: ...spotted a silver Chevrolet SSR at the Sunoco station on Rising Sun and Tyson as I was filling up my Seville. It's a nice day and the driver had the SSR's top down. Looks like a fun ride albeit impractical as a truck.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
I got to drive one a few years ago when I put my S2000 away for the winter. Some guy was putting his away at the same garage. My impressions:

It's fun in a 1970 MonteCarlo kinda way. Big, heavy and ponderous. I'd even go so far as to say it handled about as well as this "familiar" concept...


And that's being polite. :blush: Power was there, but the thing weighed like 3 tons so it was strained, big time...

Edit: couldn't be driven in the rain because it had a water leak. He had to tape off the "hole" when it got washed.

author: navigator89
text:
A deep blue Lamborghini Gallardo, an orange Ferrari 360 Modena, then a light blue 360 Modena, two Flying Spurs in white, two Continentals in white and red. Also two LS460s in greyish green. Two 911 Turbos as well, one old generation one new. Old one was neon blue, the new one was Guards Red like in the IL road test. Also a few new Cayennes.

Overall a terrific day!

author: andys120
text:
They aren't new but they're pretty rare even here in Saab Country and yesterday I saw TWO Saabarus, that's about a year's worth.

I've seen a couple of Dodge Nitros lately which I thought were nice looking for what they are.

author: fintail
text: Lots of nice new stuff out here today...I saw a Bentley Flying Spur, a couple of Continental coupes, a "Bluetec" badged E-class, an E63, a retractable roof BMW 3er, a couple Ford Edge, and a Hyundai Veracruz (VERY derivative of the CRV)

author: andys120
text:
I stopped by the BMW Store yesterday to ogle the new Three-series coupe and convertible. Needless to say both are gorgeous.

I personally am pleased to see BMW return to their classic styling themes with these cars.
They go right to the top of my wish list, in fact the 3er coupe and cab are better looking than the more expensive but overly Bangleized 6- series IMO.

Then there's the Z4s which by all accounts are sweet driving cars but are seriously ugly and if you thought the Roadster was ugly, wait til you get a load of the Z4 Coupe. :sick:

author: bumpy
text:
This one?


I like it. Reminds me a bit of the original 240Z. If it wasn't designed and built by Germans, I'd actually consider buying one.

The Z3 coupe was a bona fide uggo:

author: teds1
text:
Haven't posted in a while so I have a list.
First, the NYIAS was great. I am not gonna post any cars from the show as sightings but I will say the R8 was probably the most popular car there, the $30k V8 Hyundai Lux Sedan is going to be very significant, The Z4 Coupe is great looking but pretty spartan inside, The Lambo model was smoking hot next to two white Murcielagos, The Mazdaspeed 3 was my choice for reasonable buy, the ageing viper had a raaaaaad paint job (look it up), and unfortunately, Subaru really butchered the WRX.

Other than that I actually rode in a UNIMOG in mexico (how rare are they?)
Saw the usual complement of Maybachs, Phantoms and Flying spurs around my office
Saw another GTC parked top down in front of a restaurant
Saw two CL 550s... kinda gangsta
DB7, Gallardo (black with smoked taillights), old model Z06 with custom exhaust, and waaaaay too many people in convertibles with the top up. Come on it's spring, mess your hair up!

Oh and by the way the Z3 Coupes were ridculously awesome... sorry bumpy

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a CR-V LX today. Odd to see them with steelies and so bare-bones.

Saw not one but TWO HHRs. I rarely see those.

Drove by a brand new Civic LX. Those wheel covers are still the bolt-on type, so I guess losing them is hard.

author: andys120
text: I think the Z3 coupe was pretty good looking compared to the Z4, not a beauty by any means but acceptable, at least to me.

author: guss
text: I never got the flame surfacing either. The Z3, in convertible form anyway, was tolerable. The Z4 is just weird.

author: kyfdx
text:
I think the Z4 looks are improved in coupe form, something that I can't say about the Z3..

While I do have an affinity for goofy-looking cars, even the owners of the Z3 coupe named their annual gathering, "DorkFest".

author: ateixeira
text: I call it the Clown Shoe. So ugly it's actually endearing in a way.

author: fintail
text: Ha! I've always called those cars the "shoe" as well. There used to be one in the garage of my apt building, and it never moved...but one day it was gone, out of the blue.

author: anythngbutgm
text: Same here, I always referred to it as a wooden shoe from Holland.

author: bumpy
text: I rode behind a BMW 650i convertible. That car has an absurdly large bubble butt.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a couple of these this weekend. Still far from common around here, though.

Also saw a new Fit this morning.

author: fintail
text: Today I saw an Audi RS4, I believe it was new

author: anythngbutgm
text: Heading South on Rt3 in NH I spotted a Silver Carrera GT. :surprise: Wow!

author: kyfdx
text:
New Hampshire? Just think.. he saved $25K in sales taxes..

That probably made the difference in qualifying for the loan....lol.

author: ateixeira
text:
Casually commuting next to me in bumper to bumper DC traffic.

Makes no sense to me. Why subject a car like that to a crawling traffic mess?

author: british_rover
text: Har funny but true.

author: anythngbutgm
text: LOL!

author: odie6l
text:
I got to see a Mary Kay edition Cadillac at the local Post Office. The car is normal, but the paint job (besides being a shade of PINK) was a neat reflective Mother of Pearl. It shimmered as I went past. I was nore of a White with a Pink underlay. It was sure an eye catcher.

Odie
Odie's Carspace

author: ateixeira
text: I thought only Avon ladies had pink cars...

author: kyfdx
text:
Saab 9-2X Aero..

Summer of 2005, you could get one of these very, very cheap... undercutting the WRX wagon, even.. I wish I had.

author: kyfdx
text:
New BMW Z-M coupe..

I like these, but if you put one up next to a Cayman, I'd take the Cayman every time.

author: ateixeira
text:
Yep, you could get a no-haggle walk-in price of $19.4k, hard to believe even in hindsight.

Plus, with Saab you got 2 free years of service!

At the time I think a base WRX was $21k or so, no free service. The only extra thing you got was roof rails.

Saw a new Ducati, a Buell, and a BMW boxer. Motorcycles, of course. :shades:

author: anythngbutgm
text: Last evening. wow.

author: boomchek
text:
Black Gallardo convertible driving with the top up on a sunny day.

Really stunning looking car more so in person than in pictures.

author: lemko
text: ...silver Porsche Cayenne Turbo on my way to work this morning.

author: kyfdx
text:
I'm sort of over the Sky/Solstice thing...

They remind me of cartoon cars.. sort of like the mid-late '70s Vettes... Just a lot of swoops, with nothing underneath..

author: bumpy
text: I dunno; the turbo versions are pretty decent at what they are (2-seat GT cabrios). The base version is pretty dumpy, though. GM put the wrong engine (and transmission) in it.

author: bumpy
text: finally bought a Saturn Outlook. Still looks too similar to the Acadia in person. Also saw an XLR yesterday.

author: lemko
text: ...black Dodge Nitro and black BMW 745 with portholes! Maybe he'd really rather have a Buick?

author: rockylee
text:
Yeah, he could be a in the closet Buick, fan.-grin

-Rocky

author: ateixeira
text: Spent the weekend visiting the in-laws and spotted one of these in (where else?) Darien, CT.

author: odie6l
text:
I got to see Four (4) Prowlers running together today on my way into work. 2 Silver, 1 Yellow, and 1 Blue (w/ White Top). The Blue one could have passed for a Detroit Lions Car (Hawaiian Blue and White). It looked really neat.

Odie
Odie's Carspace

author: ateixeira
text: Saw two of these, and a Lincoln MKX towing a trailer as well.

author: lemko
text: Saw a silver Mercedes S500 this morning in traffic.

author: fintail
text: S500 is now the S550 here. The car you saw might have even been from one of those lovely highline BHPH lots that seem to be common in Philly. A lot of people will see a 2000 MY S class and think it is new...as it is different from an 06 model in just some trim detail.

author: lemko
text: ...if this is a dealer installed option or not. Spotted a black Dodge Ram "Midnite Express Truck" with door decals and exhaust stacks. It was reminiscent of the L'il Red Express Truck of the late 1970s. I remember seeing another Dodge truck - yellow this time - with a decal package and spoiler "Rumble Bee" reminiscent of the old Dodge Super Bee muscle car.

author: andys120
text:
black BMW 745 with portholes! Maybe he'd really rather have a Buick?

Maybe you saw a Maserati Quattroporte?

author: boomchek
text:
Sometimes dealers make up their own "special" packages.

One of the Honda dealers in town did this to their Ridgelines when they first came out. They added running boards, mudflaps, roof rack, foglights, and ugly graphics and called in a Urban package or something like that.

author: rockylee
text:
So they made a ugly truck even more.... :surprise:

-Rocky

author: andys120
text:
I saw an MKX for the first time, Lincoln's new crossover looks pretty good. The grille, which copies the one from a '61 Continental is almost too much for the relatively small MKX. OTOH
the car I saw could use larger wheels.

Am I the only one who thinks the new Lincoln nomenclature is idiotic?

author: ateixeira
text:
No. I'm a car guy and I have to think about it each time.

The worst part is they had a Mark Seven, Mark Eight, but these are Em Kay Ex, Em Kay Zee. So there's that as well.

For MKX, I try to think of the X as "crossover", and that helps. The Z is for Zephyr in MKZ, I supposed.

Porsche has the same issue with the Cayenne and Cayman, they names are just too close.

author: andys120
text:
Porsche has the same issue with the Cayenne and Cayman, the names are just too close.

I quite agree, I get them mixed up too. Cayenne is a dumb name, Porsche should've called it the Dakar and the Cayman (a small crocodille for cryin' out loud) should be the 987.

author: fintail
text: I saw an E63 yesterday. It was white. Why?

author: ateixeira
text:
I won't say what Jeremy Clarkson called it.

Top Gear fans will remember.

author: lemko
text: ...spotted a black and dark maroon Maybach 57 on the street one block west of my house.

author: teds1
text:
Yesterday I saw a white GT3 being driven by a 30 year old guy wearing business casual, expesive sunglasses and an air of distain. The license plate frames said Lotus of Greenwich... I wonder what HE does for a living.

Also I forgot that a few weeks ago I saw a Campagna T-Rex on Broadway. Wierdest thing was the color, Beige. Who gets an outrageous sportbike/trike thing and paints it beige?

I have seen a few Maybach 57S s near my office whcih spiced up the usual uber limo blend for a while. I can't fathom why one would buy a 57S but at least three guys who work on Park avenue did.

author: stever
text:
I wonder what HE does for a living.

Maybe he was shuttling the car for the dealer he works for. :P

author: british_rover
text: Heheh yeah but those kind of cars don't get shuttled. They get moved in an enclosed trailer.

author: fintail
text:
It's not what he does for a living, it's what his dad or grandpa does...

It's funny, I see RR Phantoms on the road here now and then, but I have seen a Maybach but once. What a lead balloon.

author: british_rover
text: The clients I have with serious money, and exquisite taste, all have Bentleys and/or a Rolls. Only one has a maybach and he does not have good taste. More of a wannabe rap promoter then anything else.

author: fintail
text: Ah, speaking of Bentley, the past couple days I have seen this same Flying Spur drive down my street, and it is a very unusual color - kind of a light pearly blue. Not bad really.

author: fintail
text: Not the newest things, but I saw the same red Enzo (it has to be the same) that I saw several months ago, and also a SL65 AMG.

author: bigo08
text: about a million Toyota Camrys on my way back from LA this morning :sick:

author: teds1
text:
I drove the length of the LIE on Sunday and hung around in Manhattan. The day's sightings made me feel like I was in Monaco instead of NY.

I saw,
2 ferrari 360 spyders (red and blue)
2 Maserati Quattroportes
4 Bentley Continental GT covertibles
Aston Martin DB9 convertible
Ford GT (white with blue stripes, the best color combo)
2 M6s
3 M5s
60s 356 Porsche roadster
Guards Red 2007 Porsche Turbo
Ferrari 250 gt Lusso!!!!!!!!
New LR2 rover, not bad but too $$$ for my tastes.
New Santa Fe (pretty car actually, I would consider it if I like suvs)
Customized Prowler

Slowly driving down Broadway reving their engines, a fly yellow Murcielago with 4 pipe tubi exhaust, smoked rear lenses and matching yellow rims. It was followed by a 360 modena spyder with the same color treatment.... Holy crap that sounded great!

And they say NY isn't a car town.

author: fintail
text:
A 250GT Lusso, as in a ca. 1964 Berlinetta Lusso? Wow

I saw a black Gallardo today with black wheels. I have noticed a black wheel trend lately - there's also a Bentley GT around here with black wheels.

author: british_rover
text:
On the right car black wheels can look good but it has to be the right car.

This morning I saw a late 90s Mustang 4.6 in a teal green with shiny black wheels.

That was NOT the right car.

author: fintail
text:
I've seen it on some E55s like mine. It's OK on a dark car...but I have no intentions of doing that to mine, even if it just meant having the monoblock spokes painted. I'm one of those people who prefers a stock wheel 9 times out of 10.

Ooh, a Porsche Carrera GT just drove by...

author: teds1
text:
I usually prefer stock wheels as well, but I have seen some in a "Black Chrome," that are pretty cool, it's more like the Tungsten color on the last model m5's wheels. As for paint matched rims... Its a fad.

And yes it was a berlinetta Lusso, and it was beautiful

author: anythngbutgm
text:
A black Ford GT driving so slow, it was holding up traffic on the road behind it

Silver Mclaren SLR
Avanti convertible (What an ugly car)

And the old...
Black Mercedes Fintail

author: fintail
text:
I saw a CLS with those black chromes...they were the McLaren turbine style. It didn't look bad...but it looked very pricey.

My car is dark grey, a person suggested that I paint the spokes of the wheels to match the car, and leave the polished lips as-is...but it's not worth the time and expense to me. I think the AMG monoblock is one of the most timeless wheel designs out there...mine are virtually unmarked, so I will leave them be.

I've never seen a Lusso on the road. At least it's not a garage queen. I can be jealous and respectful at the same time.

author: fintail
text: I had my fintail out yesterday. I swear, it gets as much attention as a really high end new car.

author: british_rover
text:
Cause those things are timeless and really good looking.

I still see that dark blue one around my dealership from time to time. It needs a new passenger side fender though as the metal right behind the headlight has come apart.

author: boomchek
text: Red Lambo Gallardo. First red one I've seen, most were either black or silver.

author: fintail
text:
Yeah, the stacked lights and high grille seem to do something to people..myself included. It makes the car look very regal (I don't mean Buick) and expensive. I once knew a guy who thought it was a Bentley...no kidding. The period color doesn't hurt either.

I bet fintails can really be rusty around your neck of the woods...those cars can rust into pieces on salted roads. If it has rusted around the lights, there are almost certainly other issues.

author: british_rover
text: I see it all the time but I have never seen the owner. It is always either parked some where out of the way or going the opposite direction that I am going. I guess it can't be in too bad a shape if it is driving that much. The interior is spotless. The leather looks so good it has to have been recovered.

author: fintail
text: Is it leather or Tex?

author: lemko
text: Cool! I had my 1989 Cadillac Brougham out yesterday and today! These old cars really stand out in a sea of Camcords and anonymous soccer-mommy mobiles.

author: fintail
text: Yep, it's nice to be able to preserve examples of old design, back when character meant something. These old cars might not be as trouble free as moderns, but they are more enjoyable, and are a cheap vice to have. In the past 5 years I have spent very little on the fintail other than gas, insurance (almost nothing), oil changes, and storage costs.

author: british_rover
text: I have never touched it so I can't say. It looks like leather but that Tex can be so good maybe it is tex.

author: fintail
text:
The leather in old MB will rot away like any other of not maintained. But the Tex will survive a nuke, I think.

Speaking of newer cars, was the 03+ Range Rover ever offered in a loud non-metallic red? I see a youngish guy driving one of these in my area, with big dumb wheels, and it annoys me.

author: british_rover
text:
2003-2006 Range Rovers came in Alveston Red which is kind of a burgandy color.



Looks kine of like that.

http://orangecounty.craigslist.org/car/329145960.html

2007 Range rovers come in Rimini Red which is a little brighter.

You don't see many red Range Rovers though. I have only ever sold two.

author: bumpy
text: Divine Auto? Is salvation included at no extra charge if you accept Jesus as your personal salesman?

author: british_rover
text:
SSUUUREEEEE it is

It was just the first thing google game me that was actually an alveston Range Rover.

Look at this Travesty though...



Five points to whoever can tell me all the things wrong with that vehicle.

author: kyfdx
text:
First.. It looks like it has low-profile tires/wheels off of a passenger car..

The steering wheel is on the wrong side..

Running boards are going to inhibit off-roading..

Sorry... that's all I have..

author: fintail
text: Ah that's not even close to the one I have the misfortune of seeing nearly every day. I suspected it might be some kind of repaint...it has a poserfied air to it. The red I see reminds me of the non-metallic red I see on early 00's Jettas.

author: fintail
text: That looks like the 95-02 model with a new style front end, and those lame cliched fender vents. The Brits love to make aftermarket facelifts like that, I have seen them for Mercedes as well.

author: british_rover
text:
Yeah you got it for the most part.

That is a 95-02 Range or P38 with a 2003-2005 Mark III Range Front end.

The side vents are off a Range Rover sport as are the wheels. The wheels are 20 inch stormer wheels that were limited production only item last year but are now a 1,000 dollar option on top of the 4,000 dollars you paid for regular 20 inch wheels. So 5,000 dollars for "special" 20 inch wheels oh and they don't credit you back the cost of the 19 inch wheels that the Sport comes standard with. :surprise:

Talk about profitablity.

Those vents on the sport are actually functional or at least the passenger side one is. THe passenger side vent is used as the air intake for the engine. That way you get nice cool air from outside the hood and water/dust has a harder time getting into the intake track.

author: teds1
text:
That thing is BRUUUUUTAL. I hate auto mashups. Have eyou seen the CLS fronted e-wagon?

I saw a guy the other day with an m6 decal on his Versa... WTF? Even as a joke thats not very funny

author: ateixeira
text:
The driver's side of the air suspension is sagging pretty badly.

There's one like that in the garage here at work. The rear sags horribly. Looks like the car is squatting.

If I had a nickel for each time I saw a saggy Rover, I'd be rich.

author: british_rover
text: The rear bags tend to fail first on those vehicles. I don't remember why.

author: ateixeira
text: They must be expensive to fix, because people drive around on them like that. It's pathetic! You get a luxury SUV and then can't keep it running properly. I'm sure it's not even safe. :mad:

author: fintail
text:
Oh, that wagon sounds bad. I have seen W140 S class with W220 front ends, W220 with W221, W210 E class with W211 front ends, etc. Well, I have seen them in magazines.

BMW should bring up a slander case for that M6 decal :sick:

author: fintail
text:
Rover knows it has a lot of customers with more money than sense lol

I don't like those side vents...seems too trendy.

author: w9cw
text: Sometimes I think preventive, and corrective, maintenance levels are inversely proportional to an owner's income. Affluent individuals perceive vehicles as more disposable assets.

author: fintail
text: Not a new model, but today I saw a W211 E55 AMG in a beautiful kind of steel blue-grey color. I have never noticed that shade before. I wish my car would have been made in that color.

author: fintail
text: Indeed...that's why you always want to have records and/or a clean bill of health when buying a higline car that is even a couple years old. They seem to be double damned...either owned by rich people who don't care, or by people who can't afford to keep the car up. Luckily most high end makes have enthusiasts, so many cars are kept up.

author: teds1
text: Well I don't mind the side vents on the rovers since they act as exhaust snorkels and not some kind of non functioning naca duct. I believe that it really started in the modern era with the M3 which had small tasteful vents behind the front fenders to differentiate it from 330s. Now of course with the everybody including the escalade sporting them it has gone too far. Notice on the new M3 it does not appear to be a vent anymore but a chrome strip.

author: lemko
text: ...maroon Lincoln MKZ and silver Chevrolet Impala with a little badge on the decklid that read "FLEXFUEL ethanol E85."

author: ateixeira
text:
For the first time on the road, I saw a new Chrysler Sebring convertible. Very strange medium blue color, with a soft top. The rear window looks small, and could have been much bigger. Visibility looks bad.

Also saw 2 BMW 3 series coupes.

author: teds1
text: Top up (rain). Not a huge fan of retractable hard tops. They ruin the coupe lines with the exception of the SL. The beemer is a great car but I don't like the cut lines or angle of the hard top.

author: bumpy
text: with all sorts of chrome trim. Must have been the top-end model; all I usually see are the plain, pastel-colored versions that the SSA pays for.

author: british_rover
text: Saw a Buick enclave today. I think it would have looked ok if it wasn't in this hideous gold color.

author: lemko
text: ...black Nissan Altima and maroon Acura MDX. The MDX sure has a strange-looking grille!

author: anythngbutgm
text: In a baby blue color. Yuk.

author: british_rover
text: Yeah I think it would look fine in more standard colors but these funny colors do not look good on a car that big and curvy.

author: anythngbutgm
text: I agree. They have a burgandy color and a deep brown that works well although I haven't seen one in person.

author: british_rover
text: Oh yeah I saw pictures of the burgandy one that looks good and seems to be a nice classic Buick color.

author: boomchek
text:
A blue Gallardo. A gray Elise. A bunch of S Class Benzes.

Red F430 Spider.

All over the long weekend.

author: lemko
text: ...red Dodge Caliber and red Toyota Yaris. Oh, yeah. I did spot my first GMC Acadia on the road yesterday. This one was dark blue.

author: ateixeira
text: Saw one, and it belonged to the parents of one of my kids' friends. 328ic. Sweet.

author: kyfdx
text:
I saw one a couple days ago in the valet parking area of a shopping district, near here.

Gray with red interior... top was down..

Stunning!

author: fintail
text: I saw one of the new Saabs with the weirdo chrome trim on the front. I don't see the point.

author: ateixeira
text: They look like they have chrome glasses on!

author: lemko
text: ...black Dodge Caliber and blue Dodge Avenger.

author: boomchek
text: We had nice weather, saw a newer Viper Roadster in red (haven't seen many around), and a Chevy SSR, both with their tops down,

author: ateixeira
text: Spotted a brand new, 2007 Sienna LE with power sliding doors....in my driveway!

author: lemko
text:
...I drove one - a new silver Chevrolet Impala! Geeze, I really like the car! Maybe I can get one as a replacement for my old '88 Buick Park Ave?

I was at the Cadillac dealer getting an oil change for my Seville STS when I spotted a beautiful new DTS in White Diamond that just caught my eye so much that I just had to ask the salesman for a closer look. I was getting that old "this is my next car" vibe looking at it until I was quoted a price of $55K. That brought me quickly crashing back to reality. If I has heard some more reasonable number, I know I would've traded my Seville. Good God, this car was as loaded as a DTS could get and the rich smell of new leather and wood trim was almost heavenly.

Maybe it's a good thing I didn't go for broke. I get such horrible buyer's remorse after I purchase a car. I'd have needed a 55 gallon barrel of Prozac had I gone through with it - at least for a week and then get over it.

author: bumpy
text:
the rich smell of new leather and wood trim was almost heavenly.

Naah, that was the organic solvents melting a few of your brain cells.

http://pubs.acs.org/cen/whatstuff/stuff/8020stuff.html

author: imidazol97
text: Actually, Lemko, it's probably a scent added to the car to give exactly that effect on the consumer. I recall a news story somewhere about the art (science) of using scents to improve the products. Of course they cost. The higher priced the car, the more likely it had a quality scent package added as a consumer pheromone.

author: kyfdx
text:
First, another new 328i convertible.. top down.. Just like the one on the brochure.. Platinum Bronze with tan interior (kinda boring).

Then... a new BMW M5.. Carbon black.. sheewwwwww!!!

author: boomchek
text:
A beautiful grey Lambo Muricelago driving on the highway beside me.

The vehicle, even though it's low and sleek looks massive compared to other cars probably due to it's wide rear end.

author: fintail
text: I saw a black CL550 at the body shop where I was not getting my car back

author: boomchek
text: What happened to your car? Did you smash it up?

author: fintail
text:
It had a weird door ding in it when I bought it, only visible from certain angles. I thought it wouldn't matter to me...but as I am OCD, it eventually was driving me insane, so I took it in to be repaired. It's actually a complicated little bump that is part of a faint crease in the door skin about a foot long, that you have to be an inch from the car to spot - I did not notice it when I bought the car. So, it is at a high end local body shop as I know they do amazing work. The girl at the desk said it would be done yesterday, but the estimator guy says Tuesday. I went and visited the car yesterday...the work is done and paint is on, but it is not buffed and the trim is not replaced. No door handles on the driver's side...scary!

So, on the new car subject, there's a new silver Focus ZX5 sitting in my parking spot for a few more days! To be honest, it's not a horrible little car...it's very unrefined compared to the E55 of course, but it is well-assembled and quick enough. It feels like a Lexus compared to my last rental experience, a Kia Spectra that I am pretty sure was a car body on a riding lawnmower platform.

author: fintail
text:
Maybe not brand new, but today I saw a Lambo Murcielago roadster, in a silver-grey color. The driver had it revved up high, it was loud.

I also saw about 20 new style S-class.

author: fintail
text:
New style DTS, a very metallicy maroon color with a tan carriage top, whitewall tires, and chrome wheels. All it needed was a continental kit.

And about 3 minutes later I saw a ca. 1990 Riviera with a full continental kit. It was hideous.

author: boomchek
text: I don't really like the back/trunk lids on the new DTS. Seems too plain, like there's something missing. I like the previous ones better (2000-2006)

author: fintail
text: I just saw one of those new Scion xB replacements. Pretty it aint.

author: fintail
text: Today I saw a MB ML63 AMG, a Ferrari 599 GTB Fiorano, an Aston DB9, and several new Suzuki XL7, which I think is a very odd design.

author: boomchek
text:
The XLz look good with big rims, but the base models look really miserable for some reason.

Today saw a Gallardo in black. Same area where I saw the Muricelago a few days ago.

author: lemko
text: Geeze, the Caddy owners have extremely bad taste where you live. Fortunately, this stuff is becoming rare around me. I was looking at a tastefully appointed DTS in "White Diamond" for myself when took my Seville for an oil change and emmissions/inspection last week. Salesman left two messages on my answering machine while I was away this weekend.

author: fintail
text:
I think it's an odd design. The headlights look to be taken from an anime character, and the things look like they are jacked up in the rear, like and old hot rod.

And you are right, lemko, there is some bad taste here. Heck, in the past I have spotted both a Sable (I actually see this one often) and of all things a Mercury Topaz with carriage tops, so maybe there's some bad old school thinking here. I would expect to find such taste in Florida or even around NYC, but not out west.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
It is absolutely amazing how many of the new Camry's I see everyday. Those things must be flying off the lots. What's even more amazing is the amounts of older ones that don't seem to be declining in the least. So there must be a bunch of Newbee's out there who jumped into the Camry fray. Anyone know what kind of sales are conquest sales? Must be pretty impressive numbers.

Ford Edge sales seem to be picking up as well, see a lot more of those these days as well.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Spotted this car today.

Kid from the S2k club is selling it for his grandmother. In case anyone is looking :shades:

Also, saw a couple of new X5's on the way home today. Nice update. 3 series coupes and verts a plenty around here as well.

Oh, and saw a red NSX (non flip lights) and a few minutes later a beautiful Bentley GT coupe in blue. Wow.

author: ateixeira
text: Sedan, looks nice. :shades:

author: fintail
text:
I spotted a silver Bentley Continental GTC yesterday, and a dark red CL550 too, at the body shop.

Yes, I have my car back, but of course it has been a fiasco. They put a scratch on the lower boddy cladding, and when trying to buff it out, went through the paint. So now my car is being driven without this trim on one side while they fix it. I am pleased.

It was also about 90F here yesterday, and the AC in the car sucks. Yesterday was the first really hot day since I got the car...and I think I might have to make another warranty claim coming. I know MB AC usually isn't good, but this is much worse than in others I have experienced.

author: boomchek
text:
Maybe your AC needs recharging. My AC works great, and starts cooling within about 2 minutes of the car starting in super hot weather. And my centre console has vents in it so it's great for colling down water bottle that's been sitting in the car all day.

I saw a Gallardo convertible today, baby blue color. For the past 2 weeks seems like I've been seeing a Lambo or Ferrari every day. I guess the nice weather brings them out.

author: fintail
text:
Yeah I am going to drop by my indy mechanic next week and see what he thinks. Hopefully not a big deal. The air it puts out is cool-ish, but not like on the C43 or even the W126 that had over 180K miles on it.

Today I saw an E55 wagon, uncommon.

author: lemko
text: ...spotted a black Mercedes G55 AMG last night.

author: fintail
text: Yesterday when finally getting my car back up to spec, I saw a new E63 AMG sitting at the body shop. It must have had some cosmetic damage repaired, maybe from shipping...I looked the car over, and from the underside and brakes, it obviously had not been driven. However, it had a huge ding in the windshield, the size of a quarter at least.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Stopped by a Benz dealer over the weekend cause the wife wants an SLK, when I look over and what is sitting on the corner, a brand new CL63 in triple-black. Now, I absolutely hated the restyled nose when the pics first appeared on the net and in the magazines, but in person this thing looks just plain brutal. Especially in black, with the multi-spoke 19's (maybe 20's), the thing looks just plain evil.

The place also had on eof those new Z4 "M" hatches, and while it has better proportions than that ugly Z3 "M" Reebok sneaker looking thing, it was still just plain odd.

author: imidazol97
text: Friday between Louisville/Nashville I saw a row of sports cars in identical colors snaking over the hills behind me. when they passed there were 10 burnt orange Corvettes all with Indianapolis 500 license plates issued by Indiana. They all pulled in at the Corvette Museum in Bowling Green next to the Corvette factory!

author: lemko
text:
...silver Chevrolet Impala
...black Chrysler Sebring
...red Ford Edge
