author: ateixeira
text: Saw two of these recently. They're still so rare that I was surprised to see them one after the other.

author: andys120
text:
I saw the new Mitsu sedan parked at a mall, first opportunity to get a good look at one and surpisingly it looked good better than a Camcord.

It was a cool shade of medium blue and had nice edgy styling that didn't descend into weirdness.

author: ateixeira
text: New G35 right behind a new 328i.

author: anythngbutgm
text: Yeah, I'm really digging the new Lancer as well. In GTS trim, I'd even go so far as to compare it to an Acura TSX than a Camcord. Mitsu really put the effort into the redesign.

author: guss
text:
I saw my first Lancer on the street yesterday also. It was the definitely a base model in white. Still it looked surprisingly nice.

I thought it was a Mazda6 at first.

author: fintail
text: Today I have seen a Gallardo roadster, a STS-V, a SL55, a retractable roof 3er, and a weird new S550 that was white with a panorama roof, looked odd somehow.

author: andys120
text:
I've seen a couple of new Miatas...er MX-5s, The new fender contour looks good and gives the car a little bit of 'Tude that the older designs didn't have.

Jeep Wrangler 4-doors are popping up a lot too. If you've ever had to sit in back of a 2-dr you'll know why .

Product planners at Chrysler must be smacking their heads wondering why they didn't think of that before. They look good too.

author: ateixeira
text:
These look best from the front. From some rear angles they actually look a bit awkward.

That 3rd row must be tiny.

author: british_rover
text: Some of the documentation with the car says that people over 5 foot 5 should not even try to use the back seat.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Sedan in a deep burgandy color. Nice.

A few new updated X5's and a Black M6 this morning. Couple of new Lancers, a slew of new Camry's as usual and I never really noticed just how many new Tacomas are out there!

Lessee, a couple of those new Avengers, a new Sebring convertible, one of those full size Hyundai SUV's that look like Lexus RX's and a couple of new CX-9's. :shades:

author: andys120
text: I saw my first Jaguar XKR today, photographs do not do it justice. In the metal it has a sleef and potent look.

author: fintail
text:
I saw a new style Unimog today. Weird thing, looks like it is 15 feet tall

- it was something like this

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Local Subaru dealers have the updated, restyled Tribeca. Looks good. Couldn't find any new Imprezas on the lots yet...

Wife and I stopped to check out the new Mazda CX-9. While it's not going to end up in our garage due to size (Our MDX is too much right now) it is quite a rig. I'm not really a fan of the slab sided CX-7, but this one is much more elegant.

Saw a bunch of new 3-series coupes and convertibles

Blast from the past: Sitting on the side of the highway was a red Dodge Daytona from the 90's?

Like this but no pop-up headlights...



And an absolutely stunning pewter Split-window Vette with the spinners.

author: kyfdx
text: E63 AMG... in black of course..

author: bumpy
text: From the side and rear, it looks like something designed and built on the wrong side of the Iron Curtain. And whose idea was it to put the side repeaters in the door?

author: british_rover
text:
European cars haver to have the side markers on the fender or door.

The LR3 is all about form following function. Every single thing on the car has a function and nothing is on the car that is not for function. That is why it only has one air vent on the passenger side.

The air vent draws in air for the engine and by mounting it on the side it improves wading depth. It also makes it easier to attach a snorkel. The engine only needs one vent so it doesn't get a non-functional one on the other side.

The slab sides and cab to the rear design mean that two 6 foot one tall adult can sit in the third row comfortably. Not other mid-sized SUV in the world can do that. Oh and with all the seats folded down there is nearly 100 cubic feet of cargo room.

author: fintail
text: Today there must have been a new Aston convention in town...I saw 5 (!) new style Aston Martins on the road today. 4 grey and silver coupes, and a red convertible. Also, a silver Ferrari F430 convertible.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
I don't know if it's really for sale yet, I think we are still a ways away but guess what I spotted yesterday? Couple of hints:

- It's got a giant gaping opening fro a grill, A pentistar shape big enough to sallow a Kia Sephia

- Continued design lineage with it's bigger, more expensive siblings

- A huge wreath and crest in the center of said huge, gaping mouth(that was probably enough to give it away)

- A non-(V)elocity model

- It didn't have a Landau roof or wire wheels and was completely devoid of curb-feelers :P

Yup, a new CTS in Silver, and if I had not driven by it 3 times to confirm my claims I never would have believed it. It was parked in broad, morning daylight in the middle of Concord, MA. I don't know if it was an unplanned stop or not but my hunch tells me that it was strategically placed as this was pretty much one of THEE busiest roads through town. If I had my camera, I would have posted pics but I didn't. Sorry folks.

author: ateixeira
text:
First on the roads, all black, in downtown DC. Only seen them at a dealer and on the auto show circuit up to now.

Talk about blind spots....

author: boomchek
text:
We did ride and drives this week in the Rogue. Neat little crossover. It will sell well.

Also we just got the Altima coupe. Nice car too.

author: british_rover
text:
Rouge?

What is that. I haven't even heard of it. Or is that the US name of the Cube thing?

author: stever
text:
"The 2008 Nissan Rogue is the smaller sibling to the Murano."

2008 Nissan Rogue Readies for September Launch (Inside Line)

author: boomchek
text: Thanks Steve, not many people heards about the car yet. It has a good price point and it should do well even though it's one of the smallest of the cute-utes.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw an Altima coupe out on the streets.

I really like it. Reminds me of the G35c, in a good way.

Plus it looks very distinctive from the Altima sedan.

Good job, Nissan.

author: fintail
text:
I saw almost the entire new AMG lineup today. Of course, I was out dawdling around and stopped by the local MB dealer. It kills me what is optional on these cars, given their price point. Still, they were quite lovely, although white is the last color I would choose for an S63.

I think I want those E63 wheels and brake assemblies on my E55.

author: british_rover
text: I saw a GL320 CDI at the auto show this afternoon. The local Mercedes club had a couple of cars from the local MB dealer on hand.

author: stickguy
text: I'm sure if you have enough money, the dealer would be happy to swap a set on for you.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
A couple of streets over from me just brought home a Lambo Gallardo... I haven't bumped into him yet to ask how, but he may have won a lottery. We just had a 4th of July drawing, one of the best odds in history of winning 1 million smackaroos. May have a winner...

Also saw a couple of new Subaru Tribecas even though they're not as exciting.

author: fintail
text:
Yeah, anything can be done with enough money, much more than I would want to spend.

Maybe eventually a set will be available used for cheap...barring any unforseen issues etc, I plan to keep my car for several years.

author: fintail
text:
Today I saw a pearl white new-style DTS with a vinyl top, chrome wheels, gold trim, and white-and-yellow-wall tires. No continental kit, curb feelers, or RR grille.

On that note, yesterday I saw a 97-01 Camry with a vinyl top, it was ridiculous. Also, an early 90s Deville with the 'full Florida' treatment - top, grille, wires, continental kit, and all.

Speaking of the GL320 CDi, I also saw one of these yesterday. I could hear the diesel!

author: ateixeira
text: Haven't seen many of these, but this weeked I spotted two of them.

author: kyfdx
text:
Porsche Cayman S in light gray..

If I could get $70K for my first-born, I would be driving one of these... :surprise:

author: ateixeira
text:
OK, a Ford Five Hundred, totally pimped out. I'm talking billet aluminum grille, spinnaz, the works!

All that for an underpowered, relatively dull sedan.

author: british_rover
text: I sold a used one with 1,900 miles on it for 54,000 dollars or so.

author: anythngbutgm
text: I'd step up to a base 911 for the same price and a much better gearbox... The Cayman gearbox fights back too much changing gears. It reminds me of the one in my Subaru.

author: kyfdx
text:
I haven't driven a Cayman... Boxsters and 911s, but no Caymans...

But, just for the looks and the rarity.. I'll take the Cayman.. I don't lust after the 911..

So.. .. if I can get $54K for the kid... hmm.. things are looking up..

author: stickguy
text:
Saw a new style 5 series, in silver. Looked just like my BILs new one. Except for the bling wheels.

God awful things. Probably 22s, but the looked like giant pizza pans (round side out). It was terrible moving, probably even worse standing still.

And way to take one of the best ride/handling combos ever, and make it drive like a checker cab!

author: gsemike
text:
In the same parking lot, I saw a new MDX aqnd a new Veracruz.

The MDX is a mess. The color of the rear bumper cover did not blend well into the body paint at all and it just looked like a overdone mess. One thing I noticed is that there is a trend towards lips over the wheel wells that are very tall and flattended out. The MDX has it as does the Altima. I don't like it.

The Veracruz on the other hand looked quite nice. It looks to be as big as an Explorer with very nice flowing lines. Hyundai has really come a long way.

author: fintail
text:
I saw 3 new CLK63s at the dealer today. Amusing that a car that bases at nearly 90K has navi as an option.

Also, an Altima coupe and about 20 new MDXs.

author: british_rover
text:
I saw 3 new CLK63s at the dealer today. Amusing that a car that bases at nearly 90K has navi as an option.


Thats Mercedes for you...

I just sold a LR2 to a guy that has a 2007 CLK550 with the full AMG package but no AMG badging thank god. He just likes the look of the AMG wheels and grill and doesn't care about the extra hundred something horsepower. There isn't any place to use it around here anyway.

author: fintail
text:
The CLKs seem to get that package much more often than the sedans. I've only seen one E350 with that stuff.

I do like the E63 wheels, I think they'd look OK on my car.

This dealer also had an S550 loaded up with AMG package and many other toys, pushed the sticker to something like 115K.

author: teds1
text:
I always see CLS s with the AMG trim package (even a badge)
I guess if it is factory it isn't as offensive

author: fintail
text: It could be worse, but it could be better by not existing at all. AMG is now used as a trim package and a cash grab. I miss the old days when it was something really exclusive that you didn't see every day. I remember back in 1996 when I saw my first C36 in traffic, I took photos of it!

author: kyfdx
text:
..just because I can..

A base Cayman is pretty well equipped at $55K..they had 3 of them for around that MSRP. And, there was a well equipped Cayman S for $63K.. CHEAP!

The last time I stopped by this winter, all they had were loaded up S models for over $70K...

So, with my CR-V trade... hmmm...

author: british_rover
text: The regular Cayman is fine and I can't ever see spending over $70k to get the one we took in trade.

author: ateixeira
text:
$63k is cheap?

That's roughly the balance on my beach condo mortgage.

So I can keep my Miata and drive it to the beach, or get the Porsche and drive to the beach and be homeless.

author: british_rover
text:
Ahh but to be homeless with a Porsche at the beach...

I think I take the Porsche.

author: kyfdx
text: Yeah... I've been to the beach lots of times.. never needed a house. I've got one of those, already..

author: ateixeira
text:
I guess all things are relative, and if you were used to seeing prices in the $70s then low $60s seems "cheap".

That's my problem, though, I'm way too practical.

I got a 3 series convertible brochure. Tempting. But then I think of what else I could do for $50 grand plus. No way.

Maybe a used Elise for $20k or so. Have they dropped that far in price yet?

author: kyfdx
text:
Elise for $20K? Don't think so..

I'm with you on the 3-series convertible.. For $50K+, I'd probably get a.... CAYMAN

author: ateixeira
text:
You know how cheap Saab leases are, maybe I should lease a 9-3 'vert.

Nah, I keep my cars a long time. My Miata is 14 years old, and I bought it used. To be honest there's nothing wrong with it now.

author: kyfdx
text:
My wife got her convertible on a cheap lease (relatively speaking... it's still a load).

But, it's her daily driver.... so, for a little more, she gets fun in the sun!!

Really... I need a Cayman...

author: ateixeira
text:
I'd rather have a Boxster. I know I don't have the time to take it to the track, and couldn't risk damaging something that valuable on the track anyway.

I look at the Cayman and think, that would look great as a roadster.

Plus, since when does the coupe cost MORE than the roadster? It should be the other way around.

Sure, it's more rigid, and that matters on the track, but how often on public roads will you exceed a Boxster S' capabilities? Plus, with the top down, you feel the experience a whole lot more. Better visibility, better sounds, immerse yourself in the drive.

I dunno, my Miata feels faster than it is because you become part of the environment around you. I guess I just like open air cars.

author: kyfdx
text:
We've had the convertible for about 1.5 years, and I'm over it... I like it.. but, I'd rather have the coupe.

I think just the opposite.. I really like the look of the Cayman over the Boxster. I'm not sure of the price difference, but it's really small... The cars are within a couple thousand of each other.

I'll be honest... the chances of me tracking a $50K+ car are between slim and none.. But, it isn't about maximum capabilities... The chassis flex, noise, visibility, etc.. are completely different between a coupe and convertible.

I'd just rather have the coupe. (in this case, disregard visibility.. it isn't that great in the Cayman, either).

I'll be honest, again... The chances of me getting a Cayman are pretty slim... I'll have to wait until at least 2011, before a used one will drop into my price range.

regards,
kyfdx

author: ateixeira
text:
Taurus - with the Mach III shaving system grille. Convenient if you forget to shave.

CX7 - like those, but hate the small interior.

SL - top down.

Aston Martin convertible - yowsah! Makes the Benz look invisible. Real head turner.

author: british_rover
text:
Which Aston was it?

I don't think the Vanquish Roadsters are out yet so it had to be a Volante DB9.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Those cars are like sex on wheels, the proportions are just about perfect...

I followed a new SLK55 for a while on my way yesterday, that is a great looking roadster. I almost would prefer it over the larger SL.

Also saw a couple of CX-9 utes, a revised Tribeca and a bunch of Civic Si couples and sedans.

Regarding the Cayman, I like it better than the Boxster too. The body lines are better and I like the muscular fender flares over the rear wheels. But that gearbox, ugh...

I guess I am just spoiled by the S2000 6-speeder :shades:

author: british_rover
text:
those cars are like sex on wheels, the proportions are just about perfect...

Topless sex on wheels I say. :blush:

author: anythngbutgm
text: lol, yeah, I'd agree to that! :shades:

author: ateixeira
text:
That was it.

It's funny, you see that and then nothing else does it for you. I stopped looking for new cars after I saw that. You're just done looking when you've found one.

author: bumpy
text: Scion xB. What's the deal with the single big backup light mounted in the left side of the bumper?

author: andys120
text:
I would get the Cayman, it's just a fantastic looking car, even better looking than the Boxster.

However I come from the era when "sports car" meant
roadster. I've owned a couple of two-seaters from the 60s and 70s and I'm definitely planning on adding a Boxster to my stable, I'm eagerly awaiting the arrival of the DSG-equipped model in 2009 or 10.

author: ateixeira
text:
Wow again. Never ceases to take my breath away.

This one was a Vanquish coupe.

author: anythngbutgm
text: I saw a couple of new Highlanders on the highway heading the other direction, one in silver and one in a lighter blue. Yah know, they don't look all that bland as I thought they were in the pics. Kinda nice actually. My only beef was the large rear overhang which made the back look ungainly.

author: fintail
text: SLR McLaren, grey with black wheels, to go with the black one I see aound town now and then

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw 2 Versa sedans. Odd proportions on that one. I prefer the hatch.

This is funny - my next door neighbor has twin boys. Identical. So I've seen an Elantra 4 door parked outside once in a while. They're in their 20s.

Well, for the first time I saw 2 Elantras parked outside. Didn't realize, but they each own one. Identical twins, identical cars!

At least they got different colors. One is light blue, the other dark blue.

author: fintail
text: Bentley Flying Spur, in a very unusual metallic light blue.

author: teds1
text:
OK I don't know what it is but there are THE MOST RIDICULOUS CARS IN MONTREAL!!! Maybe it's b/c of Formula 1 or the tremblent track... but seriously... come on it's just silly

On the drive up I saw a yellow Diablo, black aston db9 and a red 360 convertible.
Within minutes of arriving though I saw the grand prize of the weekend.... Black RHD R-32 Skyline. I just about wet myself.
I also saw over the next day, a Lotus Esprit, RUF Porsche, Triple Black Z-06 parked behind a db9 coupe, a 2006 911 turbo parked behind a DB7, a Blue F-430 spyder, and a black Gallardo convertible. Also a chain of nice lowriders going up St. Laurent an Rs4, and one more Db9 convertible on my way out of town. I am not mentioning any Porsches sub Turbo or tuners but there were A LOT of those as well.

That is less than 48 hours in Monreal for you.

author: teds1
text: Oh and a bunch of Bentley continental variants (spur, convertible, coupe)

author: fintail
text:
Last night I saw that same blue Flying Spur again, also a yellow Murcielago convertible, and a black DB9 convertible.

There's some kind of souped up late model (back to the oval headlamps) Porsche with a big spoiler that races up and down my street now than then too. It's white, not my first choice.

author: kyfdx
text:
Mercedes B-class.. (looks like an R-class with the rear chopped off, but smaller).

A couple of Smart ForTwo. Have you noticed? These are really small!!

author: anythngbutgm
text: Wow, that sounds like my kinda place! I'll have to get up there sometime. Sounds like a great place for sightings. :shades:

author: ateixeira
text:
Vantage coupe this time.

I'm finally seeing more Ford Edges, and some MKXs too.

author: ateixeira
text:
Must be Aston week here in DC.

Or maybe I've seen a run of them and I'm just keeping my eye out for them.

Also saw a CR-V LX, with steelies. Not too common, I'd say about 99% of the ones I see have alloys.

author: lemko
text: ...saw a dark blue Dodge Nitro on the way to work this morning. Also, somebody at work bought a new light blue Chrysler Sebring sedan.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
What do you think of this story out of the WP?

link title

The environmental movement is commendable, but vandalism is a bit extreme.

Regarding the topic, I've managed to time my commute most mornings where I end up being passed by the same RS4 doing about a buck-20 up the highway. But this morning I saw an RS6 as well as a Gallardo Spyder. Pretty cool sightings...

author: lemko
text: I can't stand Hummers myself, but I never would vandalize somebody else's private property regardless of how I felt. I wonder how the vandal who did this would feel if somebody did the same thing to his Prius and carved "Eco-Weenie" into the finish?

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Yeah, good call. I'd agree. It's amazing how much emotion and anger gets stirred up over a car. I would think the gas bill alone would be painful enough!

Kidding aside, it was probably some punk kid with nothing better to do.

author: qbrozen
text:
yet they never think of the fact that fixing the car (forging new glass, making the paint, spraying the paint, etc) is going to hurt their precious environment even more.

enviro-morons

author: ateixeira
text:
Vandalism is just plain stupid. There are other, productive ways to get the message across.

First off, the car was already produced, so it's going to consume gas, whether that owner keeps it or sells it makes no difference. Even if it is totalled and the insurance company sells it.

Second, there will be an incredible waste of ENERGY to produce new glass, take the bends out of that sheetmetal, re-paint, fix, etc.

It's like that group that torched a bunch of Excursions when those came out. The fire alone caused more pollution than the trucks would have caused in their lifetime. The environment only suffered.

Who won? The car dealer. They cashed in on the insurance they had, and get this - they got MSRP! It created HUGE profits for a dealer selling those behemoths.

Law of unintended consequences takes over when stupidity reigns, and vandalism of any kind is just plain stupid.

This guy will probably take a check from insurance. They'll auction it off, someone will buy it cheap and fix it themselves, and keep driving it. This will not take an H2 off the roads.

It will help H2 suppliers that sell replacement parts, though.

qbrozen beat me to it. Morons.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
This will not take an H2 off the roads.

I'm sorry, I just had to laugh at this. No pun intended? :blush:

author: fintail
text:
I saw an 08 C300 today, sitting at the local dealer. I had to go take a look, and a salesman I have talked to before came out and chatted with me. I sat in it...I am fairly impressed. It has a really cool nav system in it too. I think it looks a lot better than the W203 C-class. It should be a decent success.

I also saw some kind of brand new Aston convertible, didn't even have plates yet.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Must've been a 911/Porsche event in my area as I saw a bunch of them, new and Vintage. Further solidifies my decision to upgrade to one if I ever have a spot next to my pride and joy S2000. Especially that 911 GT3 in triple black... wow.

I had a pretty cool sighting as well which was not a car, but car related. Met Tom Magliozi, one of the Click and Clack guys while in Harvard SQ. It was only a short intro, but he was very polite and courteous. As an avid listener to Car talk it was pretty cool to meet him.

author: british_rover
text:
The Aston was probably a V8 Vantage Roadster. I think those are just hitting the ground now.

The only other Aston Convertible is the DB9 Volante.

author: ateixeira
text:
Follow-up to that story, apparently a bunch of H2 owners got together in a public parking lot (in Georgetown IIRC) with their H2s to show that owner support in what they called "solidarity".

Sighting today: VW Eos, female blonde behind the wheel applying mascara in traffic. :sick:

author: fintail
text: Light grey Bentley GTC, dark tinted windows, black top. Kind of a cheap looking color combination.

author: lemko
text: ...a beige-colored Lexus GS350 AWD and a black BMW with the name "DINAN 3" on the decklid. Not being versed in BMWs, to what does this refer?

author: qbrozen
text: Aftermarket tuned version.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Dinan is an aftermarket tuner from what I remember...

link title

author: teds1
text:
So this is better than a sighting... I got to drive one.

My uncle has leased XK8s for the last 8 years and this year when his came off lease they wouldn't lease him another or renew his lease for some reason, he had to go to the new XK. They delivered it Sunday, and for a while we had both of them in the driveway, both in british racing green with tan tops. I got some great photos and you could really do a nice comparison.

He was bummed a bit as he really loved the old one and wasn't sold on the new XKs for several reasons (trunk space being cut in half was one of the major ones).

I on the other hand Looooove the new XK even though the old one was nice. I drove it around the neighborhood a bit and from what I can tell the car is much tighter and more coiled than the last version. The steering is more focused and the car seems more agile without losing it's substantial road feel. He is going to love it, he just doesn't know it yet. Watch out for bumps though with that front lip spoiler.

author: ateixeira
text:
Long weekend at the beach...let's see the ones I remember:

XL7 - the new ones don't seem to be selling that well, though I kinda like it.

Nitro - looks like a chopped 1984 Cherokee. Not my style.

MDX - soccer mom vehicle of choice around me. Tons of 'em.

author: fintail
text: I got behind and beside a new unplated S63 in traffic today. It was not very becoming in white, but it sounded very nice.

author: stickguy
text: A Dodge magnum. 2 tone paint was bad enough, but it had full rear tire skirts on it. Not something you see every day. Or want to.

author: ateixeira
text: Saw about 3 Saturn Vues over the past week, while on vacation.

author: andys120
text:
There's lots of two-tone Magnums and Chargers running around here, most of 'em belong to the Po-lice. :P

Lots of cops are re-adopting the old black and white scheme
which it's believed gives them more "presence". It does...too bad the highway patrol doesn't adopt it. They are becoming nearly invisible with those new low-rise light bars (a State Trooper told me their cars use 20% less gas running w/o lights on top).

author: lemko
text: Didn't the old Highway Patrol cars have the lights inside the car on the package shelf and maybe a colored light and a spotlight on the A-pillars?

author: andys120
text:
Didn't the old Highway Patrol cars have the lights inside the car on the package shelf and maybe a colored light and a spotlight on the A-pillars?

I guess you're right. This is from the Broderick Crawford TV series, it's not very clear but I don't see any bubble gum light on these prowl cars>

author: ateixeira
text: Been seeing a lot of these new ones. I wonder if they updated it enough, given the RAV4 and CR-V updates went a lot further.

author: lemko
text: ...unusual Honda S2000 in a teal blue metallic. Up until now, all I saw were red ones.

author: bumpy
text: Suzuka Blue, definitely one of the less common S2k colors.

author: kyfdx
text: New body style.. I predict this will be at least as popular as the old model. Very attractive.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Also referred to as "Vintage" as it is supposedly geared towards the older folks. :blush:

Not that I agree with that as I know plenty of younger guys with that color, but it is kind of a running joke amongst the New England folks at S2ki.com.

author: ateixeira
text:
I've seen only one on the roads so far. Saw another at a Toyota sponsored event.

Toyota is all over the place in Ocean City, MD. They sponsored the Sundaes in the park and the Volleyball tournament this summer.

author: kyfdx
text:
That was my first one... a teacher at my son's school.

Usually, I see all the new Toyotas and Lexi early, as Toyota has a parts distribution facility near my work place, and all the managers have company cars.

author: ateixeira
text: We have a Toyota and Lexus dealer near my house, but they arrive no earlier than other regions. Lots of Lexuses in Potomac, MD, though.

author: gsemike
text: That's a beautiful color. Usually I see them in grey or really yellow. I'd take that blue over either of those.

author: fintail
text:
Yesterday I had a white Lamborghini Gallardo roadster behind me in traffic...driven by a very average looking middle aged woman. Maybe a car dealers wife? She didn't have the fake tan and haughty expressions so common of the Stepford Wives around my area (who likely would be scared of such a car anyway). I thought it was amusing.

The day before I saw that light blue Bentley Flying Spur I see on my street now and then, and as it was in a parking lot I saw the driver - a maybe 70 year old woman. She had a kid with her, and she made him ride in the back (?)

author: kyfdx
text: The grandson has to sit in the back, because Fluffy, the poodle thats dyed to match the light blue Bentley, is sitting in the passenger seat.. :surprise:

author: british_rover
text:
Safety first.

Kids should always ride in the back seat where it is safer.

author: fintail
text:
I think I am leaning towards the poodle scenario a little more :P

In something of that size, you are probably safer than in the back seat of a normal car. The kid was also maybe 10-12 as well, so not a toddler. I did notice the self-closing doors in action too, which were of slight interest to the kid, but the woman couldn't care less.

Today I saw the Ferrari Enzo I have seen a few times in my area. It was at a gas station, drivers door open in that eyecatching way.

author: british_rover
text: Ehh if he is only 10-12 he probably isn't heavy enough to sit in the front seat. Even with the weight sensors in the passenger seats of most new cars I wouldn't want a kid that is under the upper threshold of 100ish lbs.

author: fintail
text:
I can't imagine rich granny as being so attentive...she accidentally set off the alarm (which sounded like a Radio Shack unit from 1991) when she left the car. Maybe she didn't want him fooling with the radio :P

Today I saw another 08 C class and a new Highlander

author: british_rover
text:
I am just too used to dealing with super overprotective parents looking at new cars.

New highlander is UGGLLYYY

I haven't seen a new C-Class on the road yet but it looks too much like the S-class for me.

author: andys120
text:
I popped into the Volvo dealership today to have a quick look at the new C30.

I was pretty impressed, it looks better than in photos which make it look like a truncated S60. It's small but not small enough to compete w the Mini as some suggest it might (One had a Swedish flag painted on the roof.

It's expensive for a small car, right up there w the A3, the base model's Monroney read $27K while the turbo (T5) ran about $30K. Posted gas mileages were not impressive, 17 City/ 29 Highway which is about what my 5 Series BMW gets and it's a much larger car.

author: british_rover
text:
Both C30s are T5 but the Version 2.0 has the dynamic chassis standard and different exterior styling.

The 1.0 base MSRP is 23,445

The 2.0 is 26,445.

The 2008 EPA ratings rears its head again. I bet you would have a hard time getting under 35 mpg highway with a C30.

author: fintail
text:
I saw my third new C-class today. It does have a different look than the W203, it seems taller and shorter, which is refreshing in this day of short greenhouses. It does look more substantial than the outgoing model.

When the new S class debuted, I was not fond of it, but I don't mind it at all now, save for the weird dash.

author: lemko
text: ...black Mercedes S550. The guy went in the store and left his little kids in the car unattended!!! I guess neglecting your kids isn't just limited to the poor single mother leaving her kids in a battered 1984 Voyager minivan in a Wal~Mart parking lot.

author: qbrozen
text: But it IS an S-class. So kind of like being left at home in your living room on the leather sofa.

author: teds1
text:
I will have to post a few times to remember it all but for starters I saw an AMG CLK Black Series (In white Ironically) up in Boston.

Also an Orange Gallardo spyder in Orient Point Long Island.

I also visited an astonishing private Car Museum in an airport hanger in Long Island. This really cool old guy had accumulated about 40 cars. They were mostly brass age-30s and many were marks I had never heard of. He has 4-5 cars where they are they only example left in the world, including a unique 1901 steamer and some early electrics. his taste is towrds the quirky and unique (like a 50s Tatra Czech Police Car) and it was a very cool tour. What was really cool is that he had restored most of them himself up from salvage condition with the help of local high school kids.

author: magnette
text: Saw one of those new(ish) Porsche GT Carreras in my street at the weekend - first I've seen on the street. Looks like a super boxster, and sounds great too....

author: ateixeira
text:
MDX this morning

Pearl white 08 Tribeca. Nice color.

author: andys120
text:
I had a little chat with a guy who parked next to me in a brand new CX-7 which is one of the few crossovers I'd consider. He told me he liked the car except for the gas mileage, he only got 20mpg driving from Long Island to NH (about 250-300 miles).

That's pretty bad IMO, might as well get a Murano and enjoy that 3.5 V6 power.

author: fintail
text: Strange thing about CX7...I saw one as a taxi in Vegas

author: ateixeira
text:
Murano does cost a bit more.

A neighbor has one and they said the same thing, love it, great price, but the gas mileage was lousy.

author: anythngbutgm
text: Like the RDX are perfect candidates for an optional V6. I think Turbo power still has a limited audience.

author: ateixeira
text: I guess both manufacturers would rather sell you a pricier sister model (CX9, MDX).

author: ateixeira
text: OK, saw a Bently coupe, an Aston DB7 convertible, and then a DB9 coupe, all while driving through Avenel in Potomac, MD. I guess the poor people drive Bimmers.

author: kyfdx
text: Wow... very nice..

author: lemko
text: ...the first Buick Enclave I've ever seen in the metal. It was dark burgundy with a beige leather interior. It is a quantum leap over both the Rendezvous and the Ranier. Looks like Lexus finally has some serious competition in this segment. Congratulations, Buick!

author: ateixeira
text:
Benz SLK350

Lexus IS350

Bentley coupe - 2nd one in 2 days

A3

Acadia - hard to tell apart from the Outlook, the D-pillar in body color is what helps.

Lacrosse

Escalade EXT

author: kyfdx
text: It doesn't have a CDI or Turbodiesel on the trunk lid,.. This one had BLUETEC spelled out..

author: davethecarnut
text: Hey Fintail, do you remember looking at the C class from, say, the 8 o'clock or 4 o'clock position? IMO it looked awfully awkward. But the side view and front view were nice. The S class is "different" to alot of people, but not as "different as a Bangled 7 series.

author: davethecarnut
text: Where?? Of course, I live in California, so I'll never see one

author: kyfdx
text: Cincinnati

author: fintail
text:
I think at some angles the greenhouse can look kinda tall. And I don't like the star in the grille of the sport models, I am an old school MB person, and star in grille is for 2 door cars only. But, I do think this is a more proper design than the old C-class, which somehow seemed kind of immature to me.

If someone gave me a new S class, I would not decline it.

Today I saw TWO CLK 63 black series! One was at a MB stand at a car show, but the other was in a parking garage, driven by a nondescript looking young woman. I talked to her about it...she said it was her dads, and she didn't know anything about it other than it was fast and too expensive. I could deal with one of those...

The MB display at the car show had all the new AMG cars up to the S65.

author: lemko
text:
...a white 2008 Buick LaCrosse with the more substantial grille. It should address the complaint that the LaCrosse looks too much like the last-gen Taurus. However, if you put the Taurus and the LaCrosse next to each other, they really look nothing alike.

Shoot, I'd consider the LaCrosse Super for myself.

author: fintail
text:
I spotted several 08 Accords yesterday, as my workplace is adjacent to a Honda dealer, and the cars were out being fueled I suppose.

Also, another 08 C-class, a new style Focus 2 door, a Volvo C30, and a retractable BMW.

author: kyfdx
text:
Aston Martin Vantage

I didn't even know what it was, until I caught up to it.. Closest dealer is 120 miles away..

It's very impressive...

author: anythngbutgm
text:
New C-class, couple of 335i coupes, a new X5 and Altima Coupe.

Oh and blast from the past, saw a Buick Rendezvous this morning. Haven't seen one of those in months, they've pretty much disappeared :surprise:

Yesterday, I saw a new CTS on the back of a carrier. Looks good in white. Also had an Aston Martin Vantage tailing me up to work for a while. What a stunner!

author: ateixeira
text: I think I saw a CTS as well, wasn't quite sure (it was far) but it didn't look familiar the way an STS does, so that must have been it.

author: lemko
text: ...silver Honda Fit and what appeared to be a yellow Lotus Elise.

author: stever
text:
I went cross town this morning (cross-county really) to get some straw and coming back on the backroads I encountered 3 sheriff's cars escorting a new 15 passenger van. Except the passengers were all in full military gear and were riding on running boards hanging off both sides and the rear of the van. Couldn't tell if there was anyone riding inside with the driver.

Looked like a load of Keystone Cops.

Probably something cooked up with Homeland Security grant funds.

author: fintail
text: I've seen several LR2 the past couple days

author: anythngbutgm
text:
I saw a new Sebring convertible this morning on the way to work. I think it looks fantastic. The back end is a bit heavy, but the overall profile is elegant and classy.

Tundra pickups are becoming quite popular here, as is the newest CRV. Saw an 08 Accord sedan this morning, a couple of 335i models and as usual, a bazillion new Camrys. The SEV6 model of those look really good.

author: gsemike
text: Yesterday while walking to Penn Station, I saw one of those black and gold Hertz Mustang GTs. It's not everyday that you see someone baking tire around a corner in Manhattan at rush hour. The guy was making a spectacle of himself but looked to be enjoying himself and the car sounded sweet.

author: british_rover
text: LR2 sales are really heading up it will be our number two seller behind the Range Sport soon.

author: ateixeira
text:
What disappointed me on the Sebring 'vert is that the visibility is very poor. The rear window is the same size on the soft top as it is on the hard top.

Usually hard tops have better visibility!

Bummer. Seems like they dumbed it down, the hard top that is, to soft top standards, since they offer both.

The G6 has a much better view out.

author: andys120
text: I spotted a Dodge Sprint van equipped for RV duty with a Pop roof and (I think) side extenders.

author: lemko
text: ...gray Lexus GS450h Hybrid. The car had neat-looking painted wheels with chrome accents. Also spotted a black Ford Mustang GT. It was followed by a black Pontiac GTO. Too bad the traffic was so dang heavy on the Roosevelt Blvd. last night. Would've loved to see those two race each other - cops and "Big Brother" cameras be darned!

author: ateixeira
text:
Vantage coupe, gorgeous!

This weekend, let's see, saw a couple of the newer Escape/Tribute models. I still say they didn't change enough.

Saw just my 2nd new Highlander on the roads, too.

author: fintail
text: I saw this new thing today

author: qbrozen
text: what the heck is that parked next to it??

author: qbrozen
text: I was behind a new Vue on the way to work this morning. I gotta say, its pretty unattractive from behind. I think it is the "overdoneness" of it. The reflectors recessed into the bumper, the plastic silver tailpipe surround, and the fat chrome strip across the tailgate all look like afterthoughts. Remove all of that and I think it would be so much better.

author: ateixeira
text:
Ferrarri 599 GTB (new)

Behind it are an Audi Q7, also new, and a 911 slant-nose conversion kit.

author: qbrozen
text: oh, a conversion kit. I guess that would explain why I couldn't figure it out. Makes it look a bit like a TR7 in the front in that pic. Don't know why you'd do that to a porsche. And the wheels are pretty darned hideous, too.

author: kyfdx
text: Very popular conversion in the '80s, which is what that one looks like... Usually done on turbos...

author: ateixeira
text: Sadly I had a roommate in college that actually liked those monstrosities. He even had a poster with one.

author: guss
text:
of the Porsche looks tiny compared to the Ferrari.

I saw the an '08 Accord on the road. Coming at me the front grille is very similar to the Pilot.

author: lemko
text: ...white Lincoln MKX and a black Lincoln Aviator. Uh...do they still make the Aviator?

author: ateixeira
text: Yes, but they call it the MKX.

author: fintail
text: I saw a new style Highlander today...not remarkable for anything but that it wore a "sport" badge. Come on, this thing is as sporty as a diesel Chevette. Who do they think they are fooling? Oh yeah...

author: alltorque
text:
Sat outside having a coffee and watching the world go by on Saturday in Dalkey, just south of Dublin. In the space of 30 mins spotted 2 x Bentley Conti GTC's, (Silver and Graphite), a Conti GT, (Silver) and a Ferrari F430 in dark blue. Staggering. BMW 6's, (hard and soft-tops), almost commonplace. There's a lot of money swashing around Dublin at present but the driving standards are attrocious. On Tuesday saw my first Lexus President LS460 near Dublin airport - Black and black windows, very intimidating. My wife said that if they fitted a big gun on the roof it would make a fine main battle tank................she's not really a car person, bless her.

Came back to UK for a touch of reality.

author: bumpy
text: with maroon sides and an obnoxious body kit.

author: fintail
text:
Altima coupe...kind of like a Japanese Monte Carlo. Like a G35/7 from some angles, dumpy from others. The car was white, that didn't help.

A co-worker's mother took delivery of an 08 V6 Accord yesterday, she drove by to show him and I had a look. Pretty nice, and big indeed.

author: fintail
text: Today I rode in a Volvo C30 and a new MB C300 - a friend is thinking about either, and test drove them. Both pretty refined cars. The new C-class really is a step up from the W203, seemed nicely finished even at the 34K relatively stripped model I experienced. The C30 was also pretty basic, lots of empty spots on the dash and console, and it didn't even have cruise (neither of us could find it anyway). It did have pretty nice seats (manual, seems odd these days). 26K sticker.

author: guss
text: I was behind a new Highlander yesterday. From every angle It had Camry in it. It's like they got the same guy(or committee) who designed the Camry to make a tall wagon version.

author: andys120
text: I saw a new Ferrari F430 Spider while stuck in traffic yesterday-- top-down, perfect convertible day. :shades:

author: lemko
text: ...yellow Lotus Elise and a white Audi R8.

author: qbrozen
text: yup. cruise control is a $185 option on the C30. They are hoping to appeal to a younger audience by making pretty much everything an option. I don't mind the idea, but a custom ordered volvo can take quite a long time to arrive, PLUS they are charging I believe a $300 "customization fee" right from the getgo. So if you JUST want cruise control, that $185 option becomes $485. yikes!

author: british_rover
text:
Land Rover did the same thing with the LR3 when it first came out. With the exception of the 4wd systems and safety systems nearly everything was optional. As the 2005 production moved along more and more things became standard or in some cases were dropped. Within a year they had paired the options list down to just three or four packages and made everything else standard.

They used the marketplace to figure out which options people wanted most often and made those standard. Things that were often ordered with other options became standard and thing that no one ordered were dropped completely or made dealer installed accessories.

author: fintail
text: It's pretty crazy, as the base car is not exactly cheap. In comparing the MB to the Volvo...to equip the Volvo like the MB, it would end up costing only a few grand less. The Volvo seemed like a neat little car and was remarkably smooth...but for me, a new Mercedes for not much more is very appealing.

author: qbrozen
text:
true. But where the volvo appeals is that you don't HAVE to get all that stuff, ya know? So you COULD get a $23k volvo, if you were so inclined.

Not to mention the hatchback versatility.

author: british_rover
text: I don't see people cross shopping a C-class vs a C30 either. Those are about as diametrically opposed as two passenger cars can be.

author: fintail
text: That's probably part of it, along with the cars not truly being in the same target market as british_rover said as well. Maybe the comparison was greater for me because my local MB and Volvo dealers are next door to each other.

author: kyfdx
text:
Buick Enclave...

Nice.. about the same size as my CR-V... :surprise:

author: qbrozen
text:
HUH??? same size as your CRV??
Are you sure you saw an Enclave? The Enclave is a full 2 feet longer than a CRV, 8 inches wider, and 6 inches taller.

orr.... were you making a joke?

author: kyfdx
text: small joke..

author: kyfdx
text:
Almost forgot...

Nissan X-Trail

author: ateixeira
text:
I saw one, too.

It *is* basically a Camry wagon, though.

author: mb789
text: I spotted a 2008 Jeep Liberty. First one I've seen on the road. Looked burgundy color. Sharp looking, but could be mistaken for a Commander at first. I've seen several others at dealerships, though.

author: guss
text: It looks like Jeep is trying to make all of their cars look like the old Cherokee, Commander all the way down to the Patriot.

author: ateixeira
text: Nothing wrong with a family resemblance. I tend to think the Compass looks a bit out of place, though.

author: andys120
text: I spotted a Bentley Azure cruising the Hutchinson River Parkway in Westchester, naturally it was blue but a dark blue not what you'd call "azure blue".

author: andys120
text: IMHO Jeep should fire the entire styling/design department, except for the new Wrangler and the GC they look pretty awful. I cringe every time I see a Compass, Patriot or Commando, they use some of the design cues of the Cherokee but lack the simple attractiveness of the original Cherokee.

author: derrado1
text:
Saw my first Patriot today, as well as my first Commander. Goes to show how unsuccessful Compass/Commander are around my neck of the woods... still haven't seen a Compass on the roads, only just seen a Commander, and the Patriot's fresh off the boat and I'm already seeing 'em. To add insult to injury, Compass is the same price as the Patriot.

When I first saw the Compass in pictures, I thought it was ugly. Then it kind of grew on me. But seeing one at the Jeep dealer the other week made me realise its ugliness.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw two of these this AM.

I have to wonder if they are selling well, because I haven't seen a lot of these, and there is a Caddy dealer in my zip code.

author: gsemike
text: Have seen a couple the last couple of days. Form the rear it looks like a Mazda. Overall, I prefer the GMC and Saturn. The whole front of the Enclave is just a bit overdone.

author: lemko
text:
Somebody at work bought a new Enclave. I see it every day in the same spot.

Seems there must be a fire sale on Chrysler Sebrings as I've been seeing a lot of them lately. Sorry, no little "e" sticker.

author: anythngbutgm
text: I've noticed lately a lot of the new Tundras are equipped with BACK RACK'S on them for contractor duty. That is certainly a good sign that these things are not just driveway queens.

author: ateixeira
text:
You reminded me, I'm seeing several Ridgelines every day. The house across the street is being completely renovated inside and out.

I'm surprised because these are contractors' cars, they even have the logos on the side. Not one, but probably 4-5 different Ridgelines. Different logos, too.

I'm surprised to see them, frankly, the Tundra would make more sense to me.

Also saw a very filthy CX9 at lunch. The car has surely never been washed.

author: anythngbutgm
text: They pretty much blend in with the rest of the trucks out there. Honestly, the only trucks I notice besides the RL is the new Tundra and the RAM. The best looking two IMO. Saw a Candy Apple red CrewMax this morning which looked fantastic.

author: fintail
text: White Bentley GTC with oversized white wheels, I kid you not. Money and good taste are mutually exclusive once again.

author: peetiedog
text:
I spotted a new 2008 Audi S5 today running around the San Francisco/Oakland East Bay Area. It was wearing Arizona manufacturer's plates. I had some time on my hands, so I shadowed it for about 20 minutes. That is truly on beautiful car. I've been reading a lot of the articles on this car lately in all of the buff mags. It is actually as beautiful in person as it appears in the magazines. Very sexy lines. I think Audi has another really big hit on their hands. This car along with some of their other new offerings ('07 Q7, '08 TT, and '08 R8) is going to make Audi a much stronger challenger to BMW and M/Bnz.

After some checking, I found out that VW/Audi has an engineering/tech. center in Livermore, CA (deep East Bay Area, midway between Oakland and Stockton, CA. I hear that there may be a couple of these cars running around in this area. Official launch date is not until late November '07, so this is probably either a european version, or a US test mule version. I understand that the car will be appearing at the Los Angeles Int'l Auto Show in November and the San Francisco Auto Show, also in November. So spotting this car was really an exciting event for me. This may be regular happenings for the Michigan folk, or even the Arizona folks, as a lot of manufacturers have proving grounds and test facilities in those states. But we don't see this sort of thing much in our part of the world.

author: teds1
text:
I have now seen two CL65s. They are of course ridicuously ostentatious but I love knowing what it represents and the base shape is sooooo sexy. I would probably go for the CL550 though from what I have read.

I also passed the Audi showroom on Park ave. where they had a grey S8 with red leather, S5, TT, S6, and a ridiculously attractive blue R8 with navy side blade and terra cotta interior. I am so in love with that car it isn't even funny.

author: fintail
text:
I have seen a couple AMG CLs on the road, but I couldn't tell if they were 63 or 65. I think the AMG trim looks pretty good, big and menacing. I did see an S65 drive up my street the other day.

My area has a hugely busy Audi dealer, and although I drive by it maybe once a week - no R8 in the showroom nor have I seen one on the road. I want to see one of these.

For normal cars - I have seen a few new Vues lately, much improved over the cheap looking previous model. Also, a few 08 Accords on the road already, all sedans.

author: ateixeira
text: Nice update. They look edgier. Makes the old one look heavy to me.

author: ateixeira
text:
Expedition EL and a Navigator L
Mustang convertible
Rabbit
Commander
xD
CX9
3 Civics!
Fusion
BMW Hydrogen 7 (neat, she even asked for directions)
CR-V
Edge
Yaris - 2 of them
Lexus ES350
Flex Fuel Impala
3 series
Durango - the new square faced one
Aura

author: british_rover
text:
BMW Hydrogen 7 (neat, she even asked for directions)

Seriously did you recognize her?

I thought all the Hydrogen 7 cars were going to celebs/influential people.

author: ateixeira
text:
Naomi Campbell?

Na, just kidding. She was an attractive african-american female, probably about 30 years old. I'm terrible at guessing ages.

I didn't recognizer her, but could have been famous, or could have been a BMW employee or something, I suppose.

I was going to take a photo but she might have thought I was stalking her. Then out of the blue she asks me where New Hampshire Ave was.

At least I gave her good directions. :shades:

author: british_rover
text: Maybe just a BMW employee then. The Hydrogen 7 is a seriously rare car right now by modern standards. It is probably on the same level as the Veryon.

author: ateixeira
text: She said her name was Condoleeza something.

author: british_rover
text:
ahhahaha

Funny.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Best in class "Fun to drive cars"

link title

author: ateixeira
text: Nice list of cars...

author: fintail
text: I saw a new CL today, very modified. It was debaged, so I don't know what model. It had some kind of aftermarket bodykit, a weird rear end treatment with special taillights, and big SLR-style wheels. The car was black and looked very mean. The guy driving it was probably about 70-75, surprising.

author: kyfdx
text:
..I spotted two Toyota Matrices...

Nothing exceptional about them... It just got me thinking about the plural for Matrix. :P

author: ateixeira
text:
Spent the weekend in CT, so naturally I saw:

* 1500 Saabs
* 1700 Volvos
* 1.3 million Subarus

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Welcome to New England, Subaru capital of the World!

That may have been a factor behind the purchase of my 2007 Impreza 2.5i wagon which I absolutely love. Blends in quite nicely around here... :blush:

author: british_rover
text:
Seriously only 1,500 Saabs?

I see that many in half a day around here. :surprise:

author: ateixeira
text:
It was a short weekend.

There seems to be a Subaru dealer at every corner, it's like Ford dealers around here (Mid Atlantic).

In fact, when you give someone directions, it might sound like this:

"Drive north and turn right at the 3rd Subaru dealer, then turn left at the 2nd Subaru dealer, and when you see the next Subaru dealer, it's the yellow house on your left."

author: anythngbutgm
text: LOL

author: anythngbutgm
text: The Saabs that you saw were the old bathtub 900's and mid 90's 9-3's. Don't see too many of the newer models around unless they're rentals.

author: ateixeira
text:
Yeah, I used to see a lot of 900s when we went up to visit. The in-laws live up there.

Not nearly as many nowadays.

I'm not sure if that's bad, or good, perhaps Saab is a lot less regional than they used to be.

author: british_rover
text: That is true. I drive 15 miles or so to work and I pass by two subbie dealers.

author: ateixeira
text: See? It sounds like a joke but it's true!

author: fintail
text: I saw a new style Impreza today...couldn't tell if it was a WRX

author: kyfdx
text: I think the WRX is the only Impreza with a hood scoop?

author: lemko
text:
black Honda S2000
white Cadillac Escalade ESV
black Mercury Sable

author: ateixeira
text:
Yep, the scoop is the best way to tell them apart.

Oddly, a WRX 5 door has only a single exhaust, yet a 2.5i sedan (non-turbo) has dual exhausts.

author: bumpy
text: Dual exhausts are quieter, while singles make a bit more power.

author: fintail
text:
I saw another new Impreza today, a red one (the pacific NW probably lags just behind the NE for Subies). I don't think it had a hood scoop, it was at highway speed so I couldn't tell.

Also, a new C-class with sport trim and split spoke wheels. I am seeing quite a few new C-class.

author: rockylee
text:
2008's ?

-Rocky

author: lemko
text: I'm sure the Sable was a 2008. The others looked like 2007s. It's hard to tell cars by their years anymore. It's not like when 1958 Chevrolet was easily distinguishable from a 1959 model.

author: bhill2
text: Ah yes, the good old days when everybody knew your car was obsolete the day after the new ones came out.

author: lemko
text: ...black Toyota Solara convertible with top down and beige interior and a black Rolls-Royce Phantom. I wonder what he was doing in my neighborhood? Probably lost.

author: rockylee
text:
a black Rolls-Royce Phantom. I wonder what he was doing in my neighborhood?

He was probably trying to make a delivery of it to your driveway. :P

-Rocky

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw probably a dozen new Grand Caravans, though I was in touristy areas of Tampa, FL, so most were probably rentals.

Looks better on the road than in photos, IMO.

author: fintail
text: I was driving by a local high end lot today, and I saw this thing sitting out front. It was being moved back inside just as I showed up. Something you don't see every day...or any day.

author: rockylee
text:
WOW, never saw one of those before ? Obviously it's a Aston Martin, but which one ?

-Rocky

author: fintail
text: Guess again :P

author: rockylee
text:
My brother says a Porsche, but it very easily could be a Jaguar. Aston Martins and Jags, were rebadges anyways

-Rocky

author: fintail
text: Still wrong :P

author: stickguy
text: Is that something real odd like a SPyker (sp?)

author: fintail
text: That's it - Spyker C8 Laviolette...first I have seen

author: rockylee
text:
Well it looks like a badge engineered Martin or Jag. :confuse:

-Rocky

author: qbrozen
text:
darn. a little late to the guessing game. i knew what it was immediately. ;b

although i'm not sure why i knew it. It is pretty ugly, IMHO. It would be far better without all that chrome. Makes me think of a poorly-made model car.

author: british_rover
text:
I didn't look below the first post so it is a Spyker if no one else has guessed yet.

That company is in trouble though. They sold their F1 team and are struggling.

author: lemko
text: That would've been a good one for Mystery Car Pics!

author: fintail
text:
It was pretty ugly and really pretty crude, like a homemade custom car.

Easy to believe they are in trouble, their car sales can't be high.

author: ateixeira
text: Cool car. I like it just for being unique, I'm sure that's what appeals to actual buyers.

author: bumpy
text: It looks like a Mazda CX-9 that was worked over with the business end of a chrome stick. I'm a bit surprised Buick didn't chrome the tires.

author: ateixeira
text: This morning. These seem to be trickling out slowly now.

author: british_rover
text:
On the back mountain road I take to work sometimes saw a 2008 quattroporte in black.

I couldn't tell if what trim it was as it passed me too fast.

author: kyfdx
text:
Pale green.. with the simulated carriage roof treatment, in beige/tan..

Sweet! :surprise: I thought they only did this with Buicks and Caddys, anymore..

author: andys120
text:
I got a good look at a new Enclave today when I took my MIL's car in for service. I reached these conclusions:

1) It's nice looking and well detailed (exterior) but White isn't the best color for it.

2) It's HUGE, towering over the SWB Denali parked next to it. Perhaps that is why....

3) It's thirsty w EPA ratings of 19C-24H and that's for the 3.6 V6 w 6/A.

4) It's ridiculously tall for a FWD vehicle, again a higher step than the Denali. The women to whom this might appeal will not be pleased. I passed up a chance to sit in it because it looked like a pain and the interior didn't look that special.

5) I was more impressed by the Lucerne in the showroom with a nice coat of gloss black, tight shutlines, nice interior and a very solid sound when doors were closed.

author: andys120
text:
I thought they only did this with Buicks and Caddys, anymore..

Nah, there's no end to the aftermarket conversions that add those silly things to otherwise good looking cars. I saw a
BMW E30 (early 90s 3-series) the other day with a black carriage half-roof over white.

At least he didn't put on a Continental Spare and Whitewalls. :sick:

author: bumpy
text: Silver, temporary tag, and a little "e" sticker on the back. Just another example of SUVs reverting back to the station wagons they used to be.

author: qbrozen
text:
It's thirsty w EPA ratings of 19C-24H and that's for the 3.6 V6 w 6/A.

Sounds pretty good to me considering the size/weight/power of the vehicle. Neither our Pilot nor Pacifica were rated that high.

author: british_rover
text: And thats the overly aggressive 2008 EPA ratings. I am assuming the one you were looking at was a FWD model cause I think the AWD model is more like 16/23

author: ateixeira
text: The Lucerne is a slow seller and they can't build Lambdas fast enough! I think all 3 models are still below the industry-ideal 60 days' supply.

author: stickguy
text:
new C 30 out in public. First owner operator unit that I recall seeing.

Starting to see a lot of new Accord 4 doors though. They are spreading.

author: kyfdx
text: So.. what's your gut reaction to the C30?

author: british_rover
text: Seen a couple around here but this is Volvo country.

author: natenj1971
text: Saw a silver 2008 Accord EX Coupe (4 cyl). Silver with optional rear spoiler. It doesn't look as huge as the specs make it out to be. Infact the previous gen looks wider (maybe cause it's shorter). Kinda like it.

author: stickguy
text:
I like it, but I also have a soft spot for the old 1800ES (see, I left out the P!)

I checked one out at the dealer recently. Qutie roomy in the back, once you get in there. I'm 6' tall, and fit fine.

Funky styling, but kooool! Should do well.

C&D did a comparo test this month between the C30, speed3, Caliber SXT (?), and the WRX. I believe they called the C30 the car for baby boomer mini buyers (or something along those lines).

author: british_rover
text: I want a C30 and I am no baby boomer but then I bought a MINI as well and the demographics for that car have been skewed towards the boomers as well.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
really wants a C30. She had one of those C-class hatches that everybody hated (but for utility, it was fantastic) and is definitely looking for a nice premium hatch again (The MDX is too much vehicle for her). I have seen (2) loaded version 2.0's in the white with the brown lower trim and they look fantastic.

Haven't driven one yet for fear that she'll buy it on the spot.

author: british_rover
text:
Every dealer got a White 2.0 with the brown body kit and a Blue 1.0 as demos.

You can get good deals on either one of those although I would be hesitant to buy a manual with a lot of test drive miles.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
That makes sense, both dealers also had the blue 1.0 now that you mention it...

If she does buy one, it'll most likely be an automatic , but I'd like to drive both myself. I'm curious to see how it drives compared the the Cooper S that we drove a year ago (before the makeover).

author: british_rover
text:
Faster in a straight line but not as nimble with a bit more body roll in the bends.

More comfortable on the highway though without the runflat tires that they stick on all the Coopers.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Gee thanks, now you've spoiled it for me J/K

Actually, the reviews have said pretty much the same, but the Volvo is also bigger which is a big plus over the Mini (She is a business owner who makes occasional trips for supplies).I myself would probably choose the Mini from a drivers standpoint, but the wife wants a combination of utility, comfort and that hefty, solidity with a "essence" of a sport coupe thrown in like her old Benz and her 98' Accord V6 coupe she had previously.

author: british_rover
text: OH I agree the C30 is much more practical then the MINI and I will give up a little bit of fun to drive to get the better ride and practicality. I could adjust the driver's seat and steering wheel to a point where I could drive the car comfortably and have someone my size sit behind me. That would be impossible in the MINI. I couldn't fit in the back seat of the MINI at all.

author: kyfdx
text:
Clubman..

Too bad it's dorky looking.. (dorkier?)

author: british_rover
text: Thats the other car I am looking at but I can steal the Volvo as we have Volvo dealers in my autogroup and I can't do that with a MINI.

author: guss
text: I saw my first Smart, and it had a brand new registration sticker so it was not a demo. I was more amazed by how wide it is than it's length. I think I could fit 2 of them side by side in one bay of my garage.

author: fintail
text: Audi S5, dark grey on red.

author: fintail
text: Oh yeah, I also saw TWO Saaburus today. Seeing as about 15 of these were ever sold, that has to be something. A new style S80 as well, maybe 7 or 8 of those have sold (I saw an ad for $399 lease on a V8 model, so they can't be moving fast)

author: qbrozen
text: i actually was noting yesterday how i've seen quite a few of those new s80s in my neck o the woods. I think I've seen more of those than I ever did of the previous style. It got me thinking "hmmm... wonder if I could get a good deal on a used one when my lease is up."

author: lemko
text: ...new white Ford Taurus at the Franklin Mills Mall yesterday. The Fusion-esque grille really looks sharp on the car - better than the mesh grille of the Five Hundred.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
But over the weekend I saw an old, probably early 90's Toyota Land Cruiser that apparently was powered by vegetable oil. Couple of bumper stickers stated it, the smell of french fries confirmed it.

As far as new goes, the new Highlander has found quite a few takers, the Tundra is a pretty common sight (quite a few with those contractors racks on them). Couple of new S80's a C30 V1.0, few new MDX's a bunch of new Accord sedans and a pair of new Nissan Rogues.

A friend of mine came over so we went and checked out the Mazda CX-9 for his wife (She is replacing her troublesome, not so fuel efficient :blush: Suburban). Nice, very nice... We were going to go check out the Saturn Outlook since sales of those seem to be less than steller = possible rebates? but the dealership was levelled and expanded by the Honda store next door. Maybe next week...

author: british_rover
text:
When Volvo first came out with the new S80 they pulled a typical Ford and didn't offer a subvened lease. The V8 S80s were leasing for between 900 and a 1,000 dollars a month which is what a 50,000 dollar plus car should lease for with no subvention. The problem is people buying those kind of cars are used to leasing a 60,000 dollar BMW or Merc for under 900 bucks a month. Volvo gave sticker shock to the very same people they were trying to win over as conquests. Now in order to move the product they have to provide even more ridiculous leases then BMW/Mercedes do. If they had just come out with a competitive lease in the first place
they would have been fine.

Oh I also saw a V1.0 C30 on the road yesterday on the way back from our off-road driving school.

author: ateixeira
text:
Accord Coupe, first time in person. Looks pretty good for a mainstream coupe.

Also saw a new Dodge Grand Caravan. Boy those things are boxy, though I'm sure that's for practical reasons.

A Ferrari tops them all off, though. What's the model that flips the lid 180 degrees to open it up like a Targa?

The exhaust note was AWESOME. He was moving slowly, then downshifted, it really asserts itself even at parking lot speeds!

author: anythngbutgm
text:
180 degree flip? Isn't that the Challenge Stradale? Great sighting!

I'm not up to speed on the Ferrari models. I think it may have been the 599 Fiorano

author: ateixeira
text:
Sounds about right.

I gotta say, in photos I thought "no big deal".

In person, especially with the exhaust note, my heart was pumping! :surprise:

author: fintail
text:
I can believe this - this is only the second new style S80 I have actually seen on the road. I see lots of the old ones.

I got an email from my local MB dealer (I swear I never gave them my address) advertising an 08 E350 for $549/month, with 4K down. This is how so many E-class 'sell', and why the market is glutted with 3-5 year old cars. I suppose that $399 S80 might not be a bad deal.

author: qbrozen
text: My manager just leased herself a new C300. She took me for a quick spin in it. Its a nice car. Definitely bigger inside than I would have thought. I liked some of the little thoughtful features. The old-school radio frequency dial in LCD form made me say "cool" for some reason. The panoramic moonroof is nice, too. And I was pleasantly surprised at the feeling of oomph from the base engine. and her's has AWD to boot.

author: british_rover
text: That would be a Superamerica which is a crazy rare Ferrari.

author: ateixeira
text:
That's it. It was black. The top was open.

Spotted at the Rio in Gaithersburg, MD, basically an upper middle class suburban area.

author: andys120
text:
That would be a Superamerica which is a crazy rare Ferrari

I think you're right about the guy seeing a Superamerica but they aren't not even close to "crazy rare", 599 of the 575M Superamericas were made. You might be thinking of earlier Superamericas like the 1956 410 Superamerica of which 35 were made.

Sorry to be so pedantic but it's important to understand that before the Fiat takeover in 1969 Ferrari production numbers were very low. I grew up in NYC suburbs and during the 60s any Ferrari was something I'd see around twice a year (except for the 330GTC that belonged to a machine shop owner in my hometown).

Even that's not really rare for a Ferrari, I'd reserve "crazy rare" for cars made in single digit quantities like this 375 America Spider of which six were made.

author: british_rover
text: I was thinking crazy rare for a modern Ferrari but I thought the production numbers were much lower then 599. I thought total production was around a 100 for the whole world. Maybe I saw the number imported to the US and thought that was the total made for the whole world.

author: andys120
text: Here's the Ferrari 342 America I meant to post in #3969 (6 made)>

author: andys120
text: I couldn't find production figures for the 599GTB but I'm sure when it's all said and done the numbers will be two or three times those of the 575M Superamerica.

author: anythngbutgm
text: Oh man, what a beautiful car...

author: kyfdx
text:
This is really what Saab needs.. The way AWD sells in the U.S., this could get them out of the hole.

Well... if GM weren't calling the shots..

author: kyfdx
text:
If you've seen the new G35 sedan, you've noticed the chrome strip along the rear of the trunk lid... where a lip spoiler might be..

Today, while sitting behind one at a stop light, I noticed a little black square (about 1"), right in the middle of it.

Rear-view camera, working off the NAV?

author: anythngbutgm
text: Yes, I believe the new G is available with Backup Camera. Why anyone would need that in a sedan :blush: , I have no clue.

author: bumpy
text: Because half of the sedans on the market today have perfectly awful rear visibility, a result of tall trunks and long swoopy rooflines.

author: kyfdx
text:
I think maybe they offer it, because once you have the NAV, it is pretty cheap..... and, luxury import drivers really like the gee whiz factor..

Which brings me to a detail that I forgot..

His license plate was: G WHIZZZ

Either it was a play on "G", or he just pees a lot.. :surprise:

author: teds1
text: Nope its the Superamerica. it's a 550/575 variant with a unique variable opacity electronic roof. The challenge stradale is a lightweight hardcore 360

author: natenj1971
text: Saw a new Malibu this morning - was a fancy model in black. No license plate in the front (just where are they going to fit the front plate?). Had a very upscale volvo look in person.

author: andys120
text: I saw a new '08 CTS, the same shade of metallic red as featured in Caddy's ads. It confirmed what I'd seen in photos, the grille is just too damn big, otherwise it's nice looking.

author: british_rover
text: I think the enormous grill is the next styling fad I just won't like to go along with the mail slot armored car windows and bangle butt.

author: ateixeira
text: A bit anonymous, but nice.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
The coupe is the flashy one, I'd say probably the best looking one since the 98' - 02' at least, maybe even all time... The sedan is meant as a Camry alternative so low flash is more prominent in that class and the Accord fits in nicely IMO.

Those looking for a slicker sedan should be looking for the new Mazda6 or even the Altima 3.5SE (Or Legacy GT). But the Accord holds its own.

author: bumpy
text: A white Dodge Magnum with a black roof and greenhouse, a 300C front clip, an aftermarket grille, and some big chromey wheels.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw my first ever Jaguar S-Type R in person. These must not have sold in much volume because I didn't even recognize the little R badge until I got close in traffic.

Also saw a new Audi TT. Looks good but doesn't draw attention the way the original did when it came out.

author: bumpy
text: A Jaguar with a Type R badge? Jeebus. :confuse:

author: british_rover
text:
R is Jaguars high performance line. It is not a Type-R like Acura uses.

The R Jags are The S-Type R, XJR and XKR. The XFR will be out next year sometime with a rumored 500 hp direct injection supercharged 5.0 liter version of the current 4.2 liter AJ-V8. The XKRR will most likely follow that car with an even hotter version of that engine and possibly a real manual transmission.

author: ateixeira
text: Yeah, it's funny, they put S-Type on the left, and then a lone "R" on the right.

author: andys120
text: I saw a new Lucerne, Black with a half-carriage roof, big chrome spoker wheels, like most AZ Buicks it was driven by an old dude but they almost always drive white ones.

author: lemko
text: Saw my first new 2008 Accord last night. This one was white. Is Honda trying to imitate the Camry? Well, at least the front end of the car wasn't a gruesome as the Camry's. I also spotted a black Maybach 57 parked a block over from my house. Either the guy was lost, visiting his poorer relations, or even more of an extreme car nut than myself.

author: ateixeira
text:
I saw one with my wife, probably the first time she saw one.

She commented on how long it was, and I agree. You can see how it grew to a full-sizer.

She liked it. It has a little extra chrome so it must've been a high-end model.

author: lemko
text: ...my first 2008 Chevrolet Malibu on the street today. This one was finished in a nice dark blue-green metallic.

author: fintail
text: I had some time to kill today, so I went out and looked for new cars. No new CTS at the Caddy dealer, no new Malibu at the Chevy dealer...but strangely, the MB dealer had 8 new C-class. I also saw a new style Bentley Azure at that dealer.

author: bumpy
text: 2008 Accord, 2008 Focus, and two 2008 Town & Countrys.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
I am baffled as to where the claims of LandRover being a complete dog in the marketplace come from. I'm sorry, but when I can count more late model Range Rovers than I do Suburbans, Tahoes and Pukons combined in a spance of 3 hours, I question the validity of those claims. And at 80 grand a pop for one of those suckers, not even half that for the others I'd say we New Englanders are voting with our wallets and here LR's are quite successful.

I really hope that Ford manages to hold on to this one, I think they have something they can work with.

Also saw a bunch of new Accord sedans, a few of those new Tribecas and Highlander sales have really taken off here. On the high end side of things, a bunch of new C-classes, some CLS's, SL's and SLK's, a pair of Bentley GT's (cruising together, one after the other) a couple of 335i's and new X5's and a bunch of Q7's. :shades:

author: british_rover
text: Land Rover is doing well and it is just a few clueless auto journalists who say otherwise. The problem is jaguar is in such bad shape that Ford is convinced they need dump it and they have to throw in LR to make the sale go through. I am almost looking forward to the sale. I won't miss having to run stuff through the morons at FoMoCredit and maybe Land Rover will start offering some decent lease packages so we don't constantly lose deals to other brands.

author: ateixeira
text:
I have yet to see a Focus or a Malibu on the streets.

2008s that I see often include the new Accord and especially the Grand Caravan - nearly every day now.

Also saw a new X5 this morning.

author: british_rover
text: I saw a new fusion V6 this morning with what looks like aftermarket exhaust. Had extra long chrome tips sticking out the back of the bumper. It was sitting in a parking lot so no idea what it sounded like. This tips were at least six inches past the end of the bumper and looked really bad.

author: ateixeira
text:
If fitment is that bad, it's probably just a tip itself, put on by the owner, and not very carefully.

It'll break off the first time he backs in too close to a curb.

author: british_rover
text: Yeah I didn't bother to get under the car and see if they were just screw on tips as it was raining. They looked like cheap aftermarket walmart specials to me.

author: kyfdx
text:
Spotted one on Thanksgiving Day... attractive..

Saturn Sky? Six of them sitting at the local Saturn dealer.. Looks like they are very, very cold.... Are chrome wheels standard? They could really use silver alloys, instead..

author: bumpy
text:
I am baffled as to where the claims of LandRover being a complete dog in the marketplace come from.

LR is very much a regional thing. Once you get outside the Northeast Corridor and a few other high-dollar enclaves, new ones are a rare find. I saw more LR's when I went to Maryland last Saturday than I see in a whole year.

author: ateixeira
text:
I test drove a Vue Redline and saw a few Skys. Chrome wheels, too.

Top fitment is so poor, plus you have to get out of the car to raise or lower that top.

I think they look great, but they miss on some very key issues IMHO, so I'll probably replace my Miata with...another Miata.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
I was interested in the Sky before I bought my S2000. I was interested in it mainly for its looks and the 20k (bargain) asking price to start. That hype ended once I saw the actual production model in person, what a disaster.

The thing is just a mess, from the ill-fitting, manual top to the bathtub seating position, terrible visibilty, cheap materials and sitting on the crossmembers for seat padding. Then once the plauging differential problems showed up I was thankful that I didn't spend even 20 grand on one.

At least I wouldn't have bought one with an Automatic which is also troublesome but even then the manual gearbox was clunky, notchy and imprecise... kind like a truck from which it came from.

Lutz wanted a car that was attractive, youthful and hit a bargain basement pricepoint and I think he succeeded. Too bad the finished product is also basement quality. :sick:

A Miata is on a totally different level quality-wise, and is just so much better thought out. :shades:

author: ateixeira
text:
I sat in a Sky in the showroom and build quality seemed good, so maybe they've improved that a bit. My complaint was the top fitment and a stiff clutch pedal.

To be fair I'm used to a '93 Miata, with a very soft clutch.

But...I have an aftermarket top that I put on myself and I swear the fit is 10 times better than the factory top on a brand new Sky. For shame...

author: anythngbutgm
text:
at the Auto Shows in both Boston and in NYC. Even the GXP I had the same gripes.

Oh, and one of the guys in my S2k club bought a base model Solstice (2 grand less than the Saturn) for his wife back when they first came out. In that cool British racing green color with the biege interior.

Well with her car, both the tranny and the rear diff. have been replaced on it already.
