The top has two holes where the convertible frame rails have worn through / pinched, one of the window motors siezed and the speakers crackle badly with anything remotely resembling a bass note. Car only has something like 22,000 miles on it :confuse: but you'd swear the thing has 10 times that.

I don't know if the Saturn would be better in any of those areas but based on his car, no way would I put up with that crap :sick: even for the bargain basement asking price.

author: ateixeira
text:
Maybe they still have a ways to go...

Both the ones I saw were also GXP models. The one outside had the poor fitting top, and the one in the showroom had the stiff clutch.

author: ateixeira
text:
Let's wake up this thread.

Saw a Rogue today here in DC.

Yesterday at a PTA meeting I saw my first 08 Highlander Hybrid. Definitely a hybrid, as the many labels show.

I believe it belongs to someone we know, so I may ask for a test spin if I see them soon.

author: lemko
text: Doesn't Rambler make them?

author: ateixeira
text:
I'm too young to get that one.

The one I saw was a Nissan.

author: lemko
text: I'm aware the current Rogue is a Nissan. The Rambler Rogue was a performance version of the AMC Rambler American in the mid-late 1960s.

author: ateixeira
text: I've heard of that model, but never seen one.

author: fintail
text: Very appropriate, while the Nissan Armada windowline mimics the Rambler Cross Country.

author: andys120
text:
I saw a second gen new Mini today. It's the first I've seen even though they're '07 models. I'd read that they were larger than the '02-'06 version but I was surprised to see that it looked around 15% larger than those. It's still pretty small compared to anything else but noticeably larger.

It was a white over blue Cooper S with very nice optional wheels.

author: imidazol97
text: The Armada looks like it was designed by Aztek designers in three parts.

author: british_rover
text:
Ehhh only 2.3 inches longer with the same wheelbase.
2006 vs 2007

author: andys120
text:
Ehhh only 2.3 inches longer with the same wheelbase.

I was wondering, I swear it looks like the differences are greater than the actual measurements would indicate.

author: qbrozen
text:
I had NOT idea what it was. At about 70 yards away, I could only think it was an old Astrovan, although I knew it wasn't quite right. When I finally got close enough to see the emblem, I was really confused at first. I thought "geez, I don't remember Chrysler making an Astrovan copy in the '80s." Then it finally hit me. OH! That's the NEW minivan.

hmmm... probably not the reaction they should be shooting for.

author: kyfdx
text:
It seems like they were trying to copy the boxiness of the Odyssey... But, lost the distinction between boxy and just box.

Lots of cool features, though...

author: ateixeira
text:
Look how wide the roof is. Usually they taper inward. The new vans don't - they're as wide at the top as they are at the bottom.

It makes them feel very airy, though.

author: qbrozen
text: I think you can see my confusion.

author: fintail
text: Today I saw a 'Taurus X' badged Ford Freestyle, and one of those boxy Chrysler minivans.

author: ateixeira
text:
I saw a Taurus sedan ... already had body damage on the side. :sick:

Also saw a Nissan Rogue in Washington Circle. Pretty bare bones, no roof rack or anything. Sort of looks like the CX7 from the rear view only.

author: fintail
text:
Funny...today I saw a deluxe 08 Accord with a back door that was apparently hit by a battering ram.

Also saw my first new Malibu...I guess it is proof of GM actually trying, comparing it to the Malibu of 2002. Looked pretty sharp, although the grille is kind of weird.

author: ateixeira
text:
The 'bu is a big improvement.

I like it more than the Aura. Especially the Reese's inspired interior, with chocolate/peanut butter colored leather.

author: lemko
text: ...a new black Malibu outside the Willow Grove Mall near Philly.

author: bumpy
text: They look like the Fat Elvis version of the old xA. :sick:

author: fintail
text: Another new Focus today...the fake air vents on the fenders are very dorky

author: andys120
text: I found myself behind a new Altima coupe thinking it was an Infiniti G until I read the badge. It was the same shade of red the Infiniti comes in.

author: andys120
text:
Scion xDs (replacements for the xB) are popping up all over here, (Southern AZ).
I've seen at least 3 or 4 in Phoenix and Tucson this week. I tooks less boxy than
the xB but that's deceptive, it's still about the same size and shape. Most will find the styling strange IMO.

author: stever
text:
Saw my first CX-7 today and then saw a smart parked in the movie theatre lot tonight. I suspect it's one of the Zap imported ones. It was parked at the end of a row, scooted all the way over next to the curb.

I guess they were afraid someone would park next to it and open their car door and ding it. Or knock it over.

author: kyfdx
text:
I thought the xD was the replacement for the xA?

Isn't the new xB, still an xB? :confuse:

author: ateixeira
text: They are starting to pop up all over the place. I can't keep track of how many I've seen, actually.

author: andys120
text:
I thought the xD was the replacement for the xA?

Isn't the new xB, still an xB?

.... Stupid Alphabetic names.... :mad:

Yep, it;s the new xB that I am seeing a lot of, I'm not sure I've seen s single xD.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Highlanders and CX-9's are very popular around here. The Pilot still rules the roost though, it's like the early 90's Ford Explorer all over again.

I cannot for the life of me figure out what happened to all the Tribecas though, they were just as popular and now I go weeks without seeing even one. Gas mileage maybe? You can't even blink without seeing a Legacy or an Impreza, but the Tribeca have all but disappeared...

author: kyfdx
text: Yeah... I haven't seen one, either... But, from the pictures, it is sort of boxy, as well...

author: imidazol97
text: They've taken the boxiness out of the Xb. Inside it was spartan but tolerable. I could see it for a utility vehicle but I never could get past the $600 IIRC preparation fee. Isn't that a Daihatsu that's built for Toyota? or did I misunderstand something I read.

author: bumpy
text:
I guess they were afraid someone would park next to it and open their car door and ding it.

The smart has plastic body panels. No dings.

author: fintail
text: New WRX sedan in the parking garage of my building today

author: ateixeira
text:
Well, the original-look Tribeca only existed for 2 model years, plus it sold in small numbers. So the number of them on the road will be tiny compared to the Pilot or Highlander.

Also, they're not new any more, so you probably don't notice them as much.

The 08 model looks better and has set 3 records in a row in terms of monthly sales. It's still a low volume car, though.

author: andys120
text:
I saw a very nice looking new Lancer sporting a small wing and a nice shade of Blue/Grey.

I'm also seeing a lot of new Honda Fits. And here I thought no one would buy a car named after something you have when you're in a bad mood.

author: ateixeira
text:
I think of Fit as in "you can fit that grandfather clock" or "you can fit that large box inside".

It's a big little car.

author: fintail
text:
Not fit in that I'll have to spend 2 hours a day at the gym and develop an eating disorder to drive it?

Although I suppose driving one could be good encouragement to stay in shape, so you don't look ironic

author: ateixeira
text:
Oh c'mon fin, you and I both know you've never actually tried to sit inside one of those.

We (my brothers and I) helped my mom get one of those. Let's just say her cooking is fantastic, and leave it at that.

author: fintail
text: Hey, I rode in one once...a friend was on a test drive (he didn't buy it). It was roomy, but slow and kind of harsh (well, compared to my smooth Panzer). The (I assume) demo he was driving was also an oddball, automatic with a DVD system and body cladding.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Some friends of mine came in to town for the weekend and it just so happens that their rental for the weekend is a new Suburban. So we went out with them last night for dinner, they drove and I got my first ride in one of these ridiculous behemoths. The thing was loaded, Black and did I mention big? It was OK I guess, the engine was smooth (I find GM V8's to be really smooth in general), the interior was somewhat quiet and the thing took our New England bumps and ruts with ease. But with 1400 miles on the odometer, the rear passenger was missing and the speakers crackled and popped with even the slightest amount of bass. Oh and the transmission had this weird whirring noise on the highway and the rear backup lights never turned off (they stayed on while the truck was in park).

This is a rental but still, 1400 miles?

At dinner in Boston, I spotted new Sequoia and bazillion new Highlanders (something about riding around in a truck just makes you notice other large vehicles for some reason ) I did see a new Volvo C30 hatchback outside the restaurant though...

author: anythngbutgm
text:
the rear passenger was missing

Oh, I was missing alright... like half my thought process was missing :sick:

What I meant to say was the rear passenger door handle was missing. It could only be open up from the outside or (in my case) I slid over an got out the other passenger door.

author: kyfdx
text:
Wagon...

It's still shocking to see one of these on the road... I can't imagine this being your main mode of transportation..

author: ateixeira
text: I was gonna ask if you found the missing passenger.

author: teds1
text:
The Audi showroom on Park Ave. in NY was letting people sit in the cars today. It was empty except for me and the attendant so I spent a half hour exploring all the features of the RS4, S8, New TT, A6 Avant s-line... and oh yeah the R8!

There are only 300 available this year and I got to sit in one and shift through the gears (on a rotating pedestal, not the street but still pretty cool) It struck me as just as comfortable and useable as the sedans and that is a pretty neat trick for a mid engined low slung sports car. So gorgeous. The S8 and Rs4 had these afwul agressive red interiors, maybe they look good in a showroom but can you imagine driving around in a $100k v10 bordello?

author: ateixeira
text:
R8? Sweet. Nice xmas gift.

I'm really surprised it was open.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Black Mercedes SLR...

There is nothing that I could point out that would top this.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
left today to head back to the west coast. The transmission apparently still whines badly on the highway, but now does it on the main roads as well. I guess it settles down around the side streets. I guess it also makes a nice "REHH" noise if you start and stop in traffic, didn't hear that when we went to Boston.. must be new as well.

Fillups cost 105 bucks, twice in 500 or so miles. We managed to burn through a half a tank going into and out of Boston the other night so I'm not surprised.

How these guys ended up with a Suburban in the first place is beyond me, he drives a WRX and she drives a Jetta normally :confuse:

author: fintail
text:
I still haven't seen an R8 in the flesh, damn.

I did see a new S6 today, those LED running lights can be spotted from a mike away.

author: teds1
text: I have now seen three R8s in that showroom (1/100th of total production!), a silver one, the white one I sat in yesterday, and a gorgeous indigo blue one with blacks side blades and saddle leather interior. You can guess which one I would choose.

author: fintail
text:
Blue sounds interesting, much moreso than white.

I am surprised I haven't seen one...the Audi dealer in my town is certainly the busiest in the region, I'd have imagined they'd get one. Maybe someone took delivery and it is stored away until summer.

author: uplanderguy
text: With a handle like "anythngbutgm" I don't expect you to be very interested in this, but the backup lights staying on in Park is a safety issue, not a defect (duh). My 2005 Chevy van also does this..it's like the headlights staying on until you get in the house/away from the vehicle...only in the rear.

author: qbrozen
text: I didn't even know this car was out yet. I saw those funky headlights coming at me, then saw the sleek profile, followed by the S badging on the trunk. At first, because of the headlights, I thought "NO way! An R8??!" Still, though, an S5 wasn't much of a letdown. I think I prefer it to the R8, frankly (from an aesthetic standpoint).

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Interesting, never heard of that one before. So they go off when you're driving (Forward that is)?

Seems like it could be distracting to oncoming traffic. If you've got one of these parked in a driveway, rear facing towards the street, people driving by are going to think you are backing out of the driveway and slow down or come to a stop which could cause an accident. Kind of stupid using the back up lights if you ask me.

And regarding the handle, take that one up with the mods if you have a problem with it. I've been here for years with it. Of course if I changed it to NothingbutGM or GMrules or GMisgod there would be no problems huh?

author: uplanderguy
text:
I'm sure you and your ilk would consider the backup lights staying on for a moment after the car is shut off, cutting-edge safety technology if one of our friends from the Rising Sun had implemented it. Why is it dumb to have bright lights behind a vehicle stay on after it is turned off when people are exiting the vehicle?

I think a big difference between domestic-brand "fanboys" and Japanese-brand "fanboys", is that the domestic guys know and can admit that there have been quality issues with the domestics in the past (as well as sometimes in the present) and have been "beat up" for liking domestic cars because of perceptions formed sometimes ten years or more ago by the Japanese-brand fanboys. So be it. We can accept that. The domestics did cause a lot of their own headaches back then, and continue to do so in some ways today. But when the Japanese brands start having serious issues (do you think that Suburban's tailgate will separate in two like Tundras are??), with the Japanese-brand fanboys, what I like to call "Baghdad Bob" syndrome takes over...."There are no American bombs going off near here!", when you could hear them in the background! There is an abject inability to admit that the problems are serious, and embarrassing to the manufacturer.

I discovered about twenty years ago, that those who consider themselves liberal-minded and enlightened, are actually some of the most narrow-minded folks out there. Point-by-point discussions are met with rolled eyes and name-calling.

Bill P.

author: anythngbutgm
text:
Why is it dumb to have bright lights behind a vehicle stay on after it is turned off when people are exiting the vehicle?

Because they are just that, backup lights... No different than those idiots who leave their right blinkers on, you think they're turning right as your pulling onto the road and oops, they're still going straight.

I'm sure you and your ilk would consider the backup lights staying on for a moment after the car is shut off, cutting-edge safety technology if one of our friends from the Rising Sun had implemented it.

Uh huh, yeah that's it :confuse: btw, I am a Ford guy who just happens to accept that there is more to the Automotive universe than what comes out of Detroit. Otherwise, I consider that to be narrow minded.

author: kyfdx
text:
I stopped by the Porsche dealer to drool over Caymans... Forgot they had Volvo..

Only two Caymans on the lot, but they had five (5) C30 hatchbacks! One had the Swedish flag painted on the roof, ala the Union Jack on the MINIs..

Nice cars.. $30K? :surprise:

author: onlygmmatters
text: A ton of new Malibus this weekend. I didn't even see one Accord or Camry at all which is a good thing btw. Must have been a ton of trade ins I guess. I know a few people I work with who cannot wait to dump their troublesome Camcords for a hot new Malibu!

author: kyfdx
text:
Aston Martin DB9

Is that the Vanquish? In a light turquoise color (nicer looking than it sounds). With California plates..

Incredible sound under WOT..

author: fintail
text: I thought this was amusing...Audi seems to do a good job of protecting its new cars. I don't spot any R8s hanging around here, as usual

author: imidazol97
text: What are the bundles above the driver's door on each one on top of their raincoats?

author: fintail
text: I have no clue, I thought the whole getup looked pretty strange

author: qbrozen
text: my guess is that is a panel for the driver's door that is rolled up and tied up top for access to the car.

author: imidazol97
text:
>panel for the driver's door

Thanks. Very logical.

author: onlygmmatters
text:
Now THERE'S a wrapped gift I wouldn't want to open!

The gift that keeps on taking (your wallet in repair bills that is :P )

author: teds1
text:
Ferrari 599 in Shark Grey. I might have seen this one before, how many could there be in new york in that color?

Ford GT

Audi S5

All on the long Island expressway and FDR drive Monday afternoon.

Also a dealer in Riverhead looked like he had 4-5 Z06 Vettes in stock. Maybe the demand for these is slipping? I want a black one.

author: guss
text:
Now THERE'S a wrapped gift I wouldn't want to open!

I dunno, I would take an A8 for the first 4years or 50K miles.

author: ateixeira
text:
Cool pic.

I guess that allows them to use open air transporters.

I believe BMW, or is it Mercedes (?), delivers their cars in sealed carriers. That's gotta cost a bundle.

author: anythngbutgm
text: A guy in my S2k club says you can get Z06's for 7 grand off down south. That is before the bargaining takes place. The new GT-R is the hot car to buy at the moment, the ZR-1 that is coming will probably be the next hottest car...

author: ateixeira
text:
The Chevy dealer on 355 in Rockville, MD, had 3 vettes in the showroom last time I dropped by. One was a Z06.

Obviously they're not selling as well as when they first came out.

The ZR-1 will, though. At least for a year or two.

author: teds1
text:
I don't know about that, supposedly the ZR-1 will be a much more limited production than the Z06. They were saying only a few thousand that might come with a mandatory driving class. That doesn't sound like something you would ever see stacked up on dealer lots.

I do agree that the GT-R is going to be impossible to get anywher near sticker for a long time. The reviews are waaaay too positive and it is a freaking bargain. I know I want one.

author: ateixeira
text: If they keep production down that low, then sure.

author: giancarlo51
text:
A red Bentley Continental GTC (the convertible one) at UVillage, at first I thought it was an Audi TT, took another glance and noticed the B badge on the back, not as hot as I thought it woud look.

My first 2008 Honda Accord Coupe LX-S in white at Northgate. It was hot, looks way better in person. Probably an asian female owner because of those Japanese cartoon stuffed animals all over the interior of the car. Saw quite a few new Accords, looks really good and distinguished. Have yet to see a new Malibu...

Saw a couple new Highlanders, they're ugly.

author: bumpy
text: Looks nice, except for the giant vertical crease where the C-pillar used to be.

author: fintail
text: W221 S600 and a CL63 (or 65 - I couldn't see it clearly) today

author: lemko
text: ...a silver Mercedes R-Class. Do they still make it?

author: ateixeira
text:
I think so, but it's a slow seller.

They priced it above the ML. Most other makes price their vans below their SUVs, so that was a mistake.

Saw a Maserati Quattoporte today, beautiful car.

author: fintail
text: There are now 2 new style WRX living at my apartment building. I am also seeing the new design a bit on the road, every other day at least. I am surprised, given the blandness of the design.

author: teds1
text: Yeah I saw two new imprezas (non wrx) in hatchback form and I was truly surprised that anyone had bought one. Where the hell is the value proposition here? It's ugly, not faster, small, and pricey. Yuck get a mazda 3 or something.

author: ateixeira
text:
They're great if you live in the snow belt and want AWD.

170hp for $17k or so, well equipped, with AWD. SX4 is the only cheaper alternative with AWD I can think of, and it's not as nice.

Impreza looks like a Mazda3 so I'm surprised you'd say yuck to an Impreza look-alike.

Saw 3 new Highlanders today. They're on sale, apparently.

author: fintail
text:
The hatch looks like a 3 anyway, that sedan is really Korean looking, and I don't mean pleasant derivative styling.

Today I've seen about 10 current S-class and a Bentley Flying Spur...maybe the economy hasn't completely collapsed here yet.

author: lemko
text: ...a new dark blue Malibu and a medium blue Suzuki Reno.

author: ateixeira
text: I see a lot more hatches. I think I've only seen one sedan so far on the roads.

author: magnette
text:
Saw one of the new ones this afternoon, the first time I've seen one in the street, although I saw one last September in Frankfurt - at the show...
Don't like the rear lights though....

author: kyfdx
text:
Maseratis look good, until you see the Aston Martins... :surprise:

A poor man's AM?

author: guss
text: Out of all of the Italians, Maserati is the one I don't love. Somehow their styling is just a bit odd to me.

author: ateixeira
text: Saw 2 more this morning. They seem to be selling very quickly.

author: teds1
text:
Oh I am well aware of the traditional appeal of the Impreza, I love them and the WRX (04-05 model) is probably my next car... but I couldn't hate the new shape more. I hate everything about it. The Mazda on the other hand is great looking, I don't think you can compare the two at all besides their basic configuration. I certainly appreciate the appeal of the inexpensive awd option but I just don't understand how anyone can bear to drive one of those things.

Also saw a Maybach 62 S two days ago... Now that is a rare car

author: lemko
text: ...silver 2008 Cadillac CTS across the intersection of Cottman and Oxford in NE Philly while stopped at a red light on my way to work.

author: ateixeira
text:
First one I've seen, still had temporary tags. The new generation, too.

I guess they're arriving.

That car stands out like you wouldn't believe. People were gawking.

author: guss
text:
People were gawking

That's why people are buying.

author: bumpy
text: Deliveries started within the last week or so. Did you see if it was from Tysons or Alexandria?

author: ateixeira
text: Didn't notice, sorry.

author: magnette
text: Yesterday I saw two Maybachs in central London - a 57 and a 62 within a couple of minutes of each other..

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw one of these downtown late yesterday. Looked pretty spiffy so it must have been a Limited model.

They're nice enough, but over $40 grand to use a little less gas? Isn't that a bit of an oxymoron, i.e. an expensive way to save?

author: magnette
text: Saw one yesterday going past my office - not new, but about 2 years old. Still a rare car - I've only seen about 5 on the road.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw the GT-R in the flesh. Looks great, better than any photo I've seen could capture. Love it!

Saw lots of other new cars, too, but I think that was the stand out.

The GT500KR was close.

author: lemko
text:
...reddish-brown metallic Scion xB. At least I think it's a new one because it had different headlights and grille from other xBs I've seen in the past and they didn't look aftermarket. What I found curious was the single backup lamp in the lower left hand side of the bumper.

I thought Scion was getting rid of the xB and replacing it with an xD or something?

author: andys120
text:
It's confusing but the xB is being replaced by a new xB, probably the one you saw.

2008 Scion xB>


The xD replaces the smaller xA:

2008 Scionn xD>


Got it? :confuse:

author: guss
text:
To me the xB & xD have morphed into very similar vehichles. The first time I saw each I was not sure whuch one I was looking at.

A real mistake by Scion.

author: stever
text:
Got your message and removed the oversized photo, but my reply bounced to your CarSpace email. Probably some setting in your profile there that says you only accept email from other CarSpace email addresses.

You may have to settle for a link to the photo ....

author: ateixeira
text:
The funny thing is the powertrains are now actually different.

Before both shared a 1.5l, now the xD uses a 1.7l and the xB uses a 2.4l.

So they look more alike, yet they're actually less alike. If that makes sense.

author: lemko
text: ...new 2008 Honda Accord in medium gold color a block away from my house in NE Philly.

author: fintail
text:
I'm seeing several new Malibus on the road now...must be a good sign out here in Camcord land (although at least one did have a barcode). New Accord sedans are now a common sight too, and I have even seen a few coupes.

Yesterday I saw what I think was a CL63...it has a nice imposing look and screams money.

author: andys120
text:
I think it's maybe the third R-Class Mercedes I've ever seen. What a bomb!

I also saw the first new Malibu I've seen outside of a car show, a grey four-door.

author: guss
text:
How long has the R-class been out, maybe 3 or 4 years ? I have seen maybe a dozen. I think everyone thought it was a Pacifica rebadge.

I saw a new Subaru WRX.....boring.

author: qbrozen
text:
they've been pretty popular here in jersey. Guess they should have just sold it here.

I would say I see them about as often Scion xBs (both old and new) and Porsche Cayennes (to give to sides of the spectrum), and both of those are considered raging successes, no? The jersey market definitely seems to be an anomaly.

author: fintail
text: Kind of like here. I have seen many R-class, even some with the fake AMG sport package. Cayennes are also pretty common here.

author: kyfdx
text:
I thought the R63 was a real AMG?

I know two people with R-class.. They had super cheap lease deals last year...

author: fintail
text:
Well, it's as AMG as a minivan can get :P

I saw some low leases on those too, $349 or $399 I think. Still, not for me.

author: andys120
text:
It seems to be my week for oddball Benzes. Today I saw a white B200 with British Columbia tags. Nice looking rig, even if it looked a trifle Japanese-generic. It wasn't that small, about CR-V sized, but it rode lower.

In the same lot I saw a Bright Yellow Corvette Z06, at first I didn't realize it wasn't a regular ' Vette but then I realized it was a little lower, wore BIG wheels and spotted the hood, scoop/slot that distinguishes the Z06 from ordinary Corvettes.

I think I'm starting to like the C6.

author: stickguy
text:
at the car show Sunday!

I also was behind an R class tonight, and saw one the other day. Might have been the same one, since it seems they are all silver.

The other day I saw a ton of Accords all at the same time. It was like a convention. They must be selling well.

At the show, the MB C class was a major downer. looks OK, but the interior was lousy. Seemed very cheap, especially in tan.

THe Malibu, however, had a super nice interior, comfy seats, etc. Light years ahead of the old one.

I also like the Rogue. If I needed a small ute thingee, that would get a serious look.

My favorite though was the new Volvo V70. Man, I want to get the wife into one of those instead of the Minivan! $$ and carrying capacity be damned!

Oh, and the Jag F type looked really slick. Should do well.

author: qbrozen
text: I love the look of the new V70, but man is that thing big and overweight! Did we get the new V70 in the dealerships yet? Seems it was quite a ways behind the XC70.

author: lemko
text: ...this morning: red Nissan Altima, champagne-colored Hyundai Accent, and a dark gray Saturn Sky Turbo.

author: PF_Flyer
text:
A very interesting bit of electric vehicle news came up on the Alternate Route this morning... could lead to a whole bunch of new places to spot new cars :P

Bond, James Bond

author: ateixeira
text: Looks too much like the Edge, in fact that's what I thought it was at first.

author: fintail
text:
I finally saw a R8 today...yeah, I like it. Seems like a supercar bargain too.

Also, a Cayenne GTS (I think these are new), about 10 late model Astons...maybe there was some kind of club event, although I saw them at different times, a few new C-class, and a new CTS...sitting at the Enterprise lot. Maybe they are using these to replace their fleet of old C-class.

author: teds1
text: I had a meeting this weekend with a guy at his house in Long Island. It was a nice house but not super fancy on a quiet street. However, when I pulled into the driveway his son was just leaving... in his new silver Gallardo!!!! The guy (couldn't be over 35) had just leased it and broght it out to let his dad drive. It was soooo cool sounding. Unbelievably I saw a black one parked by my house when I got home.

author: guss
text:
Unbelievably I saw a black one parked by my house when I got home.

I thought the rest of the story was going to be that your wife bought you one.

A Gallardo would be the car I would buy if I hit the Lotto.

I woder how much it is to lease one......hmmm?

author: ateixeira
text: Drove by me today. Looks even better out on the roads. Thumbs up.

author: ateixeira
text:
Looks OK, window line seems very high so visibility must be reduced. All the lights seem to bulge outward like blisters. Not sure I like that particular styling cue.

Looked good overall, though.

Corollas sure are getting big. This is no longer the compact it used to be.

author: kyfdx
text:
The new one... in bright white..

Looks great.. wish they made it in a 4-door..

author: magnette
text: Saw one of these in Baker Street this morning - not that unusual, really, but this one had a bit of a custom job - a red stripe and a dent on the rear nearside wing - couldn't decide whether it had hit a bus or a post-office van, but somebody was going to get a nice bill I would imagine

author: guss
text: On my commute home tonight. At first I thought it was a Pacifica, but the dodge grill was throwing me. I don't think they share any parts, but they are still very similar.

author: ateixeira
text:
The local dealer has 2 of them - one is $26 grand and the other is $31 grand. This is after discounts.

Are they nuts? Seriously, this is basically an Avenger wagon, stretched.

What are they smoking that they think this is a $31k vehicle? :confuse:

This was supposed to replace the SWB minivans, which I've seen brand new for as little as $13k.

author: qbrozen
text:
Those must be optioned up pretty well. It is supposed to start at $19,8, or something like that. But that's with a 4-banger and FWD.

Automobile mag says it is the quietest sub-$30k car they've ever driven and the best fit and finish they've ever seen on a Chrysler product. Their negative comment is that it is on the Avenger platform. hehe.

author: andys120
text:
New S-Class Benzes are not an unusual sight but I saw one yesterday go by slowly and I couldn't help but feel it just didn't have the dramatic "presence" they had a decade or so ago. The new one looks vaguely Korean.

The current E-Class is the Benz to have IMO.

OTOH a Black 750i that cruised by me yesterday was loaded with presence. It looked vaguely sinister as well maybe it's the Black paint (which shone like a diamond).

.

author: ateixeira
text:
I'm not surprised that it's quiet, in fact their minivan was the quietest in a recent C&D test so Chrysler must've done a lot of work on NVH control.

Still, it's supposed to slot beneath the long-wheelbase only vans, so you'd expect the prices to be significantly lower. $31k buys a pretty nice Grand Caravan.

author: british_rover
text: First one of the US Spec ones I have seen. I see some privately imported older SMARTs on occasion too.

author: ateixeira
text:
I saw one while walking out of the movie theatre last week with my wife.

I've seen 2 so far on the roads.

author: tlcruz
text: we got our first 08 M3 coupe here and two 08 IS-F's! the M3 was gooorgeous in blue and the IS-F's were lookin' smoking hot in obsidian! I love my job

author: ateixeira
text:
In my driveway.

No, didn't buy it, just got it as a rental while my Miata's RF fender is swapped out. Lady hit me in her XC90.

It's appliance white, which is appropriate because it drives like an appliance. Spoiler is cute but the cheesy wheel covers are not.

author: kyfdx
text: Better looking than the old one... but, no thrills..

author: lemko
text: ...red Acura RDX.

author: ateixeira
text: First I saw in the flesh. Looks good, an evolution of the old one. I like this interior much better.

author: lemko
text: ...my girlfriend recently rented a red Pontiac G6 while her LaCrosse was being repaired from the accident on January 2nd. She went to Budget this time instead of Enterprise and was treated much better and the car was much cleaner. She actually liked the G6 and considered it "sporty and youthful."

author: ateixeira
text:
The G5 I rented was a bit dirty, mostly mud on the door sills.

I'm very, very happy to have my Miata back. Despite being 15 years old, it simply runs circles around that G5.

In fact I was ready to trade in the Miata for a newer one, but now I might keep it longer. It cleaned up pretty good after the body work they did, and still drives well (far better than the brand new G5 rental).

author: exit123
text: I saw a Smart Fortwo today. Very cute!

author: guss
text: I thought the G6 was a huge leap over the Grand Am it replaced. Unfortunately everyone from Consumer Reports to Car & Driver has totally killed it. I would give it a shot if they ever get their reliability up, and put the 4 cylinder in their higher trim levels. I guess those are some pretty big if's thought

author: ateixeira
text:
They're a lot better than the G5.

Still, I test drove one of the folding hardtops and it had a nasty creak in the A-pillar. Doesn't speak well for the structure.

author: lemko
text:
...new 2008 Dodge Hemi Charger in Inferno Red. My co-worker finally bought a new Charger this past Friday after talking about it for months.

Also spotted new LaCrosse sporting the revised grille.

author: fintail
text:
Yesterday I saw a Volvo C30...I'm not seeing as many of these as I thought I would.

Also an Audi S5...it had the LED running lights in the front, but only one side was on (?)

author: british_rover
text:
I am seeing a black S5 once a week or so on my commute and it is a pretty hot looking car. I think volvo only had plans to import 5,000 or so C30s this year so you won't see many of them.

Saw a new CTS the other day in black looked good.

author: fintail
text:
The S5 is a beauty, this is the second one I have seen now. They've got their styling down. I also saw a RS4 yesterday...they sound so good...but I think it could get to be an old drone after awhile.

Volvo does pretty well out here...maybe delivery allotments haven't came in yet.

author: british_rover
text:
I have only seen two out on the roads so far and this is Volvo country out here. Our auto group has two Volvo dealers and I still have only seen two of them.

Any given second I can look out my office window and see a dozen or more volvos and nearly as many SAABs. From what I have heard from people in Volvo they have very modest goals for the C30 and are importing very few of them initially. The S40 is supposed to be discontinued soon and the C30 will replace it so I would guess as the S40 is phased out C30 production will climb and hopefully that will drive the price of the C30 down some.

author: kyfdx
text:
Couple of months ago... my dealer already had five of them... I'd bet they are all still there..

2-door hatchbacks are a tough sell.. Plus, they are mostly $30K, and not as cute as a MINI (subjective, I know)..

That Swedish flag on the roof just doesn't have the same cachet as the Union Jack.. :surprise:

author: british_rover
text: Our two volvo dealers have 4 C30s and the average MSRP is about 26,000 dollars.

author: fintail
text: I think the one I saw yesterday might be only the second I have seen on the road too. I see more C70s than the C30, and probably 50 new C-class for every C30. I remember looking at the C30 and being with a friend who test drove one...the price did seem high for the base model we drove.

author: british_rover
text: The base model price is ok but the problem is the middle and high equipment level C30s are 3-5 grand over priced.

author: ateixeira
text: I'm not sure if I've seen a single one out on the road. At least not in the last month or so. They're as rare as hen's teeth.

author: british_rover
text: I just saw another SMART car a few minutes ago so I have officially seen more SMARTS then C30s. There is marketing support on the C30 now too so Volvo knows they need to drop the price to get inventory moving.

author: ateixeira
text: Same here, I've seen 3 Smarts. They really stand out, though, so you just can't miss 'em.

author: stever
text:
you just can't miss 'em

Let's hope the 'Slade drivers see 'em too. :shades:

Saw my first Saturn Sky Sunday. Fire engine red. Or at least it was the first parked one I've seen that I could get a good look at.

author: ateixeira
text:
There's one at my kids' school. I see it in the parking lot each time I go, so it must be driven by a teacher. Come to think of it there used to be a Miata, and that's gone, so perhaps they traded up.

My concern is I have yet to see one with a good fit on the top, including that one.

author: andys120
text:
Come to think of it there used to be a Miata, and that's gone, so perhaps they traded up.

Sounds more like they traded down.

author: ateixeira
text:
I installed a Robbins soft top myself, even converted my NA with a zipper-windows to an NB style self-folding type, with no zipper.

I swear the fit is better than the factory fit I've seen on any Solistice or Sky.

author: kyfdx
text: Every single Sky that I've seen has chrome wheels.... ugh..

author: fintail
text:
I remember the one we rode in (automatic and Swedish decal, not much else) stickered at like 26K I think. It was pretty spartan - didn't even have cruise control. I know the loaded ones can easily go over 30K...heading for C-class territory.

I see several older Smarts around here, as a private importer is in the next town over. He can't be too pleased that the little things are finally official, as he was selling them for 26-28K...and the over-monied suckers around here were snapping them up.

author: qbrozen
text:
coincidentally, I came to post that I saw my first C30 just yesterday, too.

When I saw it coming towards me, I thought "oh, its an S40... but something is different. A body kit maybe ..." then the profile came into view. I think its really a great looking car, personally. It used to be on my shopping list, but I'm convinced I don't want FWD again. Maybe with AWD and a stick, it would get back on the list. But I guess that probably won't happen if they want to keep the price down (and if it doesn't sell more). A couple of minor mods and it could push 260-270hp through all 4 wheels. That would be a fun ride, methinks.

author: british_rover
text:
I agree that the C30 is a great looking car and with the 2.0 upgrades it drives very great. Really just needs a short shift kit to cure the rubbery shifter.

It is just a bit too much money though so unless I can get a huge employee discount in the fall I won't get one.

Oh and I am sure a S60R driveline would easily fit in the C30 and then you would just be a little ECU tunning away from 350 hp. Can you say STI Slayer?

author: fintail
text: A 350hp C30...now that would be something!

author: qbrozen
text: well, I'm seeing used S60Rs with 30k miles for $22k around here. I'm SOOOOO tempted. If only I wasn't SOOOOO upside-down on my lease.

author: british_rover
text: Which lease the pacifica or the Honda?

author: qbrozen
text:
the honda. I've got 13 payments left.
Only 6 more on the pacifica. We're pretty sure the Pac will be replaced by a used V70.

author: stickguy
text: Was that a 2 year lease? I don't remember you having that one for 2 years already (as you would if it was 3 year lease).

author: qbrozen
text:
3 year.
Believe it or not, its been almost 2 years. I leased it on my son's 3-month bday in May '06.
And, so far, I'm right on the money with the miles. Sitting at ~29k right now.

author: british_rover
text: Yeah Honda does a pretty good job of setting up their leases just right. I have never been able to get someone out of a Honda or Acura early unless it was in the last couple of months and they were well under the miles.

author: ateixeira
text: Another loose fitting top. :sick: They really seem to have wrinkles around the C-pillar area.

author: andre1969
text:
on the Baltimore Washington Parkway in Maryland, I saw two odd Mopars. The first one, at first, I thought was just an '08 Caravan, but it looked a bit more hunkered down, and as I passed it, it appeared to have a longer, more SUV-ish snout to it. Not sure what it was. I remember seeing this concept car at the auto show called a Dodge Journey...it's not out yet, is it?

The other was an Intrepid, but as it passed by, I noticed that it said "Chrysler" on the front door where it would normally say "Intrepid". So I'm guessing it was a Canadian that jumped the border.

Oh, and insult of insults, in the parking lot at work I saw a Caddy STS...the new style, not the Seville STS. It had one of those awful fabric carriage tops on it! Someone needs to be tarred and feathered! Oh well, at least it didn't have wire wheels and gold stripe tires! :P

author: andre1969
text:
Another loose fitting top. They really seem to have wrinkles around the C-pillar area.

Now that you mention it, I saw a Solstice the other day, top up, and wrinkled. Must be a common flaw I guess?

author: ateixeira
text:
On every one I've seen.

I want alternatives to another Miata, yet none of the ones I've seen even pass a casual inspection.

The Journey is out, by the way. My dealer had 2 last time I was there.

author: andre1969
text:
if the Journey is any good? I read an Edmund's write-up on it, and it just seemed kinda so-so. I do like the style of it though. I think it's a bit too big to stick it with a 2.4 as standard equipment, though.

As for the Miata, I don't really like the style of the new ones. Looks like a cross between a Saturn and a Good & Plenty. I thought it was pretty comfy to sit in, though. It seemed to be more comfy than the Solstice/Sky.

author: ateixeira
text:
Yeah, I actually commented that the Ibuki concept car that inspired the Miata "looked like a pill". It's a bit bulbous, especially the front.

I do prefer the styling on the Solistice, by far, but...

1. You can't drop the top without getting out of the car! DUH! :mad:
2. See #1, this is a roadster for God's sake.
3. Every top I've seen is wrinkled, you wonder about the seal, cracking, fit, etc.
4. Did I mention you can't open this convertible while driving?

So, so stupid.

At least give it a power fold option or something.

author: qbrozen
text:
I might take a look at a journey if my wife's car needs another service visit before lease end (which it should). The mags I've read have all said its the best fit and finish of any chrysler in history and it is the quietest sub-$30k ride they've ever experienced.

I agree about the 2.4, though. That is just ridiculous in a near 2-ton vehicle.

author: ateixeira
text:
I have to see those in person. I think other recent Chrysler interiors have gone downhill, in fact it's hard to imagine cheaper interiors in some cases.

The dealer I mentioned had one for $26k and another for $31k, so they had better be nice.

I guess since it is based on the Stratus I expected much lower pricing, maybe $18-25k, tops.

author: qbrozen
text:
oh yeah. we did talk about this here before, huh?

Now I can't remember the numbers exactly, but I believe a V6 AWD model starts at like $24k?

author: ateixeira
text:
Sure did.

I promise not to bring it up a 3rd time until I sample that interior in person.

author: guss
text:
New Miata's have a pretty good lease deals going on right now, $199/mo for 27 months with $2100 down, I think the mileage is only 10,500 pre year though.

The definitely have more room in them than my '97, except with the top up , one of the braces lands right where my head is. The Solstice I could get used to it's size, but I prefer to wait a few years and pick one up much cheaper.

author: guss
text: looks like a tall Avenger wagon. I don't know why they needed a new name for it. I have no problems with a Avenger wagon as a name but I guess the wagon body style is not as sexy as Crossover .

author: qbrozen
text: my memory ain't what it used to be.

author: qbrozen
text:
probably not the best place for this ... but since we were just talking about it ...

Plans were to go to the NYAIS today, but that kind of fell apart. So I went to the volvo dealer instead. This dealer is the one I bought my S70 from all those years ago. They had an '04 S60R 6-speed advertised on their site. Of course, I found out that was sold. But they were kind enough to allow me to test drive a C30 2.0 6-speed demo. It was OK. I'm not enamored with the tranny. The clutch, however, is very very light. Maybe too light. The car felt tight, light, and fairly well balanced. Power was adequate. Problem was, I didn't fit comfortably. Its just a smidge off. I could almost live with the leg room, but the big problem was how tight it was under the dash. My size 14s would get caught up under there every time I needed to shift or move to the brake.

They were then kind enough to let me drive an '04 automatic S60R they had with 69k miles on the clock. Honestly, I'm in love! And all the bad things I've read about the auto tranny in that car I feel are completely unwarranted. It is NOT slow! And WOW do I love that adjustable suspension. It feels like a Lexus in the comfort setting, a bimmer in the Sport setting, and a kit car in the Advanced setting. This thing is FUN FUN FUN! The grip is just amazing. I kept trying to induce some sort of sliding, but it just refused. That is, at least, at the speeds I was driving, which was about the max I am comfortable with on public roads. I think this is going to be the car. After driving a used 330i a month or so ago, I thought that would be the one, but, at the same time, I didn't feel like I HAD to have one. This car is different. It is calling to me.

The 2 that they had were both wrong for me, which is probably a good thing. 69k miles is too many and the other one was an '06 with 14k miles, so that was too expensive. They say they'll call if another comes around. I'd like to try the 6-speed, but I think I may be perfectly happy with the auto.

author: fintail
text: I saw one of those new Jag sedans on the road today...maybe half a mile from the Jag dealer, so I assume it was on a test drive.

author: magnette
text:
Cheating a bit, because it was in the dealers window, but it's the first time I've seen a Bugatti Veyron, in Britain. It was in the showroom at Berkeley Square, the main West End dealers for Bentley. Their website says they've sold about 15, so far.
Somehow it looked smaller than I imagined,

author: andys120
text: Automatic gearboxes with their Torque Converters are sometimes better matched to Turbo drivetrain characteristics as the TC absorbs some of the snatchiness inherent when the boos comes on suddenly. At least that was the case when I drove a 9000 Turbo A/T after owning a couple of 9000T 5-speeds.

author: british_rover
text:
Ahh I noticed that with one of the C30s I drove too. Was the C30 you drove Cosmic white with the chocolate colored body molding? If so it was one of the official Demo cars that Volvo gave to all the dealers and it has the LED interior lighting package.I have size 13s but wear boots almost everywhere so on the 2.0 C30 I drove my toe kept hitting one of the LED modules above the pedals. The 1.0 I drove first didn't have the LED package so there wasn't anything for me to hit my feet on.

The S60R is a very cool car and that active chassis really does work. Torque is limited somewhat in first gear but you won't really notice that unless you drive a manual S60R back to back with an auto and give both of them sustained WOT.

In the advanced setting it will actually pump up the trailing outside shock absorber to help with turn in.

author: texases
text: Just saw the Top Gear where they 'raced' the Veyron against the RAF jet - great show!

author: ateixeira
text:
Sounds like a future purchase to me.

I've heard great things about them. About the only criticism is their relatively high curb weight, but that could be seen as a good thing (beefy feel, crash protection, etc).

Saw an STS-4 today. Most of the ones I see are RWD.

author: qbrozen
text:
ahhh... interesting info, BR ... on both counts.

The one I drove wasn't the white one I've seen pics of. I don't remember the color, but I think it was blue. Now, the one in the showroom was a 1.0 and I tried that one out, too, and I still had the toe problem. But I did feel a tad more comfy in it. I thought it may have been the manual seat, for some reason, but maybe it is what you point out.

author: qbrozen
text: I thought the same thing when I saw the curb weight (3700 lbs!). But, ya know, I guess it comes down to how it "feels" rather than reality. By the tale of the tape, my 350Z was a porker, too. As heavy as my S70 and my current Accord. But it certainly didn't feel that way.

author: qbrozen
text: sorry for keeping this off topic ... but I'm having trouble finding this info and you seem to know a bit about these cars, BR. What happened with the R in '06? They switched to a 6-speed auto. Does that model have full power available? If so, I might have to suck it up and wait for an '06.

author: british_rover
text:
Yeah I am pretty sure the 06 and up Rs with the 6 speed auto get full power in first gear and full torque. I need to ask one of the guys down at Volvo to be sure though. The torque number for the manual equipped S60s is 295 ft-lbs at 1,800 rpms or so. I guess try and look up an old test of an automatic equipped S60R and see if they list a different spec.

EDIT:

I think I found what you were looking for.

It is impressive stuff, even if the R's 235/40R18 performance rubber does not offer the ultimate grip of an M3. There is more than enough control for the most spirited of street squids (a descriptor I never thought I would use in a Volvo road test) — especially since the engine's 295 pound-feet of torque (in the new six-speed manual guise anyway; 258 with the five-speed Geartronic automatic) are transmitted through all four of the S60R's tires. More sophisticated than the XC70's system, the S60 can transfer almost 70 percent of its power to the rear wheels, reducing the understeer that plagues lesser Volvos when they are pushed around fast corners.

http://www.edmunds.com/insideline/do/Drives/FirstDrives/articleId=80020

The 06 and 07 Rs seem to have a 295 ft-lb rating even with the automatic.

author: qbrozen
text:
Thanks. Yeah, I finally found some info, too. The '06 auto is almost as fast as the manual tranny, supposedly. AND they changed the AWD a bit. Something about the '06+ Haldex being pre-loaded.

So I think this all clinches it. I gotta go for an '06. Good news is the value isn't astronomically different. I was looking at about $21-$22k for an '04 vs about $27k on an '06. Just means I may have to wait a bit longer, but I think it would be well worth it.

author: lemko
text: ...champagne colored Cadillac CTS this morning on my way to work.

author: mikeyb2
text:
Ok, so not really on the road, but at the NY Auto Show, I saw the 09 Nissan GT-R. What a hot looking car! Don't know how practical it is for me, but very nice to look at.
http://www.expotv.com/videos/expo/203/207/Auto-Show-2009-Nissan-GT-R/257086

author: stever
text:
In case you missed it, a couple of editors are on a short road trip with a new GT-R.

The blog posts are coming fast, but this will get you started ok:

2009 Nissan GT-R Road Trip: So Long Santa Monica

They are even letting some Inside Line readers drive it.

author: guss
text:
My invitation must have been lost in the e-mail.

The GT-R looks alot like a 350Zwith a new front bumper. You would have thought they would have gone a little more exotic.

author: lemko
text: ...cream-colored Chrysler Aspen. Wow! Somebody actually bought one!

author: andys120
text: They sold two,! I saw one the other day for the 1st time.

author: british_rover
text: I have seen at least ten of them since they first came out. They probably were bought by the dozen people in the focus group. :surprise:

author: magnette
text: If they are passing through east London, ask them to drop in...

author: magnette
text: Yeah, I saw that one a bit back - the plane was good too - Eurofighter Typhoon I think...

author: tlcruz
text: Saw the first 1 series today @ work. Silver 128CI ..... Now if I could only get one as a demo, lol :P

author: fintail
text:
A few new faces at the 2008 Vancouver auto show

Pics aren't so hot as the batteries in my normal camera crapped out, so these are from a phone. Decent for a phone, I guess.

My favorite cars to sit in - Audi R8 and a typical S550...just so comfortable. The R8 wasn't bad inside either, I am relatively tall and not gangly, and I fit just fine. I also say in a CLS63...nice trim, but those slit windows annoy me. The Skyline looks pretty cool...but of course, not open for sittings.

I tried to get pics of some models or names or trim levels not usually seen in the American market, too.

author: lemko
text: ...despite the high fuel costs, some people still have the disposable income to run these beasts - spotted a black Nissan Murano with a very odd aftermarket grille and blingy wheels and the "pickup" version of a Hummer H2.

author: ateixeira
text:
H2 SUT.

My Exxonn stock thanks him.

author: guss
text: it was the 2 door hatch in black. I almost hurt my neck watching it drive by. I thought it looked really good, I can't believe Saturn is not trying to sell more of them.

author: teds1
text:
I have seen a New M3 coupe, Saturn Astra, Several Smarts, and a new SL 63 on the street in recent days. Also the new Maserati GT-S in the showroom.

At the NYAIS I saw everything... Some highlights

MRAP military vehicle... sooooo huge
Hyundai Genesis Coupe- significant car, great looking, great stats, sick value. This one will change your opinion of Korean cars - Mustang Killer
Literally Everything in the Audi Booth (except Q7) was amazing this year. The new A4/A4 avant are gorgeous as is S5
CTS-V/CTS Coupe- both great variants on an impressive car
New M3 sedan and convertible, 335
Merc CL Coupe- plutocrats dream, makes you feel like "The Boss"
C-63- looks so fun to drive
Nissan GT-R - Drew a huuuge crowd
Mazda Furai concept - completely amazing looking car
Volvo XC60 concept - they will sell a ton of these, better looking than the XC90 by far.
Lambo Gallardo LP 560 4
Aston Vantage - They had a DBS too but I like the "baby" best in that family
New Challenger - I'll never buy one but I would Looove to rent one, even the base model.

Lowlights
X6- even worse looking in person
New WRXs
Evos - I don't love where they went with the styling this time
Jag XF- I wanted to love it but found it underwhelming
Garish stickers promting green credentials on hulking GM SUVs... give it a rest guys, no one is fooled
Saab- Total lack of relevance sadly
Mini Clubman - not really a big deal, you only gain about a foot of trunk space and you still can't carry much
Smart Car, just sit in it and try rocking from side to side... scary
SLR convertible. - Honestly most people ignored it. The new SL looks similar (new side vents) and has similar performance at 2/5 the price
Ferrari booth - lone rotating 430 with no signage (not an offically sponsored booth but still...come on that doesn't look good for them)

author: ateixeira
text:
At a dealer. Looks good.

Also saw a new Lexus LX on out the roads. Looks better in person, out on public streets. It seems more massive.

author: guss
text: Must be selling pretty well because I have seen 4 this week.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a new Murano yesterday...

...and then a Rogue today.

author: magnette
text:
Starting to see a few Lincoln Navigators locally - generally with very bling wheels.. This isn't a model sold here through regular dealers, so must be special imports, but I've seen three different ones this week.
Also a Hummer H3 today - yellow - that is sold here but very rare, really.

On a different note the new Jag XF seems to be getting more common here, but we have got a Jag dealers half a mile up the road.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a new XF parked here in DC, actually, just yesterday.

Looks good. Enough to save Jaguar? Time will tell.

author: andys120
text:
Pontiac G8, at a dealer, displayed front and center. Looks good in black but needed a good clean and wax. IMO this car is simply too big to be a proper Sports Sedan.

BMW One Series Coupe, Sedona Red, driving on street (first I've seen outside a showroom). Sedona Red looks better uder the AZ sunshine than under harsh show lighting but I guess that's appropos.

author: fintail
text:
I saw some kind of late model Aston on the road today - they are all starting to look the same to me, so I don't know what it was.

I also saw a young woman in a custom painted E63. It was a magenta/pink color. Pretty hard on the eyes, and I am not convinced about the quality of the paint...it didn't seem as shiny as a factory job.

author: lemko
text: ...dark blue Chevrolet Malibu and medium blue Chrysler Sebring sedan. I heard a rumor that they were going to discontinue the Sebring sedan.

author: ateixeira
text: Few will miss it.

author: alltorque
text: We now have a Ferrari 612 Scaglietti and an Aston Martin DB9 around here. Not bad for a sleepy English village - and a friend has just bought an Audi RS4 Avant.

author: lemko
text: ...red Cadillac CTS next to me in traffic and a new gray Buick LaCrosse parked behind my car. I really like that new grille on the LaCrosse!

author: andre1969
text:
I've been seeing a lot of Dodge Avengers lately. Is Chrysler dumping them into rental fleets or something?

Oh, out in the parking lot at work is a fairly new Cadillac STS with...a carriage roof!! I thought GM was trying to discourage that.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a new Mercedes ML-based pope-mobile from my office window yesterday!

Also saw a new Murano.

author: lemko
text: Chrysler and Pininfarina, (or was it Ghia?) built the Popemobiles? They were some pretty attractive cars.

author: qbrozen
text: I really didn't think much of it coming at me. Kinda looked like a Lexus/Buick ... but it looks great from behind.

author: ateixeira
text:
I don't, actually.

This time you could barely see him. The vehicle is hideous. A box on top of an ML, basically.

author: british_rover
text:
I have a bunch of XF pics from last week when I got to drive one but most of them are too big for this board.

I guess I could directly link them of something.

These compressed photos might come out alright.

author: ateixeira
text: Wow, next to the SUV is really looks longer, lower, wider than most cars.

author: ateixeira
text: Saw one of the brand new coupes while driving in to work this AM. Very cool.

author: lemko
text: ...red Pontiac G6 convertible - top down on a nice sunny day!

author: kyfdx
text:
I think it was the bigger of the two little ones ... Exige?

Seriously.. they look like Hot Wheels cars...

author: lemko
text: ...black Mitsubishi Endeavor - an uncommon SUV in these parts.

author: tlcruz
text: We got our first X6's in (red & green) and they look much better in person, IMO. But I still don't like em....

author: lemko
text: ..bronze-metallic Buick LaCrosse Super in the parking lot at work today.

author: guss
text: Pontiac Vibe, better looking than the pics I had seen of it.

author: texases
text: re: the Vibe, I saw one, too, looks good, except they have black trim to conceal how wide the c pillar is - what is it with cars now?

author: bumpy
text: with the V-type grille yesterday. It didn't have V badging or very aggressive-looking wheels, so I assume it's a poser.

author: ateixeira
text:
Toyota seems to be the worst offender. Look at the Matrix, the xB, the xD, the FJ Cruiser. Can't see a thing out of any of them.

When did visibility become unimportant?

author: kyfdx
text:
2009 Toyota Corolla S

2009 Subaru Forester

2008 MINI Clubman (Hot Chocalate color)

author: stickguy
text:
Got to sit and and scope out a new one today. A guy I know works for Hyundai corp, so he had a pre-sale one. Not sure when they are coming out.

Anyway, extremely nice car. Vey attractive, and the interior was very upscale. Comfy seats, a ton of room, neat features, etc.

If this thing drives as good as it looks, could do quite well (depnedning on pricing).

Frankly, it could have passed as a new model Lexus or Infiniti, and makes the 40K offerings of Acura look shabby.

author: lemko
text: ...but I saw a convoy of at least 20 Porsches on the PA Turnpike this past Saturday on my way to Carlisle.

author: guss
text:
On my way home from work yesterday. At first I thought it was a Yaris five door hatch(if there is such a thing).

For the first time I like the style of Matrix over than the Vibe.

author: kyfdx
text:
Canada gets the Yaris five-door hatch..

If you've ever seen the TV-series Psych on the USA Network, one of the characters drives a blue one.

author: ateixeira
text:
First one I've seen.

In person they look lower. Pictures make it look taller than it is.

author: guss
text:
I did a little checking and while similar, the Matrix is more sleek, and less cute than the Yaris.


Yaris


2009 Matrix

author: texases
text: On the Matrix, could the side windows get much smaller? Big A and C pillars, and look at how low the top of the window is. Not good :mad:

author: fintail
text: I was thinking the same thing, thick pillars and short windows. Not cool. This design fad needs to reverse itself.

author: british_rover
text: It should start reversing itself soon. IIRC The H2 and Chrysler 300 were some of the first mail slot window designs on the market. The faux four door coupe trend will probably keep the design hanging on for a few more years.

author: ateixeira
text:
I hate that trend. You can barely see out of half the cars for sale today. Especially the blind spot.

Saw a new Malibu in a parking lot. Those things are loooong.

author: guss
text: I get the feeling soon it will be like driving a submarine, we'll just have cameras instead of a periscope to see where to go.

author: ateixeira
text: Yes! LCD screens will replace mirrors.

author: kyfdx
text:
It's local.. I've seen it a couple of times.. A truly rare sighting..

In Silver, of course

author: fintail
text:
Funny...in the pretentious area where I live, I see those pretty much every day, sometimes a few a day. I even saw a G55 last weekend, it had big heavy bling wheels :sick:

I saw a CLS63 yesterday...I've read the C63 is in release stage now, so I've been stalking the local dealer once or twice a week to see if I can spot one sitting around.

author: ateixeira
text: With the new grille.

author: andys120
text:
For some strange reason I was seeing new Mazda 5s everywhere I went yesterday
and then I went to a freind's house and her sister from Florida was up driving a rented Mazda 5 (!).

For what it is the 5 is an exceptionally good looking car IMO. Gas prices being what they are a Micro Minivan is probably an idea whose time has come.

author: lemko
text: ...seen many Toyota Yarises (Yarii?) this weekend in all kinds of colors.

author: qbrozen
text:
Spotted my first For2 (or however you want to write it) on the road over the weekend. I'm shocked to have seen it in my own hometown, which is rife with things like motorhomes and Z28s (think redneck).

I was also a bit surprised at how small it really is in a real-world setting. I just don't think I could feel safe driving that thing. Its kind of like a mouse trying to navigate through the feet of stampeding elephants.

author: ateixeira
text:
Too bad Mazda ignores it. I see a lot more marketing for the CX7 and CX9.

Also, they never brought over the 7 seat model, the power sliding doors, or the AWD option over from the JDM version.

author: andys120
text: Jeez, how many people really need a 7 seater? It'd be pretty crowded in a 5 w that many seats (it must be on a stretched w/b).

author: ateixeira
text:
They have a middle bench instead of the captain's chairs.

By having 5 seats with the 3rd row folded you have more cargo space because you can fold the whole 3rd row.

author: lemko
text: ...black Cadillac SRX. There's a guy in my neighborhood who has a new silver Pontiac G8 that I see from time to time.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw another one. Black this time.

Still very rare sightings around DC.

author: texases
text:
"Still very rare sightings around DC. "

I'm surprised - is there a local dealer? I would have expected DC to be a fertile breeding ground for these things! I see probably two a week in Dallas.

author: ateixeira
text: Must be, but I've still only seen 2 or 3, and one might have been the last generation.

author: bumpy
text: There is still over a year-long backlog of orders even though we're getting 2/3rds of the factory output, so any given dealer is only getting a trickle of cars at any given time.

author: texases
text: Yes, I'm just surprised at how many there are around here. Two at the same time in a school parking lot!

author: fintail
text: I saw one of those new smaller Infiniti crossovers today. Yawn

author: ateixeira
text:
First time I've seen a 1 series in the flesh.

Looks cute. You really notice the concavity in the sides.

author: lemko
text: Nissan Rogue in black, Dodge Journey in black, and Jeep Patriot in silver-green.

author: giancarlo51
text:
Saw for the first time a brand-new 2009 Acura TSX with a lip spoiler out in the wild. Boy the rear-end is simply gorgeous. The car looks a lot bigger and I think the best view of this car is from the rear, kind of like Kim Kardashian. I wasn't able to see the front-end, maybe that is why I thought it looked so good.

Saw a white Maserati Quattroporte from the rear as well, looks good too.

I also saw a Hummer H1, aren't those extinct already because of sky-high gas prices? Don't even want to guess what his gas bill is, I drive a Mazda3 and everytime I fill it up costs about 35 bucks man. Don't want to think about how much it costs to fill up a pick-up.

author: kyfdx
text:
Spotted two 4-door hatchbacks yesterday...

Nice looking, but I'd be just as happy with a Mazda3 for the same (or less) money..

author: ateixeira
text:
Speaking of unusual SUVs, saw my first X6 in the flesh, and it was out on the roads.

Still looks odd to me. I prefer the X5.

author: fintail
text: Another of the new Jags, and a Clubman

author: ateixeira
text:
I was walking on Pennsylvania Ave and his whole fleet drove by.

Let's see, I saw 2 Suburbans, 2 Durangos, 2 DTS Caddies, and about a dozen motorcycle cops.

First time I've seen them using Durangos, so that's new.

author: texases
text: In Dallas :confuse:

author: fintail
text: I saw several of those in Vegas too. I think I read they cost something like 60K new.

author: texases
text: The odder thing - it was for hire as a taxi, under one of the local chains! Expensive publicity stunt, I guess.

author: stever
text: You can find a similar one at a trendy boutique hotel in Santa Monica used as an airport shuttle. (link).

author: kyfdx
text: I thought that looked familiar...

author: magnette
text: I saw a Hummer H2 today - totally blinged out, of course - which is not an everyday event here, even in Essex, where I was - and if it costs you 35 dollars to fill up a Mazda 3, it costs me 37 pounds, every time I fill up my Vauxhall Corsa ( a 1.2 litre diesel).

author: magnette
text:
Re the London Taxi, I read that the manufacturers are actually planning to push it in some parts of the States, as it is comparatively fuel efficient - although they are also planning to move some (ie probably all) production to China in the next few years...
That shape has actually been with us for a few years now, although the more familiar FX4 was here from 1959 to about 2002, in one form or another so taxi designs don't change much. Some bloke in our street has one, and he always seems to be heading off for his first fare at about six in the morning, so I don't really need an alarm clock if he parks outside our house...

author: british_rover
text: For some reason I thought engines in those Taxis were really, really dirty. Is that something they fixed after 2002?

author: andys120
text:
For some reason I thought engines in those Taxis were really, really dirty. Is that something they fixed after 2002?

You haven't seen dirty til you've been in a New York Cab that's been on the street for a few months. Perhaps what you heard about is the sooty, smelly diesel exhausts the London Cabs used to emit. I assume that's a thing of the past w modern diesel tech.

author: british_rover
text: Thats what I meant by dirty as in exhaust emissions not dirty like cosmetically.

author: texases
text: I ended up behind a new black 911 GT2 at a light today. What are they, $200,000? Well, the light turns green, and...he stalls :blush: Hate when that happens!

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw 2 Smarts this weekend, so finally they're starting to show up more.

Also saw a new Accord this morning.

Plus a Highlander.

Plus an X5. Looks like the old one from behind.

Also saw a base Grand Caravan, probably a fleet car. They really strip those down.

author: guss
text: my first Smart on the road ,skinny and goofy was the first thing I thought.

author: kylechoffman
text: San Diego and Newport respectively, last weekend

author: lemko
text: I saw my first Smart yesterday travelling west on Market St. near City Hall in Philly.

author: fintail
text:
I saw two new Matrix today

And a funny one... It was a new style Porsche Targa, I am not sure of the model exactly. I was driving by the local Porsche dealer, and a guy was getting into it while an employee was watching. The guy started it up with the door open, talking to the employee. The car came to life and started smoking like it was on fire, a huge amount of blue smoke was billowing out. It reminded me of my old car when a piston ring broke.

author: andys120
text: Isn't that "Matrices"?

author: kyfdx
text: Dang! Beat me to it..

author: lemko
text: ...black BMW 650i coupe.

author: giancarlo51
text:
New cars in and around the Seattle 206 area:

BMW M6: gorgeous

2008 Honda Accord V6 coupe: drop dead gorgeous, the 18 inch wheels look really dowdy and cheap and even small in the photos, but in person they got presence and they are hot.

A few Bentley Continentals gorgeous again

author: ateixeira
text:
An Accord gorgeous?

You're too easily impressed.

author: kyfdx
text: Very nice... much better than the pictures..

author: stickguy
text:
A new silver 128. Followed by (I believe they were together) an M3 coupe, still with the temp tag on it.

Seeing them back to back, the bigger car was much better proportioned. The 1 series looked too chunky.

Of course, if they had just brought over the 5 door, I would have put a deposit down on it already!

Oh, I sat in a new TSX at the dealer the other day. LOoked OK. DOn't like the grill, but the rest of the car is fine. Interior was comfy, but the center stack was a bit busy.

author: ateixeira
text:
I saw one this morning also.

They had one at the mall, and I sat inside. It's nice, a step above your standard economy sedan, but not quite luxurious, either. I liked the seats. Didn't drive it, of course, the mall has too many pedestrians.

I see a Rogue about every 5 minutes.

Also saw a new Forester. We have ours on order, but these are starting to pop up a lot also. Sales were up 66% last month, no wonder I had to special order one.

author: texases
text:
Juice-
Sorry to go off topic, but I'm thinking about a '05 Forester for our son - anything to look out for?

author: lemko
text: ...light green metally Honda Civic hybrid. They have special wheels not seen on other Civics. I think they're quite attractive.

author: british_rover
text: I think the wheels are supposed to reduce air resistance but not sure how much truth there is to that.

author: bumpy
text: The full wheel covers do help reduce the drag coefficient; not much by itself but every little bit helps. The wheels are the easiest way to spot the Civic hybrids.

author: guss
text: I thought the wheels on the hybrid Civic gave it a goofy spaceship look.

author: lemko
text: ...that Civic Hybrid would look pretty cool with some of those Bonneville Salt Flats wheels on it.

author: stever
text: This one must have been from Penske - had temporary tags on it and looked brand new. The other one I've seen in Boise was likely an import from Canada or Zap.

author: bumpy
text: The new ones have two tailights on each side while the older ones have three. There are other differences (door handles, headlight shape, etc.), but that is the easiest way to distinguish them.

author: lemko
text: I spotted what appeared to be a current generation BMW 7-Series, but the lettering on the back in BMW-esque text read "ALPINA B4." Can anybody explain what an Alpina B4 is?

author: fintail
text:
Could it have been a "B7"?

I remember when I was a kid someone a few blocks away had (what I guess was a)a grey market E28 5-series Alpina. It had some odd cladding and a strange paint job. I knew it was something really odd even then...I've never seen another like it.

author: kyfdx
text:
Yup.. sounds like a B7..

Alpina is a BMW tuner in Germany... These are factory approved models... I think they have a supercharged V-8.. About the same price as the V-12 models...

author: lemko
text: Yeah, it was B7. I just never seen one before.

author: british_rover
text: They are pretty rare and I think just started being officially brought into the US a year or two ago.

author: fintail
text:
Saw my first new face SL



I saw it driving last night too...still no C63 sitting around.

author: lemko
text: ...sort of an orangish metallic GMC Acadia this morning. I guess if you don't mind paying for gas, you can get quite a deal on an SUV these days. I was at the Ford show in Carlisle and sat in a Ford F350 Superduty. Cool truck, but I'd need to own a refinery to run it.

author: ateixeira
text:
Good year. Go for it.

Foresters had head gasket issues until around 2001-2002 or so, and wheel bearings were weak until they went to the sealed type for MY2003.

The 05 should be OK, but just in case...check the bottom of the block for oil stains, both the head and valve cover gaskets (4 total). Check the front and rear main seal as well, basically the seals at the front and rear of the engine.

Drive in a figure 8 with the windows open and the radio off. Odd noises would reveal any issues with the bearings, axles, AWD, differentials, etc.

If it's smooth, quiet, and leak-free, go for it. They're great cars. I had a 98, we're buying a new 2009 today, coincidentally, and my sister has a 2003. Dad has an 01 Outback and my bro has an 04 Legacy.

The funny thing is I drive a Miata and a Sienna. The Forester is my wife's car!

author: texases
text:
"orangish metallic GMC Acadia this morning. I guess if you don't mind paying for gas, you can get quite a deal on an SUV these days"

Yeah, GM thought they were going to hit a home run with the Acadia/etc, only to have $4/gallon make 16-17 mpg look 'bad' compared to cars, instead of 'great' great compared to full-size SUVs.

author: texases
text: Thanks! I've printed out your post, and will take it when we go looking. Obviousely, your family's had good experiences with Subies.

author: ateixeira
text: You're welcome. Good luck.

author: british_rover
text: I concur with all of that. My 2001 Forester Demo has almost 150,000 miles on it now with minimal problems according to my own experience and its past service history. I think I have a wheel bearing going as I am getting a little whining noise right now.

author: guss
text: on the way home from work. I was stunned, it is very similar to a BMW 5 series in size and shape.

author: ateixeira
text: Saw another one of these little buggers. Bright Obnoxious Yellow color.

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a beautiful Newport Blue Pearl Subaru Forester 2.5i Limited, PZEV model.

Then took it home. :shades:

author: bumpy
text: Supposedly yellow is a fairly rare color choice for them, and may not be available on the '09s.

author: fintail
text: Two newbies today, a TSX and a Forester. I don't like the new TSX, pointless edges and the dumb shield grille. The old one was much more homogenous and even almost elegant. Forester is typical inoffensive Subaru, should sell well to the loyal.

author: andys120
text:
on the way home from work. I was stunned, it is very similar to a BMW 5 series in size and shape.

The shape is similar, IMO the G8 is actually better looking than the E60 5-series but the Pontiac is a size and a half larger, too big for a proper sport sedan, closer in size to a 7-series.

author: fintail
text: Saw my first IS-F on the road. It's noticeable...but for similar money the insane little C63 might tempt me more...

author: bumpy
text: but I bet the owner wishes it were: Porsche Boxster with a huge billowing cloud of gray smoke pouring out of the back end. :sick:

author: fintail
text:
Today I spotted a new style Vibe, and a new concave grille Maserati coupe.

I also saw the most hideous E63 in the world. I have seen it around a couple times,but finally was able to get a pic with the phone. No, this photo is not doctored, the color really is this bad. I guess princess wanted a fast car, and daddy has a lot more money than sense or taste.

author: british_rover
text: It looks like a bad Chinese knockoff. I bet she totals it before the end of the year.

author: imidazol97
text: Is this from one of those Sixteen birthday parties on MTV that they give for the over-nurtured girls with wealthy parents?

author: ateixeira
text:
Saw a silver 2009 Forester, like ours except ours is Blue.

They look a lot taller now.

author: fintail
text: I've seen 2 C30s in the past 24 hours...as many as I have seen in the past 2 months

author: guss
text: I saw my first C30 on the road last week. I did not like it as much as I thought I would after the auto show. Maybe it was a lower trim level.

author: fintail
text: They look pretty different in low and high spec. I saw a highline model that even had fancy wheels.

author: bumpy
text: Saw a truck delivering about half a dozen Aveos to the local small-time Chevy dealer which usually sells Silverados, Tahoes, and Impalas.

author: kyfdx
text:
On the road today.. in red.. Stunning!

Some gimmicky stuff, though... LED DRLs, which looked like someone had hung XMAS lights around the headlights...

author: british_rover
text: LED DRLs are part of the new Audi design language. It is going to be on most of the mid to high line car.

author: kyfdx
text: Hopefully, they'll evolve into a better look than what I saw.. :surprise:

author: boomchek
text: Saw a new G* at the GM dealer next to us. It was only a V6 but it was nicely priced at $37k CDN

author: bumpy
